It’s criminal what TF is doing with his infamous fragrances. Noir de Noir used to be so potent and it’s nowhere near the same level. In a world where many quality niche fragrances are the same price as TF Private blends, I can’t quite get my head around what direction the company is going in. They have discontinued all the best ones, reformulated everything and turning poorly sold PB in too signature line fragrances. It’s gonna take a lot for me to put money back in their pockets.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I have somehow found myself on a rose kick here recently. I always grew up hating the note, probably due to older women in my life over spraying and filling up every room they were in. However, Tom Ford never seems to disappoint me, at least with his older releases. I stumbled on this one and had to pick it up after hearing so many great things about it!

The reviews were all correct, this thing is glorious, delicious, and just all-around magnificent (this is all coming from someone who doesn't like rose). The notes are compact and well blended in this, it's like a ball of goodness when first sprayed, then it slowly unravels. It opens dark and decadent with the chocolate, rose, and patchouli being the main players.

As it dries down more of that precious rose starts to peak out and then slowly dries down into a mossy-vanilla base that is just scumptious. The performance of this is great, I get a solid 8 hours, easily lasting the entire day. The sillage and projection will make a little bubble around you, not overpowering things around, but making others want to be closer to you.

This is the PERFECT Valentine's Day fragrance, so glad I grabbed a bottle of this! If you have hated rose in the past or have bad memories associated with the note, try this, you may change your mind.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
One of the 12 original Private Blend fragrances from Tom Ford released in 2007, Noir de Noir is a composition whose main purpose was to combine western and eastern notes, as well as mixing male and female accords. Thus, perfumers Harry Fremont and Jacques Cavallier created a cult classic that it is still going strong today amid the many discontinuations across this line.

At the opening, Noir de Noir begins with a sour, almost fermented like rose accord, kind of resembling a combination of sugary shoe polish with some musty rose petals. After 30 minutes or so, this bitter mixture morphs into a dry chocolate scent with the same rose note that not only becomes sweeter like wine, but it is also more prominent than before. Base notes contain the same rose and chocolate accord but with the incorporation of some patchouli undertones. These 3 accords are the most that come across throughout the duration of this fragrance. Great silliage and longevity, especially when compared to some of its Private Blend siblings.

Tom Ford fragrances tend to be very linear; however, I like how the fragrance transitions from its opening notes to the base notes, in which it does indeed switch from a more feminine leaning type to a more unisex phase. Even though vanilla is listed on the notes, it never takes center stage. Instead, the whole fragrance behaves like a tart and acidic russet where chocolate and rose take the whole composition into a dark, sweet, and elegant territory, creating an aura of sophistication, luxury, wealth, and romance, albeit too feminine for my taste. Due to this categorization, if worn under the wrong circumstances it can smell outdated and out of place. I can imagine a woman dressed up, wearing pearl jewelry, going to the ballet wearing Noir de Noir.

Like.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Rose, oud, saffron and black truffle. absolutely beautiful and I love it
Side by side comparison, If you remove the layers of black truffle and some of the oakmoss you get Xerjorffs Richwood.
Noir de noir in my opinion is much more interest

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is a wonderful fragrance, and I can totally understand the appeal. It's intoxicating and sumptuous. Kind of like velvet. On me, it's: Tobacco vanilla sweetness, warmth from saffron, dark chocolate liquor, and a wooden lacquer cabinet. There is the barest hint of rose hotel bar soap. It kind of reminds me of Angel Muse by Mugler.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: it is elegance and eroticism united in a bottle

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Very sensuous and romantic perfume, it's almost like the tale of a gothic hero/heroine; sweet saffron, richly perfumed rose, with earthy and lush oud/patchouli/truffle base that carries the fragrance throughout the entire day. Very dark, mysterious, and unflinchingly intense, but with a persisting sweetness that's almost endearing. I really enjoy this, a TF masterpiece.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is my obsession. My holy grail, my me, the one I worship and why I love perfume. It is so special I could never imagine wearing it just once or twice a year. This one needs to be given attention and then it will strive, it will glow and do magic. Definitely a waste just to save it for special or formal occasions. This one. I wear when I want to seduce, at night getting close to someone. Sometimes it’s even just for me. It loves the night, it doesn’t like the sunlight, but blooms in the dark. It’s comforting and seductive at the same time. Aloof and powerful. Tasty and earthy. Strong but subtle. It’s sublime

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Opulence in a bottle. Even if you don't like this you can't help but acknowledge its extremely well done. It's a 10/10. Jammy rose + chocolate. Your biggest problem with this is figuring out how to wear it. I can only imagine wearing it in super formal celebratory settings (eg black tie galas). I can't imagine wearing this casually or to the office. Same class as Dior Homme Parfum in my opinion.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is probably one of the few of Tom Ford's perfume that is not that to my liking unfortunately. I sprayed this on two separate days and no.. No.. Really not my kind of perfume. This is too dark for me. I am guessing it's the black rose and truffle. This perfume has been given a really good name indeed.

Edit today 10 January 2021: After many tries I'm finally accepting this perfume. I think it's starting to grow on me. 19 January 2021 - Today I finally dare to wear this perfume out. But a bit oversprayed. I can feel the expression on people's face. Hahaha. This is a really nice dark perfume.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
2 years ago I tried this and hated it with all my heart because it was sour and I didn't understant it. Now I stole it from my father and I am in love with rose, chocolate, oud, patchuli Mmmmmh
Not ok for blind buy. Def unisex. If you love it you LOVE it

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
It is part of my favorite perfume list.
The aromatic composition is dark, elegant , romantic and sensual.
I like how is perceived the rose note , it is like smelling a velvety and red rose petal with some chocolate ( those chocolate bars that have around 70-80% of cacao) , and with a little bit of red wine.

The truffle and vanilla provides smokey and creaminess hints to the rose.
The patchoulli is not too strong and the saffron is well balanced and harmonious.

So this perfume is not the typical rose-middle eastern scent, neither a powdery-fresh rose scent.

Actually, when I perceive this perfume I visualize several objects like ; a dark red-velvet rose bouquet, wine tone lipsticks, leathery men’s boots and jackets.


This perfume is all about Italian culinary and design culture.
It reminds me allot when I used to have dinner with my family in Italian restaurants ( , both, in Mexico, London and Paris).

Also it has a leathery note ( very pleasant ).

It is curious that for some people this perfume reminds them to some of the members of their family.

But for me , this perfume reminds me of several erotic and intimate memories ; the rose in this perfume is simply sensual, velvety and provocative.

This perfume, from my personal point of view ( and also experience ) is perfect for special occasions during night life.

This perfume will be enjoyable for those people that are in their 20s onwards , otherwise, for teenagers , the aromatic composition could be very strong.

I have to admit , I would buy it again, I still have almost the half of the bottle; but I really like it and I used to combine it with other perfumes and essential oils.

I like how it is perceived in the skin, it provides a warm and sensual feeling; but in clothes and leathery accessories it last hours and can be a little bit cloying if it is applied too much.

For me it has everything I want from a perfume; definitely when I don’t know what to wear and I have to be ready for a romantic ( and passionate) date I use this special poison.

I think this perfume blooms and provides that sensual emanation with casual and elegant dark tone clothes(fabrics like ; silk, satin cotton, cashmere , fur and leather ).

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tried a sample at dillards and could not stop smelling my wrist. Recommend.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Beautiful, starts sharp and woody with geranium also then settles into vanilla and floral with a hint of oud. Love it 😍

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Love this, there's a bit of a chocolate-y note imo which might be the vanilla mixed with the other notes. Perfect for colder weather and somehow reminds me a bit of an earthy and hot chai tea.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I'm in love with this perfume! A combination of truffle and gorgeous black roses with thorns makes this scent unforgettable. The rose is wrapt in oakmoss and vanilla, making it warm and earthy. Dark chocolate is present as well. This creation is luxurious, solemn, mysterious, and gothic.

I imagine a gorgeous seductive woman wearing a long black dress and dark red lipstick. She is standing alone in a graveyard and throwing crimson red roses on the grave of her late husband who she murdered in cold blood.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
What an amazing creation! An inspired combination of notes. Who would have thought to add truffle to a rose fragrance? It's a mushroom! But it works here, combining perfectly with the earthy patchouli and oud to darken and intensify everything. Probably not coincidentally, Wikipedia says this of truffles: "The sweaty-musky aroma of truffles is similar to that of the pheromone 'androstenol' that also occurs in humans". Very Tom Ford.

Although it has rose as its primary note, and would be ideal for romantic and intimate encounters, I get such an air of mysteriousness and almost emotional coldness to it. Perhaps I'm mistaking coldness for something more assertive or domineering. Maybe that's why several have mentioned Dracula's name. Dark, charismatic, a bit of a romantic but with an edge. In this vein [!!], I remember someone else describing the similar-smelling TF Noir for Men as being like a panther - dark, smooth but deadly; that almost black, dark-grey shade of purple. That suits this too.

Be that as it may, I’m currently going through a look-at-me phase in my fragrance life, so this feels more like a black house cat. I'd love for Tom to bring out an extract version, give it some welly, and for the black panther to bite my head off.

PS - Why is this listed as a chypre? It doesn't smell like one in the slightest. Classifications of this manner (based solely on ingredients) really have no use. It's such skewed logic. I can see the reasoning, and agree it works on most cases, but if it doesn't smell like a chypre an alternate classification should trump it. (Compare NdN to Amouage Gold PH: Gold smells like a chypre; neither have bergamot; NdN gets 'chypred' despite everything.)

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Don’t hate me, but I seem to be getting a lot of dark, stewed fruit from this one. I am confused by the un-sweetened spicy saffron opening - it was almost repulsive. But then the fragrance opened up... and what I got was a lot of stewed fruit with a tiny hint of rose. The overall effect is pretty good, but this fragrance reads very mature to me. Definitely not my cup of tea. If I were a “I do as I please” woman in my sixties, I would absolutely wear this. Maybe in another life.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Shade darker than TF white patchouli. Warmer and earthier version

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Noir de Noir opens with sweet saffron and rose. The rose here is more like the bulgarian rose to my nose. This sweet opening only last for a minute or two. After that, the patchouli, truffle, oud and vanilla start appearing. The fragrance becomes darker at this stage. The combination of patchouli, truffle, oud and vanilla creates a beautiful chocolate accord. The fragrance at this stage smells like rose dipped in melted chocolate. It is sweet, rosy, dark and earthy. In the late drydown, an oakmoss accord starts appearing to give a chypre feeling to the scent. Overall, it is a beautiful dark rose fragrance.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Too highly rated.
Don't get me wrong, it is a lovely scent, but frankly, there are better.
To me, it just smells too much like other perfumes for its price... if I was investing that amount of money, I'd rather go with the more unique Tom Ford Noir Extreme, which to me, feels like it has more complexity and warmth; if Noir Extreme to you feels like it smells too much like something else, please do message me with suggestions! (genuinely, non-rhetoric and non-sarcastic) I'd love to try them out.

Summary: Too highly rated for how common it smells amongst other fragrances.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Lush, creamy, boozy, chocolate-y and earthy rose and patchouli ... this one is sensuality in a bottle. I find the name quite fitting, as to me it somehow emanates a gothic kind of vibe, rather dark in nature and thus more of a night time (and perhaps cooler weather oriented) scent.

The comparisons to Turkish delight are spot on in my opinion, this one does indeed have a gourmandy facet, although I would not put it in that category. Noir de Noir is one of the Private Blends that to me leans rather feminine (which I enjoy), although of course it is unisex and can be worn by a man - perhaps by a slightly more mature man though (30+?), and rather with a more formal/business attire. I just can´t imagine this one with a T-Shirt and jeans - that goes for the ladies as well.

Performance on my skin is a bit of a mixed bag, somehow. Very strong projection and sillage for the first two hours (and I mean VERY strong, as in filling the floor of your office building, so be careful), but I do not get quite the longevity I expected from the notes profile and bearing in mind the powerhouse longevity of, say, Tobacco Vanille. On me, NdN becomes a skin scent about three hours in and is pretty much gone after five hours. Still, I love this one for its sensual and rich, enveloping aura.

Scent 9/10
Longevity 6/10
Projection 8/10 (for the first two hours a 20/10)
Sillage 8/10 (see projection)

I do get the similarities to Black Orchid - NdN however to me feels a bit more refined, more upscale. Definite love, but sample first!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I have a sample of this. I am impressed high quality and high performance. I still getting wafts of this from 2 sprays over 24 hours ago. 5/5 stars...I am holding back on a bonus star b/c I am not sure its exactly my type.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I have fond memories of this lovely scent being worn by a good friend, usually in her car as we were on the way to something fun. On her, it is rich vintage powdery elegance, with a bit of a flat plastic note that complemented the new car smell.
On myself, it was certainly interesting, and evocative, I just wasn’t sure it’s a scene I want to evoke...
The wine-like dried fruit opening starts overly sweet, like the fruit has gone slightly rancid before being dried. The plastic note held moldy potpourri roses, skanky patchouli and an incense not burning, but settled into dusty fabric over time.
I expected elegant decadence...
Instead I’m wine drunk at a house party, making out with a stoner boy, in a dank basement with hippie tapestries; his deodorant has worn off and he tastes of marijuana and the tobacco that he wrapped it in. The floor is sticky and there is a hint of vomit mingling with the rose potpourri wafting from the basement bathroom. I thought this was gonna be fun, but now I’m questioning my decisions and getting claustrophobic.

I think I will return this bottle and just enjoy it on my friend.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This fragrance reminds me of my grandmother...... I love it.
A fragrance is like a time machine in my opinion.
I’m sure that you guys know that scents reminds us of certain events, person, or place.
It may be bad or good for each and every one of us, I try to make it into something positive most of the time.
I said Noir De Noir smells like my grandmother is because she was a fraghead and she loves the scent of rose. When I was still young and I always stayed with her during weekends and vacations, she always smells great and I can still remember her perfume collection by her bedside table.
Sadly, she passed away on New Years Eve 1997 when I was 15 years old. Up until now I always wish she’s still with me because 15 was just not enough.
So when I smelled Noir De Noir for the first time it just reminded me of my younger days with my grandmother.
She loves roses and the roses in Noir De Noir reminds of the perfumes she used to wear.
I bought the 100 ml. because it’s like a time machine that brings me back to the great times with my grandmother, she and my mom were the only two people that was always there for me when my family was a mess. I love them both to death.
I’m not going too be specific about the fragrance, there are alot of great reviews below already. I just want to say that this is priceless because of the great memories it brings me.
10/10

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I tried Noir de Noir on the airport, but I wasn’t sure if this scent is for me so I bought other brand. When I back to home after my holiday. I decided order bottle of NdN and when courier delivered parcel I opened in my home and tried again. Perfect 👌 beautiful fragrance. Very deep, elegant, unique. I was asking myself why I didn’t buy it on the airport than? Now I know, that on the airport I was trying a lots of perfumes and everything was mixed for me. I stayed with this perfume face to face at home. Then I could meet this fragrance. I love everything in NdN. No needs to be change or reformulate because it’s already perfect. For me it works great. Deep, spice, woody, rose, chocolate scent. I can wear it anytime and enjoy this amazing smell. Stays on my skin up to 6 hours so it’s really good.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Ohh dear ... first sniff and I want to drink and eat what I smell ... it is a bit cold white wine and bitter chocolate 🍫 ... so simple and tasty.

“Noir de Noir” - such a mysterious, terrifying name and so surprisingly soft, gentle, almost sweet scent. For me it is on a gourmand side but with a sour and tart notes of course.
I don’t recognize rose here - cocoa powder, pink flowers (I do feel orchids) and patchouli take the main place.

This fragrance is for adults.🔞
Pleaser, seducer, provocateur and warrior. Dark knight. Perfume with a male character but for women. Dangerously addictive and complicated. You want to guess it, to understand and learn it’s greatness with every new date.

There’s nothing better than to smell eatable, that’s why I use it only being near by my husband ♥️

Good luck and be inspired 💋

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Luxury chocolate powder and juicy red rose petals.

Noir de Noir had been on my wishlist for 2 years and yesterday, I finally got it. To me, there's nothing challenging about this. It's smooth, cozy and simply divine. Wore three sprays to bed last night and woke up this morning surrounded by the most amazing fragrance cloud.

I can also see this one being great for layering, for example with Jo Malone Velvet Rose & Oud or even Dior Addict EDP for some added sensuality.

A true masterpiece.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tom Ford Noir De Noir opens with a moderate projection of sweet saffron, but the accord lasts for just a few seconds. Almost immediately the fragrance brings an intense green and herbaceous patchouli with rose and truffle accords. The patchouli is a dominant note and adds a classy, old-school vibe. The rose and floral accords are next leaning the fragrance to the feminine side. The truffle creates a very earthy and musky accord. As the fragrance commences to dry-down, the oud becomes prominent. The combination of oud, patchouli, and truffle creates a pungent, green, slightly animalic, musky, and dark wood accord, borderline offensive. The vanilla is a faint touch. The most noticeable change from the opening to the dry-down is the quick and very sweet visit of the saffron which fades away in just a few seconds, after that, the oud, patchouli, and truffle dominate the fragrance with a strong pungent accord counterbalanced by the intense rose and floral accords. Once Tom Ford Noir De Noir has reached its full dry-down, it can be summarized as a strong projection, pungent oud, patchouli, and roses fragrance with faint vanilla accords. The fragrance feels slightly animalic, bold, classy, exotic, floral, herbaceous, earthy, imposing, mature, musky, nocturnal, old-school, powerful, pungent, rotten wood-like, and mildly pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2019
WOW RATING: 10/10. This is an impressive fragrance, but not necessarily pleasant.
DISLIKE RATING: 8/10. The pungent oud, patchouli, and truffle create an accord borderline offensive.
UNIQUENESS: 5/10. Strong oud and floral fragrances are common.
MASS APPEAL: 1/10. This is far from being a mass appeal fragrance.
PROJECTION: 5/10. Very good, about 5 feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 6/10. Very good, about 6 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: 2 to 4 atomizations.
LONGEVITY: 5/10. Good about 5 hours with 2 hours of solid projection.
SEASONS: Winter, fall, colder nights, and climate-controlled environments.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, casual clubbing.
VERSATILITY: 4/10. Moderate, this fragrance is suited for formal or casual wear.
GENDER: Unisex. The pungent oud feels very masculine, the intense rose feels feminine, the patchouli and truffle are neutral.
AGES: 40 and above. This is a fragrance better suited for mature wearers.
RECOMMENDATION: An intense, borderline offensive fragrance that requires an acquired taste to enjoy it. Better reserved for fragrance connoisseurs.
BLIND-BUY: No, sample it first.
SIMILAR: These fragrances share some similarities. Acqua Di Parma Men Colonia Essenza EDP features patchouli, strong musk, lemon and flowers, another fragrance advertised as masculine that feels more feminine; Chanel Les Exclusifs Coromandel EDP is a balsamic, woody, spicy and strong green, patchouli, and musky fragrance; Frederic Malle Portrait of a Lady features patchouli, roses, and woods; Jovoy Paris Psychedelique EDP contains amber, balsamic, patchouli, and spicy notes; Parfums De Marly Lippizan features citrus, strong patchouli, earthy, spicy, and powdery accords; Tom Ford Black Orchid is a patchouli, chocolate, floral and fruity refined fragrance; Parfums De Marly Nisean features woody, spicy, softer patchouli, and ambery tones; Roja Parfums Scandal Cologne Parfum is a woody, spicy, citrus, strong patchouli, and floral fragrance; Tiziana Terenzi – Ursa is a woody, leather, patchouli, spicy and nutty fragrance; Xerjoff Casamorati 1888 brings spicy, floral patchouli, and woody accords.
SUMMARY: A strong projection, pungent oud, patchouli, and roses fragrance with faint vanilla accords. The fragrance feels slightly animalic, bold, classy, exotic, floral, herbaceous, earthy, imposing, mature, musky, nocturnal, old-school, powerful, pungent, rotten wood-like, and mildly pleasant.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
If you have Amouage Lyric man or woman then you don't need this one. This is quite boozy though, very very boozy, yup, the liqueur is there. The rose is thick, syrupy and very present. I struggle to find the woody parts of it. And like Lyric woman, there is that dirty rose part, it is mature, it is grown, it leans very feminine
It is beautifully blended. All in all it is a ROSE perfume.

Is is worth the price? Are you paying for the Tom Ford name? Are you willing to pay for the name? IT totally depends on your pocket.
Will I repurchase? hmmmmmmm!!!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Portrait of a Gentleman.

Okay, it's a unisex scent, but I couldn't resist the comparison. While I respect POAL, I find it leans too feminine for me. Noir de Noir is definitely not one for the ultra-masculine guys out there, but those with confidence in themselves can pull this off with style. It has a touch of that grandma rose, but the other elements redress the balance.
This is essentially a rose/patchouli fragrance (like POAL), but is also modernised with aspects of another Tom Ford classic: Black Orchid. The black truffle is so sensual and interesting, and immediately elevates this above anything else in the genre.
The name is very apt here. The notes are listed as black rose and black truffle, giving emphasis to how dark this fragrance is trying to be. It achieves it. The rose is not fresh or soapy and the patchouli adds a real earthiness which grounds the whole composition. A touch of oud in the backgrounds deepens the scent further. It's deep, dark and brooding, whilst also being sensual and addictive.
There is a bit of a sourness in the opening which thankfully passes as it can come across as off-putting. Others talk about a chocolate smell which I don't really get, but there is definitely a mouth-watering quality to it.
I would wear this as I love the smell, but smelling it off of another person (preferably a woman) would be the ideal scenario. If somebody walks past me wearing this, you best believe that I'm going to notice. I hate to use this word because it is so overused, but NdN really is sexy.

I like it a lot, potentially bottle-worthy.

(dislike/indifferent/like, but not BW/like a lot, potentially BW/love, definitely BW/masterpiece)

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This fragrance is one that I cannot stop smelling. Like on the skin- deep inhale to take it all in. It’s very intoxicating it almost makes my head spin in a hypnotic/spell bound way. The transition from the top note of “bright” saffron to truffled roses is so smooth. This is where I start to smell some red wine that’s slightly sour yet mouth watering. To me, the first 30 minutes of this perfume are the most interesting. During the dry down, you lose the sour note and finish with a lovely soft rose and slight earthiness in the background. A very sophisticated scent- I get the vibe of a dark room. It’s very unisex because to me the wearer is already confident in who they are and this fragrance enhances and plays into that confidence. I am younger so this feels like a special occasion fragrance, and I likely have enough in the sample to last me for a while.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This has the (to me) typical Tom Ford vibe of being kinda soft and sweet but at the same time with some earthy and dirty undertone that gives it a sort of weird edge. I would describe Black Orchid and Noir the same way.

The main vibe here is a very jammy rose, with some other things going on in the background to make it more complex. The jamminess makes it lean feminine in my opinion.

It's pleasant enough, I guess, but... Meh... At this price, no thanks.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
A dark rose that’s as appropriate to wear at Halloween as it is on Valentine’s Day. Black truffle, patchouli and vanilla give the olfactory illusion of the rose being dipped in chocolate and the richness of the notes suggests a full-bodied red wine, a Malbec or Syrah, although oud is always in the background hinting at something more sinister. Noir de Noir is indeed Valentine’s Day in a bottle, although if you’re a man and your date wears this never turn your back.

For me this is also the scent of the Carpathians, black truffles sourced from the hillsides, the last Bulgarian roses picked in autumn, tree moss chipped from wet bark and saffron and oud imported from the Middle East, which eastern Europe has always had a close association with due to its geographical location. Worn by a dark-haired woman with red lipstick and a black dress to the now-abandoned Casino Constanta in its heyday: a mistress, a courtesan or something else?

A man wearing Noir de Noir would be distinctive and make an impression; a woman in Noir de Noir would only do it true justice wearing a slinky dress, wine-red lipstick, cigarette, black garter and a handgun in the drawer of her bedside table.

Wear Noir de Noir on February 14th next year (the origin of Valentine’s Day is much darker than a cute little angel with a bow and arrow would suggest), fancy yourself a femme fatale or if you’re fascinated by people such as late antiquities collector Bill Jamieson and Countess Elizabeth Bathory de Ecsed.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Black Forest (Harry Fremont & Jacques Cavallier, 2007)

Scentrack: The Cure - Lullaby

Although not being a rose fan, I must confess I admire how realistic and complex this rose is. A fresh rose merged with dense and dusty chocolate. Like this rose grows from the compost of moist and dark patchouli, priceless tuber and oakmoss, while viscous oud is dripping from the nearby tree.
I even like it more in the drydown, when earthy and wet base pulsates even more.
Masters Cavallier and Fremont successfully brought together two different world: heartbreaking romantics and gourmand moist of the soil. For the rose lovers this is a dream, for other close to heaven. A black forest fragrance.

Rating: 8/10

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I can't give a full review (well, not yet anyway), but I wanted to talk a little bit about Noir de Noir, the patchouli, and how it relates to people like me who aren't used to fragrances that smell a little old school.

This has the "bad breathy" vibe that other old school fragrances have because of the prominent patchouli.

Give it a few days of wearing. The patchouli here is one of the more beginner-friendly ones. It's tempered by the rose and whatever makes it smell mildly wine-like. As it starts to enter the mids after around an hour, the old school vibe dissipates and that's when it starts smelling like dark chocolate. I don't foresee myself liking patchouli-on-steroid fragrances, but I think Noir de Noir has helped me to gain a better understanding and appreciation.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This fragrance is marketed more toward men but it is definitely unisex.

It's bold, dark, sweet, sultry, and appropriate for evening, winter, and fall.

It reminds me of being in Vegas at the Wynn - maybe because I first smelled the Tom Ford line in Vegas, or maybe because the casino and sports book smells similar to this - boozy, sweet, smokey, expensive.

I'll be wearing this for nights out for sure.

I love it and my boyfriend loves it as well.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I had this in my want list for over 2 years. Being quarantined at home is no joke, it increases your impulse to buy and buy. So I did it! I will write a review once I receive it.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
If you want your lady says “ oh my god I feel I wanna eat you” go for this
I smell cacao powder

It’s date night for sure

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: On me(woman) it starts with a rich deep heady rose. The rose is deep however this is not a pretty, fresh rose. This is a dark rose, if it had a colour it would be a dark red almost burgundy colour. The rose is followed by one of my favorite notes, earthy delicious patchouli and a spiciness i assume is the saffron. The patchouli calms down and moves to the background but still hangs around like a background singer with the truffle mixing together to give the dark red rose some earthiness. This makes it smell like a freshly plucked rose that you picked up with the earth still clinging to the flower. It's a rich earthy deep rose with the patchouli and truffle adding an interesting earthiness, a touch of spiciness from saffron makes this composition press your nose to your wrist addictive. The dry down brings in a bit of vanilla but it's not sweet at all just adds extra depth to an already deep, rich scent. it's an earthy, spicy rose. I absolutely love this perfume, it's the scent I imagine a femme fatale would wear, with red lips, long nails, a show of leg, and a lot of sass, with that said, this scent can be worn by a man or a woman with no issues. Love this one!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Wow, I was stunned by this fragrance. A handsome beauty!
Totally did not expect to love this, because I had smelled Noir de Noir on a paper strip twice before, and felt it wasn’t my style both times. I had actually planned to give away my small decant of it without even trying it on my skin at all! Luckily, today I figured why not just give it a shot on my arm.
It is so different on skin than on paper!! On the paper it was just some scent I’d picture on any girl out clubbing. On my skin it was RICH. Somehow it managed to make me think of port wine and chocolate and my truffle infused olive oil (without making me hungry and without being cloying at all. It is like a gourmand-but-not). It’s just luxurious and perfect. It smelled totally unisex as well, which means I might be encouraging my husband to wear this one, too. I think I’ll be buying a full bottle when my decant runs out.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: When I smell this, I put on my headphones, take a long, sleazy walk through the night and play Entombed's Wolverine Blues first and Samhain's November Coming Fire after. Dressed in black loose-fitted, high-waisted, knee-hole Levi's, faded and ripped hoodie and snakeskin chelsea boots. I smoke Marlboro 100's and sing every goddman song out loud. Desperatly in need, but still not wanting anything but myself.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The Fordian base gives the PB line their full-bodiedness. To me it smells boozy and fermented. Noir de Noir has that too in less extent.

This is opulent, woody, earthy, green (patchouli), fruity, rosy, sweet and what else? Though some say it’s chypre because of the overdose of the potpourri on its drydown, to me it feels more like an oriental.

Sensual
Haute bourgeoisie
Velvety

It’s a wonderful showcase of how beautiful dessiccated rose petals and patchouli can be when combined with wine-like accords and a helpful dose of truffle. It might sound foody but how the overall composition is translated to a masterwork is astounding.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Noir de noir is a beautiful scent with great performance. I’ve tested this for some time now and while I really enjoy it, I find it too feminine to purchase a full bottle. For +40 woman this is a stunning scent.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Luxury chocolate vanilla, enveloped in rose, patchouli and out scents. Noir de Noir is for a date night in a nice restaurant setting because it smells exquisite. It's light with great silage, good longevity.

Noir de Noir is sexy, seductive in elegant way. It smells expensive, niche quality. A good purchase indeed.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I was lucky to have bought a 250ml in 2012. Pre-reformulated or pre-diluted. It’s the beastliest beast I’ve ever had.

It must have many more than the listed notes. It’s not linear.

On me:

Longevity—infinite, even after showering. When decanting, I spilled some on my stone counter and sink. Eight months later my bathroom smells like Noir de Noir

Projection—I think migrating birds 100 miles away can smell it

Silage—down the block and around the corner

The richest, most velvety, vanillic and gently eugenolic (clove-y) rose I’ve ever known, dipped in saffron-scented, sweet-bitter chocolate, with undertones of funky, almost tangy buttered mushrooms. It smells dirtier to me (in a great way) than my hardcore animalics do!

Shame I hear it’s weak now. This was (along with TV) the best of the PB line.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Chocolate with a lovely use of roses and vanilla that adds a creamy sexy air to it. I love the air left by this perfume.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The opening is one of the loveliest rich dark roses that just oozes expense but quickly dries down to such a disappointment that reminds one of a walk through a very ordinary perfume department of a chain store.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Starts off as dark juicy roses soaked in wine with chocolate in the backround.
As time goes on the rose starts to melt into the chocolate until your left with a delicious smooth woody milk chocolate hours later .

You get a dark gothic romance theme with this 100%

This is what Catwoman would wear when trying to seduce Batman in the late night hours of Gotham City .

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Rose, Oud, Patchouli and Vanilla

A gorgeous creamy rose and oud fragrance which gives off that dark chocolate vibe. A seductive scent without a doubt.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This has chocolate and coffee notes.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I wanted to love this, but on me all i get is truffle and an acrid rose. Amazing how everyones chemistry reacts differently.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
10/10- My second love, also the best rose in the world.

I crave to slurp this poison, earthy rose, patchouli, and truffles. Oh, my gluttony!

100% for a date, mysterious yet warm and sexy.

Why doesn't Tom Ford make a candle of this scent?!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Very linear chord fragrance of truffled rose, where the other notes only deepen and enrich these two, which go hand in hand from the beginning to total drydown: rose and truffle. However, why anything else, when you have such good partnership? Again, a fragrance whose glimpse at the notes or the marketing greatly prejudices the judgment, for I see TF marketing and people calling it dark...well, it is not luminous, but it is also far from something dark - it is a simple, inviting, open aroma, as it would be when guided by any feminine and magnanimous flower, but especially by the very sharp rose here (in a "dry-citrus" style, fragrantica calls it "fresh lemony" or something like that, don't know how to describe it well), but at the same time more formal, as one would expect from occasions that ask for roses - because it is a flower so well worn by nature. That is, very versatile. In drydown, the velvety and sweet truffle reaches and even stands out from the rose for me, guaranteeing a prolonged satisfaction also in this final phase of the perfume. Unisex and especially more inviting for use by men. Projects nicely for 2 hours.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: An old-fashioned spice cologne with plenty of depth. I would imagine it is equally suited to men and women. probably not for anyone who hates patchouli, as that is a constant, but in this, I really like it.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Sexual, mature, polished. Noir de Noir is a dark, earthy rose within a powdery vanilla chocolate base. One of the pinnacles of unisex fragrance as far as I'm concerned. If I had to choose a signature scent, this would be it.

5/5

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I"m now the proud owner of a 100ml bottle of this beauty. This is the best rose scent I've ever smelled. A dark, red velvety rose with dashes of dark chocolate, vanilla and patchouli. This is smooth as butter, very well-blended. Everyone below me has described this in great detail. It smells like its pricetag, very expensive. Now, if you're expecting a sillage and projection monster, you will not get that. I imagine the perfumers intended it to last long, but stick close to the skin for hours. This scent is designed for close encounters, not to fill a room. I would highly recommend this. For the pricetag though, I would sample before committing to a FB. One more thing, this scent is very romantic and feminine to me. I'm not sure how a man could pull this off. Granted, different notes shine on male skin than female skin. Just letting the dudes know that this is very sweet and rosy, but there are earthy nuances to it. Try before buying!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Wore this again the other night and was pleasantly surprised. It felt much better on a winter night than on a summer day, who would have thought?

Although the rose is not convincing to me (more lychee than floral), it's blended very well with the vanilla, truffle and light patchouli. At some point, it reminds me of some Bic perfume (cheapy from early 90's) in a good way, can't remember which one. It's a very seductive scent, perfect for a date (unisex), less so for day to day (at least not for men). It doesn't project but stays close to the skin for hours. Though, $4 per ml is really prohibitive to me for this type of fragrance.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tom Ford Tuscan Leather was/is my most addictive fragrance to my nose. Noir de Noir is my second most addictive fragrance in a short time.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
One of the best perfumes of Private Blend TF, the smell of rose is quite natural, earthy, dark, mysterious and with a touch of sensuality. Ambivalent, in women perfectly feminine, in us magnificent.

Aroma: 10
Originality: 10
Versatility: 7 (preferably night)
Climate: cold days, autumn and winter
Occasions: gala events and romantic dates
Age: +25
Quality: 10
Price: 6
Sillage: 8.5
Longevity: 8.5
Total rating: 9.7

Main notes I smell: rose, patchouli, and in the background vanilla-chocolate
Emotions: seduction, enigma, neatness.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Today I smelled the new reformulated Noir de Noir.. I am very disappointed, TF did a terrible job.. Older versions smells great, new reformulated ones are awful.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
There's no doubt there are some formulation issues with some of the TF scents. Although not on a Creed level, where everything since 2016 has been diluted with Evian.
My Noir de Noir is from 2015 and performs amazingly. My mums from 2017 is pretty much a skin scent 10 mins after application. My first Patchouli Absolu from 2014 was a beast for projection. When that ran out I got another bottle from the TF boutique (batch 2017) and that was an awful performer. Returned it and was given an exchange for a bottle from 2018 and that one is just like my first bottle.
I don't think there's any logic behind these, they must just be bad eggs. I would suggest not being afraid to call TF out for it, and return it to the retailer if it happens. A lot of people seem to assume it's just the line as a whole and suck it up, but we pay way too much to have to put up with bad batches.
Anyway Noir de Noir.. amazing fragrance! :)

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
it classified as an unisex fragrance but I enjoy it on ladies more ... oh man it is sexy ... with a coat , high hills scarf oh man it is a killer ... Awesome for date situations... lyric, romantic out of this world ... I like the rotten vibe of this juice ...like wine (rotten) rose oud saffron... all in the smoothest way... like a silk
Masterpiece... Sex in a bottle As a man I suggest ladies: please smell like this

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: the most erotic and sexual scent ever

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: It’s a mature smell, so if you need something playful focus on citrus base perfumes but if you need something hard, like James Bond feel... then this is what you need.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This perfume really stands out and it's one of those that you can wear on special nights. It suits more on cold nights when you go out with your close friends or your significant other. Forgive what I say, but it's not a perfume for everyone, it's one of those perfumes that have a whole story to tell and will tell it to a few and close ones. To those who can appreciate it. Complex enough to intrigue, but no useless notes in this. This perfume, is like a close friend with whom you feel happy and laugh without seeking for compliments or need anyone's approval. It's not a rose perfume or an oud perfume or a truffle perfume. It's all these together. It's man and woman, hot and cold, east and west, bitchy and sensitive.. It's real..

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Not sure how/where to wear this one. Opens earthy (oud) with mild rose chocolatey sweetness. Then dry dirty (somewhat sour) chocolate rose. Then mellows out nicely. Good longevity. I've had it for months but have not worn it out. I haven't found the right situation for it. Vexing.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
An oddly lovely scent. I believe the truffle is what gives this an almost creamy dark chocolate note. It smells like flowers covered in dark chocolate. There's very little sweetness to this perfume and it almost has a dry alcohol note.
For now, I'm unsure how to wear this out the house, and where but I still enjoy this a lot at home.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Powdery dark rose mixed with dark chocolate liqueur truffles. The smell of romance. Rich and decadent suited for a mysterious and sensual person. Incredibly unisex; a fragrance crafted for the “special occasion.” This is so lovely. One of the few rose scents that I as a 22 year old male feel not only comfortable but very confident wearing. Projection is moderate-heavy however the fragrance lasts on skin for the entirety of the day. It’s also one that evolves throughout the day. On my skin it transformed between rose and truffles being the dominant note. Either way it comes across, the smell is undeniably sensual and addicting.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
It's a dark red rose, opulent, thick with earthy and musky elements. There is a very nice dry red wine accord that will linger for a good while; it's a beautiful aroma, not boozy and it's combined with a sweet saffron and vanilla combo that is really nice. I can't wear it whenever, I feel I need an occasion for it because of its richness and opulence. It’s also sensual, elegant and mature with a fleshy dry down. It's very good!
9/10

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is a heavy projection heavy silage rose heavy perfume with dirty earthy notes. I love rose but i dislike the earthy notes here. its way too earthy. Rose Vanilla Oud combo here lingers and is sickeningly sweet.

I worn this twice, one during warmer weather and one during 40F weather. I wore this to my office. It is a very distracting scent. I think it is more appropriate for date night.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Today, I sampled this popular Noir de Noir. On my skin I thought this was very familiar then, it hit me. On my skin, this perfume smelled very close to Montale Dark Purple. I absolutely love both perfumes but for me, either one would suffice.

This might be completely different for others but, my skin and my nose interprets these two in a similar vein. Both lovely. I will eventually own one of the two.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Oh my God!
Those are the words that came out of my mouth after finally got a sniff of this perfume.
I was like "finally!! The perfume that represents my personality!"
It's dark, sexy, sweet, mysterious and again DARK!
For a person who loves everything that's black with a hint of red. This is perfect!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Dipsomaniac, woody rose osmosing in pinot noir and rum, throbbing in romantic agony but in a detached, stark-dark vampiric way. Yes, Noir de Noir may seem populated by Valentine’s Day tropes of roses, wine and chocolate but they are upturned by the cold, cruel touch of a creature that has just been freed from its entombment and seeking proverbial vengeance from the grave.

It dresses in a palette of blacks and burgundies, swagging arch and mannered over earthy floors and smooth oriental rugs of mushroomy-patch and dry vanilla amber redolent of bonbon fillings of rose fondant/ganache that arrive in anonymous laced boxes at the doorstep of the unsuspicious prey.

I would not classify it as a “gourmand” however, it skips all the warmth and sugar rhapsody into the gloomy gothic with some caustic chypre elements, a dark oriental cape over an unisex, velvet tux and a stamp of Maila Nurmi lacquered red lips.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Romance.

That is the theme of Noir de Noir for me.

Elevated, highest vibration romance. The merging of galaxies; Soulmates. Intensely emotional. Deeply in love. The most beautiful of all dreams. It reminds me of my Love & aspects of myself; deep, dark, passionate, serious, sensitive, Scorpio. Earthy, grounded & rich with a beautiful, elegant sweetness reserved for the right one. A velvety rose, as spiritual as it is sensual. I don’t care to gender perfume at all. I always dreamed of smelling this on the right man (— Mine), & I love it on myself. A quiet confidence that can’t be shaken; a girl/woman who would rather read, dance & dreamily lounge around in exquisite lingerie that she collects & dream her own world, explore forests, oceans, stars & herself, than be among the noisy masses, but will make exceptions or travel to see her favourite artists. A man unafraid to embrace his femininity as fully as masculinity, worlds beyond lesser men who cannot. An introverted musician, painter, artist, who does not lack the ability to defend & kill if necessary. Swoon…

This dream is my reality.

It also reminds me of all of the old world, architectural beauty of Paris & refinement of Parisian culture.

I do not own a bottle but have been sustaining myself with samples from Luckyscent. This is about to change. If you would like to sell a bottle, please contact me.

// I automatically move away from anyone small minded enough to leave words like ‘old lady / grandma’ in a review. No one serious about perfume wants to read those immature & ignorant comments.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Forever love.

When I met Noir de Noir,I was still in the very beginning of my perfume discovering.Reading reviews, sniffing around at the department stores.

I stopped by the tom ford counter in the department store to try the different smells... I smelled this and... I thought I was gonna cry... seriously.... no way! It's like all I wanted, but I didn't know that I wanted it, or I didn't know what it smelled like, well, this is what it smelled like! out of this world beautiful. I felt myself shivering.

I looked online and got a bottle for a good price.

It's now autumn again... I opened my cabinet and reached for Noir de Noir, I'm not going out, I just missed you! I sprayed it on my arm, afraid that my love for her would have withered, within this year of smelling so many different, weird, quirky, interesting scents I never knew existed before my first encounter with Noir de Noir..

No sir! The same shiver, the same enchantment and excitement as the first encounter is what I got, a big smile on my face and wanting to jump up and down.

Noir de Noir, is now deemed, my first and forever love in the world of high perfumery.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I finally tried this perfume.. In one word, it's just perfect! There are other perfumes in this category that try to come close to this, but this is the winner! A perfect blend of its notes, nothing more, nothing less.. The perfect balance! This perfume is a great choice for autumn and winter nights. There are very few perfumes to which I would give 10/10 and this is among them.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
to my nose the most dominant notes were rose, vanilla, oud, & saffron

the overall blend went in a sweeter direction than i anticipated as a strong vanilla & floral

i like it...but its not my style & i think there are more interesting ways this combination has been interpreted by other perfumers, including some outstanding non-western brands

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
It's really pleasant and sweet. Definitely a "like." Vanille Fatale was so gross and not sweet at all.

At first, Noir de Noir is almost like a fresh, vanillic men's spicy cologne, then starts getting more rosy/femme. 5-10 mins in I get earthy "dirt" facets (not bitter, just earth). That aspect made me think maybe it is too "mature" for me. I'm not really into that dimension

But now the earthiness is fading a bit and I am getting this smooooth vanilla spicy wood. Is that the oud? My first oud?! The rose is faintly and so pleasant. Like Lost Cherry, this fragrance is so complex and interesting to me as my brain tries to make sense of it.

It isn't exactly what I am looking for, but I feel I am getting warmer (vanilla, spice, rose, chocolate, tasteful wood...)

Edit: The next morning, only the earthy parts seem to have stuck on my skin. :/ But someone else will love this.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I have had a 10 ml for a little while. I was on the fence about this one, not liking a dominant Rose note, but 2 of my favorite top 10s, are non rose dominant: MFK Lumiere Noir PH, and Creed Royal Mayfair.

I am starting to like this a lot as well, and it may be my next Winter bottle for Christmas.
It has some of the chocolate note, as Tobacco Vanille, and the safron from Tuscan Leather. I do think there is an unlisted coffee note, as Cafe Tuberosa has, which is a clone of Noir de Noir.

I love patchouli, and earthy fragrances. I see Noir de Noir as more of a dank, earthy, moss, patch, and truffle frag; with a very good dark rose, that elivates it out of the dirty earthy vib, along with a touch of safron.

It smells simple, and tight, in a very good classic kind of way. I just tried Bond Bleaker Street, its nice, and gimicky, like so many good frags; But Noir de Noir is special. It's a substantial fragrance, that will remain a classic winner.

Rating: 9.5/10

God bless. John 3:16

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is potent!

It is dark, heavy, sexy and seductive.

When I first tested this one evening at a department store, and drove home with it, I kept sniffing my wrist, and kept getting this image in my head of a pale-skinned vixen with dark hair, a dark dress, red lipstick, in charge of whatever night venue she might be attending.

Men can wear it too (I am a man), but only only only in night-time, seductive environments... otherwise just... no.

I am not into "dark" and "devilish" stuff, but the scent itself just gave me this vibe of, well, if someone were into dark and obscure and even devilish stuff (you figure out what that means), this is what they would wear. Doesn't smell bad or evil per se, but those into dark seduction would be into this.

Heavy rose, chocolaty, sensual smell, almost sexual, meant for night wear, giving a deep sexy, mysterious, alluring and emotional vibe.

9/10 (only at night, seductive and deep/dark atmosphere)
4/10 (during daytime, light-hearted easy-going events)

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The opening smells floral and projection is minimum but the DRYDOWN? Beautiful 6 hours on skin for me.. for me I get this rose/sugary cocoa like vibe from it I had this on my neck at a lounge that I frequent and the woman I was speaking with got soo close to me she wasn’t really in the conversation she was just waiting to ask what I was wearing and I told her of the fragrance and different ones from Tom Ford house that I liked as she did too and well yea..😌💦 but i have a quite a few unisex fragrances and I have 6 in particular from this house I have 1.Plum Japonais (my favorite) 2. Tobacco Vanille 3. Lost cherry (I love layering this with tobacco Vanille ) 4. Noir de noir 5. Black orchid EDT. And 6 . Soleil Blanc (one of my summer scents).

Also I layered black orchid as the base and noir de noir on top!!?!?! The women will grossly compliment you especially if you’re wearing all black with your jewelry on

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I got a 5ml sample from my SA many years ago (first release).
When I wore it, I immediately felt so nauseating. (I was a student.)
The floral note on me is enormous.
Very feminine and mature IMO. Sexy guy will rock this too.
The silage is absolutely huge and lasting is great too 7h+.
If i sprays too much, it will make me feel headache.
1-2 sprays is enough.
Recently, 12 years later I tried it again.
It is so rich and sexy. Too loud and floral for my taste.
I still think this is a masterpiece but not for me.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
My second favourite TF perfume after Oud Wood. Noir de Noir definitely screams for attention – For me, this perfume is best suited at night due to the strong performance and dark nature of the perfume.

This scent is definitely uni-sex. Floral and spice complement each other perfectly.

Fragrance 8/10
Performance: 9.5/10
Versatility: 7/10

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I normally do not like rose based perfumes. But this one just did something to me.
It‘ stunning and overall and incredible perfume.

Very dark and deep rose, dipped in dark chocolate. Saffron, oud, truffle and patchouli. I do not really get the oakmoss and vanilla as stated here on Fragrantica. Perhaps the other ingredients are simply too potent and take over the show. I would still not classify this as a rose scent. It is there but still not very dominant. A beautiful blend.
This is wild, very earthy and dark. Be careful with the sprayer. For me 1,5 spray is more than enough.

Initially I got a 4 ml tester from TF counter some months ago and I was raving about this. Finally opened up my wallet and got a 50 ml bottle.
What an incredible scent... it is so different
This is a perfume for the evening. For a date or a dinner with friends or preferably with someone you want to seduce.
Or daytime on the weekends when you want to feel sexy :)

It is for sure not an office scent. It almost makes it difficult to concentrate on work when wearing this. I tried one day by early April, it was just too much.

I would also classify this mostly as a fall / winter scent. Wearing a wool sweater and a light spray of NdN. I just got my bottle the other week and it is now summer in Europe, NdN is simply to much to handle in the summer. I´m keeping it in the fridge and wait for fall.

An interesting observation from my side is that the bottle I got is even more dark and heavy than the 4 ml tester. I compare it arm to arm and the sample feels a bit lighter. I never really noticed differences in batches and did not care much about it but here I do smell the difference. My bottle feels like the oud and truffle is stronger than in the tester. I got my bottle at a TF counter at an airport so I am pretty sure it is not a fake one.

Longevity is insane. From early morning to late evening. The first 6 hours the projection is heavy and penetrating. So once again, be very careful with the sprayer. Then it settles down, becomes more tamed and sits closer to the skin for another 6–10 hours.
I feel like my 50 ml bottle will last me for years and somehow wish there was a 30 ml of this beautiful perfume instead.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Fragrances don't get much better than this. I fell for this as soon as I first tried it. It's an absolute masterpiece. Tom Ford makes such great fragrances and this is probably one of his best, along with Amber Absolute, Oud Wood, Tuscan Leather, Tobacco Vanille, and Tobacco Oud/Intense. It's totally unisex. Unbelievable fragrance. I suggest you get your nose on it and try.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I've had this perfume for several years, & may have reviewed it before. I LOVE IT! No one could ever go wrong w/ this one. I have the Armaf one above, EXCELLENT $30 dupe! I also wanted to add, Gucci Absolute is very close too. Not as close as the Armaf, but just in case you are into these scents, wanted to throw this out there. ALL 3 are BOMB!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The phantom of the opera in a fragrance!

A dark red rose with a black ribbon on a dusty cushion, waiting to be found in the deepest darkest places under the opera house.

Basically

I love it

Mysterious, sexy gothic heavy rose. I like to spray it at night when it's a full moon and I've been on the Disarano!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is a delicate version of Lyric man by Amouage. The rose in Amouage is more pronounced and can throw off some men. Here, the rose is more sexy and masculine. The initial dry down has this very nice saffron and vanilla, followed by harmony of other notes (patchouli, truffle and non-animalic oud) .

The fragrance maintains by the smoothness of rose with warm beautiful peekaboo of harmonious other notes and accords, until faded to a skin scent after 6-8 hours. This could be an all season scent. Indeed a special olfactory experience.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I love this.

I'm new to perfume. I can only tell you how I think it smells, and how it makes me feel, both of which are likely to be different from others' experiences.

I smell rose, the most appealing of all the rose notes I've tested so far, perhaps because the color I get in my head is not bright red or bright pink, but a deep black/red color when I smell it. The color looks velvety. Maybe this is the truffle? You know how your eyes feel when the lights shut off and it's kindof a relief for your brain? The color I get from this scent is like that. A black-burgundy velvet eye mask. Soothing but sexy, yes?

I smell something warm and chocolatey, but not too spicy. Comfortingly warm, like a hug. But there's depth to the hug. It's not just a "hi, friend!" hug. It's like a hug from someone who is secretly pining for you but will never tell you. Comforting, but hopelessly romantic, yes?

I don't know how Tom Ford (and the perfume magicians) can make me feel soothed and aroused, content and full of longing, all at the same time, but it suits me down to the ground.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Can someone please post the old batches from 2007 until the first reformulation.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Don't bother buying this, it is not what it use to be. This use to fill the whole room with an undeniably beautiful aroma. Now its been watered down so much that it just isn't worth it at the current price tag.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The truffle ruins it for me. Somehow I find this combination of rose, patchouli and truffle rather nauseating. I had to wash it off.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Pretty, uncloying rose. Very feminine on my skin. Not noir enough unfortunately.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: An earthy, rosy, green, sweet, strong, high quality, and overrated fragrance.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is feminine, even Tom ford described it as such. Nice, warm and a lil spicy, I can see this as a nice scent but not for a masculine guy or a guy who wants to feel masculine, I had to sell it after a few weeks o owning. The performances was also lacking on my skin, either that or i got nose blind to it pretty quickly. Not in my alley, definitely not a blind buy

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: 2017 batch- still has the same exact smell as the 2007 batch however it’s been severely watered down. I did about 4 sprays and it projected well for an hour and then turned into a skin scent for the second hour. After two hours this scent is 85% gone. I can just barely detect it

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Noir de Noir is a lovely, classy, and sultry scent. It reminds me a lot of Narciso Rodriguez For Her.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
It’s a rose oud, one of the first of the modern trend of black fragrances, and also the best. It doesn’t burn the nostrils like Black Oud, or wither flowers like Silk Mood, or pierce flesh like Bull’s Blood. It steers clear of the mire of sticky, generic-smelling coumarin such as you find in Rose D’Arabie, Back to Black, and Man in Black.

This masterpiece is a lacy, pillowy rose enshrined in a powdery accord of vanilla, oud, and patchouli. The rose isn’t simply red, but so deeply red that it’s pure black.

Scent: 10/10
Sillage: 4 feet
Longevity: 6-8 hours

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
As far as I'm concerned, this is probably Tom Ford's best fragrance.
I use it frequently and do consider this perfume more masculine than feminine although it is qualified as unisex. Well... it's maybe acceptable.
This is a very well blended floral-spicy-oriental fragrance and very black. I find it a semi-dark to dark perfume. It's semi-dark because it's subtle and it's dark because it has really some gloomy and black notes. That blackiness completely outlines this perfume and its evolution. I already tried to layer it with other dark and non dark scents but with very poor success in my findings so far. It seems to be perfect as it is.
The perfume opens very smoothly, like someone slowly approaching with slippers. It's quite a soft and intimate saffron starting this scent journey, however a bit leathery and bittersweet.This note does prevail for a while but the global scent evolution surprises us with a powerful rose, a dark persistent rose that sticks around almost all through the perfume life.The rose note gives you nuances of powder and black woods. It's a dark, dirty and woody accord of a special rose... marvelous!
I am not a rose scent fancier but I really like this composition. Probably due to the heart notes support (flowers and truffles), the dark rose scent is emphasized with a musky, earthy and pungent aroma.
The base notes set a peaceful oud frame with earthy patchouli and lightly sweet vanilla, but the dark gloomy rose persists for quite a while. The agar wood note is not prominent but does have a base role in the fragrance shadowy evolution.
As the time passes, the dry down becomes a bit more sweet and powdery.
The perfume does give a strong impression of class and sophistication, with an above average longevity but with an average projection. Probably it is what's correct for this upscale fragrance. Excessive projection would be annoying. The scent is not cloying. The darker accords are never to proeminent and offer an excellent near skin performance. I do consider this perfume to be very well designed and perfectly blended. I have a faint heart for this type of obscure scents and I find it very alluring and sexy.
However the world is not perfect and this scent it's not an universal pleaser. It has probably as many haters as lovers. Many people reject the subtle overlaying obscure shadow present in all the stages of this fragrance. After all "cést un parfum noir de noir" (it's a black perfume of black).
I love it and consider it a real masterpiece... La crème de la crème de Tom Ford!
There is just one concern.... its price! I can only consider it quite expensive, specially when there is a very well blended similar fragrance - Armaf Club de Nuit Intense for Women - costing 10% to 15% of the Noir de Noir price.
Nevertheless and as far as I'm concerned, this is probably Tom Ford's best fragrance.

Keep your scent high!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The was the first Tom Ford I managed to get my hands on!

I am still mind blown. The note breakdown made me think this would be similar to the Rose-Oud combo in Middle Eastern fragrances, maybe on the lines of EL Amber Mystique or Armani Rose D'Arabie - both of which I really enjoy.

But this one is surprisingly modern - and ethereal the way that it is. The rose lends it a lush richness, but it retains its natural lightness rather than turning into a jammy, caramelised rose. The Oud is very much there but never overpowers the rose. The truffle and saffron (not heavy at all) lend some warmth and earthiness, but the oakmoss brings with it enough freshness to ensure this is never cloying. And the whole composition is brought together by a beautifully refined patchouli - it doesn't lose its spunk but at the same time it doesn't cross the fine line that makes it unpleasant. In its extreme dry down, it does resemble the last few hours of Mugler's Angel, but this is evidently way more refined.

Longevity and sillage are STELLAR; I have never had a perfume perform this well on me. Absolutely worth every penny. A fantastic composition and quite versatile. Except a hot day at the beach, I cannot think of an occasion where this would be inappropriate .

My only worry is the talk about this having been reformulated :-(

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Very true to it's note list. Beautiful blend of rose, patchouli, oud, and truffle. Opening and first few hours lean more feminine because the rose dominates. The dry down tho... patchouli takes over as the main note, just a little hint of vanilla comes along and rose takes the subtle role I like it to have and this becomes an incredibly sexy and masculine woody, green, sweet scent.

I would 100% buy a full bottle if the entire fragrance smelled like it's dry down: More prominent patchouli and subtle rose with more sweet woody notes. But as it stands, it's only a "like" for me. Many other fragrances ahead of it in my shopping list.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
if u are new comer in niche world
this rose note will stronger than ur nose

but if u live long enough
u will love the rose note in this frag

just smell it in the air
dont stiff ur nose in it, the patchouli and the oud is very strong

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is a scent that garners the thought, who or what smells so good. People may not say a word to you, but from the obvious sniffing around and expressions of approval, you just know they are loving this scent. Thank you, Mr. Ford for this wonderful gift — Noir de Noir.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I stumbled upon an old sample so I think I have an early batch. My first thought was, this smells like Club de Nuit Intense by Armaf, but then I was thinking it's a bit sharper and richer, perhaps a touch more floral/"feminine" as well. In any case, with these kinds of fragrances, I prefer a more toned-down quality, and since I already have a bottle of CdNI, there would be no reason to buy a bottle of this one. I'll update if anything changes over time.

UPDATE: The drydown seems more gourmand than CdNI and overall it has a "brighter"' quality; it also seems sweeter. So, I'd have to do a side by side test but I'd say now that CdNI is more unisex than NdN, but it's a matter of preference, because I can't say that one is clearly "superior" to the other, but then there is the massive price difference.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tom Ford 'Noir de Noir' is the sultry, mysterious women who walks in late because she's a double agent working for the Romanian Intelligence Service. She just came off a mission and arrived a few minutes late to an upscale formal event happening tonight. Draped in a deep blood red, backless, low cut dress with a dark red lip and sky-high heels, she is taller than most of the guests. Her long raven hair is loosely curled and put into an unconstrained low bun, wavy tendrils falling over her forehead, shaping her beautiful tan face elegantly, her beauty rivals Aphrodite herself. The small smirk on her face tells everyone to be wary, she knows things she shouldn't and if the wrong people got a hold of her knowledge.. she could start diplomatic wars. Her scent is alluring as it is mysterious reeling in bystanders (like an unsuspecting fly diving straight into a pot of honey, unware that the sweetest of treats has the ability to destroy their lives within seconds) She has a haunting presence. She may seem delicate like a rose, but look closer and you can see just how destructive she can get; her thorns will rip your flesh if you pose a threat to her.
She captures images of thick, bitter dark chocolate slowly dripping inwards of a full blossomed dark rose’s bud.
She walks toward the darkness as the midnight ink swallows her whole, only her sensual scent trail remians.. She will always be your greatest mystery.

One youtube fragrance reviewer "Demi Rawling" described this as a dark chocolate filled with rose liquor and that is spot on.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: the whole TF privee has been reformed and it lasts shortly so forget the old reviews!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Heavy on the rose, touch of vanilla and saffron, that's it for me. Quite nice, good longevity, but just a bit too feminine for my liking.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: All of the notes are exactly described by other reviewers. I love this for evening. It is sexy and dark and represents me well at 50 and brunette and full figured. I love it.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Noir de Noir is one of the best fragrances I have ever smelled, and today finally pulled the cord on a full bottle. Initial blast of rose is good, but for me the drydown is where the magic happens. Smooth, sexy, sophisticated and stunning. This may be what heaven smells like.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Smells like mom's rose jam.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Woody, warm, spicy rose.

A really nice smell for cold days.

Absolutely identical to a fragrance called Velvet by Scent Maker, which a Kuwaiti brand!

That got me thinking, as a Middle Easterner, this is not the 1st time I smell a Tom Ford fragrance that I find very familiar only to recall an exact smell by another local Arabic brand.

Is TF ripping people off by copying old scents from unknown parts & presenting them to the North American & European markets at extremely high prices as his "private collection"? Or are the Arabic brands copying him? I've smelled fragrance in chronological order that support both cases.

I've had the same experience with Montale, too.

Ok, good scents, good performance, but suspiciously similar to other fragrances (not sure who came first, though) for extremely high prices

I'm on to you, Tommy boy. I got my eyes on you.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I want to try this so badly, but there's no way I'll ever be able to afford it and I can't find any samples. Warm spicy, rose, patchouli and woody scents are my favorite. Looks like it's time to find a sugar daddy who is also a perfumisto.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Sadly noir de noir now is reformulated. I got new batch NdN and juice colour like mineral water

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The tuber note is like in Black Orchid. But this fragrance is less floral and more unisex. It could be Black Orchid for men.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
@cristinezorc You have to let fragrances dry down, boo boo.

Noir de Noir turns into a whole 'notha scent during the dry down. It goes from that almost cloying rose to a box of chocolates.

The blend of patchouli, vanilla and truffle take the cake.

This is perfect for Winter, Fall, Spring (In that order).

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Short version : what ibrahiemo below said exactly, this is the one that should be called FUCKING FABULOUS.

Longer version: I discovered TF with Neroli Portofino and was totally underwhelmed, not to mention the outrageous price tag. I tried others as well such as TUSCAN LEATHER, several OUDs and the one "fucking fabulous" which I'd rather call 'MEH'.
But this one ? Well what can I say ? OUD, ROSE, and a well blended non gourmand vanilla makes this a fantastic masculine dark rose. It's heav, heady, definitely mysterious, seductive and in fact plain enthralling really, just like a magic philter. For men +30, cold season and please don't wear this with jeans and tshirts. Very lush and FUCKING FABULOUS INDEED !!! Oh and performance wise : radioactive projection and the sillage of a supernova !

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
just an FYI for all NdN lovers-
I just bought the Byredo "rose" hand cream and seriously, it is sooooooooooo gooooooood!the first thing that came to mind was NdN and it's SO perfect to layer this with for more oomph and lasting power!

put it on wherever you are applying the perfume, and BAM! much more of what we all love...

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is a classic, not overly done. Its smooth and for a mature person for sure. Smells like TF Oud wood, but with less power and strike.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tom Fords Fragrances are overated in my opinion. But, this is one of the few Tom Fords that lives up to the hype. It will hook you. Its more masculine, how I like it. Smells Perfectly done. Its not cloying, imbalanced, confusing or overly concentrated. Its smooth. This, Tobacco Vanille, and Grey Vetiver stands out the most

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Dear Tom Ford

This one should be called
Fucking fabulous.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
As far as I'm concerned, this is probably Tom Ford's best fragrance.
I use it frequently and do consider this perfume more masculine than feminine although it qualifies as unisex. Well... it's maybe acceptable.
This is a very well blended floral-spicy-oriental fragrance and very black. I find it a semi-dark to dark perfume. It's semi-dark because it's subtle and it's dark because it has really some gloomy and black notes. That blackiness completely outlines this perfume and its evolution. I already tried to layer it with other dark and non dark scents but with very poor success in my findings so far. It seems to be perfect as it is.
The perfume opens very smoothly, like someone slowly approaching with slippers.
