It's quite a soft and intimate saffron starting this scent journey, however a bit leathery and bittersweet.This note does prevail for a while but the global scent evolution surprises us with a powerful rose, a dark persistent rose that sticks around almost all through the perfume life.The rose note gives you nuances of powder and black woods. It's a dark, dirty and woody accord of a special rose... marvelous!
I am not a rose scent fancier but I really like this composition. Probably due to the heart notes support (flowers and truffles), the dark rose scent is emphasized with a musky, earthy and pungent aroma.
The base notes set a peaceful oud frame with earthy patchouli and lightly sweet vanilla, but the dark gloomy rose persists for quite a while. The agar wood note is not prominent but does have a base role in the fragrance shadowy evolution.
As the time passes, the dry down becomes a bit more sweet and powdery.
The perfume does give a strong impression of class and sophistication, with an above average longevity but with an average projection. Probably it is what's correct for this upscale fragrance. Excessive projection would be annoying. The scent is not cloying. The darker accords are never to proeminent and offer an excellent near skin performance. I do consider this perfume to be very well designed and perfectly blended. I have a faint heart for this type of obscure scents and I find it very alluring and sexy.
However the world is not perfect and this scent it's not an universal pleaser. It has probably as many haters as lovers. Many people reject the subtle overlaying obscure shadow present in all the stages of this fragrance. After all "cést un parfum noir de noir" (it's a black perfume of black).
I love it and consider it a real masterpiece... La crème de la crème de Tom Ford!
There is just one concern.... its price! I can only consider it quite expensive, specially when there is a very well blended similar fragrance - Armaf Club de Nuit Intense for Women - costing 10% to 15% of the Noir de Noir price.
Nevertheless and as far as I'm concerned, this is probably Tom Ford's best fragrance.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I fell out of love with Noir de Noir for about a year. Recently, I reached for this fragrance to wear on a night out. I’m now back in love with NOIR DE ‘FREAKING’ NOIR. Yes! Contrary to popular opinion, I love wearing this on summer nights. I don’t get complimented but you know what it is when ppl just stand a little too close to you. They may not say anything but trust me, they’re getting their whole life while standing so close to you. I’m gonna need another bottle - Tom please stop reformulating. Thank you!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The initial blast of rose was pretty, but it started to feel a bit too sweet in a boozy way, and then the kiss of death for me: chocolate. I should have ignored the notes and read reviews. Like Flowerbomb for Him.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
It is a simple rose patchouli oud combo. That is it.
Absolutely not worth the price! If you like rose patchouli oud you will most likely be as happy to own YSL Elle, JoMalones Velvet Rose and Oud or from Atelier Cologne Rose Anonyme. The differences in smell i almost null.
So why waste you money on a very common very accessable scent?
Longevity is medium. Sillage ok.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Opens with rose and something almost like peach or candy, definitely sweet, soon dried down to all patchouli, hint of marshmallow vanilla. Unisex. Reminds me of Voleur de Roses for those looking for a more affordable interpretation of rose and patchouli.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I love the juicy full opening, but the drydown loses its depth. Worth trying for oriental and classic rose lovers, but it's not for me.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Scent - oakmoss, patchouli saffron opening that morphed into vanilla rose & oud.

Season/Time of Day - I prefer to use this one in the colder months, day or night.

Projection - I did get noticed, I didn't get a compliment.

Longevity - I get 24hrs consistently.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I've been searching for my perfect rose for a really long time, finally I found this gem and just can't stop smelling myself. Usually rose scents give me a headache or are too ¨cold¨ and ¨dry¨ for my liking. But Noir de Noir is just pure perfection. It's warm and inviting and rosy and interesting and sensual and elegant and mysterious, all at the same time. Then it becomes more and more comfortable and cosy through out the day. It's everything I ever wanted in a rose scent and more...

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I agree with the Morticia Addams comparison. One of the few rose scents I can wear. I get dead powdery incense roses, the earthy smell of soil after a storm, and sweet chocolate. The patchouli is present but toned down instead of the slap in the face level some of the goth boys used to wear. I once had an India rose balm perfume that was pretty close to this scent. As much as I love this it seems a bit pricey. I have the mini, and would likely buy the body spray version once the mini runs out.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is gorgeous though it doesnt last long. Yes, its dark and creamy. Lovely ...if only it could last.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I do not smell ROSE at all; just all woody scent for me, although I do smell the tuberose in it. A very masculine perfume and it reminds me of my dad's perfume (my boyfriend says it reminds him of his dad too). It is spicy musky (soft woody)..softer accord than 1Million Prive.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Sexy black dress
Dark red lipstick
Smokey eyes
Long dark hair
Head high to the sky
Thats exactly what I feel smelling this fragrance !

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Sometimes it feels like mouth-watering but very strong rose liquor, and sometimes like I am alone in a dry, clean and empty room with rose incense rising somewhere.

To buy 250ml bottle of Noir de Noir without feeling guilty is my eventual dream.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Beautiful. The initial phase is all rose, but then vanilla, patch and a very light oud come in and that's where I fell in love. I don't own a full bottle but it's on my wishlist.

I don't mind buying paying a little extra when a perfume is well blended with better than average longevity (6+ hrs)

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Rose, patchouly, oakmoss, interesting and fun...incredibly overpriced though!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I really prefer Oud Fleur for a Rose Oud combo.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
اجمل عطور الدار
،،
لست من محبين عطورات توم فورد لكن هذا العطر قد سحر انفي
.
.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: There is something old school and classy about noir de noir. Very smooth and calm but it has a character which is distinctive. I get the rose,vanilla and oud the most of all. I tested it in a shop and even after shower it still lingers on my skin. Beautiful fragrance!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is beautiful juice! Very sultry, lovely rose, vanilla, patchouli-only not too much, just right. It's quite soft and very close to the skin on me. As with most TF that I have had the pleasure to try, this one also stays close to my skin and has very short lasting power. But if you can get a hold of this in a sample (I get mine from Luckyscent) it is so worth it, just to see for yourself how lovely it is. I find it very feminine, but I wouldn't mind at all smelling this on my hubby. If it were less expensive, I might consider buying a bottle, but the lasting power is too short for me.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tried so hard to love this .. but the Tuber mixed with Saffron made it too hard for my nose to accept it.

It smelled like mold and fungus united in that Tom Ford bottle.

Can't. Just Can't.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: My new favorite Tom Ford. I'll definitely be purchasing this in the near future, probably just a 30ml, which you can find for around $100 on Scent Split. Very seductive red rose and cocoa powder scent. Definitely unisex, but it actually does feel somewhat masculine on me, thanks to the spices and oud in this. Smells amazing on clothes too. Sex in a bottle.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: A sophisticated, slightly heavy rose/woody scent. Nice enough, but guess what: It shares 98% of its DNA with the iconic and (still) wonderful Antaeus; the resemblance is quite striking actually. So if you want the NdN experience for less than half the price, try Chanel.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: It is cold, dark and misterious...

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is supposed to be a Rose scent but after the Rose dies it’s surprising how much Patchouli there is. Very nice and I’m not a patchouli lover

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Anyone interested in buying Noir de Noir? I love it so much unfortunately I get a headache after a while of wearing it. It’s hardly used since I’ve been using my sample. It has its packaging and is in excellent condition as I mention it was hardly taken out of the box. Please send me a msg if interested, thanks.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Noir de Noir smells like blood red rose petals, merlot, dark chocolates filled with liqeur, satin lingerie, bed sheets after sex, and a touch of a man's cologne and sweat (patchouli/oud) on warm skin. It smells very feminine to me, but I could see how it could be unisex/masculine if your skin amplifies the earthy notes. On me, it smells purely of dark roses, chocolate, fine alcoholic beverages, silk, and sex. So much so, that I could only wear this on date night. It's too naughty for daytime, and too refined for anything other than an intimate night spent alone with your partner (in other words, not a clubbing/party fragrance). Quite possibly both the sexiest and most sexual fragrance I have ever encountered. Huge compliment getter as well. If I had to describe it in one word-passionate.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: @obenno, there's actually two perfumers behind this, Jacques Cavallier and Harry Fremont, with Tom Ford as the creative director.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The best chocolate and rose scent in the world!!! To my nose anyway. Beautiful dark yet sweet chocolate with the freshness of the rose. My favourite Tom Ford private blend thus far. Initial spray is quite alarming but the dry down is magnificent. I'm always slightly aggrieved to purchase Tom Ford's as the price is outrageous but this really is a wonderful scent and certainly a luxury treat!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The Best Interesting Fragrance In The World

Take You To The Dark Side !

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is my first ever review and I love this scent. I bought Tom Ford Patchouli Absolu and got TF Noir De Noir as a sample bottle. I layered them wearing them to a work night out Christmas party and within 10 minutes had my first compliment from a passing woman who told me I smelled amazing to the consternation of her partner. What was even better is that she was a very classy looking lady with a younger better looking partner than me. I felt like I owned the evening, layering in a little level of conceit and confidence. I became the man in the advert, I was transported outwith myself with this scent; I became the rose and the patchouli, I became the antihero of the evening. Anti hero? yes, as with this scent you are every mans nemesis a threat to his insecurities. I feel that layering it with PA it becomes a little more masculine and adds to the longevity. I was smelling it as a skin scent 16 hours later.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Dec. 2017 - bought my bottle today especially for an upcoming event - a Masquerade Ball!. Of all the fragrances I own, 200+, I couldn’t think of a better choice. (Maybe my vintage Must De Cartier or vintage Opium). Event is black tie. All around are tall pines and oaks, freshly flocked with snow. Mink coats against the cold air. Everyone disguised in our authentic Venetian Colombinas. Champagne bubbling up and wine flowing down our throats. And my Noir de Noir will be wafting through the air as I pass on my way to the dance floor. Rich, dark, mysterious, sexy, bold, flirty, My dress is black, with burgundy roses embroidered on a sheer black bodice. There’s a thigh high slit in the skirt and ruffles line the hem. The dress looks like the fragrance smells. Thank you, Tom Ford, for having the vision to dress ladies in fragrance!!!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I wore this fragrance today. This overpowered tobacco oud and tobacco Vanille, and I had sprayed NdN on my neck hours before I was in Holt Renfrew spraying on TO and TV. I think I'll stick to Noir De Noir. I find it to be more versatile and just overall a better quality scent.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I. Am. DYING.! "You smell like my mother." - Oh Lort! Thank you for my snort today.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This hit me with pruned roses in a vase, overly sugared lemonade, then amaretto non-dairy creamer--gorgeous wild things tamed and tempered to be generic. I felt the need to mind my dirty mouth, to check my shirt buttons for too much cleavage.

Then the guy said, "you smell like my mother."
(She wears Obsession.)
So that's that.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Yeah, I REALLY like this but not enough to buy a full priced bottle. I did "invest" in a body spray. Again, I really like it. It's a sweet and powdery rose on my skin. It does manage to be sort of "dark" and it's sexy for sure! I get a tiny hint of oud - but nothing that I find myself focusing on or that bothers me (I'm not a big fan of oud.)

Edit: I recently bought Club de Nuit Intense Armaf for women and it is similar for TF Noir de Noir and much more affordable. Save your money and get the Armaf.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Morticia Addams´ perfume.
Definitely.
How could I know it?
Because wearing this perfume is like watching a movie.

Take 1 - Morticia is cutting the buds off of roses, which she discards, keeping only the stems.
Take 2 - Morticia is walking through the family cemetery in the night, the air is humid and smells like wet leaves and soil.
Take 3 - Morticia is preparing some mysterious potion consisting of dried saffron, vanilla seeds & tuber essence.

The potion is as "noir" as it can be, deeply sweet, with a light spicy undertone & balsamic/earthy mist in the background.

This fragrance is... I´d like to use word "enigmatic" /just like Morticia is/.

And I must confess this matter of fact - my Halloween costume was Morticia this year. And yes - I put this perfume on. I think that the illusion was perfect, children were crossing the street when they noticed me. Well done, Noir de Noir, well done.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I think people deserve to know who the perfumer behind this incredible creation is.. I understand it all falls under the 'Tom Ford' name but after ten years we deserve to know the truth! He/she should be recognised for this masterpiece.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
منذ سنوات و الى اليوم
لم اجد عطر روز اجمل من نوار دو نوار
رغم تجربتي وامتلاكي للكثير منها ..!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: A fine pick from the private line's greatest hits collection. Noir de Noir is equal parts sexy and subdued. It doesn't throw punches at people like some of Tom Ford's louder scents. It's an earthy rose infused with cacao and refined patchouli. Warm and buttery, meditative and relaxing. There is definitely a hint of chocolate but it's far from gourmand. An extremely well balanced, fine scent. But it does seem a little weak, and if I'm going to spend that kind of money I want something with a little more oomph.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This fragrance is truly something else! I purchased this perfume back in August, and I was saving it for a rather special occasion. This Friday, the 21st, will be my 4 year anniversary with my girlfriend, and I feel that NdN is the perfect scent. I have worn this whilst testing it in store, but never a true, full wear. I cannot wait to finally start wearing this masterpiece! A very romantic fragrance, that will certainly set the mood for you and whoever you wish to encounter. Floral, sweet, and at the same time masculine. Sexy, indulgent (just as Tom Ford the man himself describes it). My top Tom Ford Private Blend next to Tobacco Oud.

I had amazing projection and sillage with NdN. Longevity is superb. Very powerful juice! Worth the price tag!

Wear your favorite dress shirt. A pair of slacks, and shine up those dress shoes! Oh, and some Noir De Noir!

11/10

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Noir de Noir is a beautiful earthy rose. A bit of saffron in the beginning then the rich dark rose blooms in full splendor. Its a gorgeous fragrance, and I highly recommend trying the body spray version for $60. Its also strong and lasts a long time. I can only imagine both layered. Heaven.
Super buy for winter.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: COMBO TIP: I layer 2 parts Noir de Noir with 1 part Shangai Lilly!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I disagree with the reviewer below me. I received my 10ml decant of Noir de Noir recently, and today while I was running late to run errands, I sprayed a single spray on my chest, and 13 hours later I can still get whiffs of it. Maybe the decant I own was decanted from the vintage/pre-reformulation batch, and as everyone know, this perfume has been reformulated in the past. So far, I am impressed with the performance and projection of this scent. I grew up in the middle east, and I reckon that a majority of the Saudi people I encountered wear NdN. When I first received it, I couldn't put a single finger on where I had smelled it before but, then I was like YES THATS THE SCENT I KNOW VERY WELL. Middle eastern people are known for their taste in expensive and fine fragrances, and I credit them for evoking and nurturing my admiration for scents that I have today.

Anyway back to the performance of the scent, it smells like a mixture of pat-vanilla-rose, and so far I cannot smell oud or chocolate in any of its phase. My nose is acoustomed to oud, and so far, I detect none. Perhaps I need to compound the number of sprays to get a full effect of this magical potion. This stuff is potent, and I find that one spray can give me a projection of 3-4 feet. I will update once I compound the number of sprays when there is an occasion or reason to do so.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I received this perfume as a gift from my husband, but it has no lasting power AT ALL! My husband bought this perfume at the duty-free in the airport and he told me that, the tester was so strong and long-lasting. In fact that I could smell it for hours on the paper test. My daughter tried too and the same: as soon as you spray it, is gone. Tom Ford should be ashamed asking such a high price for a bottle of water!!!! I advise you to be careful on purchasing this perfume unless you want to throw away your money!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Noir de Noir is part of the Tom Ford Private Blend collection. It might be of interest to those of you who love a layered rose scent. It starts off with an opening that is very much about saffron. Noir de Noir is smoothly blended, so much so that the saffron is mildly detected under the sweet rising heart note of semi-sweet chocolate. There is a bit of an alcohol wave here that is like a candied dark liqueur, warm and smooth. Once the liqueur sensation gives way, Noir de Noir opens up to a brooding, dark rose and truffle scent. The heart notes take their time settling in, and it isn't until the dry-down that you can appreciate the blending of the vanilla, rose, truffle and chocolate hovering over a slightly earthy patchouli. There was some confusion by Noir de Noir in the beginning by its imposing dark and mysteriously sweet personality. This fragrance walks a fine line as being unisex and is just a tad more feminine that Tom Ford would like you to believe. Sample first, but it might be love at it first sniff.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
My favorite private blend - hands down. this fragrance is just stunning!

it is rich, Dense, opulent, gourmand, creamy, sexy, erotic, fun, provocative, sweet, luscious, and every other synonym i can come up with to describe pleasure or something delicious.

This thing starts of as a huge bomb on me of roses/honey (yes even if it's not listed) and chocolate. Holy hell, it is INTENSE for the first 5-10 mins.

then, the most incredible thing happens, it turns into the most delicious, heady chocolate i have ever out my nose on! I mean, it smells like a delicious chunk of dark chocolate served on a bed of roses....oh my F**** god it is just amazing! one of the most photorealistic scents i have EVER tried!

10/10 MASTERPIECE!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The rose note really expressed itself on my skin in this mild autumn weather here in the Midwest. It just never evolved into anything deeper or more interesting. Just a straight powdery rose scent. I blame my skin more than the fragrance since it smelled great in the store. I ended up returning it for a bottle of Tobacco Oud.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Parte forte la prima mezza ora con rose rosse infinite , intere,foglie,stelo e radici comprese mescolate ad una bevanda choco-coffee-vanilla e un pizzico di oud che le proietta lontano.Non mi fa impazzire questa fase.Quasi stucchevole in vicinanza ma altrettanto magnetica per chi si trova intorno.
questo profumo ha bisogno di vento e stagioni fredde.
Si placa in una spolverata di patch,zafferano, vaniglia dolce e gourmant. abbastanza decadente.
Come un cane vado in cerca della nota di Tartufo senza trovarla.Abito in UMBRIA e finora quella più veritiera l'ho annusata in JOE MALONE.
...Bah..

Non e' un profumo da nonna semmai... da dolce zia.
Puo' essere indossato quotidianamente da donne ma anche da uomini in occasioni eleganti.
Ok la durata. ok su tessuto. ok dopo una doccia!!non occorre riapplicare!
Un 50 ml dura a lungo.
Conveniente.

Il drydown?...BEDTIME STORIES

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is the Tom Ford that should have been named F***ing Fabulous.

It all began approximately a month and a half ago when I finally tried Noir de Noir for the first time, and I owe a thank you to two lovely ladies, osandra and Eyviab.

Noir de Noir was never even on my radar to try with rose being listed as the most prominent note; I like rose, but not ROSE. However, when I was asking for suggestions in the the forum, the amazing osandra mentioned this one; so I finally decided to buy a sample and test it. Admittedly, I was not expecting much, but after that first whiff from the sample, I was in love.

...And down the rabbit hole, I fell.

Over the next month, I wore through over an ounce worth of Noir de Noir decants, wearing it almost everyday FOR A MONTH! Oooooh, it is THAT good. Then Eyviab, being the angel that she is, sold me her bottle. Muah! Considering how often I have been wearing my new treasure, I thought it wise to invest in a back-up as well.

I know that I am a very selective perfumista, and I am perfectly content not having a huge wardrobe, but I have still had my nose on many, MANY different fragrances. Throughout all of my sniffing, Noir de Noir is one of the very few that I consider "Shalimar status", and if you know how I feel about Shalimar, then you know that is the highest compliment I can give another fragrance.

I agree with others that this is Valentine's Day in a bottle; it's so rich, deep, romantic and compelling, and dare I say the best chocolate fragrance.

Sure, there are tons of other rose-patch fragrances, rose-oud perfumes, and rose-patch-oud combinations, but none of them are quite like Noir de Noir.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: As @Ascentofman says below, Rose and Truffles, sounds simple but this is ethereal perfume.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I smell rose and truffle - Fucking gorgeous on either sex

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Yes it's unisex, yes it's gorgeous!
Simply stunning perfume.
2 notes dominate but they work incredible together; Black Roses & dark chocolate.
Not sweet, cloying or sickly, but literally the smell of roses dipped in the finest dark chocolate.
The fragrance envelopes you with a density I've only felt with Black Afgano, wearing this feels almost ethereal.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Truly delightful and delicious!

When I got this a few years ago, it was described to me as containing oud, black rose and black truffle. I feel they failed to mention that it contained a little black magic too, as I was under its spell the moment I first encountered it.

Love this and will certainly buy another when my existing bottle runs low.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I have no idea why so many think that the patchouli is the second most intensive note in this, to me it is all about the rose and the saffron. Also there is something wild and dewy lingering around this massive rose bouquet.
This smells gothic, juicy, velvety black and just lovely. If Morticia Addams would have a favorite perfume, it would be this one definetly.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Noir de Noir by Tom Ford is truly bewitching! This is one of the few fragrances I own where I can literally smell every note, yet they complement one another so perfectly. A lush rose spiced up with saffron and a sweet hint of vanilla all on a bed of green patchouli leaves with a wisp of oakmoss and the resinous, woody smell of oud and earthy tuber. This is like wearing black velvet and carrying a bouquet of red roses to a cemetery at night, there is something dark and somber about it yet very serene. Absolutely gorgeous fragrance!

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tom Ford Private Blend Collection has struck me in such a way, that I want to own one or two of his fragrances. I am quite familiar with his offerings. I own Black Orchid (the EDP for women) which I absolutely love! Lately I have had quite an interest in Noir De Noir. Josh Donaldson, my favorite baseball player, kind of inspired me to want this fragrance. I have smelt it about a year ago. I love the use of black rose, which does not make it too feminine. The black truffle is also a great earthy tone that pairs well with the vanilla and patchouli. The patchouli gives it a floral vibe which is great. All around, this scent is unique and certainly one that will get you noticed.

So, I went out to Holt Renfrew this afternoon and first sprayed this on myself to help me decide. I gave it some time. I walked around the mall for almost an hour, I came back and I bought it. This fragrance is absolutely astounding! It's very seductive, floral, sweet (not gourmand) and certainly the secret weapon on almost anyone's collection. It is certainly unisex, but I feel depending on the wearer, they make it their own. It has great longevity and sillage, certainly is something unlike any other that I own. Tom Ford did an amazing job with Noir De Noir. This marks my first Private Blend purchase. I am now a proud owner of his masterpiece.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tested yesterday, sample from Scent Samples.

Love at first sniff.
Despite reviews warning to only use a couple of sprays, I used quite a few. Wrists, inner forearms, collarbones, neck, chest and belly. It didn't open with a huge blast, for me. But oh, oh, ohhhh...how I LOVE the opening. Sweet, so sweet, the rose, but with a luscious dark undertone to it, almost gourmand.

Within the first hour I detected a clearly animalic note. I am a fan of animalic accords, so this is not at all off-putting to me. A hint of fecal, also, but it was very fleeting - the truffle, I suppose. Dirtiness underneath the sweetness of the rose. What a sexy, sexy scent.

It's interesting. Under my clothes, the perfume took on a much more masculine aspect - all leather, oakmoss, patchouli and oud. On my arms, candied rose sweetness with a hint of saffron.

The vanilla never appeared for me as a clearly defined note and didn't present itself in the lovely warm and lingering dry down I had anticipated, but which never came. Which was disappointing.

The longevity and projection weren't as great as I had expected from the reviews of others here, which was the second disappointment for me and what would stop me from saving my pennies to own a full bottle. I'll try it again in a month or so with what's left of the sample.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Fragrance -Noir de Noir Tom Ford
Bottle from - 2015

Tom Ford has released so many beautiful fragrances(Tuscan Leather,Tobacco Vanille,Oud Wood,Noir Extreme...).I'm happy to say that Noir de Noir is one of them.

Longevity - 10/10(10+hours)
Silage/projection -8/10(nice projection for the first 3-4 hours,silage also exist)
Weather - autumn,winter
Age - 25+
Compliments - 9/10
Scent - 9/10(one of the best rose-based fragrance)

Main notes according to me -rose,patchouli,vanilla,oud,saffron.

The drydown is nice and i get some -sweetness,woodiness and vanilla.

Emotions -sensual,passionate,sexy,seductive,love.

Occasion -date,romantic evening and special occasions.

You'll get compliments and love with this one.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Wow! This is a stunning and decadent fragrance. Rose, oud, patchouli, dark chocolate and vanilla. One of the best from the Private Collection. This complex fragrance is perfectly unisex, but the oud and patchouli combo makes it a bit more over to the masculine side. 9/10

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This has sultry Bvlgari Jasmin Noir at its core, but with less musky/mustiness and a slight sweetness that lifts it into far friendlier, but still sexy, territory.

I also get high quality fruity tones from it, though there are no such notes listed. I especially like that aspect of it.

Noir De Noir goes on strong, perhaps too strong. I'm not sure whether I like it at that early stage, though it has garnered a compliment. It quickly quiets down into a calmer, quality fragrance, that walks the line between sexy and warm/friendly.

Unfortunately, it continues to fade at quite a rate, all but disappearing by the 3 hour mark. What a shame. If it held for longer it might be full bottle worthy. Still, it's a good option for first dates.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
A perfect rose blend. Slightly sweet rose with earthiness on the side. Very heavy, will definitely overpower a room when oversprayed.
This would be the perfect date scent. It's hard to imagine women (or men) disliking this.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Noir de Noir is such a rich and intoxicating fragrance! This is an almost lethal brew of rich candied roses, smoldering incense, warm vanilla and dark chocolate. There is a heaviness to the arrangement that has me reaching for this usually for evening wear. I love the decadent and almost edible quality the notes give off.

name: Noir de Noir Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Noir de Noir is a definite beauty. The rose mixed with patchouli, tuber, oud, saffron and a hint of oakmoss is blended so well. Somehow reminds me of black tea with some added spices. Though I do believe it is of acquired taste. You won't please the masses, but will definitely impress someone who is interested in fragrances. Also, it projects and lasts for a very long time on my skin, 10+ hours. That is very rare, as most fragrances die out on my skin faster than on other people. So NdN is a definite winner. Do sample it, too bad it's expensive as hell (and it does smell expensive).

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Tom ford should’ve discontinued this one a long time ago it’s not worth Being in the private blend
What makes matters worse is that one of the cheapest fragrances in the market has a exact smell which makes buying this one a bad decision
I guess even Tom ford can screw up sometimes

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
If you are a fan of 4711 or Jean Marie Farina (by Roger & Gallet), you will mostly likely enjoy this frag. Fresh/ invigorating/ citrus-herbal-aromatic take on the "kolnisch wasser" genre, this one is quite nice.

It is amplified chic, per Tom Ford, as housed in an aqua square bottle. A great day fragrance, and considerably overpriced and over-hyped. But if you don't mind that, this is certainly enjoyable.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I've tried this fragrance a few times at TF counter. I love its neroli scent, just that it doesn't fit myself too well.

I tried it on my arms with a few sprays, at first the citrus scent was so splashing and sparklingly refreshing, thought it's gonna be a strong scent that lasts long, but then the freshness faded away quickly. The scent then turned into a mild soapy scent- not a cheap soap bar though- it's more of a high-end hotel kind of spa soap, naturally cold-pressed, with amber and musk undertone.

If Fleur de Portofino smells like roaming around a Mediterranean garden in a sunny summer day, I'd say Neroli Portofino smells more like watching summer sunset at an Italian Riviera luxury resort lounge/ balcony, with white candles lit little by little...

Longevity seems unexpectedly weak, I could hardly smell any scent left on my arms after 2-3 hours. I wouldn't say it's overpriced if it lasted longer. I also find it leaning more towards the “masculine” side (but who cares anyway it’s 2021 right).

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
In the opening it is lemon. Like a realistic one. Like a chef in his outside kitchen in Italy cooking up a recipe and chipping up lemons in front of a TV crew. There is a hint of moth balls that I don't like.

On the dry down I smell more green notes like green leaves. It turns into a different kind of smell. Laundry. Like fresh laundry in the green British countryside. I can then smell the lavender in the background which is great as I'm looking for a Sleep perfume.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
It's perfect. They took 4711 and made it useable. If only it lasted more than 2-3 hours and cost half as much... It's such a tough call. I could wear Neroli Portofino every single day in the spring and summer, and I don't mind spending coin on a good bottle, but with performance this poor I feel like a sucker. I've owned BMW's in the past, and will never again. Same deal. The cost of ownership is too high.

If anyone is reading this and finds mention of the Just Jack clone of Neroli Portofino, avoid it at all costs. It's trash. I'm no snob and own plenty of clones. But in my quest to find 4711 but long lasting and affordable, I found the Just Jack clone smells like if you went and took a whiff of a floral shop's outdoor trash dumpster on a hot summer day. There is a sharp burning plastic note that is so offensive. What I believe they are intending with the neroli note smells so sharp and so synthetic it comes off as burning rubber, burning plastic, etc. Unwearable garbage. Once I use up my 10ml decant of NP I'll just buy a 100ml like a sucker. Ferrari Bright Neroli is a wonderful alternative but has become discontinued. There's that Ferragamo neroli scent that is decent but has a bit too much modern men's fruit boot aquatic body wash in there for my taste.

Also, if you want to suffer this pain for yourself, I have a 50ml bottle of the Just Jack Neroli hot garbage juice up for grabs. Get it while it's hot!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Neroli Portofino is a beautifully blended, high-quality fragrance that invokes the sensation of walking through nature on a hot summer's day in a Mediterranean country. As all amazing fragrances do, Neroli Portofino takes you somewhere else as soon as you spray it. It opens with bright, juicy citruses, floral, orangy neroli, and some mintiness from the myrtle. As it dries down, the citruses subside a bit, and you get beautifully blended white florals coming through, especially the neroli. It smells so authentic, just like what you'd smell on a walk through flowery tracks in a hot country. Throughout, you get the musk giving the fragrance an alluring edge, and the amber which becomes more prominent as the scent dries down, and gives it a slight, comforting warmth. There's also a nice, subtle bitterness in the dry down which I think is the angelica, which makes it even more interesting. Performance is moderate, but for a summery, lighter fragrance, that's okay.

As amazingly high-quality and evocative as this fragrance is, I've always struggled to justify the price of niche, summer fragrances. With niche fragrances more aimed at colder weather, there's so much opportunity to use dark, interesting, loud notes, above and beyond what's used in designer fragrances, and that for me justifies the price increase. With lighter, more summery niche fragrances, it's difficult to add more interesting, deeper, richer accords, as they make a fragrance too heavy and it loses the light, citrusy vibes. So even though this fragrance is beautiful, and definitely a bit more interesting than summer designer fragrances, I'm not sure it's different enough to justify the price, whereas I'd have no problem spending the money on the heavier, more wintery Tom Fords. I also prefer more masculine-leaning fragrances, and this is decidedly unisex.

If money is no object, you love fragrance, and have a special holiday or occasion in the summer, this would be the perfect investment to create beautiful scent memories. But for me, I'm yet to find a niche, summery fragrance that justifies the price. Still an amazing fragrance, though.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I swear I smell patchouli in this. Maybe that's the musk mallow? Angelica? I think I can ID a musky scent pretty well, but I seriously get patchouli coming out in this. It makes it masculine, but it seems uninventive to me for TF. As I've mentioned in other TF reviews, I've been a fan of his a long time (since the Gucci bags in my hs and college days), and I know his genius. Neroli Portofino seems lazy for his ability, IMHO.

I'm a neroli lover, so I flock to the scent in any fragrance. One of my go-tos is JM's Basil Neroli, which I adore for its simplicity, and it is much more feminine than TF's version. Creed's Neroli Sauvage is nice, but leans a little masculine for me (as a woman wanting to wear it), though still not as masculine as TF NP. Other Nerolis, like 4711 Original, are classics for a reason, and great everyday colognes. That said, I see how TF is trying to make something stand-out, and special here, moreso than the "safe" standy-bys, but it just doesn't do it for me. And I mean that not only as a woman who wants to wear it, but also as a woman who can rate based on how much I'd enjoy it on a man. I just wouldn't. So many better TF options, or Neroli (non-TF) options to choose from.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Cost is too high for this ordinary smelling fragrance.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I much prefer Neroli Portofino Forte for a great hold, it's fresh and has character, 3 sprays and I'm happy with it for the whole day.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
It spells like a sunny day in the park, in Italy, France, or some small country side town - whilst wearing a clean white shirt.

The Neroli dominates all the other notes, it's gives a white floral mood. But doesn't last, the dry down is weak.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Neroli straight and simple. I find it too much neroli in pureness and is annoying to me, too intense. I prefer neroli more blended and not dominant. 3/5 only for neroli lovers.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Have you ever been to Sicily in spring? I have been and I had the most marvelous real-life sniffing experience in Cefalu, a lovely small ancient town on the North eastern coast of Sicily, half an hour away from Palermo.
I went there by train, and the minute I set my foot out of the train that led me there, I thought: I wanna live in a place like that. The air was scented, the scent had the same intensity you would smell in a room/close space scented by a human hand.
In Cefalu it was the Nature, and the scent invading the air was Orange Blossom, from the trees that were blossoming all over (even at the train station - where notoriously the smell is not the best!). That was like free aromatherapy! I felt happy smelling that finely scented air.
That long story to say that Tom Ford Neroli Portofino smells really like that perfumed air I smelled in Sicily...
It is exactly like the real thing. (OK, TF said in the name it would be the Portofino orange blossom, not the sicilian one, but it's the real thing believe me).
Pure orange blossom.... a little jasmine... it is quite linear from beginning to end; has a warm vanillic/amber base, that is never interfering with the Orange Blossom, but giving some intensity.
Moderate sillage. But the lasting power is disatrous.
Way too expensive to spritz every hour or so... However, great for daywear in spring summer.
Makes you feel happy.... really a mood lifter.
Similar vibe in the very unpretentious but inexpensive Cologne 4711, and I found an almost exact dupe in Zara Amalfi Sunrise (by Jo Malone).

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Smells like a bar of soap.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: search no further, the ultimate neroli-centered fragrance.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I cannot believe how lovely this is! Soft, warm and conforming, smells like a spa.
I also think it’s way overpriced, because it is the kind of scent you would usually find at Rituals.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This is lovely stuff. I got this on sale at Nordstrom, so it wasn't as harmful to the wallet as it would normally be.
I don't live anywhere near where 4711 is commonly used and nobody I know has ever heard of it, in any age range, so I have no associations for this scent other than knowing it is quite similar to 4711. It IS similar, but has a cottony laundry musk in the drydown that wafts up pleasantly. Luxe dryer sheets, almost.
Really, it's a gorgeous, delicate, sparkling neroli, that weaves in and out of being sweet and dry. Think Brian Krakow in My So-Called Life commenting on the "orange grove" smell of Angela's hair - that kind of thing.
Performance is bad, but if you want to feel chic and wealthy, this is a lovely fragrance.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Al Haramain Neroli Canvas better in every way all day and all night.. thank me!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
The first western fragrance I've approached after a year of strong Arabian fragrances. I guess it's for that reason that I felt a little underwhelmed by NP after reading all the rave reviews. It's an elegant scent, very lovely, but subtle and I didn't find it particularly unique. To spend half the price and justify all the attention I expected a knock out.

Good thing, in the end. Won't be tempted to throw money at it.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
A drier 4711, less sweet, less herbal, with twice the lasting power...
...which means twenty minutes rather than ten.

The orange flower is lovely, but it gets eaten up by the bergamot pretty quickly. I like the amber at the bottom--it roughs up the jasmine, but the rosemary and lavender don't have the freshness of the basil.

If I were stupid rich, I might buy a bottle, but tried and true and cheap suits broke me just fine.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I don't know why so many rate it for a warmer weather rather than cold, when it could be in truth for both warm and colder days.... anyway, i f love this. when i first sniffed it wasn't expecting anything much but i was aware that tom ford creates these amazing blends so it is either a hit or miss because i have a picky nose and this for sure is a hit. it is savoury and you immediately want to be somewhere else and that is why i would recommend to wear it in colder weather too like if you need some type of a perfume that would remind you of those niceee days or just a warmer day. and once i got away from that bottle i knew i had to get back to it (once i get enough income, like seriously kinda expensive), it really lingers there up in your nose or close to your nose because let us be honest you have not smelt anything like this which is a summer warmer days fragrance. if you want to stand out from the crowd then this is the one and also if you want to feel better and fresh this is the one and if you wnat something absolutely mind blowing just for yourself this is really that one because it doesn't have that specific tf dna in it yet it does so if you are not a big fan of other tom ford famous blends then you might actually love this.
anyway this absolute summer not so fresh but more savoury perfume will be in your collection for years because i doubt that there will be anything like that.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This is really nice. Smells very juicy, quite effervescent, and really pops off the skin. This is overshadowed by the performance, it is close to the skin and lasts about 6 hours at max.

The scent is amazing, just wish it lasted longer.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I was sure I was going to love this. I thought I had found MY summer fragrance. It's not unisex. I get too much aromatic and spicy and not enough citrus and and floral. It is unbelievably masculine on my skin. I do love the way it smells, but it's not for me.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: An "Haute Coutured" 4711. Thats it.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Very clean smelling and makes me happy. It smells, in my opinion, similar to Mugler Mugler cologne but to the next level. Like the mugler cologne was fresher and even more clean then it smells. Also reminds me of Jean Nate body splash my mom used to put on after a shower lol. Not a bad thing but just what it reminds me of. Good for the summer or daytime but is so clean smelling and light that you can pretty much wear it whenever. The smell lasted but does not project much even after a few minutes of putting it on. I think this fragrance is not meant to be big on projection and is a subtle fragrance. Expensive but it is a nice scent and if it makes you happy purchase it, I don’t regret it at all.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Tom Ford frustrates me with the crazy price points (consider the expensive fucking fabulous) but more so with the fact that he always makes me dip into my pocket because he curates a collection of smells that nobody else does and few do better.

Neroli Portofino is a case in point. Of the myriad colognes that exist, few have the wow factor, and even fewer pass the repeat desire to sniff your elbow crease. Ive tried many, from Parma, to Malle, from big houses to Heeley. This is the one i keep coming back to and shelling out for.

Does it last? nope. Is it overpriced? yes.

But for the time it does last does it smell great? does it make you feel good? do you get a kick out of wearing it? does it brighten a day? all yes for me.

We can analyse the components, argue about sillage and staying power etc, But for me it comes to a simple binary. It is as "transportative" as the marketing blurb says. And it is the finest smelling cologne out there and has been for years.

Which is why suckers like me keep paying over the odds for it.

Yep, the Texan is a frustrating man indeed...

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Orange and bergamot, a little spicy, a little jasmine and a hint of amber.... It is an ok citrate perfume, but it's enough to worth 260-320 euros? It's simple, it's clean, but there are better and more resistant versions on the skin from brands that don't have such prices. Rather than give so much on this perfume I better put a difference of 200 and take a Rubeus Milano, and I know it's high-class Italian perfume with a complex formula and scent. I find it silly to give so much on an absolutely banal perfume just because Tom Ford writes on it. No one was born as a baby smelling of Tom Ford, and yes, by the way this scent smells like baby powder topfer orange.
For those who do not want to lose so much money, I recommend Night Obsession, which is very similar but goes easily to the oriental perfumes, Fraiche from Vanilla Grace just a little sweater than this, and very very similar is Splendid Orange Blossom by Angel Schlesser or Marino and also Angel S. has four other gorgeous citrus perfumes in their collection. Conclusion: good, relaxing, summer scent, very orange and a little spicy but a very low resistance and at this price...I say no.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This scent is lovely and very inoffensive. Fresh, splashy neroli and bergamot. Great hot weather fragrance. Delightful.

So-so longevity, which in my experience is normal for this kind of fragrance. I wouldn't hold that against it...if it weren't $250 for 50mL!! You'll go through this so fast.

If you love that big citrus burst at the beginning definitely start with 4711, maybe layer it with something. It's so cheap that it's worth experimenting a bit.

Personally I don't find this unique or long-lasting enough to justify the price. You're paying for the brand name here.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: It's so funny to me how as an adult I'm mostly attracted to more expensive versions of botanica perfumes. This is expensive 4711 with more longevity & nuance. It starts strong, and goes powdery. It also reminds me of high fashion florida water. It seems like it's meant to be a refresher fragrance for hot weather. I would not buy a whole bottle of this. I'd probably buy a huge bottle of 4711 & carry around a decanted sprayer so I could refresh during the day.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
It was winter when I was in mall and tested Neroli Portofino. The mall area was warm and cosy, I sprayed the perfume and it made me feel like I just travelled back to summer.

Perfume is literally blooming, it's clean like white colour. On my skin it was jasmine, neroli and some plant I am not familar with. It's absolutely floral on me. I was inhaling aromatherapic scent all the way towards exit and calculating in mind if I can someday afford this piece.

The moment I crossed the door to damp rainy chill evening and my summer fields melted away like a nice dream and I was left with some sharp, biting lemon cologne that wasn't even close to what I experienced seconds ago. This is only warm/hot weather product, no grace or beauty in cold.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I've long wanted to get my hands on Tom Ford's Neroli Portofino and having lived in Liguria I decided it was well overdue.

Neroli Portofino is beautifully blended. It's smooth and is a perfume which embraces you. The initial blast is a load of oranges and lemons with a hint of amber, jasmine and white florals (of which it is difficult to pick out any individual note other than the jasmine) and a hint of lavender.

It projects moderately for about two hours before settling down to a skin scent afterwards. It's easily detectable on the skin for four and a half hours before fading away a little after five hours.

Neroli Portofino a lovely high quality perfume and the bottle is gorgeous. But ... that price ... it's so expensive for a perfume that isn't long lasting. I'd be delighted to receive it as a gift but I couldn't buy any more at the price. However, I would suggest treating yourself to a sample.

Nicely done neroli.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Yep, the longevity really sucks. So I just decanted some into a 12ml atomizer. I'm not usually a citrus fan, but it's great on a hot, 32-degree C day on the Canadian West Coast. But honestly, I don't think I'd recommend this. This scent was obviously made for hot weather. But I like fragrances that are thicker and heavier than this. I have 3 other Private Blends that are miles better. This 50ml bottle will last me the rest of my life, probably after. It's good, but not amazing. Didn't think I'd be saying this about a PB.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Beautiful fragrance, possibly the smoothest well crafted neroli scent.

Smell 8/10
Longevity 3/10
Projection 4/10

I love neroli and also own several other similar fragrances.

Zegna - Mediterranean Neroli
Banana Republic - Neroli Woods
Tom Ford - Neroli Portofino Aqua

As much as I love the scent, I would not buy it again as the price is outrageous considering the performance.

Anyone else think that Banana Boat Aloe vera has a likeness to this?

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Beautiful crisp clean summer fragrance been a favourite for many years

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This is very lovely and it’s essentially the summer version of Angelique Noir from Guerlain.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Tom Ford Neroli Portofino opens with a moderate projection of citrus and white floral notes. The lemon and the bergamot are the most prominent citrus note and they are very zesty, slightly musky, and sour, evocative of pure lemon juice. The floral accords come across as white flowers and are not as strong as the citrus accords. The rosemary note is very faint and doesn’t add much to the scent. The initial projection drops quickly from moderate to low. As Tom Ford Neroli Portofino dries down, the ambrette and angelica enter the blend enhancing the citrus and floral notes, and adding a mild musky tone that improves projection. The amber adds a mildly powdery touch. The most noticeable opening to a dry-down change in this fragrance is the citrus lemon opening to a musky and powdery dry-down. Once the Tom Ford Neroli Portofino has reached is full dry-down, it can be summarized as a moderate to low projection, musky, slightly powdery, white floral, and citrus fragrance with some spicy accords. The fragrance feels fresh, classy, summery, unisex, musky powdery, faint, diurnal, mature, and relatively pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2020
WOW RATING: 5/10. A musky citrusy floral fragrance, it feels average.
DISLIKE RATING: 1/10. It is unlikely that this fragrance will be offensive to anyone.
UNIQUENESS: 3/10. The notes in this fragrance are very common.
MASS APPEAL: 5/10. This is not the most mass-appeal fragrances.
PROJECTION: 2/10. Low, about 2 feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 2/10. Low, about 2 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: 4 or more atomizations.
LONGEVITY: 3/10. Low, about 3 hours, with very low projection.
SEASONS: Spring and summer.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, gym, office, business, casual. This is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 8/10. As most citrus-based fragrances, Tom Ford Neroli Portofino is versatile.
GENDER: Advertised as unisex, the white floral accords create a slight tilt to the feminine side.
AGES: 30 and above.
RECOMMENDATION: With a discounted price of over $200, Tom Ford Neroli Portofino does not deliver the performance and uniqueness that would be required to meet its price. It is a pleasant fragrance, a nice-to-have but not a must-have.
BLIND-BUY: No, sample it first. The lemony, floral, and musky tones slightly lean the fragrance to the feminine side.
SIMILAR: The following fragrances feature lemony, white floral, and musky tones. Bond No. 9 Texas is a good citrus fragrance with strong white floral notes; Xerjoff Casamorati 1888 is a warm spicy, woody, amber, floral, balsamic, and aromatic fragrance; Acqua Di Parma Men Colonia Essenza features citrus, musky animalic, fresh spicy, and white floral notes; Chanel Les Exclusifs De Chanel Jersey EDP is an aromatic, floral, fresh spicy, vanilla, and musky fragrance; Chanel Les Exclusifs Coromandel EDP brings neroli, woody, warm spicy, patchouli, and sweet tones; Issey Miyake - L'Eau D'Issey Men EDT is citrus, aromatic, fresh spicy, green, and floral fragrance; Ferrari Bright Neroli Men EDT is a soft but pleasant slightly sweet, citrus and white floral fragrance; Roja Parfums Scandal Cologne Parfum features multiple tones, including citrus, floral, and spices.
SUMMARY: A moderate to low projection, musky, slightly powdery, white floral, and citrus fragrance with some spicy accords. The fragrance feels fresh, classy, summery, unisex, musky powdery, faint, diurnal, mature, and relatively pleasant.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Shiny, juicy, watery (powerful I mean evocative of water, not watered down) and surprisingly complete smelling citrus. The rosemary is also intense. They don’t sit apart independently per se but I wouldn’t call it blended either it’s as if the oils sat beside each other just blending at the edges. the jasmine is indolic and can make it heady, but I wouldn’t immediately say “that’s distinctly jasmine” or floral. I’d say this, Hermes, with citron noir and pompelmouse rose, and clementine California by atelier cologne are some of the only fragrances that have extracted so many qualities of a cuties I feel as if I’m holding one in my hands.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I am confused (easily done!)
I have only once got my nose on TFNP in a store.
I have (very briefly) owned Ferrari BN.
I have sniffed the ALDI clone recently.
The ALDI clone did smell somewhat the same as TFNP (although having only sniffed it once I can't say how close it is).
I found absolutely no resemblance between Ferrari BN and either TFNP or the ALDI clone, none whatsoever. I fail to see how they can ever be compared. The Ferrari smells fusty and old school with not zesty, semi-sweet citrus, just the contents of an old ladies handbag (all respect to old ladies, whom I am very fond).
The TF and ALDI were bright, zesty and semi-sweet and not at all old school or fusty.
Did I have a bad bottle of Ferrari?
Confused......

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: If you are in the uk aldi does a clone of this called amalfi brillante. Its amazing and lasts all day easily, its the best quality and smelling clone i have ever had, i bought two bottles. Citrusy soapy heaven.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Neroli Portofino smells nice, but there's nothing particularly interesting about it. It is clean, somewhat unisex, and the bottle is gorgeous. It does not last at all, and for the price tag that Tom Ford demands, it is not worth it unless you have money to burn. To my nose, this smells almost identical to Clean Reserve Aqcua Neroli, but I actually prefer that one since it is not as sharp. It also isn't as bougie, so if that matters to you, go with Tom Ford I guess. There are better neroli scents out there that you could buy twice for the price of one of these.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I wanted to know what is the fuss about this one - so I ordered a sample. It smells almost identical to Renovality Neroli Body Oil. Neroli Portofino has a bit more going on, but still - it is not worth the full-on price.
Vibes: fresh holiday smell, smells like an Amalfi coast villa
Form: 2ml sample

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
The musk is strong with this one.
I'm surprised it's not mentioned more in this thread. After 5-10 minutes it's ALL I notice. 100% not worth the asking price.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: To anyone who is a fan of this Aldi uk have released a fragrance That is identical to this for £6.99 on their inhouse line LACURA called amalfi brilliante as a Father’s Day product and after testing I can confirm that this is not of low quality spayed on at approximately 3pm and showered at 5pm it’s now 21.30 pm and even after showering I can still smell it check it out it will not disappoint.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Reality is that this is nearly identical to 4711 - though it is for sure longer lasting. Excellent fragrance, but if you are looking for a solid neroli, going with Ferrari Bright Neroli is a no brainer based on cost (and frankly I find Ferrari gets more positive feedback).

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
4711 with an extra warm touch (amber ?) presented in a turquoise-ish pretty yet cheap PLASTIC bottle. It's pleasant (as much as 4711) and very short lived and absolutely not worth the exhorbitant price tag. 4711 is just as good and WAY cheaper.

And by the way, for that kind of money, TF could've had the decency to come up with a an actual GLASS bottle !

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I’ve had this since Dec last year and barely reached for it; first and foremost, it does not warrant the almost extortionate price tag it comes with considering the scent fades in no more than 2 hours, sillage is a joke as well. I could get over the fact that this scent is simply not for me, but not the price one has to pay for 5 minutes of good longevity to then become a skin scent to then just fade completely in just a couple of hours.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: this is gorgeous. One of the best scents I've ever smelled.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Smell is so good but the price is 5x of what it should be. It projects for 15minutes before being a skin scent. Longevity MAX 4 hours.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I had it before and it is a really enjoyable scent. Nevertheless, I can't stand the high-price tag and the poor longevity that it has. I'm such a hater of clones but there are so much other better alternatives that can give the exact smell for a fraction of the price with a better performance.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
When I want to sit back, relax, and enjoy life I reach for this. So fresh and smooth I can’t get enough of it – just makes me want to close my eyes and forget about everything. It’s pricey, but buy on discounters and you won’t regret it. Although fresh, it’s got a really nice depth to it that makes its so comforting. Obviously a warm weather fragrance, or fresh out of the shower scent. I get 4 hours longevity and soft-medium projection for the first 1-2 hours with 5 sprays to the chest. Some may argue that the longevity is not worth it but the scent is so good that I don’t mind respraying – obviously that doesn’t mean I like the longevity rating. Some would also say there are clones out there with better performance, but personally, I’m not a fan of clones. If you like the scent, which I can almost guarantee you will, I say buy a full bottle. Pay a little more for a non-clone and you’ll enjoy it more, in my opinion.

Scent: 9/10
Longevity: 4/10
Projection 4/10 (1-2 hours)
Overall: 8/10

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: beautiful lush neroli. My review is based largely on the body oil which is a great alternative to the ridiculously priced fragrance. The oil is highly fragrance and carries the fragrance for a long time

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This smells good.
My most used fragrance for the summer of 2019.
I spray it on me and I feel fresh luxurious and ready for the summer day.
A warm evening and you are ready for dinner with friends TF Neroli Portofino is great.

People don’t always tell you “ah you smell goood!!” but everyone I asked thinks TFNP is awesome.

Would a buy it again? YES.

I hoped that it would last longer on my skin than it does. that is the only negative I can say about this fragrance.

For the moment I more interested in TF Neroli Portfino Forte.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Just received a tester. The smell is very beautiful and it reminds me of Yves Rocher Neroli fragrance. However, I think YR lasts longer than this one even though the price is much lower.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I had a tester for this and I'm so glad that I tried before I buy'ed. I love Tom Ford and adore Neroli so I thought I had found my 'forever' perfume. Unfortunately, it didn't turn out quite like that. The neroli starts off strong - then fades into a dreadful, old-lady powdery musk - and finally, I was left with a sickening artificial vanilla.

I also completely understand that every perfume reacts differently so I was just unlucky. I'm also on quite a bit of medication so I'm wondering if that had something to do with it. Well, onwards and upwards and still seeking my FP.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I’d like to make a recommendation to people who absolutely love the neroli in this fragrance but maybe don’t want to spend the money for this one because of the price or the poor longevity. Van Cleef & Arpel California Reverie has the same beautiful neroli and natural feeling that this fragrance has. It’s also got the same sort of clean modern “non perfume” vibe that this fragrance has. I own both fragrance and I have to say that California Reverie is just as uplifting, fresh, and gorgeous as NP. I’m not saying that they are dupes, at all. They aren’t but if I smelled CR juice in a Tom Ford bottle I’d have no problem believing that it was one of Tom Ford’s fragrances. The neroli in CR smells like Neroli Portofino in quality. It’s also quite unisex even though the notes look like they might be more feminine I find that it would be good for anyone.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Soap from ultra, hyper, mega luxury bathrooms, like millionaire people buy for their bathroom and by just leaving it on the sink it perfumes beautifully the whole environment (and that the poor visitor puts in his pocket to take home). To fans of soap, if asked "where is your God now?", Tom Ford replies with Neroli Portofino: here is our God. I am sure that if there is a bathroom in paradise, the predominant smell in it will be this. It is so above all other soaps that it is able to please even those who do not like the genre (like me) - this is the level of excellence soapness here. After spraying, where I turn my nose I feel this carnival of very fragrant fruity flowers of an absurdly high level of quality and harmonic nuances. Speaking of God and paradise, I have faith that it is a sin to speak of "citrus" here: there is no acidity in the fragrance, despite those 4 fruits cited by the house market, but if it's necessary to point some fruit here, the most notable of which are certainly tangerine and orange. Very strong performance, it projects a whole meter for 3 hours and only then decelerates to 5cms for another eternity.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
citrus and flowers draped over a boozy, ambery foundation that is the typical TFPB DNA.

Imagine drinking tequila sunrises/palomas made w fresh squeezed citrus (grapefruit, lemon, orange, mandarin)and the finest blanco tequila on the deck of a sleek yacht. youre wearing a thin layer of sunscreen, a gently setting sun causes the occasional shimmer on the calm still ocean.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
As the packaging, and name of this perfume would suggest, TF’s Neroli Portofino would serve as an excellent summer fragrance and definitely more upon the masculine side - the bitter orange and something I can’t quite put my finger on make this smell like a ‘brighter, fruitier’ AdP Essenza Colonia with just enough Amber to keep things ‘smooth’ without being cloying...

Neroli Portofino has just enough projection to keep its summer song within olfactory reach but doesn’t stick in the nose and whilst it is a fragrance that smells rich and expensive, smooth and complex... it only gets a ‘Like’ not a ‘Love.’ It’s lacks a certain spark which I’ve found in AdP Essenza and Chanel Allure Sport that both entice and inspire.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Last year this became one of my mainstays for summer days at work. Light and fresh - starts off smelling like 4711 - but then dries down into a more rich and complex scent, whilst keeping the fresh citrus smell.

It's fresh, it's light, it's warm.....it's everything I want in a summer fragrance.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I've been wearing this perfume since it's launch in 2011. I can't get away from it... I never will.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I got a bottle based on all the amazing reviews of this perfume and it turned out to be a big disappointment. I expected the fresh citrus which almost everybody is enjoying, but unfortunately it smells like detergent to my nose(dare I say toilet cleaner). It must be just me, as when I offered a sniff to people around me everybody loved it. I am starting to think that Tom Ford perfumes just aren't for me, as much as I wanted to love them!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: The smell of my childhood family holidays in Portugal and Spain. The memories are so vivid when I smell this Neroli masterpiece. A wonderful fragrance, and the perfect warm summer's day accompaniment. Awesome!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This is a beautiful fragrance and one of my all time favourites. The citrus notes of orange and bergamot make this a perfect daytime fragrance, particularly for a warm summers day. The fragrance is a little expensive, which I do not mind paying in return for great longevity and sillage. This perfume unfortunately lacks both, therefore making it difficult for me to justify the price. An amazing scent nonetheless.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
For me. this is a perfect frag for ONLY summer daytime. ANd it is GREAT for that. It also doesnt last super long- which I think is a good thing for the only time of day I wear it. (I cant switch scents for night time)


If you have an arsenal of frags... I recommend but if you do not- stay far away.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Love this stuff since first sniff - bright citrus, heady white flower, a bit of glowy warmth in the base - right up my alley. It's very pure and smooth for its domain, the sort of way that Grey Goose is very pure and smooth as vodka goes. Indeed, it is a bit soapy, which to me is much of its allure - I like smelling clean. It's lovely on my skin, like I've just stepped out into the warm afternoon sun after a quick shower following the most amazing nap in a big, plush bed at an oceanside resort, windows wide open and white curtains billowing in the fresh sea breeze. And the bottle is beautiful, essentially a functional art piece that not only reflects and enhances the character of its contents but is a pleasure to use, being heavy, satisfying to the touch, easy to open and spray. I've checked out the recent flankers - Forte, Fleur - but they don't outplay the simple beauty of this original. Neroli Portofino got it all right on this one -

Except, of course, the barely-there longevity for the very-there price. I can maybe justify dropping the $128 on that 50ml bottle of Velvet Orchid, which is a potent, unique beauty indeed, but even though I have arguably more love for Neroli Portofino, heck no I'm not going to purchase it. Because while Velvet Orchid has few cousins, NP's soapy citrus + white floral is happily a pretty popular fragrance theme. Here are some economic alternatives: 4711 Echt Kölnisch Wasser (classic, pleasant bottle, doesn't last either but you can buy 10 times the amount for the same price); Clean Reserve Acqua Neroli (eco-friendly and health-friendly); Burberry London (jasmine instead of neroli, but a similar fresh-clean vibe and better longevity); Acqua di Parma (switching out the sharper neroli for a softer barbershoppy lavender); Armani Code for Her (similar with a dose of warm honey).

In conclusion, Neroli Portofino is lovely, but unless it's your perfume OTP I think there are a lot of other fish in the warm Mediterranean sea!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: For a bar of soap I shouldn’t pay that much! It’s fraud!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I would rather prefer buying soaps for the rest of the life in this price instead of this total no for me and the performance sucks too

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This is quite nice and nothing I’ve ever smelled before

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Very strong floral, I can't tell what note is offending me personally, maybe its the bergamot or the African orange flower. It smells like a bad hotel soap or something. It looks to be a favorite for many... but just not me.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Overall, it smells similar a generic soap bar easily found anywhere. I think it's Ivory soap? Not sure.

But there's still a level of complexity that makes it worth wearing and enjoyable. It's clean and likable. However, it's not worth its full price in my opinion--especially with its performance. At the price point, there are many other alternatives that are more adventurous (in a good way).

I prefer its cousin TF Mandarino di Amalfi much more. The Forte version of this fixes some performance problems, but it dials up the generic soap-like qualities even more.

I say this now, but likely will buy a bottle at some point at the right price. The bottle's color is a gorgeous color that looked just like the waters of Capri/Sorrento, Italy (near Portofino) when I visited in May 2019.

6/10 scent, 4/10 longevity usually (sometimes 6), 5/10 sillage. Year-round. Worth trying.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This does smell very like 4711, eau de cologne, or the generic “agua de Colonia” that can be bought very cheaply by the litre in any Spanish supermarket.
That said, I love all of the above, so Neroli Portofino is a love for me.
The important difference is that Neroli Portofino has a more refined & sophisticated edge with much better longevity. Whether that makes it worth the hefty price tag is open to debate.
It’s super clean and fresh, giving you that “straight from the shower” smell. The uplifting Mediterranean vibe makes it a perfect choice for hot summer days and I always take it on vacations to warmer climes.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Neroli Portofino is a refreshing citrus white floral. It opens up with fresh lemons, and evolves into neroli with a hint of spice as it warms up. I like how it stays fresh from start to finish. Projection is arm length. Longevity is about half a day.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I recently purchased this and just in love with it. I have been using Ferrari’s Bright Neroli for more than a year now but this Neroli Portofino by Tom ford is a whole other level. I don’t know why people compare the 2 fragrances ? I mean, I love Ferrari’s Bright Neroli but the 2 are not exactly the same or even give the same vibe. These 2 are on a level of their own. Tom Ford is rather creamy very natural Neroli whereas the Price cut can be smelt in Bright Neroli. Now I’m not saying that BN smells like shit. It is far from that and way above my other high end branded fragrances. What I mean to say is, Bright Neroli and Neroli Portofino are 2 different fragrances that give different vibes. One is creamy (TF) whereas the other is astringent and very citrusy (BN).
I love both of them but Neroli Portofino shows it’s class. I know there are performances issues which we don’t expect to get after paying such hefty price for a bottle but can’t do anything about it.
Pure quality but sadly doesn’t last.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I find this fragrance very intimidating especially for a warmer weather fragrance like this. Believe me, just go and buy the cheapie Ferrari Bright Neroli. Very close to this but better as the scent and the performance.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
So strong; I put this in the Joop! category of smelling inescapably delicious, but in an overpowering and slightly cheap smelling; it definitely has degree of ruthless arrogance.

I like the fruity-incense vibes though; perhaps just a little sweet for me.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I have it and i want it, i survive this.
The press spray of NP between though baby. This scent so liked i used and i fell better tonight.
The citric scent with the sabotage, are a fucking smell of savory.
The concentric of lemon and patchouli, touch me for a other dimension. The purchases and rotary militar, call me in the city for a many lighter same my skin.
The egg smell is right, this is a cologne of butterfly.
Cocoa butter, lemon, strawberry and bergamot... those are the really smell of Tom Ford NP.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: An opening note of bathroom air-freshener that lasts for a while, but then it transforms into a pleasant and long-lasting dry-down that is sweet creamy citrus, like a creamcicle! A much cheaper alternative is 4711 Remix, which is a bit sweeter compared to this since to my nose the citrus note for that one is more like a mandarin orange.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I read a review of this in a magazine where they interviewed Tom Ford himself and asked him how neroli portofino lasts and lasts for so many hours on the skin...
Lol everyone here says it's weak.. wtf?

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Bought this and dont know which actually lasts longer,this or 4711? Identical in almost every way, a great smell wasted away so soon. I even tried to preserve the smell by putting it on my clothing. As I've come to realize most colognes that contain blood orange have very weak sillage and no staying power!As they say a fool and his money soon parts, in this case also the powers! As always!!! Try it for yourself, everyone has different DNA!!!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Ahhhh yes.... Your typical overpriced TF freshie that doesn't last and could easily be sold for $50 dollars under a different name. Want a neroli fragrance that smells 10 times better and performs? Do yourself a favor and pick up Petit Matin.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
