reivew: After 15 minutes it's soap for the rest of the day and not in a 'smells fresh and clean just had a shower' sense, more like a 'rubbed the soap bar on my top lip and the smell won;t go away' sense.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: over hyped over priced garbage!!! doesnt last long

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: As a neroli lover I have tryed all neroli fragances I came across. To me Neroli Portofino is the best neroli till now. I love the soap, fresh smell on men and women. I tested Neroli Portofino, Mandarino di Amalfi and some of Acqua di Parma side by side. I bought Mandarino di Amalfi and now I own Neroli Portofino too. As other reviewers wrote the only complain here is the longevity. But this scent is so good that I am ok with reapliyng it a few times.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Blind buy because of all these raving reviews, but my god, what a mistake. This smells exactly like the 4711 perfume that my mother used to wear, which is maybe the reason I don't like it. This is not unisex at all in my opinion. Maybe it smells a bit better on really hot days, but I'm not keeping my hopes up...

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I have been a hard-core fan of Neroli Portofino since five years and gone through two 50 ml bottles EdP and one 100 ml of the Acqua version.
Neroli Portofino really is a beautiful summer scent but as many have said here before, it is a super concentrated version of 4711.

I live in Germany where 4711 is a staple in peoples bathrooms. On the few ocations I do get some comments on this scent, people always think it is 4711.
That is not fun when you spent lots of cash on a bottle.

With that said, yes it’s a beautiful and refreshing perfume. But I have now moved on to Mandarino di Amalfi which is much more complex and interesting.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Let me get this out of the way: longevity sucks. So too does projection.

Now ordinarily, this would put me off buying a fragrance. However, this isn't any 'ordinary' fragrance. This has to be the best citrus/orange blossom fragrance going.

Orange blossom is the main player here and it's beautiful. Secondly i get the mandarin/bergamot punch but also the rosemary, which I love. The harmony between these notes is perfect. No other word for it. There are no base notes, at least I don't detect any. This isn't a problem for me though.

Sometimes we get bogged down in a fragrance's staying power but sometimes you just have to sit back and admire the perfumer's creativity and skill. This is an absolute delight. Tom Ford uses the adjective 'transportive' for this fragrance and that's exactly what it is. It's that perfect summer holiday, with a drink in your hand and the sun on your face. It's an escape from your everyday life and sadly before you know it, it's over. You're sad but then if it had lasted forever, would you have appreciated it as much?

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
The smoothest blend of Neroli and Citrus I have tried to date, simply superb.

The balance on this is unmatched in the genre in my opinion (though I have yet to try NP Forte) and yes that includes Xerjoff Nio which is also incredible but leans more to sharper but juicy bergamot than this does.

It is not particularly unique or daring as there are tons of frags you could choose in this genre but longevity aside I think anything you would choose instead would be a step down in blend if you just wanted the perfect balance between those two main themes.

The only complaint is the same as everyone else, it is light and somewhat weak. That can be a plus in some circumstances (the office for eg.) but as I think this is designed for heat/warm weather wearing I’m not sure it is a plus point here. Hopefully NP Forte does a better job of this without altering the blend.

Still, this one’s a love. It just feels so damn good to smell it for the time it’s around.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This fragrance takes me back to the time I was in Lake Como with George Clooney. We cruised through Sorrento when the peonia were in full bloom and picked some fresh blood oranges at the side of the road. The sun was in my hair, and the air was resonant with the evergreen crispness of Tuscan cypress. We stopped at a sidewalk cafe, and I enjoyed a Limoncello spritzer while George signed autographs. I excused myself to go to the ladies' room where they had the most expensive little soaps imaginable... I slipped one into my Gucci handbag when no one was looking. Except none of this happened... BUT wearing this scent, I believe it COULD HAVE. It takes me to Italy every time I spray it. I wish the projection was better, but its the perfect Summer fragrance. Magnifico, Tom Ford! Ciao!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This smells like a dream. I have never smelt any floral so pretty. It's fresh but creamy and intoxicating in summer heat. Absolute love.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This is a great scent. Has a fruity, floral, soapy, citrusy aquatic vibe.

I really like this one but the performance is too bad to ignore.

I've gotten as little as an hour or 2 with this fragrance with almost zero projection. Have to dig my nose into my skin to smell it (half an hour or so after applying).

I have no problem reapplying poor performing fragrances in the middle of the day, but I'd be reapplying this every couple hours.

Again, great scent, absolutely unacceptable performance given the price tag.

SCORE: 1 out of 5 ⭐

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This is one I used to dislike, but after trying it on for full wearings as of late, I can say that I like it a lot. The smell of neroli here is so invigorating and authentic, and sweetens up as it continues to dry down. It's funny, because it gives off a pistachio accord, and starts to remind me of Arabic sweets like knafa. Neroli tends to do that to my nose. This would be a perfect fragrance to wear if you your Arab friends happen to invite you over for tea during Ramadan. As lovely as it smells though, I don't think Neroli Portofino is worthy of the hefty price tag. It's too weak, and isn't that unique. Of course, the quality is there with any of Tom Ford's fragrances, but I can't justify a full bottle of this. It would be smarter to get a small decant for a decent price.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: not bad but the price is ridiculous. Not worth at all

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: not bad but the price is ridiculous. Not worth at all

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I love it so much, it's so fresh and zesty. Makes me automatically think of going on vacation. The longevity isn't really there unless you spray it in your hair or on your clothes. So yes, it's expensive. But the heart wants what it wants.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
The day I first tried it by coincidence I totally fell in love. I had a 50 euro voucher in my pocket I got as a get-lost-gift from a ex-employer.(a greedy hotel-director)

At the time I had totally lost the scent of the fragrance game. I decided to buy myself a fragrance after years. Maybe because my ex-employer was such a scummy fellow I needed to comfort my senses. Now if it was a 100 bucks I would have raised and seen the cards. But it was 180 for 50ml. Still...

...to me it smelled so good I got memories of things I had never done. (like Total Recall) So I said to myself that I would definitely splash out and buy it another time.

In the mean time I got back on track of the game and kept hearing/reading comments about better(affordable) alternatives. Well, I will try them all and draw my own conclusion. (got more allowance now anyway)

I also read a few negative comments but to me Neroli Portofino smells imperial, maybe even DIVINE. If Tom is robbing us, I really hope those comments about 4711 and Alexandra are true...

-to be continued-

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Ok, I get people travel back to southern Italy and the memories of sun-bathed beaches BUT it does NOT change the simple fact that this is a one, seriously overpriced fragrance for what it is.
It's floral, fresh and basic.
I remember my father's Aqua di Zagara which was less than £10 and smelled better.
A pleasant summer scent that lasts only 2-3 hours.
I won't be buying again, but it looks pretty on my shelf :)
6/10

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Very citrusy to be neroli. More masculine leaning in my opinion.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Very nice if you like classic "Cologne" scents, this one would be a keeper.

Problem is that you get about two hours and it is gone, and I mean gone, completely.

£162 for 50ml, that is seriously disappointing longevity.

And that, my friends, is the reason Tom can keep this one.

Fictional wearer: The Mad Hatter

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This is beautiful and uplifting fresh warm weather scent. I love how it smells but it's a common vibe that you can find in various much cheaper scents. I could justify the price tag if it had some performance but it hasn't. Moderate longevity and soft sillage/projection.
Dominant notes are lemon, orange blossom, neroli and bitter orange. Overall it's more about citruses than anything else.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I spent a lot of summer vacations in Italy as a child and also in my twenties. And this scent reminds me so much of Italy. When I smell this I feel the ocean, the scenary, feel the sun on my bare shoulders. I have bought this scent only to wear the next time I am going to Italy in the summer. This to me screams happy memories and happiness in the sun.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This took me back to my summer of 2015 in Positano. The smell of freshly laundered linen hanging to dry - the smell of Marseille soap mixed with Mediterranean sea breeze. Divine.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This is my favourite fragrance for the summer - exotic and fresh. I just wish it lasted longer!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Sharp citrusy barbershop smell.

It's smells like one of the 80s citrus-scented aftershave. Likeable but absolutely not worth the price!

Why would one in his right mind pay $300 for a barbershop scent?! For a cheap, aftershave scent?!

It is sharp & citrusy. Scent-wise, there are abundance of citrus-themed fragrances that are way superior smell-wise to TF-NP. Young people who are less than 30yrs old might find this literally repulsive, espsecially females. TF managed to copy/make a repulsive citrus smell. That's a rare feat.

Anyways, it has it's fans. I don't know whether it's the nostalgia or the Tom Ford name that is selling this one.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: On my skin, This smells like that kind of soap you’d find in your great aunts house. The kind that’s been sitting around for 18 years, shaped like a seashell. It’s not really for decoration, because it’s ugly- and it’s not really meant to get you clean. Just throw it away.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Neroli Portofino always takes me back to the great memories, It was my signature scent when I was living my best time of my life so far, when I sniff it I remember every single day of my best days ever, I’m going to buy a 250 ml soon and hope to live my great life again with a new passion.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Neroli Portofino is a classic. Of course many will consider it overpriced because of the similarity with 4711 Cologne, whilst others would swear by it and not change it for any other cologne. Because let's be real, Neroli Portofino, despite being edp is a cologne type of fragrance, which many other brands such as Givenchy, Chanel, Rochas, Guerlain etc have in their arsenal either in edc or edt, also quite highly priced.

Herbal and botanical and with a pronounced lemon note and a white floral undercurrent. The floral sweetness of neroli is very well present with its steam-like effect, like a shot of hot ironing. Dry, unisex, natural smelling and quiet, calming. Pairs well with any style really, but seems more appropriate for day-wear, could work as a formal or casual and for all ages. Spring and summer are the seasons for it

People seem to confuse lasting power with sillage; and when they stop smelling a perfume from some sort of distance they consider valid, they deem that the perfume's lasting power is also little to no existent. Which is not always the case. Neroli Portofino does sit close to the skin after the first hour, and stays put for at least five hours, which is more than enough for a cologney scent

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Wanna save money and get a fragrance that smells and last longer than Neroli Portofino? Alexandria Port by Alexandria Fragrances is your resolution! I smelled neroli Portofino and did not want to pay the high price. Bought Alexandria Port instead, and I am very very happy that I saved paying hundreds!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I am just here to tell you to scroll down and read Raidthesaladbar's review. Great description of two of the more popular perfumes these days.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Very nice fragrance, with that characteristic Tom Ford power, if you know what i mean. But, it is not very original. Sure, one can smell the difference in quality between Neroli Portfino and similar perfumes out there, but we are not getting anything new.
Because of this, i don’t have much to say. Buy it if you love strong and natural smelling neroli and orange blossom and if you have the money, but do not expect anything surprising.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Ok, serious question: Why does anyone buy this? I'm not saying it's bad - it's an upscale version of the classic Kölnischwasser (now 4711 Original Eau de Cologne). But therein lies the problem: You could get virtually the same fragrance for less than one tenth of the price.

I'm usually the first one to shake my head at those poor misguided souls who discuss fragrance like they're talking about car insurance ("value for money") - but 300€ for what is blatantly a 10€ perfume? If my clumsy cockerspaniel, intrigued by the smell of citrus and the clicketyclack of my hipster typewriter, jumped onto my desk right now and knocked the two unlabelled blotters off, he'd be the only one who could reliably tell them apart any longer.

And yet there's a bewildering number of correspondents in here singing Neroli's praises over the good old 4711. I can offer three theories:
(1) They all have both the same penchant for classic colognes and the keen canine sense of smell as Sniffles.
(2) Those groups of rich middle-eastern tourists I always see blowing thousands of euros on fragrance in the TF boutique spend their time between lavish European city vacations writing Fragrantica reviews (it would certainly explain some of the spelling and grammar around here).
(3) There are people who splurged on Nerolino Portofino, learned afterwards about the cheaper original, and are now trying to rationalise away their expensive mispurchase.

(Hey, if you're in category 3, I feel ya - I went through two full bottles of Sauvage while I was renovating before I learned about Raid Max)

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Pretty nice, but every freshie from TF lasts 3-4 hours on me. I'd rather buy Dior Homme Sport or Cologne for half the price and double longevity.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I wrote a review of Neroli Portofino earlier. One of my favorite scents of all time is 4711, so I did a comparison between 4711 and NP. You can read it below, but the differences are slight. The most important thing is Ford’s creation is creamier, more Amber-and lasts longer. I bought 4711 soap, shower gel and a huge bottle of the cologne which I decanted into spray bottles to try to get myself to smell like this all day, but could not get the scent to last long. Even the old trick of soaking a cotton ball with your scent and hiding it in the bra doesn’t work. I always smelled clean and good, but not like juicy orange blossoms.

I’m going to Hawaii, and athough I intend to stock up on a plumeria fragrance you can only get in Maui, I wanted to smell like 4711/Neroli Portofino on my trip. So I broke down and bought Tom Ford’s $55.00 atomizer from Nordstrom.

I put it on at Nordstrom and once again, it’s lovely and has lasted all the rest of the day on me. I can smell it now, in bed. Neroli Portofino is not an exact replica of 4711, as I said if my review, but it’s close enough. So again, I’ll shower gel, splash with 4711, then use my atomizer of NP and I should get the fragrance I want all day as I sit under the Hawaiian sun.

It’s sad to be addicted to something so expensive. If I was a one or two fragrance girl, I could justify the price. But I have over a hundred bottles so adding a $300/600 frag is just impossible as I know I won’t stop trying new ones. My little atomizer will be a treat. Just an idea for you Neroli Portofino lovers out there.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: good fragrance but why that damn poor longevity? you paid a lot of money for that?? tom ford please....

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I can't believe this is not a more popular fragrance given the success of neroli portofino and also Jasmin Rouge. It's like a combination of the two where the sharpness of the neroli is cushioned by the soothing embrace of the Jasmine's white floral tea notes. In neroli portofino forte I find that it has a horrible artificial citrus smell, and fades down to a skin scent in a couple of hours. I think this has better performance although is not incredible but with NPF I feel I have to wait for the citrus to subside before I get the pure neroli scent and then it's gone. A small window of opportunity to enjoy it. With this I instantly smell the neroli and the soft jasmine and the two work better than other neroli frags I've tried although I love adps essenza di colonia but with nb the neroli takes centre stage. I've started wearing it before going to bed as for me the combination of neroli with the tea like notes of the jasmine is incredibly calming.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Expensive 4711 Kölnisch Wasser Dupe :)

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This fragrance was a love at first sniff for me. I’m a sucker for Neroli and Orange Blossom so I just can’t help myself. It’s definitely a happy, charming white floral fragrance. It’s also calming due to the lavender and amber. It’s one of the most natural fragrances (sometimes we have the strangest experiences… plastic? couldn’t be further from the truth to my nose, but we all smell differently). The natural nature of this perfume is of the same vein as Acqua di Parma Colonia. There is the beautiful citrus note that blends so well with the neroli and orange blossom. It’s not a loud fragrance. There is the slight herbal note of soothing lavender and uplifting rosemary along with angelica with the quiet sensual amber grounding all of it. The balance of this fragrance is perfect. It’s gentle and ethereal enveloping the skin and the air around you in a cloud of sweet citrus, joyful neroli, soft sweet sensual whispers of amber, relaxing lavender and rosemary… It’s like lying down on the softest puffy mattress after the most perfect summer day spent with someone you’re in love with. Almost like the euphoria you feel after a perfect workout and in the shower, when you’re alive, elated, but relaxed. I’ve been to Portofino Italy and this fragrance captures the mediterranean gorgeousness of that place. It is refreshing, happy, chic, but as many have noted all too brief. Tom Ford is an extremely tasteful human being. I can picture him there in Portofino lounging on a yacht, looking effortlessly stylish, handsome, and smelling this classy. Portofino is a place that you wake up at 10am, have a beautiful brunch by the sea, dress sexy, refined, but also casual, never hurry, and maybe take a cruise on a boat. I spent my honeymoon in Portofino surrounded by the glittering deep azure blue/green sea. This fragrance conjures up the pure bliss of the blossoming orange trees and natural heaven of the sea and culture that I found in Italy. It captures that relaxed beautiful attitude of truly enjoying life. It is effortlessly luxurious and classy. It’s truly a gentle and joyful fragrance. I only wish it would last longer or this would be my signature scent.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: i love this fragrance. Very fresh , clean, cool....so summer time and day time

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Smells exactly like sunscreen. No thanks

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
this is so funny - when i got my first whiff i said to my friend OMG its 4711! She looked like I was crazy but I was so excited. I feel validated that everyone is saying it in here too.

That's my grandmother's perfume & I still buy it for her at a german's specialty shop. Maybe I can convince her to split a bottle of Tom Ford with me ;)

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Citrus, a watery rubber plastic smell, white floral, maybe some wood. This reminds me of a summer day by the pool; fresh and clean. Strangely, I get a bleachy, comet bathroom cleaner vibe. The citrus is more prominent in the opening. During the dry down it's all watery plastic wood with white floral. While it has different notes NP reminds me of Kenzo Pour Homme in many ways.

Unisex, projection and sillage feel soft from the start but It hung around for a nice eight hours. Maybe its in my head but it felt stronger during the dry down. Not sexy and good for work. A hot weather scent all the way. Composition is nice and interesting. I like the rubbery wet citrus, floral. I see the pool toys baking in the sun as you splash around in the water; sun block, chlorine. Should perform a little better for the price. Bottle looks cool and fits the concept well. Not outstanding but there are definitely worse TF scents out there.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Okay, you guys are being a little bit extra with the "exactly like 4711" stuff. Yes, there is a big similarity, but do not forget that 4711 disappears in a few minutes and is pretty cold and bitter and herbaceous, whereas NP lasts at least 5 hours on me and has a thick, warm, creamy mandarin-amber note that 4711 does not have.

I'd compare this to typical generic Turkish lemon cologne "Kolonya" before I'd go with 4711 because at least Turkish cologne isn't bitter.

Anyway, I made a huge mistake of layering this over Dior Addict that was almost done with its dry-down after 5-6 hours with only a faint boozy vanilla remaining, so I figured "what's the harm?" and the harm is that it turns out mixing this with vanilla becomes a rather cloying tobacco-like experience oddly reminiscent of Tobacco Vanille (Which I'm one of the rare few who hates that perfume, again the tobacco is too cloying for me) so actually since a lot of people like Tobacco Vanille, how about this?:

If you regret your Neroli Portofino purchase, try layering it with whatever feminine spicy vanilla scent you have lying around and see if you can't create something completely different out of it? (but have the soap and washcloth ready, it could turn out to be a disaster!)

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
All orange, no neroli
I teach kids and they all asked me: “Why does it smell like oranges in here?” Nuff said...at this price? Seriously? Eat oranges.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I'll make this short: it's the exact scent of 4711 Eau de Cologne with better longevity. The scent itself is mesmerizing and spectacular (as is the scent of 4711, upon which this is based). But the longevity is only moderate at around 4-5 hours - which is an improvement to 4711 as that only lasts 2 hours if you're lucky, but it's nothing groundbreaking. And it's way overpriced. If you have the cash, then by all means get Neroli Portofino Forte for something better that lasts even longer. But if you don't want to pay that much, Bond No. 9's Eau de New York is just superior to this in every way and for less money. And the best cheap alternative to Neroli Portofino is Ferrari's Bright Neroli. But if you want something more 'green', then go for Mugler Cologne.

However if you really just want the Neroli Portofino scent to last on you for 8 hours and don't want to keep spritzing 4711 Eau de Cologne in a travel atomizer, then listen to my advice and get the perfume oil version of this for $6 from the Kuwaiti perfume oil company "Universal Perfume Oils and Cosmetics" (Google it). It's exactly the same as Neroli Portofino but with better projection and 8 hours longevity. And a 3 ml bottle of the oil should last you ages. You now have knowledge of the best kept secret in perfume buying.

5/5

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Clean. Extraordinary. Citrus. Like a clean office building, Maybe even a citrus candle. Probably one of the best scents i've added to my collection in a while. Wasn't expecting this one.

7/10

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: From complete Neroli portofino collection, this one is the nicest in my opinion. It is very specific frag. and it reminds me on Delial German sun lotion from 80's. This is realy Mediteranean smell, I think more for the ladies then for the man, but very nice, natural and moderate. It is different category from ussual perfumes so is the price. A good one.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Very very clean scent.i like it, similar to Mugler cologne.To Use only in spring and summer. For the price go to mugler.
My rating 8/10

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
The ever-polarising Tom Ford and Rodrigo Flores-Roux present us here, with Clinique Happy's older, bolder, sultrier sister; the sister that causes commotion at family gatherings and just doesn't care.True, this opens with a blast of fancy-hotel-soap, and throws us back to the cologne-dripping lotharios of the '80's, but in dry-down is where this frag shines. The gorgeous blending of the citrus and floral notes is so perfectly done; as it warms on your skin, Neroli Portofino simply sings. To me, it takes me back to the beaches of the Med in summer, to spritzing this beauty on recently wet skin, while watching the sun go down.
Utter bliss.
PS If this frag is outside your price point, its dupe is YSL Saharienne. I've got both, and they're VERY similar.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Neroli Portofino: The Inconvenient Truth:
The note pyramid listed is surely wrong, because for me at least, this has two primary ingredients, so skilfully blended I can't pick them apart: Love and Hate. In a beautiful turquoise bottle.

HATE: the grotesque price. The sometimes pathetic longevity. The hype. The way that on the wrong days it can just randomly turn to straight citrus cleanser on me. How disturbingly like an ordinary cologne or a plain ol' lemon soap it can seem now and then.

But but but....
LOVE: how it becomes something so drop-dead gorgeous on really hot days. Its unique sweet warmth underneath the sparkling freshness. How it makes me feel cool (in every sense), calm and competent. The way it can bloom into the essence of the most expensive Mediterranean luxury holiday I've (n)ever had. The fact that the first instant I ever smelled it I fell in love, and my nose told me -ordered me!- to work and save so I could seek it out, years and years before I knew anything at all about perfume, aeons before going full fraghead.

I read so much here about 4711 I sought that out, but it really is not in the same league, even if you divide by 20 to account for the price. Now THAT, even though hugely refreshing, really is a sharp cleaning product that's gone in minutes. To me it's 4711 that is a pale shadow of TF NP, not the other way around.

I will probably migrate over to Monegal Entre Naranjos, Bigarade Concentree or L'Erbolario or even Ferrari Bright Neroli for my next bottle of something citric... But until then, I'll savour every precious overpriced pretentious drop of Portofino, and will keep that beautiful empty bottle until I die, to remind me of what got me started on this insane lifelong quest for the most wonderful smell in the world. For all its many, many faults and its obnoxious reputation, I owe this scent a massive debt of gratitude. Tom Ford, I don't know whether to thank or curse you for that.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I used a sample today and immediately I get some kind of sunscreen scent, I thought okay it's probably the alcohol and waited it out.
3 hours later and it still smells like I sprayed sunscreen on my arm.
This is a very subtle fragrance which surprised me.
To be honest, I sort of enjoy this sunscreen scent but I definitely would purchase a cheaper alternative.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This is so beautiful. I'm a sucker for a good neroli, and this is just gorgeous. Zingy, slightly bitter, uplifting, fresh, a dream. I can almost see myself in a quaint rural village in the Mediterranean (and I grew up in rural/suburban Med so I should know!) when I close my eyes and sniff it.

The problem is that, while the fragrance itself is heavenly, the performance is only OK. Way underwhelming for such a high-end fragrance and the big bucks you have to spend to get it. It lasts maybe 5-6 hours total on my clothes, and only about 2 on my skin. Mind you, my skin hoovers up fragrance like a black hole and very few perfumes last on it more than 1-2 hours, but if it's specifically a TF one with THAT price, I'd expect more.

Would absolutely buy if it was significantly cheaper (like, 70% less), but for that price I'll not stock up once my sample has run out. It will be beautiful while it lasts, though!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I love this refreshing orange-lemon mimosa sparkler. Pretty linear as far as not having the top/mid/base contrast, and altogether is similar to a saturated orange-citrus, aka juicy. Kind of like a gummi bear, I find myself half drooling feeling like I'm at a fantastic beach in Capri sipping a mimosa with orange trees opening all around. It's half glam and half peaceful and tranquil.

I try this on at Sephora, but it might go on my to buy list. I keep going back for this one and find flaws in everything else. Does that tell me anything?

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Soapy lemon aroma. Quite strong. First impression was the smell of FastumGel medicine

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I was so incredibly lucky to buy the candle of this incredible fragrance last Friday night. I'd been wanting this for a year or so but just could not justify the price. Anyway, i've waited three months for the film 'Call Me By Your Name' to get released on iTunes and last week it did. During the waiting of it, I wondered how I could make the evening just perfect. An evening with amazing friends and the perfect film. The film is set in Northern Italy during the summer of 1983. Instantly I realised that the smell of Neroli Portofino would be that definitive scent of the air in northern Italy and voila, only the best candle could replicate this... it had to be a TOM FORD NEROLI PORTOFINO candle. So with Illy espresso (as in the film), San Pellegrino, myself cooking Italian food for my friends and this candle, the evening was perfect.
It's the best film that i've seen in the last 10 years and oh my, this is the most beautiful, delicate, perfect candle that i've ever experienced in my life.
It's perfect.
Now my house as well as myself can smell of this surfing, summer beach, beach house fragrance. Just perfect!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Fragrance -Neroli Portofino Tom Ford
Bottle from - 2016

Neroli Portofino opens with a soapy,clean,bright,vibrant and refreshing burst of citruses with dominant lemon and madarin with a wisper of lavender and herbs lurking at the edges.You can almost feel the power of the waves on the windy sea that erases everything except the present moment.
During mid development,potent citruses slowly give way to a delicate white florals with a calming and deep touch of herbs and with a hint of amber.At this point,dominant notes are orange flower and neroli.
This all leads into a sensual,ambery,musky and a bit floral base with that sunset beach vibe going on.

Longevity - 6/10(6+ hours)
Silage/Projection - 6/10(moderate to soft projection and silage for the first 1-2 hours)
Weather -Best in late spring and summer
Age - 22+
Compliments - 7/10
Scent - 8/10

Main notes according to me - orange flower,mandarin,lemon, neroli,bergamot,herbs,lavander,amber.

The drydown is a bit musky and soapy and I get some -amber,flowers,ambrette,angelica and a hint of orange.

Emotions -power of the waves,sunset beach vibe,sparkling, clean,bright,fresh,sensual.

Occasion -For more or less any ocasion when you just want to smell nice and clean.

Could be a nice signature scent.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
A perfect summer breeze. So fresh, bright, and, to my nose, natural. This fragrance is light and airy, and takes me right to summertime. Lots of citrus with a mild floral note that does not lean feminine nor masculine, and some sparkly, salty, aquatic vibes as well. Performance is a weakness, especially at the price point, but I wouldn't expect a fragrance like this to last too long.

9/10

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Neroli diluted in perfumers alcohol,there is nothing interesting,nothing original just a pretty bottle and a catchy name. If you like Neroli L'artisan Seville a l'aube or J.F. Schwarzlose 1A-33, Maitre Parfumeur et Gantier Jardin du Néroli or just get some organic Neroli EO's on line or from your health shop,a million times better and cheaper.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: After finally smelling this, I would say Tom Ford's Neroli Portofino captures and epitomises what can only be described as a gourmand aquatic. Without getting too dramatic, it does smell a little bit like you're jumping into the waters of the Mediterranean. More than other classic aquatics like Cool Water, this one is deftly balanced by some truly lovely white florals, plus the bergamot and amber add much in the way of sophistication. However, the relatively poor longevity does not justify the price tag. Sadly I won't be getting my own bottle, but I will, however, keep getting free spritzes at David Jones...

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This is a gorgeous uplifting bright clean citrus scent. It’s very high quality and a step up from the usual aquatic stuff in the designer game. As others have said it may be a bit highly priced for what it is but if you (like me) can find it on notino or something for a decently discounted price I think you could do worse. Highly recommend this for people who want a clean high quality smelling perfume. 100% unisex. 100% love.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Lovely perfume, but for the price point, it doesn't make sense for me to think about buying it!
sillage and longevity less than moderate, even if I found it half of its real price I wouldn't matter to buy it!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I bought a few Tom Ford samples from Lucky scent. My daughter is a huge fan and I am a bit daunted by the high price, not really sure they are worth it yet. But I am trying to be fair. This one is a beautiful citrus, floral to my nose. It is more complex than that, but I am trying to narrow it down some. It reminds me of France in the summertime. It is a summer fragrance, and I cannot describe it any better than Paul did. What a lovely review! But.... sadly to say, it only lasted 2 hours on my skin. It was beautiful while it lasted but I need a fragrance with staying power! Not a tease for 2 hours and then walk away! Please!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Value Excellent
Quality Excellent

It took me over 10 years to find my perfect fragrance and Neroli Portofino is it. I fell in love with it within the first one second of its introduction and six years later our love affair continues!
This fragrance doesn't shout! It's a true combination of the ultimate ingredients and essential oils that create a lemon, neroli and varied beach/beach house/free/healthy smell. OK, so it fades to become more of a body scent but to me, that's a great thing as strong fragrance annoys me and gives me a migraine!
Neroli Portofino has a magical scent that comes alive on your body every few hours - I guess as ones body heats up. It appears and it's truly incredible. This is the kind of cologne that you'd spray all over your naked body after the most incredible rainforest shower in a beautiful beach house before your day is greeted by the sunshine, beach and heartfelt friends!
The fragrance from it is sexy, stylish, chic, young, innocent, contemporary whilst being modern retro at the same time!
It's PERFECTION. It's the ultimate tanned, body smell. It'll transport you to happy times in Portofino, Italy or at that glamour beach house in the South of France. It's perfect for surfing in, a day on the beach or a classy opera/ballet/restaurant with friends. It's perfect for wearing with a T shirt and shorts OR a fitted suit. It's elegant but young, stylish but never pretentious or vulgar.
There's nothing like it for summer and summer night dreams. It's glamorous, fragile almost, incredibly elegant and full of dreams! It's sexy, it's perfect and you'll love it - but don't tell anyone - it's our secret!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: My gfs favorite on me of the ones I have, 2nd to Mugler cologne

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Such an amazing scent!
Unfortunately it lasts very little on the skin, at least on mine. It's very expensive, and can't imagine spraying that too many times since the lasting power is very weak.
Neroli Portofino is 100% a summer scent, fresh, enjoyable, different from all the usual citrusy ones that are created for the warmer months. It's perfect for nights by the sea... close eyes and dream.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Don't waste your money.Instead buy 4711 for few bucks.Its just an overpriced Tom Ford creation.Very fresh and clean but unfortunately doesn't last too long too worth this high price.I have tested this today and after 3 hours i could barely smell it....

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Despite having a colder than usual summer this year, Neroli Portofino allowed me to still experience summer in a bottle. I normally don’t enjoy clean and fresh fragrances because they can feel too much like cleaning products. However; Tom Ford was able to achieve the perfect balance between crispness, fruitiness, and floral.
It’s vibrant and effervescent; it reminds me of champagne on an Italian beach or something. Any time I travel to a beach destination, I’ve always found myself bringing this fragrance along. My only gripe with it, is its wear time - some days it’ll last hours and others it’ll only last one. I’ve been able to prolong its wear by applying a water based makeup primer to the areas I intend to wear it on and have noticed it’ll last on me eight+ hours.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I just got a decant of this, as I will never ever be able to afford a bottle. I was excited to get this; based on the reviews it sounded like something I'd love. And I have to say, I do love it, except it wasn't as exceptional as I thought it might be for the price tag. I did see reviews comparing it to the 4711 cologne, so I guess I should have had an idea of the kind of scent it was, even if I couldn't recall if I'd smelled 4711 before.

Still, I do love the fragrance as it takes me back to my childhood. At first, I couldn't really place it, but I did a scan of the reviews and saw some comparing this to Nenuco, which was a huge part of my childhood. Although I couldn't remember its scent right off the bat, it must be this that Neroli Portofino reminds me of. Really fresh and lovely, but due to the memories, makes me think it could as well be a child's perfume. Nothing wrong with that, except for how much NP costs. It seems a bit simple for a designer perfume, although it does have a higher quality smell than Nenuco and such colognes. It's like a luxurious version of these.

Clean and fresh with a citrus opening, I would still love wearing this, particularly on a hot and humid day (which is most days in my country). It makes brings to mind weekends and idle days perfect for lazing around, the summers of my childhood. I will definitely wear it to bring back that feeling of my youth.

However, I wouldn't ever buy a full bottle, and perhaps will try 4711 instead when I use up my decant.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I can't lie I was quite surprised how this performed in 95 degree heat! I work in an office but I would go & bake in th sun occasionally throughout the day & everyone I walked by was AMAZED- Grab a decant because a bottle is higher than birds' nuts!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I will start by saying I am not a Tom Ford fan. I find his fragrances way too pungent for my taste. After reading glowing reviews for this scent, I decided to try it. I don't understand the reviews that claim this is some kind of masterpiece. On me, this smelled exactly like suntan lotion. If you like beachy scents, there are plenty of options for much less money, such as Bobbi Brown Beach or Replica Beach Walk. Or pick up a bottle of your favorite sunscreen, it's good to protect your skin. As for my tendency to find TF fragrances pungent, this one wasn't nearly as strong, and probably would have needed refreshing after 4 hours if I wanted to keep it going. A definitely pass for my taste.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I grew up smelling the original Eau de Cologne everywhere around, especially in older men. This is identical. It is very hard to see this as an elegant classy fragrance when everybody was wearing this when I was a kid. I find it sharp and overpowering. Also, very expensive. I would rather buy the Eau de Cologne and carry it around, in order to refresh the smell during the day.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Smells beautiful.
One HUGE problem: No one will know !
Very very weak performance, even when i showered with the NP shower Gel, applied the NP lotion, then sprayed a ton of the perfume on my body and clothes and STILL got weak performance ! (I purchased it from Harrods, in case you're questioning the authenticity)
Definitely not worth your hard earned $$$ in exchange for this poor performance !

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I wanted to try this for so long, finally got a sample and all i can smell is lemons which lasted about 2 hours. Big disapointment.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Just tried my third scent from tom ford. I was totally in love with costa azzure I tried today and I got a bottle of Neroli as well today.

First thing it reminded me of for some reason was the pez's we had has a kid, the ones that you stack in a plastic dispenser with the funny shapes on the top which is a very pleasing scent. Comparing it to costa azzure there is an obvious lack of oud scent found in the costa, costa is my all time favorite scent as of now. The lemon is very noticeable for the first few hours then starts to fade into a very vibrant fruity seaside freshness.

On my skin this thing projects like a damn monster. Im getting 7-10 feet projection and im on my third to fourth hour now. Thinking about this I would have to say the forte version of this which is much stronger im not sure i could pull something so potent off although its worth a try. For my I guess I can see why they made a aqua version of this cause to my nose this is extremely strong in a good way. I guess maybee my nose picks up hits of musk and lemon more then others but yea to me its my most powerfull scent in my collection albeit my collection is still small.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I love this one. I don't understand, what is TF thinking? This used to be good performer! "Well, if we tone it down people will spray more and consume more and hence buy more". In reality, it has the exact opposite effect. People are going to spray less because of how precious it is, and they won't buy again knowing how poor the performance is now.

Here is a good business opportunity for you wannabe perfumers out there. Get some good fixative, mix it with 4711, and sell it at a affordable price. Boom! Money.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
A good quality neroli that nods to the classic colognes. Longevity is as expected for this style - it's comparable in performance to 4711 or Guerlain's Eau de Cologne Imperiale, from which it clearly takes cues. It's essentially a citrus floral with a nice herbal twist.

Neroli Portofino is, of course, very much on the pricier side for what is essentially a fleeting cologne. For the money, you do get a gorgeous bottle and a very well crafted scent, but it is hardly the benchmark neroli its reputation would have you believe. There are dozens of great neroli soliflores on the market today; Neroli Portofino is among them, and among the most expensive. Make of that what you will.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Unlike 4711, I think this perfume is best suited for evening time. Although its opening is very bright and citrus-laden, I find the dry-down to be very dark and complex with heavy musk notes. I find the overall presentation to be quite evocative and primal in nature. This fragrance is quite compelling and has a certain allure that draws one to it. Great unisex offering from TF. Love it!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Very similar to Burberry Brit Rhythm For her!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
this is a lot like 4711 and the likes....for quite a high price....having said that, it does generally sell for well below it seems looking at the comments and from my experience also....the longevity lasts quite a bit on me....running about 5 hours now....but the sillage kicks off strong but dies down relatively quickly....

i like the smell especially in the hot summer months....its a change for me from the usual heavy scents i prefer....wouldnt pay full price for this by any means....happy with the addition for the $80 i spent for the 50ml....some may differ and still think thats too much i know :)

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
The company that imports Tom Ford in Greece, had this in plenty at their bazaar yesterday, the 50ml bottle for 23 €!?!?

It is very short-lived and quite similar to 4711. I had smelled it when it first came out, as my mum loves 4711, but for 160 € who would buy a 50ml cologne? One that is gone in an hour?!!

Would you believe me if i said even 23 was expensive? Ts ts ts!! The reviewer who said Emperor's New Clothes is spot-on for this one!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This is the third Tom Ford I've sampled.
And I'm afraid for me Tom Ford fragrances (and I would add jo Malone to this too) are a bit emperors new clothes...
It's all rather style over substance - for example the Yves rocher neroli is better than this and £20 a bottle.
The bottles are ugly - dare I say pretentiously so?
I think this one smells like mouthwash.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Amazing. Perfect for work. Multilayered with every note nothing short of divine. Not offensive. Develops throughout the day. Worth every penny. Absolutely divine. The king of Neroli parfums.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
For me, this Tom Ford îs just like Persil, Ariel, etc. I wait for a long time to get this and when finally get it...big mistake.
Not for me, not a niche scent.
Longevity max 3 hours

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Thanks Jabbara97 for the decant;

Fresh, aquatic and even sweet. Gentlemen, don't be alarmed this is not feminine at all IMO; Unisex, but not feminine. There is some jasmine, citrus, lavender, and some....you guessed it, neroli that just pops! I don't think you could spray too much of this...I don't believe this will be cloying, abrasive, even aggressive for those around you.

Nice,..I mean, it is Tom Ford :o).

Projection: 7/10
Longevity: 6/10
Silage: 7/10
Overall: 6.5/10

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Absolutely adore this stuff, the traditional neroli par excellence, bar none. Spring orange blossoms, creamy soap lather, Provençal herbs, clean skin, subtle Grasse jasmine. It's every bit as beautiful as it sounds.

Problem? This is absolutely not the EdP it is purported to be, and the price is simply extortionist; I've a gorgeously done 500 ml apothecary style bottle of (Roger et Gallet) Jean Marie Farina Eau de Cologne "Extra Vieille." It cost around $180 AUD, and "Extra Vieille," which does have a good dose of neroli in its composition, can be made to last hours on clothes and skin if applied properly. Neroli Portofino on the other hand...? Most retailers are asking for around $420-$440 Australian Dollarydoos for 100 ml of a supposed EdP which disappears from the skin and fabric in about 2 hrs time, and has zero presence.

Beautiful as it is, that sort of money is hard to justify on something that disappears in the blink of an eye, even with a generous disposable income.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Hearing this scent was similar to my beloved 4711 made me buy a decant. I adore 4711, but of course, it lasts only an instant, enough time to wake up your brain and refresh you, then it's gone. I'd hoped Ford's Neroli Portfino would give me the same scent, only linger.

When my tiny bottle arrived, i had not selected my perfume for the day, so I immediately sprayed it on my left wrist, and was overjoyed to smell that yes, indeed, it is 4711. The opening scent is the same, a burst of orange, and citrus so juicy you can taste it. I put some 4711 on my right wrist to compare, and for a brief moment they were identical.

Then, in the Portofino, amber appeared, giving it a a richer, more golden and sophisticated scent. It was nice, but not my beloved splashy juice, it is more creamy, deeper. The 4711 stayed bright.

Dry down time, the 4711 was gone, the Portofino again smelling like mostly orange with a touch of amber. The further it gets from the middle, the more it gets to the beginning. It has been seven hours and I still can smell it, back to my beloved 4711 if I stick my wrist to my nose. On the 4711 side, of course, there is only my skin. Yet today, I smelled 4711 all day.

I enjoyed the decant and have enough for a few more uses. I will probably splash myself with 4711 and then use the rest of Mr. Fords blend together with that. On my skin, it does last. But after that, I do not think I'll buy, as it's too expensive to get almost the same. I think I'll stay with 4711, and reapply as needed. Now that 4711 has soaps and gels, I will do fragrance layering in the hopes of having something longer lasting. .

When you adore something, as I do 4711, when it is that pure for you, it's hard to accept the same thing with new notes. Neroli Portofino is more complex and deeper, and while beautiful, I can't help but just want my sparkling splash. So it will not be worth the price to me. If you are unfamiliar with 4711, then this may be the Neroli perfume of your dreams.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: The bottle reminds me of blue oceans, but this is too expensive considering what it is, and the lasting power. It's interesting that it smells like a cologne splash from 1799. 4711 is so affordable and comes in an enormous size, so I'd choose it on a hot summer day. You can always decant it into a spray bottle.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I both have this and 4711. Neroli Portofino smells like a slightly sweeter and much more refined 4711 -- like a $100 white tee shirt vs. a $20 white tee shirt. I think it's an elegant, balanced, and upscale take on a neroli cologne, and it's one with slightly more depth without losing its freshness. Does this push new boundaries? No, but I don't feel like it needs to. And it's easily unisex. I'm a woman and I enjoy wearing this, but would also like it on a man.

Just one thing though. When I wear cologne water I like the experience of liberally shaking it out onto my hand and patting it everywhere, which you can't do with this (and especially at this price point). So I personally kind of prefer the less expensive, more casual 4711 for my neroli cologne needs.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I have the opportunity to tried a sample last summer. It was really cool because i was in a boat at Portofino and i decide to try this Neroli portofino directly in Portofino to embrace the scent at 360 degrees!
At that time i loved the smell, but then (last week) i went to Naples (near Posillipo).
And guys what a really embarrassing discovery..............

What a really embarrassing discovery............

Basically every single bathroom near the sea has this exactly smell.

I don't know why but there are only two options:

Option one: Neroli Portofino has 0 quality and is the same scent that luxury hotels near the coast of Naples use as a clean detergent for their bathrooms.

Option two: Those hotel are so luxurious that can afford to use the real Neroli Portofino as a clean detergent for their bathrooms.

I'm sorry for Tom Ford lovers but i think is the one...

So to make a long story short:

Scent: 6,5/10 (Even if is a detergent smell is still a nice smell)
Longevity: 4 hour
Sillage: Poor
Projection: Not really a skin scent but really close

Ah.... Versatility? Mah.. Beh... Boh... It is a casual "happy" fragrance but can be used even in office or in a formal situation. And is only for spring/summer days... i can't really imagine a different use..

Trust the truffle dog, it knows the rules of the game.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: The best barbershop scent I have smelled to date. A classic. Smells just like 4711 (Muelhens) but more potent. A must for your collection, imo.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Have almost full 100 ml bottle of this fragrance.Contact if you are interested.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I've tried so hard to like this but as soon as the fizzy top notes fade, it is soap, more soap, and nothing but soap. And not the good kind. I'm no citrus hater, but this just isn't one of the good ones, it doesn't smell fresh. And for that price, it is just appalling. Big fat pass.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Nice citrus neroli perfume, but short lived, very short lived. For that price you expect something a bit more persistent.
Pity...

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I picked this up mainly because I'm a sucker for citrus aromatics, but also to see what the hype is all about. As most people have noted, this fragrance smells exactly the same as 4711, but at 15-20 times the price. Is it worth it?

In my books, yes. While both fragrances smell similar, there's a certain depth and sophistication that's lacking in 4711 that Neroli Portofino offers. Don't get me wrong, I love both fragrances. But 4711 is what I would wear when I'm heading to the supermarket, while Neroli Portofino would be reserved for that special date. I don't see myself buying another bottle anytime soon, but will cherish every drop of the bottle that I do have.

I get moderate longevity out of this one (around 5-6 hours), with average sillage.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: After smelling this and Acqua di parma's essenza di colonia today, I realized that I hadn't smelled any neroli based perfumes before and I must admit, I don't need to any time soon. I was under the impression that this was universally liked, but if that's so then my nose must be from another dimension. To me this smell isn't even bearable, it's just awfull.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I think Neroli Portofino is a breathtakingly beautiful blend of naturally fresh Mediterranean citruses, flowers and herbs supporting the purest neroli and orange flower absolute you can imagine. Very expensive yes, but the quality of this perfume clearly outshines all the other neroli based fragrances I've tried.

The scent itself is very similar to Mäurer & Wirtz 4711, which is exquisitely refreshing but light as a feather and lasts only a brief moment. Neroli Portofino on the other hand manages both to capture and refine the essence of the classic refreshing citrus cologne and to make it last. On my skin this gem stays lovely, crisp and fresh yet smooth and creamy for well past six hours.

Simply angelic! ☆☆☆☆☆

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I bought one 100 ml. bottle for $13. Fresh and interesting barbershop fragrance. I think in hot summer days will be great to wear

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
The 100 Days Challenge - Day 31:

Like Happiness, Portofino is steep and short-lived.

Today's word: Happiness.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
My only complaint is that the fragrance doesn't last longer. The dry down is absolutely amazing. The flankers are ok and last longer but the original is a masterpiece. It does smell similar to 4711 in the opening, but smell your skin 90 mins after application. Absolutely amazing!!!! The best things in life are sometimes worth the price. I used to think this was overpriced until I realized how superior the dry down is to anything else I own. Absolute masterpiece and a must recommend for any gentleman!!!

The projection and longevity are lacking, but in my world you want a scent that is clean, light, and pleasant. Perfect for the office and light enough to not offend any of my clients.

If you want a more masculine version then check out the forte flanker, which is very good,, but in my humble opinion the original has all the magic!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I love this and it's so different from anything else I have really. It is essentially unisex but isn't too masculine that a girl couldn't wear it and smell great. It is basically a fresh Neroli fragrance, perfect for warm days ideally. Highly recommended if you want something a bit different.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I always pick a sample of this stuff when I get the chance, it really does smell nice, clean and inoffensive, but in the end, it's just not worth the asking price for a full bottle when there are so many other neroli-based fragrances that are so close to this in effect to be had for a fraction of the price.
If you have the money to spend, though, you could definitely do worse, it is really nice and easy to wear, never too sweet, sharp or soapy.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Childhood memories in a bottle. Reminds me of walking through our front yard of different orange trees and other citrus trees growing up. I get the vision of the trees with fruit on them and on the ground sitting in the St Augustine grass. Such a clean and fresh scent. Glad I gave this one a try. Sunny spring and summer in a bottle waiting to be sprayed.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
this was the first perfume that i bought on purpose!

i picked it up because of somebody gushing about it on twitter a few years ago & fell in love instantly. neroli and oranges and a lil floral muskiness for fun. this perfume is a winner & i have yet to a hear a bad word said about it. it's also my mama's favourite out of all my perfumes!

super summery and more than a little sexy, it has been a summer go-to for a few years, now! the reviews are making me want to consider the neroli portofino acqua and the maurer & wirtz 4711 original.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: This is an amazing fresh fragrance and smells very similar to Aqua di Parma Essenza.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I am in the minority here but i get beast mode performance on this. 10 plus hours each time with moderate silage.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This is simply an exact copy of the very famous and classic 4711 Eau de Cologne, which you can get for only a few bucks. Longevity of 4711 is absolutely comparable to this one. Sorry to all Tom Ford fans but in my opinion it's just a shame that the brand copies an existing fragrance and tries to sell it as a new one and for a horrendous price!!
Save your money and get the original instead!!

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I have sampled this every so often when I pop into a Sephora. Just to see if my dislike to this frag has changed. To this day, it hasn't.

My verdict: it smells like froot loops cereal with a hint of lemon.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
I love this smell for one reason, it reminds of the barbershop cologne they used to splash on my neck after each haircut when I was little, the one that you feel before you smell, and it felt like acid on raw skin. I can still remember the barbers grin whenever they did that, it was their feeling of fulfillment when they see the victim (customer) grimace with the their neck on fire. I still remember the bottle they used, it came in 2 sizes (500 & 1000 ml) of evil torture.

This is what NP from TF reminds me of, its a typical barbershop cologne.

The scent itself is nice, its sweet, full of white florals, and very citrussy. There is no heavy or skanky scnets there, just alot of freshness.

Nicely done TF

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Very simple and linear smell. Not worth the price tag but this is a truly "soapy" scent arranged with a sweet and white-floral neroli, myrtle, lemon and orange blossom! It has nothing to do with Thierry Mugler "Cologne".

Longevity: 1/2 hours -/+

Sillage: soft.

7/10 You'll be smelling clean but you're going to break the bank.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
This smells EXACTLY like a day at the beach. Not coconut, tropical, fruity like people would like to fool you into thinking a beach smell is. No, this is exactly like you went swimming in the sea with your friends and then emerged glittering with water droplets to lie on your towel in the sun and eat greasy food from vendors walking back and forth on the beach with their carts. EXACTLY like a beachy day of sun and surf. Whether this is appealing to you is a personal matter of taste.

I love it, it almost seems like a slightly citrusy woody scent to me. This is amazingly refreshing and clean in summer heat.

It's not complicated and it doesn't have layers, it is linear. Some people tell me it smells like soap when I wear it.

However, it is very expensive so it might not be worth the price tag to you.

I think it is one of the best scents ever made. Must-buy.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: I am usually not a big neroli fan but this is one of the nicest neroli fragrances I have ever smelled. A lot of neroli fragrances tend to have an old musty smell to me and this is crisper and cleaner. So fresh and beautiful. Neroli fragrances have literally been around since the invention of cologne so this is hardly groundbreaking. But what it happens to be is a perfected neroli "cologne". While it does share a similar scent with 4711 (and countless other neroli based fragrances), the difference in quality is pretty apparent. I have 4711 and don't enjoy it while I love Neroli Portofino.The quality and fragrance far surpasses 4711 and is also more female friendly. It lasts all day on me. The blue bottle is also stunning. NP is the perfect go to daily scent and is a refreshing change from heavier or more dramatic perfumes. I absolutely love it.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Like others have said, to me this one is EXACTLY like 4711 original. I had a small bottle of it back in the 80's and always loved the fresh smell.

When I took the cap off this at Sephora for a sniff, it immediately reminded me of 4711. I knew nothing of this perfume, just wanting to try Black Orchid and noticed the pretty green bottle. I sprayed it on my wrist thinking it might change, but it was uncannily similar to 4711.

I honestly don't smell any of the notes - not that I'm any good at it, but it just smells like clean laundry or soap. Just fresh and clean and eminently pleasant.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: While there are a lot of comments that say this smells like 4711, it somehow doesn't. For me, it's not even close. Why do i love this? It simply reminds me of childhood happiness. There was this spanish cologne i used all the time as a kid. Uncomplicated, fresh, green, citrus notes. Heavenly even if doesn't stay as long as i expect. I wouldn't mind spraying again in the day. If my bottle runs out i just might get another one for nostalgia.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Amazing neroli perfume (maybe the best out there) BUT with major longevity and projection issues. It is very similar with the 4711 cologne. The price is over the top.

Follow my scent journey on instagram
instagram.com/scentsexual

*This review was written after several full wearings of the perfume and not just after smelling this on paper or on wrist.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: To me, Tom Ford fragrances are very much hit or miss: e.g. I love Velvet Orchid, but cannot stand Black Orchid, etc. Neroli Portofino is definitely a miss: there's just nothing in it that would justify the premium price. It's very harsh: half lemon-scented kitchen cleaner, half superglue. There are so many colognes out there that smell better than this (and at a fraction of its price).

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Neroli Portofino by Tome Ford is a masterpiece product of this recognized company. This great perfume have got a Citrus and White Floral scent with a bit sweetness. I also can smell something spicy in the middle note. Orange Flower scent is dominant and then I suppose I can smell Orange, Bergamot and a bit Lemon scents too. The longevity and projection are great and It can be wear in Summer and Spring for daily usage. With no doubt It is a marvellous perfume for people who are choosy
یکی از بهترین رایحه نرولی میباشد جهت تست موجود دارم
سمپل ارجینال جهت تست موجود است

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: It's disappointing in longevity and sillage but it's still very pretty. I liken it to liquid Castile soap with orange oil. It is over-priced.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
An expensive and more developed 4711 with well blended, rich ingredients but not much staying power for me. My favourite part of this is probably the interaction and balance between the floral and 'soapy' accords with the citrus - very well done!

A beautiful and fleeting, transportive experience at a high price - 6/10

UPDATE: 2 years later and I don’t know if my nose has changed but this is a strong love for me now. The performance is not great, but better than I’ve heard from most reviewers and better than I’d initially thought - it gets very subtle but still present most of the day. 8/10

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew:
Un parfum été pour être bref. il ressemble bien au Thierry Mugler Cologne qui est accessible a des prix très bas
la teneur du parfum est normal ainsi que la projection, elle peut durer environ 3h.
sa particularité est la fraicheur citronné, le coté fleurale est aussi présent afin de donner un autre tempérament au parfum
vue son prix, y'a beaucoup mieux ...

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Like Grey Vetiver before it, Neroli Portofino is a sincere take on a classic cologne, dressed up and modernized with the standard Ford treatment. There's a ride called "Soarin" at Disney's Epcot theme park in Orlando. It's a great relaxing flight simulator that allows riders to glide along in front of a massive IMAX style screen. At one point you soar over vast orange fields, and are hit with a lush blast of orange scent That's exactly what Neroli Portofino brought to mind. Inside this translucent green bottle is the most epic orange and classic, royal soap. A gorgeous summer fragrance with some real staying power. I'm transported to historic hotels in Florida with Mediterranean architecture, marble floors, and beautiful, old swimming pools with waterfalls and coral caves. But a quick trip back to reality ensures me once again that I am not a rich man. It was fun while it lasted, but I'm afraid I have to settle with Mugler cologne, Neroli's excellent peasant cousin.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: A musky floral with laundry-like notes; fresh but soapy. A bit too heady for me; I sometimes find neroli and orange blossom a bit much and that's certainly the case here. There's also the edge of something unpleasantly synthetic and a bit cheap smelling, perhaps that vaguely aquatic note. Projection and longevity are pretty poor. All in all, I can't recommend this, especially at this price. For my neroli fix I think I'll stick with Bottega Veneta's Knot.

name: Neroli Portofino Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2011
reivew: Smells like turkish lemon cologne. Very poor sillage.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Hermes Voyage d’ Hermes (2010) - cardamom tea - Im sure most would think of #jeanclaudeellena ‘s creation resembling like a Gin & Tonic, but this refreshing and versatile perfume has more to give to the wearer. First, I don’t get the boozy vibe from a gin&tonic, instead I get a beautiful spicy and floral Cardamom mixed with Lemons and Tea leaves. To supplement the green-accord from this, Mr. Ellena even placed even more green notes and I get a fresh dewy grass smell. Rounded out by Cedar and White musk - really well-made.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I don’t understand why this perfume is called delicate and soft. It's too sharp. It is so sharp that it even causes headaches. The smell 10 years ago had intoxicated me with its wonder. Who can help me? Why is the smell of 10 years ago not even 1% similar to the smell of today? I give 100/100 to the scent 10 years ago and 0 to the scent now.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Lovely perfume, lasts about 8 hours on my skin. Quite unique and a much more pleasant version of Terre d'Hermes.
If you like this, you should try Dior Homme 2020: a much more rounded and addictive scent than Voyage, IMO.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
it simply smells like a cruising the Atlantic on a boat and that cardamom makes it unique
having both, edt for spring/summer, parfum version for fall/winter
simply J.C. Ellena signature style - transparent, airy freshie but with Hermes timeless elegance.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Perfect for a sunny spring day. Its smells clean and green. It smells like a delicious tea would smell. I have not much to add. I think the people commented before me, had it right. Its a great smell, but gets very close to the skin fast. It is unisex. But I think its a bit better suited for a man.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I tried this again today at a store. I used to have this perfume and it brought back good memories, Such an excellent perfume. Lovely. Too bad it completely disappeared on my skin. You could not smell it. Still, I love it.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
There’s a strong blast of gin on the initial spray, and then it settles into a blend of soft coconut curry and lemon tea. I would say this leans slightly masculine but overall pleasant and something I would wear.

The bottle design irks me. It looks cool and all, but it’s not very functional.

Edit: the more I use this, the more I’ve been loving it. The dry down is my favorite. It gives you a very comforting feeling and has a hint of sweetness.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
In 2010, when I was 10 years old, my uncle was taking tourists, one day he invited me to my grandfather's house, we went, and there were French tourists. One of them gave me a small copy of this perfume, yes, I remember. a running horse, and a white dove on top of the horse. I sniffed it and was silent for a moment because I had never smelled a perfume like this before. How wonderful. I never used this perfume again because I forgot the name, But I remembered the picture. Ten years later, I searched for it in the picture. I only used it once, but the smell is still in my brain. But I'm hesitant to buy it now because its smell has changed. I am afraid of that.
Please tell, if you have a version released in 2010, does it smell 100% similar to the current version?
has it been reformulated?

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Green, fresh-musky, classy.

When I hear Voyage I imagine sunny and windy weather, and middle-aged pair with horn-rimmed glasses and dressed in white linen loose clothes, with brown leather valises is hurrying to the small jet plane. And this scent totally reflects my imagination. That’s the case when the name suits perfectly the scent profile.

This is totally Ellena’s style, so if you like his works you’ll definitely like this one. I wish it could be more long-lasting, but unfortunately, we have what we have. It starts with bitter green lemon and cardamom, then musk takes its place and the scent becomes a bit warmer yet fresh. It pushes about an hour or so and completely disappears after 4-5 hours from my skin.

I would recommend buying a 35ml bottle with a 125ml refill instead of a 100ml bottle that’s a bit ugly and unhandy to my taste. To me, EDT better than EDP in terms of smell, despite they are almost the same.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Fresh, a little spicy. This smells exactly like an expensive hotel's washroom.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: It reminds me a refined version of Ulric de Varens UDV

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: One of my favorite frag .I have a bottle from 2010 50% full .long lasting all day . Smells better than Declaration .Declaration is more spicy. This juice is more fresh .

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: A.D.N Hermes Saddly lost! Poor projection and longevity resulting for an inofensive summer or spring cologne (specially on spring time, because it is so poor than in summer has no much live in skin and air ) ... Declaration by Cartier has no the power, and imprint of the initial Cartier s seasons but is just more complex of Voyage... This Hermes fragance sinned of a common cologne.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Smells wonderful and fresh but longevity and projection are absolute jokes. I get around 1 hour of longevity before it completely disappears from my skin after 6 sprays. Maybe it's the new batch.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I have no patience with endless iterations of 'pink sugar', which so many feminines seem to be, so this unisex fragrance is a refreshing offering.

It is spicy and woody, like an old cedarwood chest, and there is a distinct but not overpowering citrus freshness. The drydown is essentially a softer version of the opening.

Do I like how it smells? Yes. Do I want to wear it? No, but I can see plenty of people wanting to.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
The page said: woody floral musk, it smells more like spicy citrusy to me. And because I work with a lot of spices (I love them!) it speaks gourmand, but not the sweet kind, it's savory.

Voyage d'Hermès is a shy and polite scent. Sillage is moderate, unintrusive, but enough. I'll see how the performance later. It's categorized as uni and I have to agree, though it smells pretty much feminine to me. Also, this is a day time perfume. You might want a stronger scent for night occasion (or maybe you don't).

This find is a bit of a surprise. I didn't expect it to be available in my usual store. Hence my quick buy. This scent is a tribute for my late friend who said he liked it. Now I get to remember him (and how he smelled) whenever I spray this perfume.

I like the scent, objectively speaking. And since it's my friend's favorite I like it even more. As a memorabilia though. For someone else, I think the scent fits for someone who wants to smell good without being noticed too much, all while throwing the fun in (because the spice!).

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Fresh and a bit spicy. Elegant, pleasant and expensive smelling. It's soft and sensual. Great scent! Dominant notes are tea and cardamon.
Final Note : 9 / 10

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
A cardamom centric fragrance. Opening is very zesty, and uplifting. Cardamom, lemon, and a peppery musk dominate the heart and base notes. I'm a fan of Ellena's work and even though Voyage smells nice and pleasant, it's nothing more than that. Nothing really here that will blow your socks off. A safe option which is suitable almost anytime. Performance is fairly weak due to its transparent nature but if you enjoy lighter scents and like the smell of cardamom then this would be a good option.

6/10

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
This has to be one of my favorite fragrances in terms of scent profile in the whole world, but one of my least favorite in terms of performance, as others have pointed out. It's an absolutely addicting blend of citrus, tea, wood, and musk with a beautifully rendered cardamom note. It's clean, airy, billowy, and out-of-the-shower fresh, but there's also a little bit of dirtiness or earthiness undergirding the whole thing that adds a sexy edge. It's genderless, ageless (in my opinion, though one might argue that it better suits someone 20+), and just phenomenal in every way EXCEPT for performance. It's pretty much an instant skin scent for me, with a longevity of maybe 2-3 hours, practically EDC in terms of strength. Now, I must add that I do live in a subtropical, bordering on tropical, climate with extremely hot and humid weather, and I have perfume eating skin.
