Even so, I've applied Voyage d'Hermes in an air conditioned environment without going outside and gotten the same outcome. Wearing this on my daily walk to work resulted in total annihilation, with not even a trace of the fragrance remaining after fifteen minutes. I've plowed through my 35ml (very cool) bottle of Voyage within a matter of months. This reflects both my love for the fragrance (and I do truly love the smell) and its utter lack of performance. For that reason, despite the fact that I adore the smell, I will either be purchasing the Parfum once my bottle is finished, or looking elsewhere.

6/10

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Nice, but don't go out of your way for it -- and do not pay top dollar (say, at the mall or Sephora). If you see a "deal online" go for it (say $40.00 or so). Not a good blind buy IF you own Cartier Declaration already / not a good blind buy if you DISLIKE Cartier Declaration (of which, this is only slightly better). Bottle design can be a curse OR a blessing to whoever may own it. LOL.
That said it's hard to find anything actually bad from the house of Hermes !

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
This is beautiful, my favourite cardamom fragrance. Perfect for when I want a clean fragrance without the citrus in slightly colder weather, when AdP and most citrus are just too light.

So understated. This juice makes me think of fresh white linen.

Performance is rather weak but to be expected given the composition. Surprisingly, I get better performance from the EDT. Prefer it to the EDP also (which I also really like). If you're thinking about getting the EDP due to performance of the EDT I'd advise to try it first.

Great for the office and most daytime occasions, also spring/ summer nights

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Hermes Voyage is a lovely light, refreshing fragrance suited perfectly for warmer weather. It is perfectly unisex with neither traditionally masculine or feminine undertones, though as cardamom is used extensively in men's fragrances, I can see how some would find this leaning masculine by association.
Comparable cardamom-centric fragrances such as Cartier Declaration and Narciso Rodriguez Bleu Noir are more complex, heavier, and just a bit more interesting to me. Voyage is cleaner, more transparent albeit more fleeting on my skin than the others. Indeed, it is quite subtle. When considered next to my favorites (Declaration l'Eau and NR Bleu Noir) Voyage seems a little thin by comparison as I prefer the others. However, if you are seeking a representative cardamom fragrance of good quality, this one is an excellent choice.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I have a sample of this in both EDT and EDP and for some reason I get 'celery' in among the notes. I have also detected that same 'celery' ... an almost bitter and not attractive celery note in Versace Ethereal. I really wanted to like these but I can't get past the 'past its prime' celery aroma. What is that? I know many don't detect this. Is it connected to the 'peach' note? I need to scrub off because it has such an adverse effect. Someone tell me what I am smelling pls. :-(

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
EDT > EDP

I sampled both today, and the edt was both superior in sillage and skin scent, even after I washed my hands!

Wow, this is a beauty! Can't wait until my next payday!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I get a strong dry juniper which seems to burn off very quickly and is followed by earthy cardamom with maybe a little bit of ginger and nutmeg (?). It continues along it's earthy-spicy-woody way, becoming very faint after 30min. I do catch wafts of it at ~1ft distance but it's very airy and light, I need to get within 1" of my skin to smell it strongly and consistently at this point.

I'll have to try this again soon, I enjoy it while also not knowing what to think of it.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Ice cold gin and cardamom. I can't fathom why it's labeled "warm spicy" - the scent is frigid!

It's not a "natural" arctic smell - I know the arctic, I live in it - it lacks the smoky ozone bite of natural frost. This is like the blast from a walk-in freezer.

Reminds me a bit of a particular brand of cleaning fluid we have here in Scandinavia - Ajax window cleaner, but without the ammonia. I don't mind, the smell is cleanliness incarnated.

I imagine it's what Tilda Swinton's witch Queen Jadis would have worn in "The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe", espcially in warmer weather when it looses its cleanliness and turns a bit animalic.

I wear it year round, but actually prefer it in the colder months. It's a confidence booster. Ice Queen me.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: What comes to mind? A tailor made white shirt, designer shades, freshly washed hair that dried in the summer wind. It is elegant, clean cut scent. Minimalism and high quality. Voyage gives me good vibes, makes me feel content and puts a smile on my face, even if it's cold outside. Still manages to transfer me to a beautiful place, where the sun always shines.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Voyage is a strange one. I was expecting to smell almond (which always smells like glue to me!); fortunately, no screechy glue scent here. Instead, it is dominated by green notes, tea, leather and musk. The leather is soft and understated, hence it doesn’t overwhelm the senses. It lasts for quite a few hours; the opening is on the sharper side, but then it mellows and becomes even greener than before. Sillage is moderate.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: makes you feel elegant, this is my initial opinion, to be continued.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I doubt people who are referencing YSL La Nuit Dl'Homme as a cardamom dominant fragrance have tried this. This has the most authentic cardamom accord that I have ever smelled period. It is fresh, bitter and spicy, has the signature DNA of JC Ellena. Not very much a crowd pleaser but a well rounded fragrance all in all and of high quality.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
To think that I almost missed this one just because it was in the men's section!

A reviewer said earlier that the dry down smells like deers balls and as funny as that sounds, I can see why!

Very animalic, also very masculine in the opening. In time it becomes lighter and more suitable for a woman, while also maintaining what I personally identify as a leather accord.

I have a hard time choosing between the EDT and the Parfum version, for warmer seasons this would be the better choice. Both, however, exude good taste and a great sense of style.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Very Nice Scent, It is a laundry scent however. Performance isn't enviable, but the scent and it's potency is just right. If you want something that will scream louder that's also a laundry scent, try Versace's The Dreamer

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
This, simply, smells divine.

Nothing more, nothing less, it is just a beautiful smell.

Its understated, in the most Hermes way.

I want my clothes to smell like this, I want to smell like this, I want people to smell this on me.

If refined, considered, low-key, impeccable taste had a smell, it would be this.

Love.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: A feminine-leaning, unisex, soapy smell with poor performance. I do not understand all the praise...

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
یک ادکلن هلی از النا خالق دکلاریشن باشباهت زیاد به این کار
-----------
Scent & Qualiy: 8/10
Longevity: 6/10
Sillage: 7/10
Creativity & Uniqueness: 7/10
Affordability: 7/10
-----------
Overall: 7/10

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
This is everything I never knew I needed from a hot weather fragrance, and I absolutely hate that it took me so long to find it.

I am, historically, a wearer of "men's fragrances" in the heat. I do like my fragrances to be very feminine, generally, but fragrances made for women typically rest on a bed of sweetness, which, in the high heat, I am unable to tolerate without developing a blinding headache. (Phew. What a run-on sentence!) My solution? Layer my femme fragrances over uber-clean, uber-fresh men's summer fragrances, my favourites being Bleu de Chanel (yup!) and Boss Orange by Hugo Boss. I had all but given up on ever finding a women's summer fragrance that was 'enough' in and of itself.

I initially was decided on purchasing Dior Homme Cologne for my summer scent this year. Fresh enough, clean enough, a little bit spicy, tolerable longevity (though below par) and though not at all femme enough for me, I thought, "Well, this is probably the closest I'm going to get." ... which is a dangerous thing to think in the perfume world. There is actually a *perfect* fragrance for everything if you are patient enough.

Enter Voyage d'Hermes. Oh me, oh my. It smells like iced black Indian masala chai with lemon slices in it. That only happens to be my FAVOURITE summer drink (to be fair, Indian chai is my favourite drink all year, iced or steaming hot, as appropriate). It's fresh, but... unexpectedly so. Usually, you get a mojito or something (looking at Acqua di Gioia for example), something fresh but sweet, too. This is not sweet at all, but also doesn't veer too far into masculine territory for the lack of sweetness. It is exactly unisex. Or sexless? But... sexy, too, with the cool spicy cardamom. It dries down to a soapy, clean, somewhat woody skinscent, which reminds me of the smell of a docked boat somehow. Ugh. I absolutely LOVE the scent of this.

Performance is wanting, I only get a max of 4 hours, but I wouldn't spring for the parfum because I personally don't mind reapplying, since I love the initial burst of this. Sillage is about arm's length, which is my general comfort zone. Surprisingly, it is also a crowdpleaser! I was at a late lunch in the sweltering heat one day, and I touched up the scent. Everyone appreciated the freshness so much that my bottle ended up getting passed around the table for everyone to get a little spritz! Then the waiter said our table smelled very good. (Usually, people groan about perfume in the heat...)

A definite must-try for anyone who is looking for an unusual hot weather scent, male or female. Jean Claude Ellena, you are a genius. Voyage has set the stage for every subsequent summer fragrance I try to disappoint me.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: This is really one of the most beautiful scents I've ever smelled. The lemon here isn't a typical juicy or sharp lemon, but more like a lemon cookie, mixing with fresh spices and soft woods, all with a light, airy texture. Voyage is the DEFINITION of casual elegance. Reminds me of a sunny spring day, or lounging on a patio overlooking the Mediterranean while the breeze blows through your white linen shirt.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I forget about this one sometimes which is unfortunate. Every time I wear it I fall in love with it again.

Voyage d'Hermes combines two of my favorite notes, grapefruit, and cardamon. The green, watery notes add a clean freshness that makes Voyage d'Hermes perfect for the office. Or the tennis court. Or any daytime activity really.

It is definitely unisex. It's soft and understated, but with a hint of gin and tonic. It's a very elegant fragrance

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I'm a woman and find this scent intoxicating. I haven't smelled it on a man yet...soon I hope! The first things I smell are a blast of pepper and cardamom which makes it quite sharp (which I adore). Then it just mellows to a fresh woodsy and slightly zesty lemon. Wonderful!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I really enjoyed the tester, so bought it..upon receiving it, although I like the fresh aromatic spiciness, I felt it wasn't typically feminine enough for my taste..it smells similar to Dior cologne, and I felt it was more appropriate for young men, so I was happy to give it to my 15 year old son..it is a fresh classy scent, the fresh notes mix well with a woodsy undertone.,more masculine smell and the bottle too is more suited for guys..great scent by Hermes .

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I am a woman and love it. Haven´t heard a single compliment yet from the husband...He loves all of my other perfumes though. Do you think it´s weird to smell this on a woman? I think it´s perfect for office wear. What do you think?

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: JUNIPER BERRIES! Why isnt it listed?

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: This is a great fragrance with weak projection and lasting. I really wished it lasted more and projected better. Such unique fragrances should be better performing. Unfortunately only, the ones with Oud do that.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: The smell is great freshness with spice thrown in I like edp slightly better but both edt and edp remind me of a fresh Stella Artois being opened at a family party weird how some fragrances just give you a feel some are short flashes some tell a story some good some bad that's what I love about perfumery they all paint a picture for you

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
This is so good, but i think they are really having a hard time making it last so they add this little ingredient. The bugspray drydown of Hermes Colognes esp the citrus scent needs this specific ingredient, and the smoky fumes from traffic at the rooftop in Paris in su le toit isnt really meant to be there. They add Petroleum to all their citrus scents to make it last thats why it smells like bug spray and traffic fumes.

Update: It took me a long time loving this fragrance, It smells ginger. Its so complex but its simple. Well balanced. If you want to love this fragrance do not use this like a cologne after bath you will not appreciate this. Use this when youre traveling or walking a lot. This really reflects the brand. Simple but elegant. It does not get boring and everytime you get a whiff you get a different note animalic musk to lemon and ginger juice. This is not for everyone. Only for certain people who likes to be unique and smart. If you dress smart and wear this then you certainly are smart and you want to be different than what the crowd wants (*bleu de chanel, terre dhermes, ck one ehem niche cliche). Then they will like this because you are wearing this. This is not a "smell me please! all nose on me!" perfume. The scent is only for the people that is close to you and can get near you. This scent is not douchebaggy like "f*ck me girls i smell good" perfume. This is more like of a directive, young and beautiful/handsome CEO of a design brand or the perfume of the teen sons/daughter of a Hotel Founder.

Very animalic on the dry down. Smells like deers balls.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Sweet, fresh, woody and sophisticated without smelling complicated or uptight. Very like Acqua di Parma Ginepro di Sardegna but not quite as long lasting. Very unisex, and a great summer weather fragrance that doesn't smell like sunscreen. It's the scent of dry woods warmed by the summer sun carried on a salt breeze.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I find this scent very soap like. Not in a bad way mind you, but just a clean soapy fresh clean scent. It's very mild and won't offend anyone. I'm not a huge fan of unisex scents so it's not for me.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I love the spicy smell of this fragrance BUT i find it at the same time very weak, longevity is a problem here and it is a skin scent within minutes. Love the brand and the bottle though.
i give this one 6/10......

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Just when I thought I was getting good at detecting notes, this perfume has baffled me. I smell fig leaf, like, more than anything else. But there is no fig to be seen, and nobody seems to smell it either. Very strange. To my nose, underneath the fig leaf, there is the unmistakeable Ellena/Hermés DNA. I can definitely smell a resemblance between this and Un Jardin sur le Nil. I don't smell spicy notes, certainly not cardamom... I'm baffled. This is very nice, though. Refreshing, botanical, and juicy.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I like it! Very pleasant and smooth citrus/cardamom dominant scent. In fact it could be one of my favourite warm weather scents if it had at least a high-moderate performance. After 1 hour or so, it becomes a skin scent with zero sillage/projection. Not even a scent bubble that many prada edp create.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I don't find this at all masculine - quite feminine in fact, and beautiful at that. So interesting how different scents read differently on different people.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: A pleasant, refreshing offering from Hermes. A potent citrus that hangs around for a surprisingly long time! Sharp lemon combines with cardamom and spicy pepper for a likeable, stylish fragrance. I wish I could wear this but it's definitely too masculine for me. Another great fragrance from Hermes, though.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: To me this smelled a little like CK One plus cardamom. The cardamom is very prominent initially. If I didn't already associate cardamom with food, I think I'd enjoy this scent more. There is a classy little touch of musk that compliments the other notes. Once the cardamom slap to the face wears off a little bit, the drydown is a well balanced, pleasant scent. I will give it that, but frankly its resemblance to CK One torques me for the money I paid for it. This is not a cologne where you're going to walk into a room and wow anybody. It didn't seem to project well. I'd return this if I hadn't lost the receipt. I'll try wearing this for awhile to see if it grows on me, but I'm not holding my breath.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
This is a nice perfume for daily use.
It has some fine notes. It opens with a citric-spicy note of citrus and cardamom that is embedded in a green tea-like note.
The last note that is also present is the musk but very subtle.
This perfume has something easy going and gives freshness.
It reminds me a bit of cologne 4711 that is used in the same way as the title of this perfume suggests. I guess that is why they made this perfume deliberately in a way you can use it as often as you need it. Because the longevity and the silage is not that great. But the notes in it are very harmonious.
When to use on warm days, when y on the road, when ever and mostly, spring, summer, just as refreshment and of course unisex because it has class; its Hermes.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Amazing scent. Fresh yet musky at the same time. It is clean and simple yet sophisticated. Works for both genders. However, the silage and longevity don't last long. You can probably smell yourself after an hour or two, but it wouldn't project.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
This is one good fresh, spicy, pure green scent! I like it, it's mild and classy, a little powdery as well.
Very similar to the EDP version, just as good.
A distinctive Hermes' fragrance, you just know immediately, it's Hermes.
Great composition, light touch and pure elegance.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Green and Clean! Loving this! This is my comfort zone. Non-offensive and classy. Longevity is a concern, but still slightly detectable at the end of the day. A winner if you enjoy green fragrances.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Very woody indeed, opens like pencil shavings. Maybe a very slight hint of metal as well. It warms up very nicely into something like Lancaster D'Light and Burberry Woman but slightly more sophiticated. Very good genuinely unisex perfume. I'd be happy with anybody who smelled like this.
Also I found this very long lasting indeed, all day and definitely longer on clothes.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Lighter version (Female) of Terre d'Hermes.
The cardamom is too much & gets cloying as you were it more and more.


Projection: 5/10
Longevity: 5-6 hrs

5/10

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Bright, somewhat harsh-edged opening. A bit of citrus, slightly spicy, along with some vegetal green, followed by a much softer, vaguely floral heart. Honestly I can't even detect the base notes in this, and it's a skin scent within 45 minutes. Totally gone in 2-3 hours. Note: these results are from a decant worn mainly in air-conditioned spaces in a tropical country.

Disappointing for me. I love my Terre d'Hermes, and I'm a fan of the Jardin series. This scent is just OK, and longevity is such an issue (at least on my skin and in these conditions) that I don't think a bottle would be worth the price.

What has worked much better for me has been layering this with Philosykos (EDT). Somehow the two short-lived fragrances seem to make each other last somewhat longer in combination, and also the Hermes seems to tamp down the coconut note which I feel is a bit too prominent in Philosykos. The scents really complement each other well. So it's a winning combo.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Voyage d'Hermes begins with a blast of citrus, persists with a veil of warm spices, and ends with a delicate sprinkle of tea and flowers. So unique, so sophisticated! It makes me feel adventurous and ready to take on a challenge!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
this stuff is pure magic mmm

this is one of the best citrus openings ever its so uplifting and mood changing from the first spray

its citrus note (lemon) & warm spics (cardamom) hit just right in its opening followed by some middle notes of tea florals and earthy accords which just projects off the skin beautifully the dry down is just as wonderful with hints of wood and musk but thats where it all ends for me

unfortunately this scent doesn't let its beauty last since longevity is a big issue i dont know how well the edp version does in that regard but I'm willing to break my golden rule and still buy this scent

i may just have to carry around a atomizer to make this last throughout the day

do yourself a favour and give this one a try

thank me later ;)

on to the next

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: It has one of those "fresh citrus" openings unlike any other, with a prominent realistic cardamon blast that's both awakening and mouth watering (one of my favorite accent spices for cooking). Minutes after the opening, cardamon shares its spotlight with the rest of the crowd, turning into a well blended aromatic fresh spicy scent.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Voyage d'Hermes is another masterpiece from the house of Hermès. I feel this unisex fragrance is more suited for men, but could very well see this on a woman. This is my go to for when I just want to smell fresh and clean. It is very well balanced. The citrus opening is typical of say for most of Hermès cologne, but this one also has a blast of cardamom. Now, I wouldn't recommend it for the summer as the cardamom is overwhelming with the heat. It is wonderful though any other time of year, moreso than most other cardamom fragrances. The mid notes are very interesting to me, its a unique mix of spicy oriental, aquatic, and green. I usually am not a fan of outright aquatic or green fragrances, but voyage is really balanced nicely. The dry down then turns into this lovely woody peppercorn essence. The longevity is average, 3-4 hours with probably 6-8 on clothing. Projection could be s bit better. The bottle design is especially cool and plays into the equestrian heritage of the house. The packaging also is dead on with the feeling if the juice. Overall, another winner for Hermès and for those who want a nice, clean everyday fragrance that's unique.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I Love this grapefrukt and the flower spicy smell it's so sexy and beautiful .become one of my beloved frag elegant expensive and sophisticated !! 10/10

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Beautifully crafted flanker, absolutely modern befitting today's men and women on the go. Voyage d'Hermes is remarkably fresh, flowing yet serene; does not dim or goes dull at any point. Signature of modern charm, never overpowering! Love to win this.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
When I know this perfume is going to release, I definitely want to have one.
The aroma is very pleasant to wear in this tropical climate area (Jakarta). And it last longer even though the climate is rather harsh.
I feel very feel very fresh all day long.
Perfect scent for hot and humid area.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: This one smells like Un Jardin Sur Le Nil, just missing a few notes. I like it, it's ok but I think I'll go for the one with the extra notes, though it is EDT just like this. Interesting bottle.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Prima donna Cardamoma

This sleek vibrant beauty is one of the instances of the pumped-up reality.

And by the way, Parfum version is long lasting but it's reminiscent of the organic salad, Sur Le Nil, rather than the Cardamom Heaven, Voyage EDT.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I have no idea whether you are the kind of people who experience recurrent dreams. You know, the kind where Chucky chases you down with a chainsaw along the hallway of your school, or where you show up naked at your workplace, or where you are taking the same math test you once failed over and over again. Most of my friends tell me they dream of flying, over and over again. And each time they do I cannot shake a certain feeling of fascination: because I never dreamed of flying nor does it seem like a desirable activity to me. I guess my feet are just too firmly on a ground of my own making to experience such ‘lofty’ desires. So as I was saying, I never dreamed of flying. Until the moment I unscrewed the cap of a bottle of Hermes’ Voyage.

Beauty addicts are surely conversant with Hermes as a label – from the iconic Birkin bags to the magnificent silk scarves and the over the top outstanding fragrances. Funnily Hermes started out as a manufacturer of riding attire – you know, saddles, whips (not that kind of whips, you naughty people ;-) ) and the like, and slowly started moving in the luxury items direction, until it finally metamorphosized into the world’s ultimate symbol of luxury and opulence. I am not a huge fan of Hermes, admittedly – I would go for LV or Dior any day of the week – but I have to give them credit for boundless originality and a certain unmistakable touch to each and every one of their products. You can instantly recognize a Hermes – and once you recognized it, it’s bound to be unforgettable.

Imagine being an eagle, or a swan. Your wings are spread, your gaze fixed on a horizon which is never out of reach. Beneath you snowy mountain tops, silvery lakes with silvery fish leaping playfully through a crystal clear surface. Fields of green, juicy, vivid, complete green, daisies and lavender, forest groves, deer grazing in the distance, and sun, sun, sun – endlessly luminous. The air is so fresh and clean it’s almost intoxicating. You can hear no sounds – just distant echoes from the hilltops, remembrances of the beauty of a world you left behind. You breathe in, and out. There is nothing in that blue infinity but you and a God of your own making. Have you ever smelled freedom? This is how it tastes like.

Voyage is officially classified as woody musky – in my book it is airy ethereal. The cleanliness of this scent, the purity, the otherworldliness are simply impossible to put into words. This truly IS the smell of air – or at least the way I imagine the air above the highest mountain tops might smell like. For my entire life I have been an worshipper of heavy, opulent, hypnotizing scents – but I admit I find myself completely enveloped by this magical, surreal broth. There’s one thing I have to say, though: you need patience with this fragrance. In the beginning you will be hit by that typical Hermes vegetal note which is present in everything from the Jardin collection to the male Terre (which I ADORE – though sniffing the pure perfume version last week was a huge disappointment – I’ll be back on this one), and which I abhor. Luckily, in Voyage it subsides pretty fast, giving way to that delicious airiness I mentioned before. So be patient, it’s completely worth it.

Voyage is officially unisex – but I have to say it clearly moves much more in the male direction – which is perfectly fine with me (Gaultier Squared is, to my nose, though unisex, clearly feminine, and so is Rabanne’s One Million, which is labeled a male scent). I can imagine an English aristocrat in a white silk shirt wearing it on the marble terrace of his countryside chateau, sipping a glass of Hennessey, overlooking the garden labyrinth, the white pebble pathways, the wrought iron gates that separate his estate from the rest of the world. He is looking up at the skies, taking the world in. And the world is his.

Wear this one when you feel there is no limit to how high you are allowed to get your hopes. When you feel like you can soar not only the sky, but all skies. When your life grows wings and unfolds into what you never dared dream it could be. Voyage is not simply a scent of flying. It is not only flight – it’s levitation.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: بوی هلی که این عطر داره بی نظیره. خیلی خیلی طبیعیه. از همون اول میتونین این بوی نافذ رو تا عمق . وجودتون حس کنین. واقعا ارزش خریدن رو داره. خارق العاده هست. با زدن این عطر به خودتون اگه افسرده هم باشین بلند میشین و شروع میکنین به ورزش و فعالیت بدنی. منظورم اینه که حالتون رو خوب میکنه

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Me and my husband share this. Great for travelling light. Crisp citrus with floral and woodsy notes. Very unisex. It is nice I like it. Although it smells much better on him.

I feel in the effort to make this unisex it is a bit too pleasing. Trying to make everyone happy. It is not something I love. It doesnt come close to Terre D'Hermes for my husband. But nice enough to keep us both happy.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I BUY THIS FOR MY HUSBAND AND AM SO HAPPY WHEN HE WEARS IT. LET'S FACE IT, I'M THE ONE WHO SMELLS IT THE MOST NOT HIM. FIRST WHIFF, A MAN COMING ON DECK FROM BELOW ON HIS SAILBOAT NOT YACHT. THIS IS JUST CLEAN HONEST FRAG. AT ITS BEST.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Talking about EDT..
elegant blend
Perfect choice for work or a day meeting
it has got the very necessary power that gives you a refreshing kick right after its first spray
cardamom combined with spices in more than a perfect ratio with a dry down of charismatic wood are enough to clear your mind & make you ready for a successful day
Very serious problem with EDT is that neither the projection nor the longevity support the awesomeness of this fragrance
It just disappears in less than 2 hours
Projection can be compromised but too short lasting time becomes the convincing reason to think twice before you buy this elegant fragrance
Smell 8.5/10
Projection 5/10
Longevity 3.5/10

If we talk about EDP..
Projection and longevity are good but addition of extra cardamom makes it rather sweeter and less masculine
Smell 5/10
Projection 7/10
Longevity 7/10

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: too much cardamom hermes. i tried this in some duty free with test strips and really liked it enough to buy. a few days later at home and on skin... well... it just goes to show... try it on skin before buying. haha. did not like it one bit. that's the problem when you try too many scents on yourself in duty free that the only other place left to spray is on a piece of paper. i'm sure you cardamom lovers will regal in this one.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: This is a voyage you want to take! Although it is a rather short voyage in terms of longevity.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
A Voyage to India!

I love this, it honestly smells EXACTLY like Indian tea boiling, with the the green cardamom at the forefront,which is the centerpiece of not only Indian tea but also Voyage D'Hermes, an ode to Cardamom and spices with a refreshing twist. There are some similarites with this and Apres les Mouson. Where as Apres Les Mouson is all about the wet forests of Southern India, Voyage D'Hermes conujures up images of Tea Plantations in India
at dawn.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
There are a few fragrances when i wear them on me for the first time, do not instantly satisfy my taste. This is one of them. Cardamon combined with floral notes didn't work well for me. The initial whiffs were clogging. But eventually, say about an hour or so it left a nice but not so pleasant ambery and a slight musky kind of fragrance.
I would never wear this when im gonna have a tuff day at work and definitely not when im annoyed. Its not supposed to be a morale booster or a mood uplifter for me. I'd wear this fragrance when im going to the beach on a sunny afternoon or maybe not.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: To me this is very spicy, and chock-full of cardamom. Not light, not fresh, not clean. For me, this is for cardamom what Kenzo Jungle is for cloves.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Yet another excellent fragrance by J-C.E. from the house of Hermes. It's a classy effervescent lemony scent with woodsy notes and a hint of cardamom and/or green tea. Lots of character and somehow has a very passionate/sexual vibe during the drydown. An original bottle and it's refillable though I've never seen refills of this fragrance for sale anywhere.

This one doesn't stick around for very long. On me, it's lasting around 3-4 hours and then it's a pure skin scent for another 2-3 hours.

I'm a big collector and this by no means is my first or only well made, quality fragrance that doesn't last all day and that's just fine. Anyone wanting more longevity is probably wearing it to work during the day and the important thing to remember is that with any great fragrance, the first impressions you make that day, probably in the morning when you're freshly showered and shaven, are what people around you will notice and remember. Nobody wants to smell you all day. If you're more interested in smelling it on yourself and want to keep that vibe going, carry a small decant in your pocket and give the back of your hand a spray every few hours.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I am not the biggest fan of cardamom but this, oh yes this, its a big exception, its the type of fragrance u cant simply dislike its clean and of very high quality really recommending it for people who like cardamom

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Such a great scent, truely unisex without straying too far to either side. It's unique in that it's not offensive, but also very appealing and attractive. Like all other Hermes frags, it stays true throughout without changing dramatically from top to dry-down. I get Cardamom, Ginger, and Tea all the way thru. In a word, this scent is 'sparkling'. In some more words, it's refreshing enough for a bright, sunny day, and warm enough for an evening in. A classic.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: i love this one , this is expensive smell for sure , this is what i imagine a powerful wall street broker to smell like , for me it is unisex and honeslty it brings so many awesome memories i used it trough a trip to southeast asia and for me this is the perfect summer scent forever

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: This is a masterpiece, it is obviously a JC Ellena creation, you can't miss that. It has that twist at the end of the ...sniff. I always think that twist is his signature. The dry down brings to mind un jardin en mediteranee, only better. It is fresh, green, of course citrusy, with a bittersweet aftertaste.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Voyage d`Hermés is simple and complex at the same time for me. Have you already saw those pictures where you see an image and you can only see the other images that forms it if you pay attention on the details? Well, it`s how is Voyage d`Hermés for me. On the bigger scenario, the scent can be simply a fresh, green, musky scent, in a minimalistis style perfectly for being a scent representative of Hermés as a brand. But then, if you spray it liberally and pay attention to it as it develops on skin, you`ll see that this is a kind of moment where Ellena recapitulates elements that he has been perfecting so far. You see flashes of Angeliques Sous La Pluie, Terre d`Hermes, The Different Company Bois d`Iris, Eau des Merveilles. And while it`s reminiscent of previous works, the fragrance quotations are shaped in this green, musky accord, perfect for a summer day and with that soft, barely there, silk aroma that Hermés seems to be favoring now. If you love strong and dramatic aromas you`ll probably don`t see any fun on this, but if your style goes towards light scents with a subtle complexity, i recommend this one. As I said before, spray it liberally, it works much better and creates a more surrounding fragrance on skin.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Voyage d'Hermes is my first Hermes I've ever tried and my first scent by Ellena. I got this after falling in love at first sight with the bottle and because I wanted to feel as luxurious as the brand. From the bottle, the bitter citrus is almost overwhelming--it's a manly, spicy, green citrus and reminds me a bit of pine sol. After a few short moments on my skin, it opens up to reveal a very pretty floral hiding beneath it. The citrusy-woody-floral combo is very pleasant and takes me to some sunny spring morning. In terms of color, I smell a chartreusy lime green followed by almost carnation pink. It almost clashes, but I like that. However, from such a luxury brand and from such a notorious nose, I must admit I was "underwhelmed" in terms of sillage and longevity. I want an Ellena to be my signature scent, but this one doesn't quite make the cut.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Elaborating of the topic of perfume is like reckoning of magic. Even if someone does not believe in magic, she or he is carrying a sense of fear towards it. Perfumes are most of the time relating to human souls in just about the same manner.
A perfume,liked or dislike, touches us from the inside of our beings. A perfume makes you feel something, be it good or bad. Perfumes are designed to affect your internal sense of mood; they are made to alter or even create your mood and sense of momentary being for certain time... From this perspective, perfumers are giant mood creators; or even souls' 'players'... So, should we talk about perfumes superficially anymore. For instance, if a perfume touches your inside creatively, remember not only the notes, but also the soul who designed it to delight you from innermost.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
To start with . I seriously feel ellena need to retire now. I find this fragrance as well advertised but lacks a character and it doesnt last long . They made a decent bottle for sure but it only smells of cardamom throughout and gets really repulsive to start with like synthetic material in towel soap .
I find it too expensive in vain . Some people say sophisticated . I dont think so . I find its deo spray better and even its shower gel is good . I will rate 5 out of 10 as the bottle looks good .

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
In her classic Cuisines of Mexico (1972), Diana Kennedy decries some things that American cooks do to Mexican dishes: drown them in shrill "chili" sauces, coat them in melted cheese, etc. One other? The tendency to overuse cumin, especially when not realizing that generic "chili powder" often already HAS cumin. The word she used to describe the resulting note is "sweaty."

I really, really wanted to love Voyage, but instead of cardamom I got a sweaty cumin note that detracted from the overall experience. I purchased a sample from a reliable source after enjoying a card sample. But on my skin in cool to warm weather it was not a success. Average sillage and longevity.

Scent: 4/10
Sillage: 5/10
Longevity: 5/10

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: A creamy lemon and grapefruit that smells rather Mediterranean to me. Cardamom adds some wamth. Reminds me of being on vacation. Perhaps that's why it's called "Voyage." Clever title, nice fragrance.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Very poor longevity. After 2 hours I could barely detect it. Too bad since it is a pleasant parfume, less "earthy" than the rest of Hermes for men.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Smells like a gin and tonic. Classy and a little rough around the edges, just like a man should be.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Declaration, Terre d'Hermes...Voyage I really like and appreciate Mr. Ellena works but....maybe needs new inspirations...

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Love this! A must try if you like cardamom. When it was released I had a spray and returned to work afterwards. Kept getting little wafts of clean, warm spice all afternoon. I find this wearable year round - the fresh citrus and cardamom work in the warmer months and the spicy, woody notes when it's cool. If you want something a little richer the parfum version has more musk and the addition of amber. Both are gorgeous scents!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
A voyage to a cardamom bush which lasts 30 min and costs $60.

A lot better than my previous trip with the same company which took me to the terre of rotten oranges and decayed vetiver...

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
It took me some time to fully appreciate this classy scent, but now i can't go without it.

It's perfect to wear in warm weather, you want to feel classy but don't want to stand out too much, you just like to feel fresh and classy, then Voyage is just perfect.

It's not overpowering, not offensive, but still unique at the same time.

It takes a very special kind of balance to make a unique scent so versatile.

It's probably one of my favorites.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
A really nice scent,very spicy and peppery, unisex in an excellent way.
But somehow there is a typical tone to all Hermes perfumes, a base scent that is similar in all of them and gives me an annoying headache...

Such a pity, as I really like the scent.

longevity is good and sillage moderate.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I cannot understand ratings for longevity and sillage, I can literally smell this whole day on me, and I have about 40 fragrances and I know what is weak and what is strong perfume. This one is definitely not the weak one, at least on my skin. The most natural and fresh fragrance I own, I just adore it! :)

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
The perfumer Jean-Claude Ellena uses travels as inspiration, a state of mind. You can see this in several fragrances from the brand.

In this fragrance, there's something located between peace and freedom, represented in the ad campaign by the encounter between the White Dove and the wild horse, which runs through several landscapes. Some say the bottle was inspired by a pocket magnifying glass, with its container in aluminium, but I own another perception, because I can only see the modernity of USB flash drives that are sold in this same style. The high-tech side speaks louder this time, though both are portable and made to carry on trips. Mere coincidence.

It counts on citrus (amalfi lemon) and spicy notes (ginger, cardamom and coriander), in the output; Green notes, Hedione (chemical compound that has floral nuances) and tea in the heart; Woody and musky notes, reinforced by the presence of Iso E Super (chemical molecule that has nuances of cedar, vetiver, crystalline and slightly ambery aroma) in the base.
It's another unisex fragrance and the results demonstrate diverse experiences, mainly, on the skin of women. On my skin, it has a great citrus output, which only grows to a more synthetic aroma with soapy aspect. I've seen many comparisons with Déclaration, by Cartier, but I don't agree, because the outcome of both, at least on me, it is not similar. In my perception, it remembers more the elegant and simple style of Bvlgari Pour Homme.

It has a very poor sillage, but it lasts forever. I can see this fragrance as a wildcard for the warmer weather because it can be worn without fear and in several occasions.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Bomb of freshness and elegance,so clean and earthy,you can smell every note alone....

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I'm a little frustrated that there's fragrances I thought I'd posted reviews for, then when I check turns out I haven't! Nevermind.
Nothing to dislike here. Voyage D'Hermes is a classy scent a woody, musk, spiced citrus, reminiscent of Cartier Declaration with prominent cardamom and fresh citrus. I wouldn't have thought it to be everyone's cup of tea, but with the relative popularity of scents like Dior Homme sport lemon & spice is a popular combo. I'm a real spice fan and as such enjoy this fragrance. I don't think it's as intrusive as the Cartier and slightly more wearable.The verdict then? It doesn't inspire me but I'd wear it.
Great for spring and summer, Hermes deliver yet again.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Great unisex fragrance which is slightly on the masculine side.
The juice is not synthetic nor chemical smelling, gives very great feeling of freshness and naturality.
This is a high class and easily wearable fragrance to all occasions. I would rate it 10/10 since there is nothing i would like to change about the fragrance. Very recommended for those that would like to have a high class scent that is easy on the nose yet projects good.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: really sharp from the beginning, too masculine for me even though I was looking for something unisex...EdT gone on my skin within 3 hours, thus I consider it overpriced. what I really adore about it is the amazing bottle but it´s quite not a reason to purchase

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I find it hard for a women to wear this primarily because the citrus and bitter cardamom notes give it a very masculine feel.

The fragrance takes me to Tea Plantations of Assam, spicy, rooty and wet.
Also reminds me of a garden after monsoon rains.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I wish they'd be more specific than 'spices' because I seem to get a distinct amount of nutmeg from this as well as green cardamom. It reminds me of Cacharel's lovely 'Pour Homme' with it's oily lemon nutmeg - but the slight aftershave feel doesn't put me off at all since I used to wear Cacharel sometimes.

Jean Claude Elena's ubiquitous sour grapefruit note is not very appealing to me. So the fact that amalfi lemon is substituted for grapefruit here makes this immediately more appealing.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
The cardamom is exquisite.
The Best Cardamom fragrance

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I received a small tester and I actually thought this was a mens fragrance! And I think that isn't that strange because a guy can pull this off very easily. All with all this may seem a simple fragrance but it isn't at all. It smells really natural and fresh which would be perfect suitable for every occasion. I'm not thinking about getting a full bottle but it's a pleasant surprise.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
@Yohji: "Sagittarius people association". Well here is one to confirm your theory...
I happen to have both small quantities of Voyage EDT and EDP. One day I tested them on either arms to compare which side I might like better. Very difficult! In a nutshell, they are definitely related but still different enough. EDT comes across way more citrussy than the EDP, in one word Gin & Tonic! I do not fully agree with people saying longevity is poor, however I cannot say whether the EDT or EDP lasts longer, they just carry a different feel for me. In fact, the EDT seems to have one particular component that really seems to make it cling to my skin like there is no tomorrow, could be the famous Iso E. I love both the EDT and EDP - perhaps the EDT is even more refreshing in summer so you could reserve the EDP for winter. EDP turns into a much more warm and ambery skin scent.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Well, this is pretty incredible.
Unique. A very first fragrance that made me think that I would LOVE to smell it on a man. It's spicy and clean, that Hermes cologne note is present. But I love it on me instead ;)

The only scent that makes me think of Wes Anderson's movies, ('Darjeeling Limited', the opening scene in Paris), expensive (yet simple and organised) travel, and extravagant, 'member's club only' lifestyle that most of us are unlikely to have.
A very good selling point. The bottle is a work of art.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I love this fragrance! It smells so interesting, aromatic, spicy and cool! Just like a forest in the winter! One of the best unisex fragrances! Contragulations Hermes!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I'm just the opposite of scott6459, I love the opening of this fragrance above everything else about it. I adore the first moments of crisp cardamom an citrus and the dry feel of woods and tea at the back of my throat, mixed with the "almost sweetness" of the musk and hint of florals. I love this characteritic brush-stroke of Ellena: the "almost-sweetness" I detected in his other creations like L'Eau d'Hiver and Un Jardin Mediterranee (among others)...they seem to go towards sweetness with determined steps, just to stop before really getting there, I love the tension that this effect creates! I do enjoy this scent a lot, but I think I would enjoy it more on my husband than on myself. Bravo, Monsieur Ellena, once again!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: waste of money

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
ROUGH TO SMOOTH VOYAGE

Opening was a harsh spicy lemon - definitely not my favorite fragrance combo.

Over time (quite a bit of time), it softened and allowed for some nice refined notes.

If I could just skip the opening and first hour - I'd be on board.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Perfect mix, natural, warm, sensual, different

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: A spicy citrus opening, with mellow lemon and heavy dose of musky cardamom. There are other spices here too (pink pepper and thyme maybe?) which are blended together as one accord. There is a very subtle velvety rose to the dry down (imagine a lemon yellow rose), with warm woods (cedar?) resonating. Eventually becomes powdery and amber-like over time. This is a very warm, uplifting scent. I have noticed numerous reviews indicating best use of this scent for summer, perhaps due to the brightness of the opening Amalfi lemon. In contrast, the overall impression I received was one of an autumnal sunset. (43)

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
When I got this fragrance I was expecting something a little sweeter but it is very earthy, so I mixxed with D&G 10 La Roue De La fortune and BOOMMMM, stays in my skin forever and now has a touch of sweetness. love it that way!
Voyage fades away very fast by itself.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Totally out of the box I am addicted to this smell. At first impression: herbal, spicy, lemony fresh, courageous, freedom, it smells natural, one of the most natural perfume I ever smelled reminds me of Aveda hair products but with more complexity. When the middle note sets in, I smell bittersweet ginger, comforting and powdery. I love that is it unisex, can totally be the perfume for a couple into each other, adopting this scent like their love. Unisex perfumery is an oxymoron, masculine and feminine. Both sex wearing it should be the active type close to nature, outdoorsy, I don't see coach potatoes wearing this. On a man I see a natural, smart, hipster, surfer type with a quiet personality, patient and kind to women with a soft side, yet confident of his masculinity, I also see it on a homosexual with an artsy side. If your macho skip this. I like the smell on a man mixed with its natural strong manly odours it accentuates/balance with his masculinity instead of overpowering it like boring musky man perfumes. On a women I smell confidence, sporty, none girly, wanting to stand out among other women,who got sick of floral and fruity scent wanting to be a new person, wanting to shock instead to attract(with common vanilla or sweet scents),and try different things maybe after a breakup and wanting to explore the world full of danger, therefore Voyager?

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: This is a perfect summer scent for men, Fresh but not too sweet, I do not like it for myself or on other women, I definitely like this on guys only.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Ellena is definitely a Master Perfumer but this time he has probably missed to give his best. Voyage is an Ok fragrance imo , rather its a ruined version of Classic Cartier Declaration which i really like.

Good Luck next time.

6.5/10

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Very easy fragrance to wear, not provoking, no offense, no overwealming layers, which comes handy in summertime. I appreciate it a lot, but it is only suitable in hot season, for winter it becomes a bit too simple for my taste. All noble and refined still of course.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I love this perfume, is something exceptional. It is one of my favorite men's fragrances. Its smell reminds me of good memories, like the summer, freshness, dreams, life.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I bought this in haste thinking it would be as good as Terre d'Hermes. It's nowhere near as good. Very generic and a bit over the top. I finshed the bottle quickly and was glad to see it empty. It would be the first and last time. Better stick to Terre.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
If you can find a 3.3oz/100ml real bottle for around $60-$70 then it's highly worth it. Overall, the sillage on skin (0-10) is about 5.5, longevity on skin (0-10) is about 6, and projection on skin (0-10) is about 6.5. On the flipside, if a man or woman wore this but spraying undergarments like tanktop or bra with 4-sprays and 2-sprays behind each ear; WATCH OUT!!! Everyone will love crossing paths with you cause it's that darn amazing.

Clean scent with a powdery citrus, some spices, and a light-woodsy accord, hardly any floral at all, but if you sniff around long enough a person can sense a ginger note (maybe) although its not listed.

As far as people stating synthetics like comments regarding Hermes-Voyage eau de toilette; For the record, I own creed, cartiers, real aged oud attars, tom ford private blends collections, and few other worthy scents... Not by a long shot is this a terrible fragrance. Im actually on my 2nd bottle in 2yrs and its enjoyable.

Remember its all depending on the method of application. Highly concentrated HARSH-CHEMICAL scents will last longer on the skin and no telling whatever else its doing too. Hermes is not a seller of harsh-chemicals and therefore expect to apply this on undegarments such as tank-tops and bras for longer wear. In addition, fragrances react different depending on weather (cold-cool-warm-hot) and body temperture.

*hope thats not too long! :)

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Voyage d`hermes is a woody fragrance with fresh and citrus-fruity overtones.It is a simple,subtle and very well composed fragrance.

Main top note consists of angelica leaves and citruses, the middle is juniperberry, and the base notes are mix of cedarwood, sandalwood and white musk.

The most prominent note in Voyage d`hermes is Juniperberry, althought nobody mentioned it.It is real smell of juniperberry.Very natural,I can claim this because I had a lot of opporunities to memorize this smell as i was picking juniperberries from the nature almost every summer.I know the nature very well as it is part of my life.I live near mountain and often go picking different kind of herbs.Voyage d`hermes is nature in a bottle fragrance.When I smell it, remaind me of the smell in the morning when a go trought junipers to pick the juniperberries.

Slightly wet herbs,slightly earty,the smell of juniperberries and the smell of juniper nidels and the air in the morning sun.And, just add water when you are thirsty and that is Voyage d`hermes.

This fragrance for me is pretty original on it`s own.It doesn`t last long,the same as the moment in nature doesn`t last long.It is meant to energise you and resfresh your sences, it is not a sillage monster to go clubbing.Voyage d`hermes is to enjoy the nature.To have part of nature always with you.To love the life.

I highly recomend Voyage d`hermes to those people with deeper soul and introspection, who often find the joy in small things and moments in life.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Voyage d'Hermes is a weird scent for me. It's not my usual ultra-feminine floral type, but it's very interesting and somehow comforting.
It's true as said before that it really reminds of Cartier Declaration or Eau de Cartier or some Hermes fragrances.
They all have something in common with a citrus-aromatic opening as if lemon and herbs wear crushed together, then spices like cinnamon or cloves but quite diluted, not too much East-type then a woody base with lovely ambery tones or should I say synthetical ambery notes, only slightly powdery with an allure of woody fabric conditioner, it screams: "I'm coming out of the shower, worn a cashmere pull and a pair of black jeans and ready for you baby, but with class"
All in all is a very classical scheme for a perfume but with an eye blink to modernity and acceptability.
It's a kind of smell that has become kind of an acquired taste around and a safe smell, half warm half clean, cosy but not sexual and trans-gender.
Worn by a woman it gives some warmth without being too frilly or too femme-clichè.
Worn by a man is a style of non-aggressive rather intellectual man.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I dont get any cardamom from edt. Neither do my girlfriend, who also tried it. This starts out citrusy and woodsy. I was honestly hoping I would get more from this one, especially in the drydown. If you are a man, go for Cartier Declaration.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: With such beautiful notes, I expected something a lot better. This is another watery, bland Hermes perfume, like Jardin Sur le Nil, another perfume with beautiful notes, but turns out very bland and watery. This EdT mostly smells like citrus. I smell cardamom only for the first few seconds, and I certainly don't get any impression that there is tea here. This smells similar to many other citrus/fresh perfumes and is pretty unremarkable. For cardamom and tea notes, there are many other wonderful options like Jacomo #8 and Malabah.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I love the androgenic nature of Voyage d`Hermes. This atmospheric fragrance suits both official and unofficial occasions, but still has its own cheerful character. It's relaxed yet energetic. It brings associations with a sunny pine forest by a waterfall.

It was quite difficult to choose between EDT and EDP. In EDT crispy atmospheric opening notes are long lasting, while EDP turns into cozy woody warmth within an hour. Both are inspiring and lively, but EDT is more energetic.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I don't think Ellena has to work on longevity, Elixir des Marveilles is really long lasting. He is a great creator of subtle, delicate, exquisite scents. Many times that I was wearing Un jardin Mediterranee or Kelly Caleche, people ask what's that perfume so great and delicate. I love that!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Take a Voyage with Hermes! It goes on bright and citrusy like the cheerful start of a vacation but then almost entirely disappears a couple of hours later - like your excitement when you've discovered the Carnival cruise ship you've booked passage upon developed power and waste disposal problems.

Voyage comes in a clever swivel travel bottle that you can throw into your luggage for the TSA employee to steal during his inspection. (I lost a point and shoot camera that way once.)

A nice fragrance, but, really, Jean-Claude Ellena, the perfumer for Hermes, needs to work on longevity. This juice is like their d'Orange Verte - a great, light, citrus scent but gone in no time at all. For the price point, this represents bad value for the dollar.

Second wearing: Here's how to make it last - don't spray it on your skin, spray it on your cotton shirt. I put it on at 6:15 AM this morning and I can still smell it at 3:15 PM.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: This is very nice and very casual scent. The sillage is not very good but it's ok when you wear scent for yourself sometimes. It's spicy and fresh clean at the same time. I like this better than Un Jardin Sur Le Nil, Un Jardin Sur Le Toit, and Un Jardin Apres la Mousson. This is not as overwhelming and you can spray and spray and spray without feeling like you over did it. Sheer perfection!!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I really like the smell of this perfume, it's very sexy for men, seductive and at the same time reassuring - although it is not complex and doesn't change over time. The main problem with this fragrance is that it disappears after 5 minutes completely. people around me could not smell it on my skin. I had to go back to the store were I bought it and they were very friendly and allowed me to replace it. If you like the smell opt for the eau de parfum, which also has a weak silage but at least has a much better longevity.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: pp

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
The moment I donned Hermès VOYAGE D'HERMES, I was reminded of BVLGARI POUR HOMME, which I recently reviewed. They are both light and clean and tea-like, and quite pleasant, if not very thrilling. There's not a lot to say, to be honest, because the blend is quite subtle. To some, subtlety equates to boredom, but not to me. Sometimes I like a low-key, light but friendly scent such as this.

BVLGARI POUR HOMME and VOYAGE seem to use the exact same clean musky base, and it dominates both perfumes. The big difference to my nose is that VOYAGE offers the lightest dusting of cardamom, which is one of my favorite notes, so of course I like this composition better than BVLGARI POUR HOMME for that reason alone.

I have been curious about this creation since its launch but never had the opportunity to test it until today--I must have had "other priorities" during previous visits to Sephora, which is where I obtained this sample.

I would definitely consider adding a bottle of VOYAGE to my collection, and I admit to being swayed in that direction by the bottle itself, despite the fact that I probably don't need any more "twenty-first-century open-office-ready" scents. That won't prevent me from picking it up on sale at some point.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: i really like this perfume. fresh,the power of smell is long lasting. and feel like a boss every time you wear it.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I first smelled it on my father in law! The lavender was what captivated me. I had my boyfriend try it on and made him buy it at the duty free on our way home from Paris. Love this soft smell, that is not aggressive. I wish it would hold longer than 3 hours. I think I might try it on myself as it seems to be a unisexe perfume.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: the loveliest fragrance of my wardrobe.. just love the way it changes the notes and keeps you busy judging it all the day..

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Fresh and sophisticated unisex scent. Love it! My husband and I both use it. Warm Summer days on the Mediterranean.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Something very very synthetic about this scent. I can't quite put my finger on it, but it smells like cheap soap you'd use to disinfect your counter tops. The dry down is pretty much the same as the initial spray, but less synthetic.

Here are the notes I get: lemon grass, amber, sandalwood. No tea, no green notes, no spice, or most of the other notes claimed to be here.

Sorry, but this gets a big thumbs down from me despite it's attempt to be unoffensive and easy to wear.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I am a woman but I just ordered some of this on Ebay after obtaining a lovely sample at Sephora. Sephora had it as a "Unisex" scent and I agree. I like the fresh ginger and cardamom top note, pleasant, fresh, aromatic and energizing. I can't wait to wear this all day--may need re-applying to maintain the freshness, but is elegant and discreet enough to wear to work (office job).

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
A voyage to India
When reading reviews on Voyage d'Hermès it surprised me, how few people commented on the prominent cardamom note, which to my nose, overpowered all other notes.
I may confuse other notes with cardamom, but when referring to Voyage d'Hermès in the future, it will always remain 'that cardamom fragrance'.
The woodsy notes come up much later. Quite surprisingly, the tea note finally becomes dominant in the drydown! Quite the interesting chameleonic scent.
Too bad today is a cold Jnauary day, while this supposedly is a terrific one for a sweltering hot summer day. I won't have that option again as it will be sent out to another young parfumista, who would love to test it.
I may try to get hold onto another sample of this, as I'm a fan of tea fragrances: Green Tea by Elizabeth Arden has long been a signature scent.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
This is my first time reviewing and testing an Hermes fragrance. The quality of the ingredients really shows. This smells fabulously realistic, like a Mediterranean piazza on a mid-spring morning. There are clear notes of bergamot/citrus, coriander, lavender, and resins. It's really gorgeous and a smart, fresh floral for a man.

It bring to mind clear image of a man reading a newspaper on a street cafe in Milan. He is dressed sharply in a white pinstripe suit and two tone shoes with metal tips. Ice clinks in his glass as the gin and citrus cocktail, ribboned in yellow, green and orange fruit peels, slowly melts.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: all i can smell was pepper :(

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Scent: 9/10
Price: 4/10
Projection: 5/10
Versatility: 9/10
Compliments: 9/10
Buy/Try/Pass? Try
Rating (0-10): 8

Note: Everything you want in a summer fragrance (if you can stand iso-e) , except for longevity and price tag.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Muy pocas casas perfumistas me parecen más sofisticadas y exolusivas que Hermés. Por eso me resulta imperdonable que en este caso no hayan tenido en cuenta la fijación de este perfume exquisito que se evapora como agua de las manos. Lamento haber gastado tanto dinero para esto. NO lo recomiendo

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Very rooty and earthy. I like it quite a lot. Dark and natural.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I tried this from a friend's bottle. As I usually do before deciding on unloading a ton of money for a folly, I sprayed it on a piece of cardstock. On Sunday. At first I got a very sharp scent of pepper. Very sharp. Almost repulsive. Lots of pepper. And something else. Something making it it positively eatable. (Hey! You want that - once in a while...) Not sugary - por favor, - not sweet but pungent and sharp. Cardamon husk (the green part) but not the seed. And nothing, at all, not a whiff, not a faint scent, not a thought, of anything citrus. Nor flower. Any. Green, but not green tea.

Monday. It started settling. Still sharp, still very peppery, but a lot more inviting.

Tuesday. - almost 60 hours after spraying -. This perfume is just the gift that keeps on giving! The dry-down is so much more than the top notes. Now I smell AND taste the clove. Clove! Like some very small dark brown spicy candy we used to eat in the 1960's and 1970's to mask the smell of illicitly puffed cigarettes. And a faint chocolate smell. Now it is po-si-ti-vely eatable. Like chocolate filled with liqueur.

My next step is to try it on... If it lasts, its a 'must have'....

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I loved Voyage at first spray but sadly it disappears within minutes on me. A fresh burst of citrus and light flowers but fades so,so fast to a faint hint of faint woody cedar...and then, poof, it's gone.
I won't get it again for that reason sadly- oh and the bottle design is pretty annoying...

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I loved Voyage at first spray but sadly it disappears within minutes on me. A fresh burst of citrus and light flowers but fades so,so fast to a faint hint of faint woody cedar...and then, poof, it's gone.
I won't get it again for that reason sadly- oh and the bottle design is pretty annoying...

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
I love this, it honestly smells EXACTLY like Indian tea boiling, with the the green cardamom at the forefront,which is the centerpiece of not only Indian tea but also Voyage D'Hermes, an ode to Cardamom and spices with a refreshing twist. There are some similarites with this and Apres les Mouson. Where as Apres Les Mouson is all about the wet forests of Southern India, Voyage D'Hermes conujures up images of Tea Plantations in Assam
at dawn.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
LOVE IT! I'VE JUST TRIED IT! REALLY INCREDIBLE! VERY GOOD, VERY LIGHT AND VERY CLEAN SCENT! IT'S CITRUSSY NATURE MAKES IT GOOD FOR SUMMER DAYS WHILE IT'S SPICES AND WOODY NOTES GOES WELL FOR WINTER AND FALL NIGHTS! THE MUSK INSURES THE PERFECTION OF THE OLFACTORY PALETTE AS IT GOES REALLY WELL WITH WOODS AND SPICES!

(THE START REMINDS ME A LOT OF TERRE D'HERMES ALTHOUGH THE FINISH IS MILES APPART! INTRESTING!)

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: This fragrance made mr. jean Claude Ellena just for me ;-) The first time I smelled this perfume I fell in love with it. Thank you for making such a excellent fragrance. Ok, this is what I like about it...it's a bit of mystery mixed with fresh citrus and a touch of musk. Also like the fact that it's unisex. Too feminine doesn't fit me. I love it.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Starts with warm juniper/cardamom aroma – and I find myself in a wood paneled room of an estate house: somewhere where traditions and memory od generations are almost tangible. That’s a very deep scent, no hint of sweetness in it, bit no sharpness and sourness. Comforting, but not relaxing, that is I want to go out and explore the world rather than lie under the blanket with a book. The best weather for this scent would be foggy fall or cool summer. I wear this interchangeably with Angeliques Sous La Pluie by Frederic Malle, only Angeliques… is really great when it’s raining, Voyage when it’s dry.
Also I can't complain about the staying power - 5 hours is more than enough for me.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Lovely but it only last 20 minutes on my skin. Such a pity for so expensive frag

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Good, but gone after 15 min...

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
This is a typical Ellena creation. Light, simpel and transparant, yet refined and elegant. I`m not a fan of the first 30 minutes. The green citrus notes reminds me of Gin & Tonic. After 30 minutes the fragrance gets woodier, and the musc and soft spicy notes are more prominent. This is the best part. Voyage d Hermes is a light and fresh scent for all occasions, yet it`s very refined. Great as a signature fragrance. Thumbs up from me!

(I`m very cuorious if the edp version is very different!)

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Gives new meaning to the word fresh. I have not smelled such a delicious blend of fresh sophistication in only a way Jean Claude Ellena could come up with. The opening is a lemony grapefruit citrus blast that smooths its way to a spicy warm woody base. A very clean scent that may come across as to "safe" for some but I absolutely love it. Extremely versatile as well. In the words of Katie Puckrik...."smooooooooooth". The EDP is great too. EDT works well for the day. EDP I would probably use on a cooler summer night. Two thumbs WAY UP!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Voyage is lovely, fresh and delicate, but longlasting. Its citrus and spicy opening is mouthwatering, and as it develops it leaves on the skin this elegant note of green and woods. Just before fading away it makes me think of incense despite the fact incense is not listed in the composing notes. I love it, I think it is a perfect fragrance for spring and summer. It makes me feel elegant and fresh, but in a different way.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Great fragrance, longevity is good (not great) and the scent is perfect for summer. I love the subtle but clear spices, and the citrus notes are lovely. It is perfectly blended and sets great on the skin. I've used it for most of the spring. It's a great casual fragrance and is perfect for a night out with friends, or for a spring/summer day with your significant other. I personally prefer this EDT to the Parfum. Definitely try this one out, I'm confident you will enjoy it's casual, but satisfying scent!

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: The description led me to have high hopes but this just doesn't work. The components don't blend and there's an overall antiseptic quality. Maybe it's better on other people.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I find Voyage d´hermès is an amazing fragrance. Don´t make the mistake to judge it by the first impression. On the skin it is something completely different. I get very much out of it. Unlike with many other fragrances, I can´t say what ingredient I smell, it animates my imagination. I always can smell a horse rug, or like the back of a horse smells after some activity ( really great). Then I can smell grassland, with some herbs and sweet flowers ( very discreet ) and hay. But everything is very smooth, subtle and I only get a hint of it ( except for the horse rug). Projection is really good, but lasts not so long ( about 2-3 hours). Longevity is good on skin (4-6 hours) but great in clothes ( days). But the best thing is, that the smell does not change at all with the time, it just stays as good as in the beginning, until it is gone.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Simple~ i just love it

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: man scent, the fragrance of desire...

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Unbelievably light in the most complimentary way. Starts off with a squeeze of lemon and warms into a smooth blend of lightly spiced wood with a touch of sweet. I sprayed some on and caught a sniff and had to commit, it's a daytime scent that pleases.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Voyage d`Hermes

Starts out masculine with warm spicy citrus.
Once the scent is settled, on my skin, I smell a mixture of 3/4 Un Jardin Sur Le Nil and 1/4 Un Jardin Apres la Mousson.

The masculinity is femininized later by romantic florals. The spice fades, a green note matures. The citrus lingers .. very fresh, clean .. becomes powdery in the end during the dry down.

Voyage d`Hermes has low projectivity although--like other Hermes perfumes--never fails to last.

Soft citrus, gentle fresh spice, and light vegetal floral. Voyage d`Hermes .. is charming indeed.

Now I must confess that I am to choose between Voyage d`Hermes and Un Jardin Sur Le Nil. You can probably tell .. I am torn .

(｡◕‿◕｡)

My apologies Voyage .. I decided to shack up with Un Jardin Sur Le Nil ..

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: I'm waiting for the EDp concentration. The EDT has a good smelling but doesn't last to long. I expect that the EDP solves this longevity problem of the original one

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew: Great news! Finally Hermes will launch Voyage d'hermes in EDP concentration on 1 February! Amazing:)

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Love it Love it!
Even though it took time for me to get used to it (it was a long way) - but worth it..
It's a sophisticated perfume (characteristic to Hermes). It reminds me of pine, citrus, spices & green tea.
I wish if it only stayed on longer.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Voyage is really one of the best quality perfumes I have ever smelled. I smell nothing remotely artificial on it, on the contrary, it is very very natural, IMHO.
It's a classy, elegant, refined but thick and full and rich perfume.
I wouldn't have known this fragrance if a dear member here (Montezuma) wouldn't have sent me a sample of it.
I fel in love with it the first moment I smelled it!
I don't like cardamom very much but this perfume is one of my most favorite, I LOVE IT LOVE IT!!!

I know many people find it more masculine but I just fail to see it this way! And I am a woman-ish, classical woman who wears mostly flowery scents and dresses instead of trousers.
Then, I guess, it's probably a matter of skin chemistry.

name: Voyage d'Hermes Hermès (unisex) ~ 2010
reivew:
Voyage is an artificial smelling capsicum and synthetic musk blend that lasts forever if you spray it on clothes.

Personally I hate it, but if you are a lover of bell pepper type scents or the idea of pepper meets clean (synthetic musk) sounds like your ticket, you may want to give it a try. It does smell nice on first whiff.

Voyage reminds me of its sister Eau de Gentiane Blanche, which also smells nice, which I also dislike. Perhaps like Gentiane Blanche, Voyage would smell nice on someone else, in passing.

The bottle design is distinctly pointless bordering on annoying.
