There's classic incense here, classic oils. Amber is the obvious stand out, but not a plasticy or syrupying amber, a wet oily one rubbed into skin. Myrrh, sandalwood, coriander and vanilla all make themselves known laced throughout the burning heat of the amber. I swear to god there is even oregano. Wearing it, I feel myself in a church somewhere old and hot, and there is light fighting through beams of wood that smell as though they have been freshly cut down and there are candles burning somewhere and the smell of books that have been sitting in someone's kitchen… It’s transformative. Is this a perfume? Or is this a story? I’m lost. It’s complex but it’s kind enough to take you by the hand and walk you piece by piece through this maze. 8.5/10

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Wooow this is a beautiful scent. My mom did not like it which I can understand. She likes classy and clean scents with a hint of flowers in them. In here, we have something sour and dirty which I find really comfortable and sexy (animalic note?) to wear during colder days. A little bit oriental I would say and definitely nothing you can get in your casual perfume shops. A must try!!

Scent: 9/10
Longevity: 8/10
Projection: 7.5/10
Price: 10/10

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I always had issues with Serge Lutens fragrances. I love the quality of the compositions, his vision. But I could always hardly imagine myself wearing one of them because they were too feminine or too strong. I had a bad experience with Fumerie Turque which I quickly swapped. That was way too over-the-top for me. So there remained Ambre Sultan which I sampled on so many occasions over the years. I eventually had the opportunity to buy it for a good price. I haven't managed to actually quite enjoy it. It's the kind of perfume I could spray on a handkerchief and leave it around, but on my skin...I'm not sure. As somebody here once pointed, it might be good with a warmer weather. So I'll definitely give it another try this summer.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Opens with spices, dries down to a vanillic amber with a waxy texture. I wouldn't call it smoky, although a very light incense makes a quick appearance at some point. Quite nice, but it has a metallic tang that bothers me a bit; it's particularly strong 10-30 minutes after the application. It might be the oregano and/or bay leaf?

The performance is average at best. It becomes pretty much a skin scent after an hour and the effective wear time is 4-5 hours max. Certainly not a powerhouse in my books. Lately I spent hours sitting in a car with my mother, who is quite sensitive to perfumes and therefore very vocal with her complaints, and she didn't say a word about this one...

All in all, it's okay and totally wearable, but nothing hype-worthy to me. Likeable, but somewhat uninspiring. To be honest, you'll get a similar spicy-vanillic amber effect with Calvin Klein's Obsession and you actually pay a lot less for better performance. As far as niche ambers go, I'd much rather pick PdE Ambre Russe or Ambra Nera by Farmacia SS. Annunziata.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I am in shock that I never posted a review for Ambre Sultan...
I love ambers. And this is probably the gold standard in ambers.
It is unusually cool in S Florida and this is the perfect time to pull out your ambers. There is something opulent, magnificent, decadent about the aura that an amber surrounds you. Lutens created the ultimate herbal amber if that makes any sense. Ambers can be very sweet, but the presence of bay leaf cuts through like a knife. And it brings it to another dimension. There are other notes in here as well, but... the beauty of this is that it conjures images of you being surrounded by the most luxurious veil, scarf, coat, whatever you want it to be. It intoxicates your senses the way a glass of good wine will do after a long day at work. It is cozy, but with twisted thoughts in mind. And that to me, is the magic of scents.
Smell great my friends.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
A dense, sensual, spellbinding amber. This smells like Bagdad, Damascus, or Riyadh of the imagination... like a Moroccan souq. The opaque, heavy, incense laden amber is especially prominent in the opening, before it starts giving way to the sharp aromatics which, combined with the flute-like myrrh, add a fascinating edge underneath all the soft, sweet, powdery stuff. Unlike some other Ambers I've smelled, like L'Artisan's Ambre Extreme, this is a somewhat "dirty" amber, but not as in the funk of sex (like, say, Muscs Koublai Khan) but that of a room that's had hundreds of years of perfume and incense accumulating in carpets, curtains, furniture, the very walls. Unlike other SL's, it's not challenging or weird, just a potent, perfect amber; as one reviewer called it, a reference amber. I can see why this is so highly regarded - it's a true classic.

Edit: Having a bad day. What is the first thing I reach for? My sample of Ambre Sultan. Being enveloped in a comforting, cashmere cloud of amber makes everything better. :)

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Adore this, so warm and comforting ambery vanilla balsamic. However sadly I don't feel that this lasts at all! Very quick to turn into a skin scent and even then very faint...I found this with most SLs sadly! Lovely scent though would definitely be on my buy list if it were longer lasting.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Perfect resinous amber, not the light powdery stuff that is in so many women's perfumes. This smells so much like the amber I used to get from the herb shop to infuse oils with. I get a few nice woody notes, pine and cedar mixed in there, but the amber is still the star. A sweet vanilla comes in during the drydown

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Does NOT smell like Amber Absolute to me. I mean, it evokes a similar vibe but they don't smell alike to me at all.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: goes on sweet, spicy amber but dries down more herbal; get the smell of cardamom and cumin at first that is probably the coriander and oregano

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Update, I gave a rather superficial review as I do not have words. Ambre Sultan is the smell of hymn books, the warmth of light, the woody smell of church pews, the heat of desert, the gold of a solid piece of amber held in the hand while enjoying the golden light from the exquisite stone.
Agreed with one reviewer: there is something of Organza Indecence in here. To me it is more golden smell than O I and it is deeper, even more opulent if that is possible?
Organza Indecence is pink with a hint of rose gold, Amber Sultan is pure deep amber light and firy warmth.

Will look forward to experience it in the fall. A must for oriental fragrance connoisseurs. It makes me think of amber fetiche by Goutal, yet in this composition the amber becomes warmer perhaps through the use of vanilla and resins.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: What a beautiful amber. It can only be described as exquisite. Summertime here in SA, I will have to save mine for cooler rainy days only or at night. Too spicy for days on which the temperature rises to 38 degrees C. This is exquisite and I think I am a S L fan!

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is based on a decant I received recently, I don't own a bottle of it.

I am comparing this to amber oil that I have, the typical arabic one and I can smell few differences. First of all this one changes with time unlike the amber oil. Second, this is less sweet, less fruity, more smoky than any amber oil I had or tried before.I am not getting any patchouli at all.

I will comment on longevity and sillage after I give it a proper wearing.

Update: Sillage is moderate and so is longevity, I can smell it as a skin scent after 5-6 hours

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
The most gorgeous amber! Thick and sweet. Very beautiful perfume.
Beautifully spicy, smooth, aromatic. Wonderful.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I rarely buy blind, but the reviews of this made me curious...and hells bells it's gobsmackingly gorgeous. Warm, complex and grown-up; echoes of incense, spices, gardens on warm summer nights. I think this might be the beginning of a Serge Lutens obsession...

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
oh my.
i only want to say is that this must be the best amber i have tried.
an elixir.
the herbs and spice stay with me for a long time and they are exquisite.
love love love.

i read many Serge Lutens reviews since joining this site about 2 years ago and i thought i would never like any of them, until i tried Feminite and then this. i love.

if you enjoy woods, spices, complexity, sumptuousness and amber, you have to try this.
top notes and all. it is beautiful, interesting and alive.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Lutens Ambre Sultan is a rich, thick, sweetened amber-vanilla warm hug with my chemistry.The angelica and vanilla sweeten up this fabulous amber accord. It does have its off the beaten path spices at the top, but I find it interesting.

This smells very close to the drydown of the original Opium formula on me. A whole bottle of that from the beginning?! Yes please! Only it is deeper, thicker amber than YSL Opium's drydown. If you arent experienced with dark orientals, you might have an issue with this, so try before you buy. Perfect for the fall season! Beautiful in its way. First amber fragrance I really liked. Fleur d'Oranger +datura noir +AS is lovely.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
امبر سلطان نمیتواند فرمولی اتفاقی باشد
.پشت این بو تحقیق و تفکراتی بوده که این عطر را بدین شکل و رایحه دراورده است
امبر سلطان ترکیب فوق العاده صمغها و کهربا و شدیدا بالمازیک و نوین هست
بوی صمغها و شیره درختان حس و حالی طبیعت گونه و نیمه وحشی به عطر میدهند که حضور قوی کهربا عطر را به یک بوی خوشمزه و خوردنی و شیرین و رام تبدیل میکند
بنظرم کهربا بیش از هر چیزی در عطر نقش دارد. و به خوبی گیرایی و جذابیت را در امبر سلطان ارایه میدهد. چنین کهربایی مرا بیاد بوی کهربا در ابسشن کلوین کلاین انداخت نافذ ، حیوانی و شهوانی اما مذاب گونه و داغ
اگرچه این نمیتواند بو و عطر من باشد ولی ساخت و افرینش چنین ترکیب زیرکانه ای شایسته تمجید و ستایش فراوانی است
4 / 5
ambre sultan is not accidental formula.
To create this fragrance research and thinking has been.
The fragrance is a fantastic mix of resin trees and amber highly balsamic and morden.
naturalist and semi-wild mood That is balanced by Amber
amber is delicious and powder
This amber is similar to smell of amber in obsession ck
Impressive .light animalic
4 / 5

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Ambre Sultan can be the type of fragrance that really challenges a new or unaccustomed nose. I remember when I was new to this hobby and I tried Ambre Sultan-- I really didn't care for it. Most of it was due to the opening, originally.

Now I try it again, and I am in love with this fragrance. It is a very warm, rich and full-bodied amber. I do not find this similar to Amber Absolute personally, as AA has more of a syrup-centric amber at the drydown, whereas AS is more-so focused on a lush vanillic amber. To most though, that distinction won't be as prevalent.

Both AA and AS have challenging openings (AS is foody, AA is smoky), and I do find it for me personally that you need to give them time to wear to open up and reveal its true identity, which is some of the best golden, sweet warmth you can find.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Guerlain's Shalimar is Scheherazade. Ambre Sultan by Serge Lutens is Scheherazade pursuing a graduate degree in women's studies, who goes to the shooting range on weekends (with Agent Provocateur lingerie on underneath her clothes!) This fragrance is definitely unisex but retains all of what makes Shalimar sexy: the burning embers and rich resinous vanilla. The top note of sandalwood is what makes it decidedly more masculine, and less hazily seductive. The oregano is a thing of beauty in my mind - a stunning and original addition and I love it. The benzoin practically burns the back of my palate but I adore it, like a fistful of cinnamon-cassia candies. I always ponder for a moment about possibly sharing a spritz or two with my date, but then I decide I'm too selfish and want this all for myself.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
It's a shame how reformulation can kill a fragrance stone dead in it's tracks. I first sampled this six years ago and I remember a bold spicy amber fragrance with a challenging opening filled with spices and a divine drydown. The projection and longevity were great.

Well fast forward to August 2016 and the fragrance seems to have been made PC safe. Gone is the challenging opening and the bold projection. What you have is a scent that smells watered down with the herbal spices virtually gone and a scent that now whispers on the skin when it used to be a roar. What a shame.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Blind bought it on sale at TK Maxx and it doesn't disappoint! Goes on strong on me with a distinctive note of woods balancing out the sweetness. After an hour it dries down to a tobacco amber. Not sweet so might not work for everyone. But I've never had a bad experience with SL.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is the third Lutens I've tested and the second bottle I've purchased. Clearly me and Uncle Serge were meant to be. But between this and my other SL love, Muscs Koublaï Khan, I actually find this to be the more interesting blend. Based on reviews, it seems to respond quite differently on different wearers. On me, it really is a sexy bowl of soup, which may sound ridiculous, but is actually gorgeous. The bay leaf / oregano opening is intense and on me, not necessarily a bracing or cool green, but rather reminiscent of dried but pungent spices. Unlike others, I do get hints of amber very soon after application--mostly a subtle vanilla note. After the herbs back down a bit, the amber emerges and remains for many hours. About an hour or two in, a gorgeous beeswax note also enters the scene, adding an impression of heat to the bouquet. Overall the impression I get is one of dry heat, which I think this makes this scent appropriate for both warmer or cooler weather, depending on whether you're trying to cool yourself down in summer or really embrace the vibes.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is the third Lutens I've tested and the second bottle I've purchased. Clearly me and Uncle Serge were meant to be. But between this and my other SL love, Muscs Koublaï Khan, I actually find this to be the more interesting blend. Based on reviews, it seems to respond quite differently on different wearers. On me, it really is a sexy bowl of soup, which may sound rediculous, but is actually gorgeous. The bay leaf / oregano opening is intense and on me, not necessarily a bracing or cool green, but rather reminiscent of dried but pungent spices. Unlike others, I do get hints of amber very soon after application--mostly a subtle vanilla note. After the herbs back down a bit, the amber emerges and remains for many hours. About an hour or two in, a gorgeous beeswax note also enters the scene, adding an impression of heat to the bouquet. Overall the impression I get is one of dry heat, which I think this makes this scent appropriate for both warmer or cooler weather, depending on whether you're trying to cool yourself down in summer or really embrace the vibes.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This perfume is awesome – it is something very special. A strong, warm amber that is somehow complex, and not too sweet. It has something of a “bracing” quality, from the herbal notes I guess (though I don’t identify individual “herbs” in it, per se). It smells wonderful. I find myself reaching for it often after work, when I feel the need for a something that smells strong and pleasant. My husband is crazy about this on me. Excellent value, as well. So nice to have a perfume that lasts. My best blind buy ever.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
My favourite amber and the only one that makes my heart beat faster thanks to the cooling effect of the herbs set against the sweetness of vanilla. It is not cloying or too gournand. I love it.

Something tells me that it is not really a fit for me, though. I tried to get my husband to wear it but it isn't his style either. My 9-year-old son loves it - it reminds him of old books. Is he too young a recipient...? This is a fragrance I want to smell, it just won't be in my personal wardrobe.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is not a review per se as anything I say at this point about Amber Sultan would be pretty redundant. So just a few thoughts. This was one of the first frags I got when I got into niche and 60-70 frags and a few years later, this is still one of the best darn things I have ever smelled!! These days every niche house has their own Amber frag and quite a few designer houses as well and some of them are very well done. But and this is purely a personal opinion, none of them move me like this one does. Certain things in life touch you on the spirit level, a song, a piece of poetry, a painting, very subjective but when they strike a chord in you, it's like it was made for you. Ambre Sultan does that for me.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Gedlive, below, wrote an excellent and informed review of this. From my perspective, AS is the best bang-for-the-buck niche fragrance on the market. I wish there was a bit of smokiness to it, and to my nose I get primarily an oregano + amber + vanilla blend, but overall it's an easy to please amber that's versatile, long lasting and sweet (borderline cloying). It's a fairly safe fragrance, well suited for men and women.

If you like this, try Interlude Man from Amouage, which adds more dimension to the oregano and amber accord by adding smoke, incense and myrrh to the mix, creating a true masterpiece. I score AS an 8/10.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Hi! Anyone around London Interested in a Swap? I bought it (isn't this how must blind buy stories start?) and did not like it all. I would have left it at the bottom of my perfumes box forever, but my husband liked it and has used it twice (I've gotten him interested in fragrances a well, he says he find it sophisticated) and it really drives me crazy. I can only get near him in the powdery stage (and that takes a long time to come by). I can't put my finger in what is it that I don't like but I've never felt so strongly (in a negative way) towards a fragrance. I'm glad other people enjoy it so much and again, if anyone is interested in a swap of a bottle with 95% still in.. I'm into greens, woody, fougeres, gourmands, acuatic.. Love perfumes and love trying new fragrances, it just did not go well this time.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I really did want to like this but I struggle so much with the "Kitchen spices" opening, which on me lasts about two hours.

Shame really as the drydown is quite nice.

I decided instead to take L'Artisan Perfumeur Ambre Extreme as my Amber scent of choice. This works far better for me as the opening is not harsh like Ambre Sultan.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
It should be given as a lesson in Perfume schools.

How to make an amber base fragrance?
This gem is the one of the best answers...

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Mr Lutens and I have a kind of love/ hate relationship! Iris silver mist I adore, De Profundis I hated, Chergui, I liked but found it a little bit too sweet. I love Amber and overlooked this one for some time expecting it to be fruity and sweet, how wrong I was! This is the most beautiful Amber fragrance, up there in my top 5 Amber scents, I literally can not stop spraying this stuff! It's not sweet at all, it's resinous Amber and I love it.
EDIT: after trying this I revisited Chergui and I had previously over sprayed obviously as with a gentler hand I loved this and.....ordered a bottle!

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Holy Sh**, I wasn't expecting to like this after the fail that was Tom Ford's Sahara Noir but I tried it anyway after reading on Fragrantica that this is a better version of it. It starts off as an oriental herb garden: spice, Amber and a nauseating projection that would initially throw a lot of people off. After an hour or so the vanilla kicks in and it becomes a sensual and rhythmic gospel choir that serenades you as myrrh and sandalwood join the chorus. Absolutely fabulous scent. Projection is amazing, can be smelled across a room, it has fantastic longevity on my stubborn skin (6+ hours). Overall: 8/10 as I find it slightly headache inducing. It is also somewhat similar to Diptyque's Eau Duelle!

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I agree with SNicole82. People see the word Sultan and affiliate this as a spicy amber but it's really not. It's a basic amber in the same mind frame of Ambre 114. It has the same powdery vibe and not a whole lot more to offer. Does it smell good? Of course! Is it a Top 5 amber? IMO no. I am not bashing it in anyway as amber is my favorite note as well but sample some more before buying.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is my perfect amber. I enjoy amber as a base note, but when it's used as the main ingredient, I find it can either become too medicinal or too syrupy and cloying. Ambre Sultan avoids all of those pitfalls and gives us instead a warming, subtle and dry amber.

The woods here stop that syrupy thing happening to the amber. They keep it dry and reined in. The notes list makes it appear as though there's a million different herbs, spices and resins going on - and I'm sure there are - but the end result is some beautiful blending that makes this seem much more simple than it must have been to compose. It smells like amber, woods and subtle spices. Beautifully done.

I have no idea why this is marketed towards women because it's completely unisex. Men, don't be shy about trying this one!

Beautiful.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I like amber,I really do like it,and I felt this one would be an absolute love for me,I imagined a sweet,warm sexy resinous amber,a bit powdery,a bit green,a bit spicy
but this one is only amber+spices for me,not that kind of warm,charming spices which make the scent tasty...spices are very edgy to my nose,very loud,very difficult to get along with,they ruin all the beauty of this warm amber for me,this is a scent I even can't imagine to use it as a female,and for my man,it may be imaginable but I would appreciate him not to use it,it makes me snizz crazily
Thanks god as hours pass the spicy edges become a little rounder and less iritating for my nose,thanks god I own just a 10 mil vial of this

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Don't understand the male female category especially when most better quality and nieche fragrance's are unisex.
This unisex juice as a real warm resin/amber aroma. I also pick up a smokey/woodsy (sandalwood) vib making it ABSOLUTELY STUPENDOUS for the fall winter months. After this juice settles patchouli and benzion brings everything together beautifully making it very luxurious perfect for evening wear.
Longevity and Silage is excellent lasting well past 8hrs...
I own several Sergei Lutens fragrance which I adore them. This juice has a complex warm aroma with a spicy/smokey blend. I'm going to stock up and buy another bottle, I wish they would make it in a 100ml bottle. 9.5/10 kudos Serge for these amazing fragrance's

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I thought I reviewed this, but I guess not, so here goes:

I'm an amber fanatic. Sweet ambers, dry ambers, resinous ambers, dark ambers, etc. I do it all. I prefer my ambers resinous and dry with a spice kick as it gives me a more earthy vibe, which fits my personality and style.

This was halfway there. It's dry: OK. It's resinous: OK. But, no spice came out. It wasn't really warm. It's a good fragrance don't get me wrong, but after 2 weeks of testing in many settings, I'll stick my Amber Paste.

Okay longevity, moderate sillage.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Sexy. Erotic. Elegant. Well-balanced. I would LOVE this on my lovely more than on me. I honestly can't add to anyone else's comments. Great sillage and very long lasting.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I have written about it previously. Two years later I return with a slightly more accurate design.

If there's one thing that makes me happy after facing a lot of problems that permeated my daily life, it is to write about fragrances, as a whole. Something transcendent happens inside me and I feel myself better through writing. I confess not be too cool to write this, and so I chose a fragrance which gives me besides joy, complete happiness when I use or feel, the elected is the Serge Lutens House, which from the beginning of the 90s presents the consumer market perfumístico with "arts" bottled known as niche perfumes, the fragrance in question is the eastern Ambre Sultan launched originally by the hands (nose) Christopher Sheldrake creator of much of the fragrances of the house and also some renowned fragrances Maison Chanel, like Coco Noir Extrait. Now, to me, Ambre Sultan opens dirty and high power. Logo appears sound huge doses of coriander, dried leaves of Patchouli and most other newly crushed green substance is chipping his departure, it should be borne wrist to endure it, but hatred is added to the right fragrance. His departure hours later reminded me of the "dry down" of oriental floral Madly Kenzo, perhaps for medicinal nuances (remedies) that both have at one point, that in my view. Your heart is amber, with amalgams of gross Mirra, those used at the foot of the Christmas tree in the festivities of the holiday season and that perfume the whole environment, also with resin touches that warm this phase and make Ambre Sultan an interesting scent in we instigates a onusta happiness. Finally, at the bottom, we can see sweetened aspects of Vanilla fused to benzoin in its natural form acquired from nature, still in latex form, something other than what we are used to feeling, since it refers to old thing, muffled and why not dusty? ! However, this sum, resulting in a combined evolution so exceptional that the need to have it is almost immediate, I can even doubt that it is void, and if it is for a minority. Ambre Sultan fixed and design absurdly good, all around feel and question the very unusual scent that hangs in the air when he in contact with the skin presents his most sublime way of being, ie, a fragrance that deservedly gets the rating it has in the world of niche fragrance as a "sui generis". Indeed, look for it, have a to call it yours.

Word of the Day: disappointed... (day 01)

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
The opening is warm but suddenly turns spicy. I asked my husband what he thought and he first said -- you smell like potpourri...and then he twisted his face away and said yuck. i don't like it.

But i LOVE it. I feel transported to a log cabin in the middle of vermont apres-ski sitting around a nice warm fire, the smell of cinnamon and slightly herbal notes in the air, roasting marshmallows over the fire.

It's warm, sexy and spicy with a smokey sweet undertone that's perfectly balanced.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: When I was little I used to open my father's violin box. This perfume smells of rosin, that little amber coloured piece used for brushing the bow of the violin. Whenever I spray this perfume I open again that violin box, I am again a little girl mesmerised by music and smells. And that scented memory is here again because of Ambre Sultan.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Great fragrance but the longevity and projection are very weak and soft . I think it has been reformed as some people before me are having the same issues. I'll be looking for a older version

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Nebelgeist, how right you are. Radical change from the 1st time I tryed SLAS 2 year ago. New version lacks vanilla stays closed on an (intersting) incense accord. Still fine, but far away from the original bomb.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: There is a certain poetry to Ambre Sultan that resonates like the sound of Buddhist brass bowls - very long and echoing. Serge Lutens' perfume is a study of perfect balance. It is laid out like a wheel, with wood, fruit, incense, greens, and spices in equal measure. It makes for a linear incense-like smoky and rich perfume experience as only Sheldrake/Lutens can make, and it succeeds on every level. Deep, profound, intensely wearable, delicious, cloak-like, velvety, sharp, a hint of sour green. A wonderful perfume.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I have been intrigued for a year, reading interesting reviews here, and thinking for sure it's something I would like, but may not be to versatile or dear, I already have some rich balsamic fragrances. From the reviews, notes, and Oriental theme, I was thinking, it's going to be heavy and dark, resinous, or realy sweet and I don't like sweet...
I heard alot of Lutens frags are very sweet. I have Fille en Aiguilles, and it is much sweeter than this one.

So I was a bit surprised. First impressions; it is predominantly Herbal and medicinal smelling, very niche and strange in a good way. It is like nothing else in my colection. I am very glad to have it. After a sample vile, my bottle is on it's way...

The reviews seem polarized and all over the place, understandably so. This is a true niche fragrance. I started thinking of niche as super expensive, quality, private blends etc. But isn't the true meaning of niche, being very unusual, not mainstream, where few are they who like them. Like Caron's "Yatogan" unusual, polarizing, difficult to recognize or understand. This is how I understand niche and Ambre Sultan.
It reminds me of " Rien" Etat Libre, a very strange niche fragrance. This one has that medicinal strangness, but is more grounded earthy, so I prefer Ambre Sultan. Performance; longevity is very good, I just purchased mine from fragrancenet, projection is average to obove avg. This is more versatile than TF Amber Absolute, because of the fresh herbs and spices. TF Amber Absolute has a masculine vib, whereas Ambre Sultan is totally a shared fragrance, like herbal tea, it's gender neutral.

It's not dark or heavy as I imagined it might be. It's not to sweet or sexy.
The spices and oregano do not make it smell like kitchen spices, but maybe exotic herbs, as in a Turkish market, yes.

I thought there would be no freshness to the fragrance looking at the note pyramid, but it does have some fresh spices, not quite citrus, but sour herbal fresh.
Because of the freshness, many say this works in the Summer heat as well, if you go light on the trigger.
From the Fragrantica note pyramid all the balsamic resins are on top, and herbs below, less dominant. I think the pyramid is upside down, the herbs should be on top, although it does have beutifull, rich, vanelic balsams and woods.

This frag realy evolves beautifully, after the herbal/ spicy top notes burn off a bit, 20 minutes in, the rich Amber shines, and the fully rounded heart accord takes shape. I love every stage of this fragrance. It may be an acquired taste, try befor buying if you can, otherwise go for a blind buy, this one is special and I think worth a risk...
Into my top 5 it goes !

At Kafkaesqueblog.com Zoli Zol writes a great description of Labdanum and beswax in Ambre Sultan. "Nutty , chocolatey, resinous, leathery, cognac, rum, boozy, honey, toffy, animalistic, darkly syrupy", I confirm those are all good adjectives that describe, Ambre Sultan, as well as herbal, medicinal, in the opening which I love also.

Update: After not having worn Ambre Sultan for a week, I'm so impressed, it's my #1 fragrance now. It is nicer than Amber Absolute, which is great I have a 50 ml, but Ambre Sultan has that same beautiful Amber, and so much more goodness...

Rating: 10/10

John 3:16. Merry Christmas

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
My nose and tastes must have undergone a big change over the last years, because I had sampled Ambre Sultan several times in the past, and always been disappointed -- repulsed, even.

I revisited this fragrance last month. What happened to me? I now find it beautiful and well-constructed. The dry herbs are the heroes here : they keep the resins in check and prevent the scent from veering towards the cloying "sweet amber" effect which many big ambers have. I find it pleasant and smooth (if a bit linear, but most Lutens' are like that and that's ok).

I wonder how many other fragrances I've disrespected and should now go apologize to...

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I love this scent, very sexy and warm. Powerful at first but softens on the dry down. I love the way perfumes can evoke memories or even fantasies, it's fun to wear them to magnify an element of your persona. This is my mysterious seductress scent, just back from the orient in the 19th century or the scent of the vampire perhaps. To be honest most scents I love evoke this. This scent is both erotic and romantic, and perfect for the winter boudoir.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
What a warm and cozy scent. I'm delighted.

This is an office-friendly scent for me, as opposed to some amber colognes that can be way too much for an office setting.

This scent wraps me up like a blanket, and I also notice a suede-like scent to it. Like being wrapped in a suede blanket, if there's such a thing.

There really isn't much I can say here, I feel like this fragrance is worth more than the explanation I'm giving, but words to explain it kind of escape me. What I'm loving about Serge Lutens fragrances so far, is that they're simple in appearance, and complex but not challenging to the nose.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
warm, strong, spicy and incense-y.
benzoin and amber, myrhh and coriander.
these are the top 4 notes I can detect.
the benzoin takes a semi cloying note after a while (almost play-doh like...)
this is long lasting and similar to TF Amber Absolute - however, TF Amber doesn't ever reach a cloying phase with me.
great for a fraction of the price of TF AA, but would not purchase again.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This wasn't love from the first sniff. However, this autumn I wanted to have something vintage, woody, preferably not sweet and exceptional. I just decided to go and purchase this one and hope that we could become friends. We became best friends, indeed. The autumn leaves and atmosphere around me goes so well with this perfume.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: The smell of late October afternoon sunlight filtered through fiery orange leaves, of dry and fragile fiery orange leaves dancing in the wind, fires in the distance, scorching sun on skin just before the bite of frost, haze of distant scorching summer sun, in lands of eternal summer

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Nice and soft, comforting balsamic smell.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
It's a secret...elegant, sensual, very sophisticated scient. Something
like the sky in the night, sideral,
Unique and beautiful on my skin and very long lasting on clothes..i love it

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: The satisfies every amber and incense need. Layers and layers of desert incense burned over decades unfurl, true to the incense and not to the ash. As its essence diffuses, a true, real, delectable amber essence is unveiled in the presence of the wearer. The incense stays prominent longer on bare skin, and the amber prevails handsomely from beneath garments. The incense makes this the type of amber men can wear with confidence. It's rigorously masculine. It's Valentino in The Sheik.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I had such high hopes for this after looking at the notes and reading the reviews. Unfortunately I do not like this at all. This just smelled like a jumbled muddied mess. This is weirdly the epitome of the dark side of what a well-blended perfume can be--a cloying sickly-sweet soup.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I've held off on trying Serge Lutens because I knew I would fall in love with this line. Ambre Sultan is actually the second SL that I've tried, after Sa Majeste la Rose, and it's just amazing. It's powerful, confident, fierce. AS has got tons of myrrh and amber laced with oregano, coriander and bay leaf. Super spicy delectable. Love love!

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Ambre Sultan layered with Muscs Koublai Khan is the most amazing scent. MKK mellows the oriental aspects of Ambre Sultan and adds a outdoorsy, smoky vibe to the whole mix. Alone, MKK is just too...BO, but combined with Ambre Sultan, it's absolutely perfect. And they can be layered pancake style, rather than side-by-side. Christopher Sheldrake is a genius.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Reformulation warning. I repurchased a bottle, recently, and it was like when a bottle of soda goes flat. It had all of the superficial characteristics of Ambre Sultan, but without any fizz or depth. The herbal facets in the opening are barely there, the drydown is mostly a generic, synthetic, sweet amber. The new bottle also had a significantly weaker formula, inside, in terms of sillage and longevity. It might just be an age issue (I ordered from a site at significant discount rather than from SL site) because I have no way of knowing how long this sat in a warehouse. But after reading some recent reviews, I wonder if some people are only sampling this inferior product because my original bottle was extraordinary.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: My first impression is it very resinous and I am picking up a lot of amber, like one would expect. This smells just like TF Amber Absolute, so it is a great cheaper alternative. Although it is for women I would definitely wear this.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: it is just beautiful

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: First of all this is a shared perfume. This is one of those that I bought right when it first came out because I had gotten ahold of a bottle of ambergris tincture from 1968 from the estate of a perfumer and fell totally in love with that smell and knew I could never replace it so I began trying every amber or ambergris perfume I could get my hands on each time impatiently waiting for the base notes with my fingers crossed just hoping for that smell I had grown (and still very much am) obsessed with. Well, since this perfume does not seem to contain any ambergris at all, I was obviously not all that happy with it but I did like the smell and wore it daily for several weeks. Then suddenly the fragrance started to bother me. It is definitely a rich, spicy aromatic blend of resins and is one of the best representations of what is meant by an "amber note." So if you are looking for a somewhat spicy, but not in a harsh way, pure amber perfume that is rich, warm and long lasting, then this would be a great one to start with. Of course because Serge Lutens perfumes are not cheap, and they are very unique I find that it's easy to love or hate each one, so I always get a sample or better yet a 5ml decant to wear it a couple days first. Then I also know if I want to buy the 50ml spray bottle or the 75ml bell jar. My ambergris obsession lives on and to this day I wear pure natural ambergris tincture on my left arm almost every day, but only once in a great while my precious 1968.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: It is UNISEX.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
SIMPLY A BLESSING FOR THE NOSE AND FOR THE SOUL!!!

For me is the olfactive transposition of a protective and warm coat in the coldest winter; the fabric is a soft cashmere, hot, not soft like a velvet, but only slightly coarse (bay leaf, coriander and oregano); then the balsamic development, with the softness and cozyness of the vanilla and benzoin.
It's like a meditation scent (i would sniff my wrist for hours), and a protecting shield from the unpleasentness outside....

AN ABSOLUTE MASTERPIECE! !!

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I'm extremely thankful to our dear co-member nexangelus for gifting me a bunch of samples to try out, just because of my recent interest in Serge Lutens fragrances :)
This is the first sample I tried out of the bunch and I already feel like giving my first impression!
I notice that my tastes are changing and I'm getting more interested in niche as they tend to offer something completely different from the mainstream brands.
Ambre Sultan opens with a spice overload on my skin with dominant aromatic bay leaf and myrrh, which can come off as pungent. More spicy than ambery. It stays like this for about two hours after which it finally changes for the better. The spices tone down, amber and resins come more to the surface and by now it's way more wearable for me. Another hour in and I get whiffs of what reminds me of cacao??? It's not listed and probably not even part of the composition, yet that is what I smell. It balances and rounds out the scent and makes me wish it would smell like this from the very opening. I'm not a big fan of very spicy scents, that's why. I would like Ambre Sultan to be more about the amber right off the bet, less spicy, less sharp, more balmy and more sweet like the dry down.
Maybe I just need to give my 'to spices untrained nose' a little more time to get used to the spicy stuff, in order to like it better in time...
The dry down of AS is wonderful, but I don't think I would really enjoy spending over 2 hours wearing this before I get there... yet, maybe some day... :)

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I've been on an amber kick lately. I have gotten and fallen in love with AG Amber Fetich; Amber 411, Ambre Russe among others. I blind bought the beloved SL Amber Sultan and it did not meet my expectations AT ALL. On my skin it was very dusty, herbal, vegetal and bitter. It is only vaguely balsamic. I assume the coriander, bay leaf and oregano overpowered everything else. Very disappointing.

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I finally got this and wow, it smells just as I'd hoped! I'm new to Serge Lutens and this was actually a blind buy, but after looking at the notes, I just knew it would be a winner, so I didn't hesitate on ordering it.

I couldn't help but spray a little bit on me when I opened it. It's a little strong at first, but I don't think it's overwhelming. Very lovely, resinous, and thick. I kinda reminds me of Ormonde Jayne's Tolu in a way. Both are very resinous and warm, so fans of it might like Ambre Sultan as well. IMO, this is not a summer scent at all; it's best for late fall and winter, but, a person could wear it on summer nights, maybe by a bonfire. It's a little smoky and incensy on me at first. As it settles, it gets more "golden", more ambery. The dry down is a little dark on me; yeah, it has a Goth vibe about it, at least on my skin. This is based on first impression, so I'll update on longevity and sillage when I can give it a proper wearing. Oh, and I know it's for women, but men, you can easily wear this one too. So far, I'm curious to try more Serge Lutens!

name: Ambre Sultan Serge Lutens (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is a beautiful incensey fragrance on my skin. Longevity is not great, only about 4 hours and it smells almost identical to April Aromatics' Calling All Angels. Considerably cheaper than CAA though so I know which bottle I will be purchasing in future.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This smells like Glade Cashmere Woods air spray and with an overdose of a cross between stale, flat Fanta Grape soda and Grape Children’s Motrin. Hard pass.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
One of the most amazing scents but... lasts under 30 minutes
no loegnvity in the new version
nice for the 20~30 minutes or so it lasts
Go with Carved Oud from Thameen instead

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
tom ford fan 🙋🏾♂️
finally got my first private blend today and what a way to start my journey for the private blend.
blind buy just like all my TF collection and love at first sniff. and straight in to my all time favourite of course.

couldn't say about sillage and longevity, only got to test it on my hand but what a smell! I get a woody earthy ( wet earthy) smell. I can not stop sniffing my hand right now.

10/10

edit: Im getting hints of encre noire.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I’ve found for me personally that a lot of the Tom Ford fragrances are a hit or miss. I actually gave up on trying to find one I could actually love. I mean this is a designer fragrance, gah! The prices for them make it difficult to justify finding one that I can I love. So I gave up.
Then I found this one & I absolutely love it. I can actually agree with all the positive reviews on this one so there’s nothing more to add. If you like woody & oud.. This is at least a must try. It’s certainly masculine but FBW IMHO.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I can't put my finger on what exact product this reminds me of, but I'm getting "air freshener" scent made into a body scent, if that makes sense. Smells like something Febreeze or Glade would put out. It does smell good, clean (but not aquatic), and leans more masculine as opposed to unisex. An interesting choice for body fragrance.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tom Ford is a ghostly, glacial coniferous rosewood sandalwood melange of chilly, bitter, peppery woods. It is a tiny, sinister statue of a scent in an empty room where the temperature drops suddenly, with no explanation. The perfumed version of a little gremlin that appears in a haunting tale; one that skitters in the corners of your vision when the eye is focused elsewhere and inches eerily to your pillow when you're at the knife's edge of wakefulness and dream.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: at first this smells like very fresh woods with cardamom, then it softens and i get more vanilla. after about half an hour it's a woody vanilla with cardamom and vetiver. i find this to be super comforting. it leans traditionally masculine but anyone can wear it.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Blind bought this for my boyfriend, who loves Tom Ford. Oddly enough, he had not tested this, even though it is a bestseller. And with good reason! I can not stop admiring the smell of this perfume, it is the perfect blend of spices, freshness and sweetness.

I'll probably use up half of his bottle myself. 10/10!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: It's nice. It's the first TF I've liked so far.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I just tried my Oud Wood 10ml decant.
I see it in a fresh new way, a better way...

Early in ny collecting, I tried the old Oud Wood, and was very impressed initially.
Then it fell out of favor for me , and I sold my bottle.
I though it smelled unnatural, a concofany of synthetics and some natural notes.

I purchased a small spray decant to try it from time to time. Now I think I may purchase a bottle again...

It reminded me of YSL M-7. A semi sweet Oud and vanilla, a more mass apealing Oud, yet an Oud dominant fragrance.

What sets Oud Wood apart from M-7 is a strong Cardomom and peppery presence as piquant note.

So it smells more natural to me now as an Oud and Cardomom fragrance. I've come to like Cardomom spice as in Diptyque Eau Duelle, but it's stronger here.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: A slight none offensive oud, creamy wood, that after being applied will ensure that you will get complemented. This is a very versatile & alluring fragrance that is a big winner for me. I absolutely love it & so does my wife. It does not last as long as many of my other fragrances, but the quality & scent is compensated by the fact that is smells so good.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is one of my faves in my collection. I bought this a day after i smelt it at holt renfrew, it was that good. To my nose its woody, slighlty creamy and sweet from the sandalwood, amber and vanilla. Very versatile and can be worn year round. Projection isnt crazy and longevity aint beast mode but the scent makes it well worth it.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I can see how this could be unisex, the absolute divine woodiness is immaculate. I wanted to bury my face in my arm after smelling this. At first spray I thought, this is something I could wear as a very feminine woman who loves wood notes but as the dry down continued I distinctly smelled MAN. A man who cares about where he’s going, knows what he wants and carries himself with impeccable stride. This is a man who uses beard oil, wears tailored slacks casually, cleans his hiking boots. This is a beautiful man. That’s all.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
TF oud wood scent is super seductive and mysterious. It does not have good projection because it was not created to project like a beast. It is a perfume that says 'I am here' instead of 'Look at me guys'.

Scent: 10/10
Longevity: 9/10 (last for days on clothes)
Performance: 8/10. (depends on how you define performance. To me, it means making people remember your scent as a unique and classy scent)

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This scent itself is beautiful,but poor sillage...
I love the smell,but being an eau de parfum at such a high price rate the sillage should be better and that's the reason I'm not going to buy it.When spending such amount on a scent I want to enjoy it during the day,and it's too subtle to really enjoy it.If the sillage was better then buying this is a no brainer.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I just want to thank Richard Herpin for being alive and making this masterpiece.


That is all.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Its so deep.. dark..smooth.. sexy? I have no idea but I really love this scent. Smells like an Audi.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I'm compelled to testify on behalf of this Tom Ford work of art: it's simply intoxicating. Prior to being sprayed with Oud Wood at the Tom Ford counter of my local Bloomingdales, I had no idea what to expect aside from the rep telling me it is by far their best seller. Immediately upon smelling my wrist, it didn't trigger any kind of excitement or "wow" factor, but instead made me wonder what in the actual hell she just sprayed on me. As I continued through the mall, my nose kept leading me back to my wrist; over and over again, back to my wrist. I was hooked, fascinated and didn't want it to end. Its allure is still one that I find very hard to explain, only that it feels as if it always existed somewhere, perhaps remote or hidden, just waiting to be inhaled and revered. As I've heard mentioned before, it's as much an aura or vibe as it is a scent. Now owning this, I can't imagine being without it. If ever there is a day when I cannot access this fragrance, it will be a sad day indeed. IMO, a masterpiece.

Yes, the projection and longevity issues are real, but if you truly love the scent as I do, you buy it, reapply it as necessary and take it for what it is because there is simply nothing that smells quite like Oud Wood.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Oud Wood is incredibly easy to wear. I mean it almost doesn't smell like a fragrance, it just smells good. Soft, musky, woody. Not a lot of oud, but the idea of it is there. For me, it's perfect, but if you're looking for a real, heavy oud, this is not it.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
YESSS. It's a high quality oud perfume.

It's dark, mature, calming, sophisticated... I associate this scent with a sharp, charismatic, competent businessman in a expensive suit.

TF's Oud Wood is the BOSS of all oud.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I’m not sure if there is hardly any real oud in this. Or if there is, it must be a very low grade extraction from cultivated agarwood which even that scenario is a bit hard to believe in this case. Definitely can be a synthetic oud oil and a fantastic marketing strategy to make people believe that they are wearing “oud”.
After all we are living in “Iso E super in a bottle as an olfactory treat” era. So no surprise here.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is what I think of when you hear the words "signature scent"

I also think of Gucci by Gucci ph (not the square bottles), for some reason I find them extremely similar in when to usethem, not necessarily in scent.

Smells great, doesn't last so long, not sure if it's worth a bottle but it smells addictive

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I like it. Not the best fragrance I have, nor is it one that I reach for often. However, when I do, I am always happy that I did. I am not the biggest oud fan, but this one seems to work fine. It is not in your face, and despite the opening being pretty loud, it settles into something really nice. People generally seem to like it. Would I repurchase when my bottle runs out? Probably not. There are just too many other amazing fragrances out there.

7.7/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tom Ford's Oud Wood is the pinnacle of male perfumery for me and should be the holy grail of gentlemens fragrance. I discovered it through reviews on here and from buying a 15ml sample. It truly is beautiful but (and it is a huge BUT), on me it has the worst performance of any fragrance I own (and I own many). Even if I douse myself in it and also use the Oud Wood deoderant in liberal amounts, it becomes a skin scent in 30 minutes. Fragrance usually always lasts on me throughout the day but this is sadly, a joke when it comes to any longevity or sillage. For a masterpiece costing this much, this should deliver far, far better performance and this simply isn't good enough and constitutes a terrible waste of money!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I left a slightly disparaging review of this on here last week.. looks like it has been deleted due to too many people giving my comment the thumbs down..

And I’m here to say that this is a good thing!.., because, over the past week since, I have been testing it and found that my initial thoughts were incorrect... how incorrect?.. well lets just say I now own a 100ml bottle of it.

The first time I tried it for some unknown reason I got this “womans makeup bag” scent in the background from it.. but, everyday I have applied it since, I haven’t had the same makeup bag experience.. Maybe it reacted with something else on my skin on that first occassion which gave off a different scent?.

Anyway... i now love this stuff.

One thing I will add.. 3 sprays (1 on back of neck, 1 on the inside of each elbow) and it lasts 10 hours on me.. pretty happy about that given the comments from others saying they struggle to get 4-5hrs..

Also.. Tried TF Oud Wood Intense today.. totally different scent, they shouldnt have really called it Oud Wood intense they shouldve given it a different name altogether.. but i dont mind it either to be honest.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is a stunning, and a timeless masterpiece. If I am not mistaken, this is also their best seller. I can see why, it is the most mass appealing niche designer. It is sweet, incencsy, woody, and very slightly oudy. It can be layered like most Tom Ford's so for the person that feels this is less than perfect, spray this first then over top a "counter" fragrance and you will see blending magic. It is not the best performer like most Tom Fords but is luxurious like most Tom Fords. All in, the avg rating is accurate.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This was a blind buy for me, and I sort of got what I ordered. The scent is buttery smooth, extremely well blended and very enjoyable, at least in the cold Finnish winter weather. I can discern about all of the listed ingredients, but... For an EdP formulation, the longevity is very poor on my skin, 4-5 hrs at most. On a shirt, longevity is good, but there is no depth.

This is an original and very pleasant scent, but way overpriced for the performance, in my opinion.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I get a windex’y toothpaste opening here. Not a great start...goes on the skin very oily. Immediately sits too closely to the skin and doesn’t project very well. Ironically I can’t smell much oud here at all. Still smells of good quality but the composition is strange. Glad I only got 2ml.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I dislike the opening of this but it dries down nicely. Definitely a unique fragrance, very woody but I get a strong cardamom note as well. I like oud and this has more lighter oud notes. Leans more masculine but not completely, I wouldn't feel out of place wearing this myself. Longevity is a few hours on me and projection is pretty strong. I'm not going to run out and buy a full bottle for myself but it's a fragrance I can appreciate and would find pleasant on others.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tom Ford's collection is very much hit and miss. It contains some absolute beauties such as Fabulous and Jasmin Rougue but this was disappointing. I'm very picky when it comes to oud perfumes because most are knock offs and use cheap ingredients. This is no exception.

The overall scent is strong and powerful but it lacks the oud intensity in longevity. For £120+ I expected much more than just a simple fragrance which has a nice opening but no more. The opening wears off within 30 mins so it's a poor performer. Didn't really turn heads either.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Opens with a sharp synthetic rubber, plastic aroma. As it cures on my skin I get little glimpses of paper and cedar and some pepper. Final base notes are rock and stone and some gunnite feathing though.

This is why our hobby is so addictive and wonderful. There is such a wide variety of opinion and recall from our past memories. Amazing fragrance. 5 stars.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I haven't smelled this in a couple years but my friend offered me a decant so I wore it tonight.
Wow. Just wow. The best synthetic oud full stop.
This smells sophisticated and classy.

Perfect for a black tie event.
It smells better now than an old formula I smelled and this is a brand new batch.
I need a giant bottle of this immediately.

10/10 Stunning
Performance 6/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I love scents like these that make me feel absolutely crazy for not getting it. Oud Wood is a prime example. Here's what I smell.

Opening: It smells like opening a new bottle of a stinky vitamin. There's no other scent on earth that smells like a pungent bottle of stinky vitamins you're going to loathe taking every morning.

MId: Vitamin still coming through strong, but now it's shifted into a weird rubber scent. Like a tire.

Full dry down: Kind of like opening a new action figure from the 80's. A pulsing plastic, pvc, or rubber smell. Like a sickly sweetness and dampness too.

Crazy right? That's all I smell. No oud. No wood. And this is why I love this hobby. We all bring something different to our experience with the fragrance.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
i normally like oud fragrances but this just isnt doing it for me :(
performance is ok, not amazing
overall i can understand why this is liked not not for me personally im afraid.
6/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Most of the ouds I own beat you up and take your money. Oud Wood kind of just nudges your shoulder as it strolls past. A moderate performer but overall, I think that works in it's favour. Don't get me wrong, I love a beastmode fragrance, but sometimes there's a sophistication and allure in subtlety. I get vibes of ADP Colonia Intensa, without the fresh burst of citrus in the opening of course.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: this a very nice smooth fragrance , although i smell less of the oud .... has a good Longevity about12 hours + projection of over a meter

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Nice woody romantic scent. Sweet tonka good balance with vetiver and nice spice from srichuan pepper then smoothy woody oud in background. Good versatile. Nearly perfect for my taste but the only bad part of this perfume is longevity. Only 4-5 hours on my skin.

Scent : 5/5
Longevity : 2.5/5
Sillage : 2.5/5

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This smells extremely Oud, and extremely wood. No shit, I guess? It’s intoxicatingly good, I applied a 2ml sample and was smelling under my shirt and at my wrists for the next 3 hours. It’s a very masculine scent, and after trying a sample I plan to get an entire 250ML bottle. If liquid gold smelt like something, this is it.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Had my first 50ml Bottle of this from 2015 and had to buy another 50ml bottle next year before I decided to get the 250ml bottle in 2017.

Doesn't smell like any other Oud out there, but I think thats the reason I still wear it on daily basis as signature scent. Because it really smells different, like I never smell any other parfum out there yet similar to this one.

Longetivity moderate, around 3-4 hours strong projectivity before it fades. Stays in fabric much much longer than my skin. But from my experience the 2015 batch that I had do stays longer on my skin compared to the latest one I brought.

From what I know, this batch with grey bottle, and silver text is a reformulation from the original 2007 batch which had a brown bottle and gold colored text. I wonder how these original batch from 2007 smells like because people said it smells kinda different.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This was one of the first Tom Ford Private Blend's I ever sampled but wasn't the first I bought and in fact, was a gift. I do like this, it's unique, definitely very Unisex and to me, kind of an anytime fragrance. Seems most people like this in cooler weather, I typically reach for this in the Spring.

I wear this in combination with a roll-on "Wood Fragrance Enhancer" from JYCTY, which is an independent fragrance maker here in Toronto Canada. With the enhancer, it improves the smell just slightly and I get a decent 2 hours of projection before it just sits on the skin.

Without the enhancer, I'm lucky to smell it for 30 mins. Even Jo Malone colognes perform longer than this supposed EDP.

The scent is nice but it's hard to justify the price with that performance.

You won't get compliments with this and the couple times I've smelled it on people, it was so obviously Oud Wood that I feel it's more like that expression "sometimes you wear the fragrance, sometimes the fragrance wears you". I think that says it all about this one, at least on me and the few I've smelled it on.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Oud Wood is one of my 5 favorite fragrances in terms of smell alone - classy, sexy, and easy to wear. However, it is completely gone from my skin in 4 hours. I get better performance from the original Colonia...which should be embarrassing for tom ford as ADP is a fresh and citrusy Eau de Cologne. Both my nose and those of others cannot pick up any trace of this on my skin past the 4 hour mark. I do get better longevity on clothing, but projection is so soft that no one can really notice it anyway. Darn shame that a darker fragrance that smells so good performs so poorly in both projection and longevity. Not worth a repeat the purchase because of that. Given the notes that it has, and the hefty price tag, it should really last longer. I will not be buying it again unless it is amped up a bit.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This smells SO good. Really smooth and inoffensive.
I purchased a 2019 batch code bottle but pity that it does not last at all (1-1.5hrs before sitting closer to skin).
Recently bought 4 TF Private Blends and the other ones held up for at least 6-8hrs before becoming a skin scent and im quite disappointed that this was not one of them, as i personally rated it one of the top among the 4.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is really good. I had a hard time choosing between this and Tobacco Vanille, but ended up going with TV. Signature scent potential. Really good longevity on my skin. Unique, saving up to get this next!

Rating: 9/10
Compliments: 6.5/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Hands down my all-time favorite oud fragrance, very woody and robust without being too "out there". Completely different oud profile to something like Amouage Interlude, which is much fresher.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I received a free ~1 mL decanted sample as part of a larger order from a private seller on Ebay.

The opening reminds me of a fancy cinnamon whisky or red hots, almost like an educated cousin of fireball. It dried down to a massive cardamom bomb with some sweetness behind--maybe it’s the tonka? You could call this unisex, but it leans slightly more masculine than truly androgynous. I’m not getting any oud, and not really a lot of wood either. It has
3-4 hour longevity on me, which is better than many fragrances for my skin.

Overall, I’m not impressed given TF’s supposed reputation and definitely not worth the massive price tag.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is expensive, but there is just something that makes want to buy this.

I tried it a few days ago, I was amazed!

I still don't know is it worth the money, but the impression it left is outstanding!

Also heard stories that the new formula is bad, so quite unsure about this one in the end.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I don't remember TF oud wood used to smell like this?
I can barely smell any oud in the dry down, however, the sweetness from vanilla and tonka is good.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I have a 30ml decant from a 2015 batch, really nice stuff.

I get quite a medicinal smell in the top, but it is evened out so well by the cardamom, vanilla, and amber in the base. This is mature, but modern and smooth.

Performance seems fine on me, projects about an arms length and lasts about 8 hours on my skin.

I am not sure of previous formulations or newer 2020 batches, but this smells really great on my skin. Another wonderful offering from Tom Ford that I can see becoming a love!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
A nice, soft & subtle woody fragrance.
Very inoffensive and perfect for the fall time.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I own second bottle of this, but they dont last long for me, I can feel it only for 2-3hours. And what I like the most about these fragrance are first sprays, I like that sweetness and deepness, it is so good! But after maybe 1 hour it becomes quite gentle, I want that forst notes to last longer! Scent for me is 9.5/10
What other fragrance could be very similar to this?

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I was gifted the EDP with the body spray and deodorant stick. You'd think with that combination Oud Wood heaven would be assured - but not quite. I get around 3-4 hours of reasonably airy projection which sinks down to a skin scent lasting up to around 9 hours after application, but the deodorant and body spray don't add much to the mix.

The thing is though - this actually sounds an awful lot better than it feels in practice. For one thing, Oud Wood wears quite light - nothing like an EDP and feels more like a 'all weather cologne' (a bit like Endymion but actually not even performing as well as that and in many respects needing a bit of heat to lift the fragrance off the skin now); secondly, I remember the yellow label version and this truly felt like an EDP - never crazy heavy like TV or TL but definitely more dense and better projecting than now. It is nothing like that now - not even having the durability that it had or one would expect at this price.

Lastly, OW is actually one of the most acclaimed fragrances of all time on various forums and sites - and no doubt it is beautiful and will be found under many Christmas trees again this year. But I firmly believe this has become a fairly significant con-job in its current iteration. Seriously, the mark-up on perfumes is already enormous - so on Oud Wood it must be nothing less than price-gouging with the changes that have occurred. If Fragrantica really was able to affect some change for perfume consumers it should direct the attention of Estee Lauder to what long-term consumers are thinking about this fragrance.

Glad it was a gift - at least in its current state....And hope it returns to what it once was too. (BTW, don't kid yourself that you are getting anything like this with Versace Oud Noir - the Versace is good but not that good.)

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I thank my lucky stars that I found this fragrance. If I had to make a perfect sent it would be this.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: To me its Barbasol, wood, and Histoires de Parfums 1725. The cardamom comes off strong on me, and I also detect a slight lavender note. Unisex, maybe leaning a bit more masculine; soapy and spicy

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I didn't expect this to smell so good! I was already so hooked to Tom Ford's F-king Fabulous and this - Oud Wood, smells as great! Very pleasant and nice fragrance upon first sniff.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: A calm fragrance .. that reaches the hearts without a date, it is lighter than M7 and more intimate and quality. When you wear this perfume .. smells of rosewood and cardamom, mixed with Chinese pepper, are very fierce, to surround you directly with a wonderful warmth that you feel directly. The heart of the fragrance is a smoky mixture of rare oud wood, sandalwood, vetiver, and tonka bean in addition to vanilla and amber. The initial emission moment of this fragrance is very exciting and intense with the scent of incense, with the timidity of the emergence of the rosewood scent, which seizes periods after periods to appear strongly accompanied by cardamom. The intensity of the fragrance does not remain long "despite this conflict because the amazing thing about it is that it is surrounded by the scent of sandalwood lurking behind the vetiver and which is very siege, which is easy for them to colonize hearts before the smells easily because of their ability to control in the darkest of circumstances .. And despite all this remains light plankton of incense in The atmosphere is an oaky nature, woody essence and earthy emission that evokes a pleasant intimacy in the soul that everyone who inhales a whiff of this striking aroma becomes familiar with it. Amber and vanilla will love this fragrance, when you put it on your wrist it lasts from eight hours to twelve hours depending on the air temperature and the type of skin as you know, then the smell gradually fades away, but a little remains before your wrist reverently as a sign of the strength and stability of this perfume. This perfume is as if you are in front of a man who has torsion and blackness and is staring at you with a piercing eye, and you can only admire such a character.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is a masterpiece. Superb in every sense. I read another users review stating this was the fragrance that catapulted their interest in the hobby. I think I can honestly say that this fragrance opened my mind to the possibilities outside of designer frags and how far a house can take a creation and capture our imaginations. Im blown away by this juice with every spray. Its a 10/10 for me and always will be.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Good scent, beautiful smell. The logevity it's ok around 6-7h and the sillage is not wow, but good. I would recommend this fragrance to someone who would like to get into oud fragrances.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This was the fragrance which switched my interest in scents to a passion.
A couple years ago I had the incredible opportunity to live on Via Cola di Rienzo in Rome, a bustling upscale shopping street 5 minutes walk from the Vatican. Each evening I would stop by a particularly well-stocked profumeria and select a fragrance to sample for the day.
It was a crisp fall day, and I remember standing on a bus some time after spraying Oud Wood on my wrist, thinking somebody smelled amazing. I kept getting whiffs of something woody and mysterious, light and playful. A few stops later the smell was still there and I realized it was me. Though I usually try not to smell myself too much, I could not help but sneak furtive sniffs the rest of the night.
Being young and without means, the next day I went to a different perfume shop to sample Oud Wood again without feeling pressure to purchase. Again I was struck by the beauty of it.
Since then time has passed, and I am no longer in Rome. Feeling sentimental, I ordered a sample and waited in anticipation for that smell I loved so much. Sadly, when I sprayed the sample, it simply was not the same. At first I wondered if it was just my sentimentality getting in the way, but the more I have sprayed it the past few weeks, the more I am convinced the magic is lost.
The scent now is similar, but it feels more transparent. I think the beauty of it came in the richness it once had - too opaque to smell all the way through - and therefore mysterious. Now, it is sheer, and while nice, rather ordinary. Whereas I once smelled sweet woods (not oud, but definitely wood), I now get something more akin to dark cherry cola.
Alas.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I didn’t like the opening but like it a lot once it dries down to the heart. It’s classy, bold but easy to wear and versatile woody with oud scent. I don’t know if there’s real oud but I can definitely smell the oud note.

But very disappointed by its performance. It stays very close to the skin and only last 4-6 hours then scent is all gone. I don’t know if it’s because of my skin chemistry since I have medium skin tone and a little dry. I cannot justify its cost since it’s at a niche price. Scent is nice tho.

Update: I finally got some Oud fragrances from ATH and I’m sure this Oud Wood doesn’t contain real oud. Trust me. I compared the ouds of ATH side by side with it.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I wasn't impressed and I think it is way overpriced. It is very good but it is straight cardamon to my nose, probably the most straightforward cardamon fragrance I have ever tried and I know cardamon very well since I have used it to cook many times. Performance is lacking.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Upon first sniff, I didn't feel overly moved by this scent. Then throughout the day the complexity opened up. This reminds me distinctly of walking in the woods in Missouri with the vegetation and trees wet from rain. There is a synthetic note that reminds me of rubber that I can catch from time to time which brings down the enjoyment for me, but because its fleeting it doesn't entirely negate the experience.
Unfortunately the longevity is pretty poor on my skin. The sillage is decent but closer to the intimate side of things. It's overall lovely but I can't see myself buying a full bottle due to its performance and price. Maybe I'll try the intense version.
7/10.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Forget about oud, there is none in there. This is a rosewood centric fragrance supported by sandalwood, cardamom and the right amount of tonka and a tiny bit of amber. The use of that little bit of amber is done masterfully as if they used more of it, the dry down would become a too sweet and powdery affair as they have alredady included a couple of other rather sweet notes. A very viril, woodsy and yet gentle and masculin fragrance perfectly suited for the fall.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The smell is fantastic. It is a soft oud/rosewood/sandalwood fragrance with good development of the sweet notes of amber and tonka beans. HOWEVER, the performance is terrible. It lasts a few hours maybe but the sillage becomes so negligible it is basically a skin scent in 1hr. So sad such an amazing smelling fragrance has no performance.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
"Oud Wood, is oww good!" :P

(review in construction during my exp. with it)

-Definitely has REAL white/szechuan pepper in it, and it has that scent about that smells more foodie than one would want to like to wear, it also is over-powering and takes away the beauty of the Oud note. There is also a stinky funky sour note to it and it's not pleasant! I don't know if that's real oud or synthetic, i can't see them spending the money on using real oud, the thought of this disappoints me and makes me not want to support investing money into the frag. I can't see a women liking this note on a man as it makes him smell dirty gross. I need to get my hands on real oud to know what it really smells like.

------

2nd spray, will expand the review with more exp to give it an authentic review to give the frag justice.

STRONG opening, packs a punch! No alcohol on opening, goes straight to a funky-sour note, id assume that's oud or synthetic oud. Followed by a strong new-car leather note that i recognize from Ford's 'Tuscan Leather' frag.
Then as it starts to dry down to the mid notes something really sweet-sour rises that isn't pleasant, yet intriguing - then after a few mins that note fades away.

Mid notes start to develop where you get hints of vanilla, cardamon, rosewood and amber. It's now smoothing out and is quiet beautiful actually. A hay-like scent is now coming into play, is that the Vetiver i'm now smelling?

Didn't like it on first spray in the store, ran from it right away.
At home testing it again today, im enjoying it. But i feel like this is a half-assed/half-baked frag that needed more work on before they released it. Therefore, this is completely over-hyped. I like this, but i do not love this.
I wonder if he uses real oud? Id like that very much if Tom Ford's line did.
Need more exp with it to give you guys a final opinion & rating.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
