reivew: I bought Tom Ford's Oud Wood for me and White Suede for my wife, as a physician it suits me well to wear a perfume that is not so "in your face", I would not want to trigger an asthma attack for my patient with a powerful heavy perfume, a soft trace of Oud is what's left 20 minutes after spraying 5 times, not acceptable for a perfume of this tier made by Tom Ford, not to mention that as an Arab I am used to the Arabian oud perfumes whose scent lingers for hours after spraying, comparing it to other Tom Ford's fragrances the Noir Extreme and Tobacco Vanille are much more satisfactory but rather less versatile, you can easily wear Oud Wood to work or university... as a conclusion value for money? Average...

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
ok so I've revisted this and changed my rating from "LOVE" to "ok".
let me start by saying I've owned a lot of Tom Ford fragrances. I used to spend my money like nothing back in the day. these days I don't buy $400+ fragrances much anymore because I'm smarter with my money.
today however my wife randomly surprised me with a big 100ml bottle of Tom Ford Oud Wood which retails in Australia for $485. some people earn that in a week of work! so buying this you would expect something grand.
Tom Fords Oud Wood used to be one of my favourites, it was there back when I had only 4 or 5 fragrances in my collection (now I have 50 or so).
it was worn by me sooo much. it was amazing, it was so unique, it was an acquired smell & it was strong and projected its uniqueness unapologetically!

so my wife asks me to close my eyes because she got me a surprise,
what a wonderful suprise, just looking at the bottle I was already taken back to when we were dating.
I opened it up (this was 10 mins ago) I sprayed one spray on my inner forearm for me and one on my neck for her.. (that's what I said as a playful joke as I sprayed), we were so excited. $485 but where was it? where was the oud wood? what the f happened? it's soft, it's pleasant...but it's not the amazing oud wood and it's certainly not a $485 fragrance.

why would they use the same name and make something that is nothing like what that amazing fragrance was?
I'm 10 mins in and it's already fading away and it's just "ok" really.

there's no love, there's no amazing .. it's gone.
I won't call this oud wood & I won't sing praise to Tom Ford fragrances to my friends anymore
and you know what? I just want to let them know that yes they saved a few dollars by changing this the way they have. but guess what? I don't think I will buy another Tom Ford fragrance anymore. I'll take it as perhaps all my favourites are reformulated and I won't re-stock when they finish. my 100ml tobacco vanille is nearly finished. I wore that one on my wedding day 7 years ago but I'm out.

I'll politely tell the sales associate at the Tom Ford boutique and see what she says or what she offers to do but if they don't turn me around. I'm done and out!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: For anyone who owns or is familiar with Marco Serussi OUD, you'd agree that there is almost no single dissimilarity between it and this Tom Ford Oud Wood. The scent itself is a not a bad gradient of oud, but certainly not my favourite oud-type frag. I can confidently say that the DNA of TF Oud Wood matches MS Oud 100%. wow!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
First time I smelled this fragrance I liked it very much it was “night charm in a bottle” and that was long time ago, after years I decided to buy one, but I noticed that the scent is lighter kind of fresh somehow and less sweet like a watered down or maybe reformulated, the old one as I remember was in gold plated and much thicker woody and sweeter but wasn’t annoying sweet scent.
Mostly when fragrances companies make a successful fragrances by time they ruin them by reformulation and replace the ingredients by less quality ingredients and selling them nearly at the same price!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
What happened to this!!!?????

Cmon Estee Lauder. You should be ashamed of yourselves.

This was one of my first loves form the TF line, this, Tuscan Leather and Italian Cypress..

This is not even close to that fragrance I bought all those years ago. This is just a cardamon and sichuan pepper bomb. There is no roundness, depth, warmth, no performance, NADA!!! Non of that charm and complexity we all loved in what seems like, a very long time ago.

Basically, the entire TF private line has gone to shit. The originals anyway. Dont get me started on what happened to Noir de Noir and Tuscan Leather. Ill lose my shit. No one was a bigger fan of those than me.

Now.... I have completely gone off TF. His new releases are a joke. What are they? They have no purpose. No direction. Just flavours in a bottle. Only saving graces are White Suede and Ombre Leather which has clearly superseded Tuscan Leather.

Almond > Cherry > Peach. WTF????? Really. Get it together over there. Cheap and tacy perfumery at its worst. Especially from a powerhouse like TF.

I hope someone at Estee Lauder reads this and reads it good. I'm sure I speak for thousands of TF enthusiasts out there on how disappointed and jaded they all are regarding TF these days; EL and TF are losing lots of love and $$$ and won't be getting any back.

Especially from me, a life long and loyal consumer of TF.....but not anymore.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Some time ago I wrote a comment about the old version(yellow) and was a perfect perfume. Now I am writing about the new version (grey).I bought it a month ago and i want to say the perfume smells very nice,but the perfomence is weak for the price.The old version was 100 times better.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
this is a delicious,
bedtime perfume
🌳 🛌 💤 😴 💕

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Got new bottle, was using 5yrs old bottle previously. Wow hell of a difference. Completely new scent with synthetic notes.
Original was heavenly natural rosewood, cardamom, while this is a synthetic mess. RIP oud wood.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
One of TF's masterpieces. Oud Wood is sharp, woody, smoky and resinous -- its overall simple and linear but executed with perfection. As usual, Tom Ford's use of Oud is undetectable here, as he has simply perfected how to work around this note without making the overall fragrance smell middle eastern or plasticky. I absolutely admire and respect that. However, the name is a bit misleading as this one is all about rosewood, vetiver and leather (birch tar) smoothen out by amber, tonka and spices. Absolutely Fantastic.

Real notes: oud, chinese pepper, pink pepper, cardamom, birch tar, cistus, incense, sandalwood, vetiver, patchouli, rosewood, vanilla, tonka bean, amber

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
To me, Oud Wood is a strange fragrance. It smells exceptional on a strip of paper but when applied to my skin it's barely noticeable. It lingers for around 4 hours like a skin scent that hardly projects. Very light and fleeting sillage. Like most people, I have to admit that Oud Wood is a beautiful Tom Ford creation that has almost universal appeal. It's woody, chocolatey, luxurious and slight smokey at the end. Another issue is the price. The private blends are super pricey and to me it doesn't perform enough to justify that price bracket.

Overall 7/10. It would easily be a 9/10 if it works on my skin though.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Very Good fragrance it has the sparkle that Sean john unforgivable gave me back in the days.... don't get me wrong its different and even better.


9/10 steady rotation

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: It's never not old feeling actually. fresh and amazing of oud wood

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: So perfect that it gets boring. I think that's a major accomplishment. For the casual consumer who isn't passionate about fragrances, this is a must-have.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This was one of my first niche frags 5 years ago. I remember saying in my review, this is a scent made in heaven.

Then I gradually lost interest, disliking it, and selling my gold label bottle. Some of my favorite fragrances I didn't like at all on first impressions: Like Yatogan, I laughed at how ridiculous it smelled, then I gradually came to love it.
It was the opposite with Oud Wood, its flashy and impressive on first impression, then I realized how artificial the flashiness is.
I recently purchased a 10 ml that Tom Ford sells now, just to smell it now and then.

The reason I lost interest is that there are NO recognizable notes except cardomon perhaps. It smells like buttered popcorn, and marzipan accord.
There is no Oud, synthetic oud, or any recognizable wood here, and I've reviewed 500 fragrances.
Its a virtual oud, and a vertual fecal note, that gives it a sensual anamalic vib.
This strange scent that is TF Oud Wood is interesting, and I understand the worldly appeal of it. It just bothers me that it's so unnatural. I had to put on some Le Labo Bergamote 22, to smell something fresh and natural to recover from Oud Wood.

The new reformulated black label, is a shadow of the original. Maybe not so bad, but performance is weaker for sure.

I will enjoy my 10 ml from time to time, best in cold Winter. It is unusual, nothing like it, except Naxos, had this synthetic cocaine/ Oud Wood vib going on as well. I didn't like Xarjof Naxos as well. They smell good, but I just dont like the way I feel about them at times.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Amazing fragrance. My wife loves it!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Wore this on a rainy 70(ish) degree (Fahrenheit) day today, which turned out wonderfully. Oud Wood is nice for a gray, rainy day fragrance for anyone with some precipitation in their forecast. Not offensive inside or outside (just so long as that rain isn’t followed by heat and mugginess).

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: To me this just smells like a sexy man. It's warm and spiced and just so incredibly beautiful. I think oud is something a lot of people don't like because it can be very overpowering, but this has just enough that it's strong and the center of the perfume but doesn't overwhelm. Unfortunately lowering that overpowering aspect does cause it to be less projecting, so sillage is going to be weaker obviously. But this is great for even those people. This is pretty much a universal crowd pleaser. I now want a full bottle.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Why Tom? Why?!!!!

Oud Wood could be easily one of THE BESTS fragrances that i've ever had, but no!
The scents is fantastic. You may come around to a lot of similar scents but this one is class, luxury, and confidence in a bottle.
It has a very faded oud combined with lots of woods and cardamom. It's dark and soft, not simple, yet not too complicated.

BUT

The performance was below my "worst case scenario" expectations!!! I should put my nose on my skin and give it a deep inhale to smell it properly.

I was really into this one but after sampling a 3ml decant, i decided to go for something else for fall/winter.

Scent: 9
Projection: 4
Sillage: 4
Versatility: 9
Value for the price: 4 (The scent is an absolute gem, but for this price I wanted a better performance).

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Wow. Tom Ford's Oud Wood is a rich, complex, spicy scent.

Those who've described it as seductive, sexy, and masculine are spot-on.

I love that I don't have anything else in my perfume arsenal that smells like it. The cardamom, vetiver, pepper, and rosewood are the most dominant notes in the opening.

I don't smell the warmer notes (sandalwood, amber, tonka bean) until the latter part of the dry-down.

I didn't start paying attention to oud scents until last year, because I found them rather overpowering and more on the masculine side.

This scent, on the first spray, is intense and spicy. It leaves a noticeable trail. As soon as I smelled it, I gave it to my husband.

Use a light hand and give it at least 30 mins to dry down, as it's less sharp and much sexier/seductive. Otherwise, it will be much too strong in spaces where you're in close proximity to others.

I don't see myself wearing it as it's too masculine for my taste, but I love, love, love it on my husband.

Do not buy without testing, as that's much too high a price to blind-buy something you may not like.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
It's not an intimidating oud, it's not a sticky, gasoline like oud, this perfume is lovely and even those who don't usually like oud will enjoy it, I love it and here's why
I've always wanted to love oud, but the ones i've tried in the past smelt sticky and very gasoline like not to forget smelling like a grandmother's spice cabinet, so I decided to stay away from those kinds of oud and look for a fresh, dry oud and this is the one! It smeeellls expensive, It's perfect on it's own and with layering, it makes any other layered perfume smell luxurious and expensive. and even if you wear it in the summer you won't smell gross because this is a dry perfume doesn't go bad in my opinion.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Oud Wood is what I could call a "complete" fragrance.

I've never had a signature scent. Ever.

But this could easily be a signature scent if one is inclined to it. And this is due to the fact that it's a shy/discrete interpretation of a bold concept. It's not overpowering or cloying in warm weather and it's perfect for cool and cold weather.

It's a perfect balance between light and bold, in my opinion. There's an "airy heaviness" aura in it.

It has the "woody" facet of agarwood, more than anything fecal or animalic or cheesy.

Gorgeous fragrance!

On my skin... excelent performance! But be warned: it's not loud by nature (nothing to do with reformulation only).

10/10



ps.: I want to make an observation about formulations: I think the current version of Oud Wood is closer to the original formulation than Amber Absolute, for example - people say that the new AA is the same scent watered down, but I think they actually changed the scent (slightly, but it's noticeable). I don't get such a change in Oud Wood.

But I digress...

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: It seems those who enjoy the current formulation haven't smelled the earlier batches, thus didn't try it expecting the same scent. I just finished my 2009 iteration bottle and repurchased a 100ml. The current formulation starts with a sweet, astringent "woody" accord. It is so screeching to me that when smelling directly, it gave me a bit of a headache. After ~20 minutes, it dies down and you're left with a sweet, woody mess...I'll leave it at that. I'd highly suggest you try Ex Nihlio's 'Bois d'Hiver' if you were a fan of the original Oud Wood.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Oud ain't oud and wood ain't wood,
Yet you grab a full size and you atomize,
Then you close your eyes and you mesmerize,
And you idolize, as you reach your highs.
So it ain't no oud and it ain't no wood,
But it never failed to make me feel (rap) good.

J.S.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Hello all!

I don't have this fragrance. So why am I writing this. I tried it, but this is not the reason.

The reason I am writing this is that my sister-in-law came by my place with my bro'. She was wearing Oud Wood. There was only this smell in the room. Is smells very nice, but some consider this a "mild projecting fragrance". When I tried it, I thought so too. IT IS A BEAST! It does not bother anyone like other beast fragrances do, but it projects a lot!!!

I am gonna buy this!!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The faintest hint of a nappy fecal from a facsimile oud. Baby-product emulating muscs. The smell of new car, an upscale model. If this wasn’t designed specifically to reflect the everyday life of your average middle class young father, I’m Johann Nepomuk Hummel. Little baby throw-up on the new car seat included. Nothing at all wrong with this but... Come on, it’s perfume, live a little.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
True story

All proud of myself I wore this for my first night out in Bangkok. I asked a bar girl how do I smell imagine my chagrin when she said " You smell like an Indian" As the Bard said it is not what you think it is what she thinks that counts.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
(For disclosure, I just own a 10ml refillable travel atomizer of this fragrance.)

Oud Wood is the quintessence of gender-bending scents created by Tom Ford in his marketed "Private Blend" collection released in 2007.

Tbh, it is one the classiest and most sophisticated woody scents I've ever smelled so far. 😍 This is such a statement piece and woods are prevalent from top notes to dry down. For me, the dry down is the prettiest part! The agarwood or oud is known to be complex and heavy however, Tom Ford made it tamed. What I love about TF Oud Wood is its quality, it's really really really well-blended and polished! ❤️💯

But here's the catch, this fragrance is weak. 🤦🏻♂️ It projects only for minutes then the scent became so close to the skin. And for a retail price tag of ₱12,600 for 50ml bottle which is available at Rustan's, it just proved that TF Oud Wood is also the quintessence of social inequality. 👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼 Thank you, next!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Wow, I love it!

I'm a little late to the oud party, but I recognize the smoky sweet mysterious woody scent from AM Eau de Minuit by Lolita Lempicka - Except in Oud Wood by Tom Ford it's just way more pure and intense, and without the licorice of course. I think i'm an oud fan!

With Oud Wood by TF I associate an oriental house with a lot of ebony figures.

Mysterious, fascinating, authentic

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
On first spray, Oud Wood is handsome and vibrant. It stays that way for an hour or so, then dries down to a just barely there skin scent on me. After 5 hours, it’s still here but just barely as I said.

For a Tom Ford fragrance, you would have hoped for more for the price.

More scent, more sillage, more projection, more longevity.

It’s a nice woodsy scent with a slight hint of almost incense like smoke. Smells like a slightly more upscale men’s body wash or something. It’s a nice scent, but is it worth the price? I don’t think so. I think one could definitely find better value for the money.

So TFOW is a warm smooth scent. It’s one that I like but I wouldn’t purchase it. I just think it’s not “enough” to justify its price tag.

And as for the oud? I don’t get anything dirty or animalic in this fragrance. Pleasant and soft slightly smoky woods—- almost a campfire type scent.

Masculine yes, but totally unisex to me. I think this would be nice on men and women.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
One of the most attractive Tom Ford perfumes.
When a man wearing Oud Wood passes by me he cannot go unnoticed.
Although it is unisex, it seems to me more suitable for men.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Smooth, spicy, woody, clean. Simple but performance isn't so great. Overpriced.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Was hyped to check this one out since it is considered an icon.

It smells very much like a sweet Oudy shower gel. Definitely clean, and there are very mild traces of Oud, which is very calm and not animatic whatsoever, definitely mass-appealing. I wouldn’t consider this an Oud fragrance. The sweetness is a woody sweetness, most likely from the Sandalwood.

Overall, it smells pleasant, but nothing special at all. Very unimpressive.

6/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I love this but the projection sucks. This is the only perfume I paid a lot for and won't project even after 10 sprays. It doesn't get cold here so that doesn't help which is why I need to overspray either way.

This smells good enough that I got a full bottle. Is it worth it? Yes. Am I frustrated that I'm the only one who can smell it after 10 sprays? Definitely.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tom Ford Oud Wood opens with a moderate projection of very pleasant woody accords. The opening is woody and sweet; the combination of wood notes is fantastic, the oud found in this fragrance is delicate and far from dark, pungent or animalic. With the woody notes, the sweet accords come up creating a very pleasant and winter/fall wearable scent. The woody accords can be described as a combination of dark, fresh and very aromatic woods. The vanilla and Tonka bean are the two more prominent sweet tones, both give the fragrance a moderate sweet and delicious accord. The pepper and cardamon are there to support the featured notes, the Sichuan pepper feels spicy but not anywhere near as spicy as black pepper; similarly, the cardamom adds just a soft touch that enhances the woody accords. A few moments after the opening, the amber enters the blend creating a soft, sweet, projecting accord. The vetiver described as a note is barely noticeable. The fragrance is linear, the only noticeable change from the opening to the dry-down is the development of the amber which occurs towards the dry-down. Once Tom Ford Oud Wood has reached its full dry-down, it can be summarized as a mildly sweet, moderate projecting woody fragrance with soft spicy accords. The fragrance feels modern, versatile, elegant, unisex, inviting, well-blended, wearable, and very pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2019
WOW RATING: 9/10. This is a very pleasant woody fragrance; this is probably as pleasant as a wood-based fragrance can get. The agarwood feels more like dark wood than animalic oud.
DISLIKE RATING: 1/10. It is very unlikely that this fragrance will feel offensive to anyone.
UNIQUENESS: 9/10. Woody fragrances are common; however, Tom Ford Oud Wood is a fragrance that makes wood accords very wearable.
MASS APPEAL: 9/10. This is a crowds-pleaser fragrance.
PROJECTION: 3/10. Low to moderate. About three feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 3/10. Low to moderate. About three feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: Four atomizations should suffice.
LONGEVITY: 4/10. About 4 hours with 2 hours of moderate projection.
SEASONS: Spring, fall, colder nights, or climate-controlled environments.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, office, business, casual, holidays, home, romantic, dating. This is an office-friendly fragrance
VERSATILITY: 9/10. This fragrance feels very versatile, ideal for almost any occasion.
GENDER: Unisex. Tom Ford Oud Wood is a very refined fragrance. The soft spicy and oud accords create a slight tilt to the masculine side.
AGES: 30 and above.
RECOMMENDATION: Tom Ford can be found discounted for about $300 for a 3.4oz bottle. The cost/value balance is out of proportion, however, it is a great scent. If money is not a problem, this is a good investment. Otherwise consider alternative. This is a nice to have, but not a must-have.
BLIND-BUY: Yes, but only if you are familiar with its main notes.
SIMILAR: Here are some examples of fragrances with soft wood notes. Bvlgari Man (no the Black version) EDT includes softwood and fruity notes; Cuba Gold Men EDT is an affordable woody, floral and spicy fragrance; Guerlain L'Homme Ideal EDP includes softwoods, almond, and other notes; Hugo Boss - Boss The Scent Absolute EDP features woody, ginger, and rum notes; Terre D'hermes EDT Spray, is orange and grapefruit based but it contains soft/sweet wood tones as well; Prada Luna Rossa Black Men EDP is a mostly peppery and woody fragrance; Tom Ford Oud Wood is a very pleasant, soft woody fragrance, however, very pricy; Acqua di Parma Men Colonia Quercia is a great woody, and spicy fragrance; Pasha de Cartier Edition Noire is an elegant and versatile, slightly sweet, ambery, aquatic, and woody fragrance. Xerjoff More Than Words is an oud, sweetly fruity, floral, and ambergris, a good but overpriced fragrance.
SUMMARY: Mildly sweet, moderate projecting woody fragrance with soft spicy accords. The fragrance feels modern, versatile, elegant, unisex, inviting, well-blended, wearable, and very pleasant.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: One word. Boring.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: One of the best perfumes i ever smell. Its a shame that the others cant smell it on you, only if they hug you. Sophisticated, mature, classy, charming... this fragrance will make you fell like a boss. 4 out of 5 stars because of the performance issues.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Seeing a lot of reviews and the voted top notes I wonder if people are actually smelling this or simply voting based on its name (ie, Oud, Wood).

I get a lovely fresh oud off the top, easily my favorite part of the fragrance. This transitions into a collection of notes that eventually become its base to my nose (no distinct mid notes): tonka, some amber with cardamom prominent. Oud is more or less gone 15 minutes in and becomes quite sweet bordering on gourmond.

As a rule, I don't like sweet frags, vanilla and amber are two notes I usually stay away from, and this definitely isn't my speed as a result. Wish this had more oud and a bit more complexity otherwise in the base.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
damn this stuff is STROOONG STROOOONG. smells very woody I'll give it that. the oud actually blends pretty well to where it kinda smells like a literal wet log haha. I'm torn on this one. not quite sure if I like it that much. I can see how people would like it though. it smells very realistic. smells like nature lol. reminds me of an old hiking trail I used to frequent when I lived in a different location.

wearing it today on my second application from a tester vial and I'm about 10 minutes into it and already getting a headache, just like the first application. which is never good

I'm not a fan of oud, like it puts me off. but this stuff isn't terrible. it's definitely a winter fragrance, for cold winter nights. I could see how it could be amazing in the right scenario if it hits the air just right. but with that said I could never justify getting a bottle of this for the price. nope

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Silage monster!!! I bought the oil version and the quality is truly amazing! It last for days on my clothing after washing them. Very expensive because of the quality and ingredients!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Comercially viable urine that costs you arount 190$ for 50ml. To make everything worse, the performance is really humble. Don't believe the hype! And never blindbuy this one.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Woody, sweet, but not too sweet, balmy, warm, cosy. Masculine and not unisex imo. Watch the overspray!
Most likely best during the colder months.
Try before buying.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Bought myself a decant last week. I've worn it twice this week. To me it's okay, but nothing special. I think it's way too expensive for what it is. Nothing special. If I had to choose anyway, I would go for TF Ombré Leather.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I've never understood the hype around this fragrance... To me it's really nothing special.

For some reason my brain is immediately reminded of cheap liquid hand soap in an airport bathroom.

Someone said that it smells like urinal cakes, and I can really see that connection.

It's just kinda boring.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Love this fragrance so much that I bought the 100ml bottle, travel atomizer, body spray, and body oil (not all at once) lol. I know that may be overkill, but I think this is how TF wanted us to experience this masterpiece, and it takes the fragrance to a whole other level! Oud Wood reminds me of an apple product, you have to buy the additional accessories to experience the full capabilities. Is it worth the money? It’s debatable, your probably saying, “it’s not worth it if you have to buy all of that”. Don’t knock it until you try it! One thing is for sure, it smells amazing to me, It’s all personal preference. It’s mysterious and sexy!

10 out of 10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I am going to get this fragrance as my special event fragrance. I just don’t know when I’m gonna get it Because the way my bank account is set up I got a checking and a savings. When I do get it I’ll probably get the smaller 50 ML. Although I will get the 100 ML if it does come with a TF suit.
The longevity of this fragrance is pretty good I get about 8 to 10 hours, projection is soft about an hour but what I like about this fragrance is that it has great sillage and that makes up for the projection. This screams luxury & class without raising its voice and it’s also pretty versatile. Besides hot summer days, I think this can be worn all year try to keep it formal though.

10/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Short and sweet; this fragrance is fabulous! Do I wish it last longer, yes but I still get 6-7 hrs. Regardless of the performance the fragrance is unbelievable and over rides this issue. Love it!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Clean, refined, classy.

This is a great scent. It’s refined, great for in a suit, going for a nice dinner, a family meal. Projection and longevity wise it’s good, it will get you complements; but it’s not as strong as something like Tobacco Vanille. Don’t expect this to be bombing our rooms, this is a toned down fragrance but smells great. It’s definitely pleasing, and people are going to like it.

Rating:

Longevity- 8/10
Sillage- 7/10
Uniqueness- 8/10
Rating- 8/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Having encountered so much praise for this online (particularly here) and having tried this in-store and been 'whelmed' (neither over- nor under-) I bought a number of samples from a respected retailer, expecting this would inevitably lead to a bigger investment. After various tests, the result is no further purchase. This IS a beautiful fragrance, but is it as good at being 'Oud Wood' as "Tuscan Leather' is at being TL? Not in a million years.

Oud and rose is a well-worn (eastern) combination, but there's a smoothness or creaminess about the oud here, rounded out by the texture of the tonka and vanilla, that really works well. Though listed as unisex, this works better on a man, I think. The flipside of this 'unisex imbalance' for a woman would be Jo Malone's Velvet Rose & Oud which works better on women and is more potent (though less complex - which doesn't at all matter if you can't actually SMELL the TF incarnation).

It's true that oud is still pretty unusual as a main element in Western fragrances, and there's nothing exactly like this but there ARE alternatives - the 'reminds me ofs' above are close and the Versace is probably the best mainstream Western oud in terms of performance and price. An Eastern-style alternative oud fragrance, to my mind, would be Rasasi's Faqat Lil Rijal which shares some notes with Oud Wood but has some very interesting geranium in there too. I'm not suggesting the Rasasi is a clone/dupe (in the way La Yiqawam clearly is for Tuscan Leather) but it's a similar type of fragrance that's equally complex, sophisticated and un-synthetic but with better performance and better price point.

In summary, the fragrance is wonderful but weak: the level of projection, sillage and longevity make the price point an insult to even the most devoted Tom Ford followers. Perhaps it would be a perfect signature scent for a very brand-conscious guy in an office environment where people might complain about strong fragrances; the oud isn't the 'pongy' barnyard type.

I can see why there was a need for Oud Wood Intense, so perhaps that's another one to try, but this one certainly is not going to be added to my collection.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: A sexy, luxurious and seductive smell that makes you feel like an Arabian knight. Loves smelling it on my hubby! It’s pricey though.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Oud, sandalwood and rosewood are a great combo. Not surprisingly it's the oud that hits you first then the rosie rosewood. Rosewood and sandalwood are notes I really enjoy. The vetiver is strong as well but really comes into its own after half and hour.

Gradually the oud eases off a bit and then the spice and pepper come through. It's not quite as heavy. Let's be honest here it opens very strong. It's so heavy it makes me think of Serge Lutens Borneo after a load of spices have been added. There is a green element from the vetiver that combined with the wood notes makes me think of aromatic notes.

It doesn't really develop much. It remains an intense spicy oud/rosewood/sandalwood bomb. Vanilla is listed but it's presence is pretty much minimal on my skin. I'd have never guessed it was present.

I get good longevity and sillage. I guess it's unisex if you like your oud. I would say though that it touches a tad to the masculine. It's definitely a fragrance to only wear in cool/cold conditions as it's quite intense but if you live in a hot environment then this will hang around a while.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I have received around 30 different samples lately. This is a nice one. Sophisticated, clean. The price however brings the overall score down IMO. Its not worth the asking price and does not smell better than others around the $80 price...yet they want at least double that. No thanks.

6/10 Good, but not worth the price

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Agree with the review below by the Smell of Derbyshire (EDIT: this is now quite far below since this review has been re-uploaded).

This is disappointingly middle of the road.

Nothing unpleasant but I wasn't expecting this to smell like it does. It's a waxy, rubbery fragrance that is a nice blend of lighter woods - I expected/hoped for something a bit richer, denser, darker. It has a creamy-woodiness (the sandalwood and rosewood makes for a nice mix) and the Oud is very tasteful i.e. easy to wear, and very light. Not much Oud at all. Perhaps it's overly synthetic in the way you don't really get the pungency I associate with a good quality Oud note - nearly all Oud is synthetic in perfumery but some capture more of the 'stank' than others.

Thankfully, that tyre-rubber smell does calm down fairly quickly. It does develop into a nicer scent - the creamy woods are more prominent, with a bit more sweetness. But 'nicer' isn't particularly exciting either...it just feels like it's 60% of the way to a really great fragrance, but no more than 60%. And perhaps that's the point. Perhaps that's the whole point. It's mass appealing, safe, 'nice', with enough luxury and richness in the fragrance to adhere to Tom Ford's marketing shtick.

The sweetness from the tonka and vanilla makes this unisex for sure, but I'm not sure how many women this would suit. It definitely leans more masculine, but for a man, this is a pleasant, pleasing scent that could be described as slightly feminine despite the focus on woods. From a distance there's something floral about it. It's not the 'mainstream yet deep and woody' fragrance I was hoping for at all. (UPDATE: Bois Marocain is a lot closer to that.)

Longevity and projection is ridiculously poor. Lasts 3-4 hours of wearable/detectable scent, 6-8 hours if you're being very generous and really, really digging your nose in to your skin. And I mean really digging - just to get a trace of spicy, oudy woods. Maybe 20-30 minutes of projection: genuinely, it's poor, but I'm not sure that's necessarily a bad thing. I think this works nicely as a skin scent (reformulation issues have surely neutralised it) and is a reward for close proximity - greetings, farewells etc. Sillage obviously non-existent as a result. Again, I'll repeat: for a scent like this, that's not a bad thing.

Disappointing overall then, for me. It's a 'like' in as much as it's a decent fragrance but not something I'm going to buy a full bottle of. Hoping Oud Wood Intense and Tobacco Oud have more going for them (UPDATE: they do)...have a number of other TF samples arriving next week and I'm hoping they're better than this (UPDATE: some yes, some no).

I'd echo the poster below once more and say if this was £80-100 for 100ml, I'd give this a solid 8-9/10. It's very wearable and appealing with enough nuance to it that it's going to stand out against designer brands.

But it's not. In the UK at the moment, it's £240 for 100ml - and in that case, it's a 5/10. As I said, it's two thirds of the way to something really good with the cost knocking some points off.

However, I can say right now that I think this is a grower - I've found with many Tom Ford scents, there is 'something' about them that, despite their mass appeal (or perhaps because of it?) it's easy to get comfortable with them. It's easy to really 'wear' them, to get used to them, for the fragrance to become 'you' and yours. Particularly if you're not someone who wants to collect more than 10+ bottles. I can totally see how this can go from a 'hmm, nice' to 'THIS is what I wear when I dress up/go out' etc.

I'm going to persist with this and come back and update.

UPDATE 13/4/19: Alas, I cannot get on board with this. I want to like this - I want a classy, dry woody scent, with the mainstream appeal yet distinction that TF's PB produces, in my opinion. For some people this clearly achieves those things, but not for me.

It's simply not...*special*...enough. Having sampled a good chunk of the TF Private Blend line, including Oud Wood Intense which is very intoxicating and slightly challenging, this isn't worth a full bottle. Oud Intense isn't what I wanted, and it plays it a bit 'close' to the dirty/funky line with the animalic note, but if ONLY Oud Wood intense had gone further down the deeper/darker woods route it might be a really great 9/10 fragrance. There are no doubt some who will love this, some who see this as a 'aspirational' purchase, and other who 'need' it in a collection etc. But unless you adore it and consider this a signature scent I would consider many other TF PB fragrances over this - at which point it becomes redundant and/or a vanity/money-burning purchase.

I'd also say the Tom Ford DNA is slightly jarring with this scent. Others, like Amber Absolute, it smells great. With this...I'm less of a fan.

As a side note - it's already said elsewhere - but unless this is one of your favourite fragrances, just buy Versace Oud. Or, better yet, look to something like Armani Oud Royal, which does this 'palatable designer Oud' so much better, if you're unwilling to jump off the deep end in to niche ouds.

*original review posted Mar 22 2019*

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I can only describe this as mind-blowing when you first wear it on your skin. When I first started on my fragrance journey about 6 months ago, I was in a department store and the name intrigued me so I sprayed it on. My mind was blown, I didn’t know people could smell like this (I live in an area where fragrances are rare, and if they are worn they’re blue). This has become one of my absolute favourites since I bought a 100ml (at a great price on notino btw). It just works on my skin, and it is my second most complimented fragrance.

The scent: 10/10 If there is Oud it’s only there in the initial 2 minutes, which has a resinous medicinal quality. But yeah, this is not an Oud fragrance, the emphasis is on ‘wood’. And it’s beautifully blended as there’s no one wood that stands out, but I get a very creamy almost sandalwood/cedar vibe. It also has an almost vanilla creaminess to it. It’s unique, and is definitely best on skin. On paper it’s plasticky and harsh, on skin it’s like your swimming in an imaginary hot dessert made of wood that for some reason is delicious.

The longevity: 8/10 I initially got disappointed with the longevity as I thought it only lasted 2 hours. If you spray on your neck then I find you go nose blind very quickly. I sprayed it on my wrist and could still smell it 6 hours later, and once I got a compliment 8 hours in. So, perhaps a bit like Aventus (which it smells nothing like to clarify) the noseblindness that is caused by the intensity of aroma-chemicals used masks it’s true longevity to the wearer.

This is better in heat in my opinion, it becomes really woody and creamy. On colder days I like it less as it seems sweeter in a resinous way, which isn’t bad but not as good.

Overall 9.5/10 a modern classic. Not to mention most non-fragheads will never have smelled this, especially if like me you are in your early twenties so it will turn heads.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
What an amazing scent, one of my favorites! I would love to smell like this for the rest of my life. It starts fresh and then gets woody and sweet. It is so versitale, easy to wear at any time of the year even summer, but not when is really hot outside. It's versitale and easy to wear but in a unique way, not that blue style that is everywhere. It is suited in a dressier occasion, but you can wear it casual too. An elegant, masculine but not dated scent.

My biggest complains are the perfomance and the projection. I've never try it before the reformulation but in my skin projects for a little more than an hour and stays very close to the skin scent for about 6 hours. After 4-5 hours you can hardly detect it on your skin. It is very disapointing pefomance for such an expensive parfum.

10/10 for the scent
6/10 for the perfomance
5/10 for the projection

I wouldn't recomment it because of the bad perfomance and the high price! Please fix the perfomance!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This belongs to the bf.
On him, very oud-y, dark and sultry.
On me, almost floral, very light.
On both, complex and changing.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
It has been 13 years since the launch of this gorgeous perfume, but to me it is still one the best oud base perfume and one the timeless perfume ever. I always looking for new look to oud note in perfumes and Oud Wood is one the first perfumes that took oud to another level.
Instead of animalic and sweet face of oud, there new spicy woody aspect in this one and for this, it is one the easiest oud perfume to wear. It is not heavy or cloying but as much as you want is exotic and sexy.
Tom Ford already proved himself with involving to creation of magnificent M7 but this one is something else. This is a perfect and balance blend of woods and spices.
Opening of this perfume has a little medical vibe because of oud and other woods. But after 5 minutes Smokey and woodsy notes arrive and mix with spices. Cardamom, vanilla and pepper are so bold in spicy notes and these spices match with woody note so perfectly. Cardamom is the one I really like in this perfume and give it very pleasant touch. And in the end creamy sandalwood comes to play to make this combo a perfect ending.
I take my hat off to Mr. Tom Ford just because of this masterpiece.


سیزده سال از لانچ این عطر بینظیر میگذره و هنوزم به نظرم یکی از بهترین عطر ها عودی ای هست که میشه به راحتی توی این باز که پر از عطر های عودی جور با جوره انتخاب کرد.
چیزی که من توی این عطر دوست دارم اینه که توی اون موقع یه نگاه متفاوت به عود کرد و با پایین آوردن جنبه خای انیمالیک و شیرین عود یه ترکیب جدید که به راحتی میشه پوشیدش ایجاد کرد.
یه ترکیب فوق العاده از چوب و ادویه که میتونه نظر هر کسی رو به خودش جلب کنه.
آقای تام فورد قبلا هم خودش رو با شرکت داشتن در تیم طراحی عطر ام 7 افسانه ای ثابت کرده بود و اینجا با به وجود آوردن این ترکیب بینظیر نشون داد که میتونه خلاقیتش رو به مرحله بعدی ببره.
شروع این عطر یکم تند و دارویی بخاطر عود اما خیلی زود این بو دارویی مانند فرو میکشه و بوی دودی و چوبی فوق العاده ی عود در کنار نت های اسپایسی مثل هل، وانیل و فلفل خود نمایی میکنه. وجود این ادویه ها به خصوص هل این کار رو خیلی دلنشین و جذاب میکنه.
در آخر هم جوب صندل با اون حالت خامه ای مانندش به عطر اضافه نیشه تا یه ترکیب بی نقص رو به جا بزاره.
اون کسایی که دنبال یه عطر شیک، لوکس و همه پسند از عود هستن این چیزیه که میتونه راضیشون کنه.
ماندگاری و پخش بوی مناسبی داره.
قیمت فقط مشکل اصلی این عطره یکم سخت پیدا میشه.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: sophisticated indeed. Alot of rosewood, get cardamom. its a beautiful scent. very synthetic smelling though.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I'm a woman and got a sample of this to try out on myself. First impression: masculine, nice but not sexy, smells like a sophisticated grandpa... I washed it off and the remaining scent became quite feminine and powdery, like a sophisticated grandma... Maybe it's just my chemistry?

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I adore Oud Wood.

Quite how Notino are selling a 50ml bottle for £130 and 2ml samples for £3.83 is messing with my mind though.

Are the samples genuine?

And if so, is the bottle worth the difference?

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is nowhere dark and thick as I remember it being when I first gave it a sniff years ago. I'm certainly not trying to say that it got watered down in the meanwhile, even though I would now describe it as a watery oud, pardon me. It gets a bit watery or airy on male skin, and I think it can be even a bit sickening. Or at least it doesn't meet my expectations from an oud dominant fragrance - I prefer them thicker, chocolaty or at least powdery. I suppose that in the meanwhile I got used to the scent of oud and got familiar with its many iterations and interpretations.
On female skin, this gets musky. It actually very much reminded me of White Suede - another TF fragrance I admire very much and would certainly love to have and enjoy it. I thought at first that a very good girl-friend of mine, who wears it regularly, actually wore WS - she smelled so feminine and sensual. I was very much surprised to find out it was Oud Wood on her. Obviously those two TFs have much more in common than it appears.
I suppose that this is a safe oud. Something that wouldn't go unnoticed on the western hemisphere, but will not be bothersome either.
Curiously, though, I've never imagined a woman actually wearing it even though it's marketed unisex, but now that I know one who sports it, I can say I much prefer it that way. It develops a certain dept and warmth, whereas it remains kind of thin and cool on a male-friend of mine.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
My first designer fragrance - I really like the smell of this but for me really poor projection and longevity. Sophisticated and masculine...

In terms of performance it's almost like others on this site have a different fragrance. Mine bought at Frankfurt Duty Free at the start of February 2020. (Batch code: AA9 19310)

About 30min of very moderate projection - maybe arm's length then skin for 1 - 2 hours. Gone after 3 hours.. Last longer on clothes.

I've a 5ml travel atomizer that I use to reapply halfway thru the day or if I feel the need for a boost.

My Versace Oud Noir smells roughly the same to me and double the longevity (and a fraction of the price). The TF is richer and deeper and that why I stay with it but a real shame about the productivity.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is probably my signature scent, I absolutely love the woody fragrance of this Tom Ford cologne. It doesn't last as long as its counterparts in the same brand and it doesn't scream "Here I am!" either. It's perfect for any day, anywhere, and any situation. I'd recommend making sure that when you spray this once, catch half of the spray on your lower neck and the other half around your collar area on your clothes so it lasts much longer during the day. Since it isn't that pungent in the first place, a second spray wouldn't hurt.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This one blew my mind when i was new in the community and smelled it for the first time and I still love it to this day. Extremely easy to wear. Good, inoffensive synthetic oud accord that adds a beautiful warmth and depth.

This is my everyday scent. Longevity is good, consistently get around 8 hours. Doesnt fill a room and is never obnoxious, around 1 meter projection, perfect for a unique everyday scent.
Love it!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Biggest disappointment I ever had in all the hyped fragrances I've come across.
Starts off very sharp and even disgusting to me, with the weird notes of like a burned rubber + strong alcoholic blast(not a boozy note you would find in some other frags) + some spices. After like half a hour the rubbery smell calms down and theres some synthetic sweetness note(raspberry?) and woody notes(no oud detected) start to come out. After like 1-1.5 becomes a skin and a more enjoyable scent with vanilla, amber and some spices creating a typical warm-spicy aroma you would literally find in hundreds of designer frags. No sillage and no projection whatsoever. After 3-4 hours its completely gone. And the most pathetic part of it is that it costs 200+ bucks for 100ml. Is it a joke? Or was it just badly reformulated? Either way, there is no reason in the world to buy this for its price, do yourself a favor and get some Amouage or Xerjoff instead.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: woody beauty. this is a tricky one guys. for people that are not used to niche smells. this one for me if i smell it up close it really doesnt smell good to me. but when the first time this thing came to me in the air... in smelled sooo damn goood. so damn classs woods spicee beauty i never expected that the scent that smells pretty bad up close became such a nice thing in the air. for me this is a beauty! stilll try it before you buy it. but understand that the MAGIC happens in the air and in a little colder weather. 10/10 more masculine.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tom Ford Oud Wood.
Smells good rich and masculine and a bit “safe” not too heavy.
Like the most of Tom Fords fragrance it’s smells really good.
If you think of the price you pay it should smell more/stronger then just a couple of hours.
But I’m happy too have it in my collection.

Many comments from females.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: nothing like versace but carved oud thameen is 99% similar and way better in everything.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I love this fragrance but I wish it was stronger!

Smells amazing, lasts for 10 hours on my skin. Projects for less than half an hour.

It's an amazing skin scent. Amazing at that job. But for the price I really do expect more when it comes to sillage and projection.

Wonderful sweet spicy woods, soft cardamom. What oud is here? A soft oud if any. It's still lovely but it's a skin scent and over-priced for that reason alone.

I'll still keep buying it though. Can't stop smelling myself!!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is such a smooth fragrance. I have a recent formulation and get decent performance, but admittedly I go hard on the trigger.

There is nothing dirty about this fragrance. It is soft, fresh, spicy wood and stays that way for the duration. It is appropriate for all occasions and for me is very versatile.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This one is a scam at this point.
It has very limited longevity.
Tried to wear it many times and it just disappears.
Very common occurrence with the new formulation.
20 sprays last less than an hour.
I love most TF Private Collection creations but this one is a scam.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Shy oud!
Look elsewhere if anyone wishes to smell an exceptionally blended oud(thinking of Ajmal's Khallab and Plum Japonais here). Oud is a sensual note which can be manipulated in a million ways, and this scent fails exactly at that.

Oud here only gives a kinda-sharp opening and adds another woody facet to the other exotic woods present in this fragrance. This fragrance is for those who hate oud.
For a comparison, Guerlain's Santal Royal is a better oud but TF Oud Wood is a lot better scent overall.

Dry down of this fragrance has creamy sandalwood with some amber. Mass pleasing woody office scent. Signature worthy for a CEO who can afford the private blend.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Similar to Versace Oud???? Pleazzze! TF Oud Wood is QUALITY and WAY more classy.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Nice but very weak performance and projection.
Under an hour for me...

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: If you don't love this oud fragrance then you will never love any oud fragrance. Absolutely masterpiece.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This fragrance is absolutely gorgeous! The only downside is the performance, on my skin it is gone after 2-3 hours. If it lasted longer I would buy a lifetime supply!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Oud.....either you love it or hate it. This is a great Oud fragrance, but definitely not for everyone.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I really enjoy this scent. I feel it unisex upon opening but the dry down is masculine. its a unique smell in my opinion, no monster projection but decent. don't blind buy this one. test it out 9/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is a nice creamy woody type of scent. I get the medicinal type Oud in this albeit faint but still nicely done. I don't know why some complain about the performance of this, I get easily 6+hrs. The silage is close yes, which is perfect for I don't want it to be loud and obnoxious like the garbage of the 70's - 80's, the era that ruined perfume wearing from being permissable. People do notice it when they are within your bubble and no one complains. I don't sense a resemblance to Versace at all as that has a tobacco aroma to it IMO. Anyway I like this and it performs perfectly.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: To my nose: cardamom gives this one a creamy and powdery feel. I do not get oud, but I do detect woods( maybe sandalwood play-up the creamy vibe), and some greens, but not like grass more like a fern bush.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I got a 5ml decant and this doesn't smell good to me. Tried it quite a few times now and just dislike it. I don't smell anything else everyone says. Not sophisticated, not smooth, not sweet, none of that. To me it smells like powdered laundry detergent, the cheap kind you buy cause you're poor as hell. Sharp, abrasive and uninviting. Maybe it's the decant I got, so I ordered from someone else another 2ml, if my opinion changes I'll update this.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Got a sample vial from sephora. I feel rich! It is woody, smokey, tobacco, vanilla, boozy. Juke joint, speakeasy, VIP section, Gentlemen’s club.

I would wear it during the day. It is not feminine but idc!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is the fragrance that's responsible for my ever emptying bank account into the world of fine perfumery.

I still can't think of a more perfect all-round fragrance that pretty much any man could wear both casually and formally. It really is a masterpiece, and I can't stress that enough.

Valentine's Day is coming; if your significant other needs something a little special and you need ideas, this would go down a storm. (I hope my taking notes reading this...)

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Oooops.... the TF fanboys apprently didn't like my comment, and it has been deleted... But no worries, I'm reposting it here, so that everyone can enjoy:

Retried this one today. Interesting... an "oud fragrance" without oud. It won't be the first time it happens, but at $250/300 a pop, that's simply unacceptable. It's all about saffron and creamy rosewood, supported by vanilla, pepper and an camphorous aromachemical supposed to give an impression of oud in the opening (similar to the one used in other low-tier designer frags), the ends up giving an herbal/minty/medicinal impression very far from the real deal. Should have been named "Camphor Wood".

The opening is a fuller bodied version of Versace Oud Noir (shockingly similar) while the drydown shares similarities with Dunhill Icon Absolute. Even better: Montale Dark Aoud, which uses a woody aromachemical more true to oud - what TF Oud Wood dreams to be.
It's nice taken on its own, even if very linear and with disappointing performance. (the need to overspray is unacceptable at that price point).
Just to give an idea, 10 sprays of Oud Wood on one arm, 1 spray of Dark Aoud on the other: I can only smell the Montale, and have to stick my nose on the skin for the Tom Ford...

It may have been unique when it was originally issued (due to the use of Givaudan's aromachemical that was new at the time, with exclusivity of use by TF), but now that the Versace is available for ~6X less, and the Montale for 4-5X less, there's no valid reason to spend such amounts of money on this one.
Will do the job of being a nice and discreet woody office frag for colder days for early career professionals, but that's pretty much it.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Woody oud, very clean, very soft, very fine and sophisticated. Copied with great perfection by Versace Oud Noir, but here the aroma has a little more naturalness, although Versace has some extra notes of interest that I didn't feel here, like leather and spices. Incredible right? A designer frag has more layers than a niche. However, the proposal here seems to me to have been so intentional: oud woody, pure 100% linear and without extra sensitive notes to disturb the experience. However, the aromatic metaphor is the same for my nose in both: pharmacy cotton.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Comforting, really easy to like. A set of woods that achieve a stern tone, although very wearable. To me, it leans towards masculine in most situations. Sillage is moderate to soft, a skin scent after an hour or so.

Carissa, performed by Sun Kil Moon

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The rosewood adds a real softness, a light floral airiness that keeps the oud from veering too spicy or oriental. It's a delight to smell and is actually much more subtle than you would think. I wished it to be stronger because the oud in it is absolutely lusciously layered against the sandalwood.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I love this stuff, but as many people have stated, longevity could be more with the price attached to this. (Newer batches)

One thing I have realized is the atomizer is very weak. Similar to a JPG type sprayer... Nothing like a Dior or Chanel type.

Therefore generous spraying is required in order to give it some oomph.

This is one of those that is priced too high but the scent factor comes through to justify a purchase. IMO.

Also, you can consider getting the many byproducts like deodorant, oil, body spray, to help longevity.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Close your eyes in every review. Smell it. Some days it’s fantastic some days not.. taste it a lot. Very good but not the king.. expect to last more.. but no it doesn’t..

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Love TF but this is a dud for me. Sweet and light, not lasting or distinctive.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Sorry to say, but most fragrantica users do not know what oud smells like. That's why you see users vote oud being the most prominent note in Oud Wood or Gold Prestigium.

The word 'refined' is over-used and honestly just an excuse to give the consumers a toned down version of something. That being said, I don't even get any "refined oud" in this one. You can get "refined oud" in M7.

This starts off with a pleasant floral-woody note and dries down to a tonka-vanilla combo. The cardamom gives a nice semi-sweetness to the fragrance.

Overall, a nice smelling fragrance. Very safe for most situations, easily a dumb reach. But the deceptive marketing and ridiculously high price point is unjustified IMHO.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: That one is how a man must smell at fall-winter in a special occasion! One of the best tom fords releases! Perfect blend of woods and really wearable oud! Its a really good one if you want to go in the world of oud but you re not familiar with it! If you love woods and you can afford it than go for it!! It worths it!! And for sure solid compliment getter!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Mysterious and unique scent. Haven’t smelled anything like it yet. I am still undecided whether I just like it or really love it. The smell is pleasant though. However, my wife didn’t like it and it reminded her of cleaning products. Very unisex. Longevity was weak, couldn’t smell anything anymore after 2 hours. Don’t know whether I will buy a full bottle yet but the smell does intrigue me. Maybe I will buy a small 50ml bottle first.

EDIT: Love love love it! Best scent I own by far! Just wish the performance was a bit better.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: To my nose this smells like kitchen cleanser which doesn’t mean it smells bad per se, it’s just that I don’t want to wear something that smells like cleaning ingredients.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Amazing scent. One of my favourites ever. Wish it projected a bit more. It turns into a skin scent too quickly for my taste. But the scent itself is heavenly. However, I do think it’s overpriced for what you get.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I concur with NS248. Wow, wow, wow. Nothing that I would say adds to it... except, again, wow!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Pavlov would have a field day with the word "oud" in fragrances. Fragrance appreciators and collectors read it or hear it in the name and some kind of bell goes off, "Oud, oh my god! Rich, skanky, smoked, rubbery, burnt wood opulence!". Which is I think a correct response, but however, interpretations and utilisation of oud can and should differ in my opinion. M7 has taught us so much (that is just one fragrance example). With that being said Tom Ford Oud Wood is a great innovation and interpretation of an oud fragrance.

Right from the opening the oud and rosewood are present, but ever so mildly, and I like that, restraint yes it is good, dare I say artistic from time to time. The aura of pepper around the rosewood and oud is beautifully executed here. Then this bourbon, (It is in my cocktail rotation lately) sweet sandalwood rolls in with this richness, and all this is done with a whisper. Oud Wood is not a bombastic fragrance, and I don't want it to be either. Finally, in the mid we get the amber, tonka and vetiver, with just a kiss of vanilla. And that is all you get and that is all you need!

Tom Ford Oud wood is a skin scent but as mentioned before that is what you want it to be. Case in point I received this as a Christmas gift from my wife, because this is what she wants to smell on me when we are close. Can't argue with that. Oud Wood for me is a scent for someone in their late 20's and up. This can be worn in or out of the office, hell even date night this works. In my opinion this veers more masculine. You can dress up or dress down with Oud Wood, which is a true testament to it's versatility.

I wore this fragrance so many times to figure out how I felt about it and how I could use it. It all clicked when my wife said, "Spray that one. That is what I want to smell on you today.". Problem solved. Give Tom Ford Oud Wood a few sprays when you want something dynamic and inviting!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: what a rounded, sweet, and woody smell with hints of cardamom. It evokes mystery.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I'm not a super fan of the scent, although it receives a lot of attention when I'm wearing it.

If you want the same scent but something lighter, go with Versace Noir pour Homme. If you want something stronger, go with Thameen Carved Oud.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Guys need to stop blabbering about this perfume's lack of projection. It's not supposed to scream out loud! This perfume is incredibly sexy and is meant to give your date something dangerously delicious to smell while nibbling on your neck. 1 Million is a perfume to clear out a room. This is one used to seduce. Def has a woodsy smell and it screams luxury. If you aren't all tied up in getting a TON of compliments from strangers that will most likely never run into you again this one is for you. Delicious and sexy!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
New 50ml bottle. Projection is so disappointing. Very little oud and simply disappearing on my body. The Oud Wood Intense is a bit heady but far superior for me.

If anyone is willing to swap I would be interested!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
While there are many fragrances I like, I've been WOWed by only 3. This is one of those 3. This is the perfect blend of freshness and woodiness. Not so fresh that it's only a summer scent, and not so woody that it's only a fall scent. It blends the two together so that it's perfectly appropriate for either season. It elicits imagery of a clean shave followed by enjoying a day by the water. I want to wear this in the summer and fall; on special occasions and doing daily outdoor activities.

Oh, and I tried Versace Oud Noir to see if it's a good replacement for Tom Ford Oud Wood, and it absolutely is not. The Versace version dries down into a sweet noir combined with an awfully blended oud. Nothing at all like TF Oud Wood.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Sure it's quite unique, but performance is underwhelming and for sure not what I imagined as a scent. I was expecting a woody fragrance with some oriental notes as the name would suggest but I smelled a rather green fragrance that reminded me of cypress, bushes and moss in the woods.
Great smell but I wouldn't wear it.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Sure it's quite unique, but performance is underwhelming and for sure not what I imagined as a scent. I was expecting a woody fragrance with some oriental notes as the name would suggest but I smelled a rather green fragrance that reminded me of cypress, bushes and moss in the woods.
Great smell but I wouldn't wear it.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Nothing good or bad to say.
It's just meh.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Probably the easiest perfume to wear without being too generic.

Notes:
For me this one is all about Coumarin and Brazilian Rosewood, and a slight hint of Cardamom in the opening. And I get some very close to skin sandalwood smoothness in the dry down. I can't smell ANY oud at all in this one.. so the name is a bit confusing to me...!

Performance:
Projection is weak which makes this a shy, day to day wearable beauty. On my skin it lasts 8-10 hours with the first 1-2 containing hints of projection.

Character:
Smooth, Clean, Safe (but unique). Both gentlemen and hipster friendly.

Caution: If i use this one to many days in a row i can't smell it anymore.

Rating:
Scent: 9/10 (Love it! Just a tiny bit too linear, and some batches are better than others)
Projection: 3/10 (Skinscent after 1-2hrs)
Longevity: 7/10
Variety: 10/10 (Super Unisex, super wearable, in all weathers and occasions!)

Not a blindbuy, sample first.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I don’t even know a single person in this world who doesn’t like this fragrance.

Absolute masterpiece from Tom Ford.

Totally worth the high price.

I can wear this all year long, In any occasion, even on a hot summer night.

9.5/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: always one of the best

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I love Tom Ford's fragrances and have a few of them. I'm a woman but find that more masculine scents tend to smell better on me. Saying that, I found this way too masculine. As a middle eastern woman, I wear a lot of different ouds, but I didn't get ANY oud smell from this one, so quite disappointed. To me it just smells quite chemical, and a bit like a strong cheap men's shower gel. Not a fan, and it didn't last very long. It's a no from me.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I recently bought OUD WOOD after all the hype and because i'm a fragrance lover.I was disapointed not by the scent itself but by the performance.It smell great but don't project and don't last at all.It really don't worth the pricetage.I was satisfied with TUSCAN LEATHER and TOBACCO VANILLE so mr ford i forgive you for this one.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I have recently purchased another bottle of Oud Wood as it is one of my favourite fragrances but it seems much softer than the bottle I previously owned. Don’t get me wrong I do get wafts of this here and there throughout the day, but my new bottle doesn’t seem to have the strength or sillage that my old bottle had. The older bottle was 3 sprays and I could smell it strongly all day long and well into the night. Not with my new bottle which is disappointing considering the price.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Originally bought an A82 gold label in Milano (2012). It lasts for an entire day (12h+), moderate sillage, very oftenly complimented. It's very true to the initial smell throughout the drydown, nice mix of sandalwood, rosewood and oud with vanilla.
Old one was running low, bought a new one last week. Was an A89 grey label (2019). Lasts a while shorter, about 6-8h before only becoming noticeable when nose to skin. Sillage is VERY soft on this one. Starts out very sharp and unpleasant, not sure if overly alcoholic or something else. Dries down to almost pure sandalwood with a trace of vanilla. There's no oud or rosewood present.
If you can get a gold label, maybe even batch A82, this is an amazing sweet oud and present perfume incomparable to any other oud.
The grey label (or at least A89) is not worth getting imo, it just smells like a generic cheap woody perfume without oud with an OK longevity.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I received a 2ml sample of this today and I like it. It reminds me of Bleu de Chanel Parfum (not EDT) though on the dry down. I only sprayed it once. I'm going to give it another go tonight and see what I smell. The opening is great though, just enough oud, I love it, but for me the oud disappears later on in this frag.

Note I haven't smelled Bleu de Chanel EDP since I sold my 100ml bottle last year. My nose may have changed a bit since then.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is probably in my top 10 elegant fragrances that I've smelled. You can put this on any man with a suit and his vibe will change instantly (for the better, of course).

It is advertised as unisex, but I definitely don't feel like a woman (by my standards, of course) could pull this off. It evokes a peaceful, sorted out man, who doesn't want to stand out from the crowd, but does so naturally.

It is one of those perfumes that made me realize some time ago the amazing power of smell. You definitely feel like you're about to accomplish big things when wearing this. Seems to make you more successful in pretty much every aspect when you have it.

Now talking about the scent itself (sorry for getting so passionate) I barely get an oud touch. I get a coffee, sweet smell, tobacco and heavy smell, instantly recognizable. People are saying its sillage is moderate, but I believe it does fill the area are you're in, maybe not a room, but definitely more than 6 feet. No need to get more than 3 sprays on skin, and maybe one on clothes.

A must have, imho. Your 30 ml bottle (for around 110 US dollars) will last you a REALLY long time.

9.75/10.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: TOM FORD as always making unique fragrances out there. OUD WOOD is very well blended oud perfume, it is a perfume that makes you feel you are in a suit even if you are wearing trainers. It is also very unique, in a world full of blues, sauvage and invictus smelling unique is a very nice feeling. It is a very long lasting perfume and projects very well for 6+ hours. It is also a very gentleman perfume, women can wear it too but not their type imho. I have just recently bought this bottle and is growing more on me each time i wear it. It is also very versatile, the best time to wear is winter days. fall and spring for me.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Interesting. After 45 min you have to bury your nose into your arm to get a whiff. Not worth the money. The bottle is cheap, light and plastic feeling. Look else where for your thrill, and also for a scent to just contemplate to because this one is for neither.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Sublime scent, what I find interesting is that most people claim to smell no oud in this. I have some oud chips from Cambodia that I burn on a mica plate that smells very similar to oud wood.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Beautiful! Gentle, classy and refined! Great sillage and longevity. Moderate projection.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The opening is a little scary, pure chlorine. But it changes and becomes a sandalwood fragrance (smells like pure sandalwood oil). For me, there's not even a hint of oud in here. NOT.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Oud Wood is a perfect work scent, and would be a great choice for a signature scent (if you have the money).

I’ve been delving into niche and luxury designer scents recently, so naturally I had to buy a decant of Oud Wood. The first spray I applied to my wrist, and I was met with the smell of chlorine/Clorox that a couple reviewers mentioned. Beneath that smell was a pleasant transparent wood. Also I now understand the meaning of what some reviewers describe as a watery note. I initially had mixed feelings because I loved the woody note and watery transparent character, but was off put by the Clorox smell. After an hour the chlorine note toned down, and deeper in the dry down the amber and vanilla became noticeable. This added a subtle sweetness to the fragrance. And after a couple hours I really liked it.

The second wearing I applied two sprays to my neck. What a difference the location made. The chlorine note was now more of a fresh clean metallic note...much more pleasant. Smelling it up close on my first wearing was the problem, whereas smelling the sillage projecting from my neck was an altogether different experience. I’m not sure if the chlorine note is the oud, but whatever it is,I think this is what adds its watery clean vibe.

The sillage is beautiful, sophisticated, and unique. It doesn’t fill a room, but it projects enough to be noticed. It’s light and transparent, rather than being heavy and dense. That makes it a great choice for work. I normally reapply at lunch with my fragrances, so if a scent can project a couple feet for 5 hours I’m happy. Oud Wood accomplishes this; it lasts 12 hours on my skin and consistently projects about 1-2 feet for over 6 hours. I don’t know if this contains and Iso-E Super, but it behaves like Iso-E does. After wearing it for 10 hrs I thought it was only a skin scent, then I moved my arm and could detect the sillage from my wrist that was two feet away.

Oud Wood is a perfect choice for the office because it is unique, non-offensive, transparent, long lasting, sophisticated, and could be worn year round. It’s probably the next fragrance I’m going to buy. I give it a 9/10...but the more I wear it the more I love it so it may become a 10/10.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I have the old version (yellow). On my skin the long lasting is 12hours+ and the projection is 5-6 hours.For me this is very good fragrance!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I love this! If you have a problem with longevity, 2 sprays at the same spot.

I can smell it 16 hours later! This do not have bad longevity.. maybe the old batches was crazy good, i dont know?! But this will last you all day in the fall and winter.. 9/10

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tom Ford's Oud Wood is a pleasant, warm, synthetic sandalwood and cardamom fragrance but I do not really consider it "oud". I recognise the same "oud" that Tom brought over to the West with M7 by Yves Saint Laurent but there is not much more oud in Oud Wood than there was in M7.

I find this an enjoyable scent to wear (which is rare with the expensive Tom Ford releases) and once upon a time thought this was very special and I would have it as my signature scent. I have since discovered there are much better "oud" frags, better wood frags and better Tom Ford frags (Beau de Jour).

Oud Wood is a good starter niche but I think I am now wanting "better" and more natural scents and ingredients.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I really enjoy this one. It's a clean/fresh oud and it's effin sexy. I have tried the gold label version as well - that one starts out with a very medicinal aroma but as it settles it becomes very deep, warm and sweet. I love spraying it onto my jumpers in the winter and getting wafts throughout the day. So comforting.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I've done a complete reversal on this. I REALLY hated my sample as I was getting a rotten celery vibe from it. Last week, I was walking through a department store and it was out on display so I thought: "What the hell, why not?". Wow.....what a difference a FULL spray makes. I came to realize that, in order to appreciate it, a small and limited sample wasn't enough. I immediately swapped someone my ADP Colonia Oud for a 100 ml bottle of this and I couldn't be more pleased. A very masculine soft oud that makes you smell like a million bucks. Love it!

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: How sad that they reformulated this scent into a watered down nothing version of the original. The original fragrance had a sharp clarity to it, an alien symmetry, of oud and patchouly. The later batches are mostly patchouli. I propose a toast for Tom Ford's Oud Wood, may it rest in peace happily unaware that later generations discredit its name :'(

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: More masculine. Too strong for me. But deep and sort of sparkly.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is beautiful. This is not mass pleasure but its for your own delight.
Spray it, go to a lonely and lovely place, smell it deeply and watch the world move.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
What can I say that hasn’t already been said? It’s the quintessential fall fragrance. Only a hint of oud here but that’s all that’s required for the desired effect. It oozes class but remains alluring. It’s sophisticated but not austere. Just enough sweetness to remain playful while maintaining a charming woody/spicy vibe.

To sum it up in a word: debonair.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This fragrance is not for everybody. That being said, I fell head over heels in love with this beautiful unisex perfume when I sampled it. Since that sample I have purchased 3 more bottles.
