Upon first whiff, It definitely smells of a woodpile. But it's the dry down that makes it my personal favorite. Rich, sweet and warm undertones start to waft up after wearing it for about 2 hours. For me, it stays that way another 6-8 hours, then just gently fades.My experience as far as projection of the fragrance depends on how much you put on at once.Yes, it is pricey. But in my experience as a fragrance afficinado you just know when you find your signature scent. I wear this year round, and occasionally layer it with Yves Rocher Vanilla noir. When I layer the fragrances, I am always getting asked what I am wearing and told how wonderful it smells. Keep in mind personal chemistry and try to sample first. IMHO it's decadent,sexy,and addictive.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I have this parfum. The smokiness from the agar and sandalwood is just lovely. It just reminds me of the 80's when my dad had put on kouros, smoked his cigars and left the room. This one stays 10 hours easily on me. The sillage to me is close to my skin which is perfect. One spray on the front of my shirt around the chest area and i can smell this every time I take a breath. Just wonderful. Certain perfumes are meant to please you, the people around you and the ones you walk past. Other parfumes are meant for only your pleasure. Tom ford oud wood is for my own pleasure. If I want to be loud I use Amouage Interlude for men. The price is a bit on the high side here in the netherlands but in my opinion it is worth every euro.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
It's not that interesting in that it's not something you can pick up nuances in.

Performance wise, 1 spray to the back of the neck (2019 bottle) and I catch whiffs of it still 10 hours later. I wouldn't want to wear more than one spray of it or it. Tried 2 sprays and it was too much and would be loud and would lose all its class because of it.

Performance is fantastic.

A good scent, nothing magical, far too two dimensional to be intriguing, but the quality certainly shines through for sure.

At time of writing, above it is rated at 4.45/5. I would say that's a bit generous as its propped up by its great performance really.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
As a female I prefer Unisex fragrances and use Mugler Over The Musk (My Favorite Fragrance by far), Clean Sueded Oud, Victor & Rolf Spicebomb, Replica By The Fireplace and Atelier Silver Iris. I thought I would love this, but this is VERY strong and MUCH more masculine than the other unisex fragrances I love.

It does smell expensive (nothing artificial here), but it also makes my eyes water and I feel like I need a shower. After wearing Oud Wood for two hours I still am smelling it more than I would like. I think it will be wonderful as a body spray with one shot at a lower level. I don’t want to get it anywhere near my face ever again. It is great that it lasts so long since the price is high and one shot is all you need, so the bottle will last forever. I give it four stars for the silage and nice smell, but still perhaps better a fragrance for a man.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Pro’s: A not too obvious unisex fragrance, well blended, no rose (like a lot of other Oud’s)

Con’s: You may end up smelling like Taylor Swift

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Very smooth and pleasant, almost but not quite seductive scent.

Very well blended and smooth, has a slight hint of oud, yet mostly is a soft, sexy scent that most people would enjoy smelling, while they would run away from a sample of barnyard, fecal oud oil from Arabia.

Could almost drop the word "oud" and just call it "Tom Ford Wood".

Only problem is poor longevity and projection.

Scent itself is ultra smooth and nice.

7.5/10 (would be 9/10 if it performed better)

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Not so bad,very smooth expennsivnes.

name: Oud Wood Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Nice Frgarance, But The Opening can be Off Putting at First sniff and it takes time to transition to the next Step, But overall The Dry Down is Nice & Classy and it lasts for a long Time. Kudos TF.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Absolutely gorgeous, one of the best put together perfumes I’ve smelled.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
NOT your typical gourmand; to me, this is a warm spicy (leaning towards masculine) scent.

It's definitely a fall/winter scent, meaning heavy. I get a lots of dry warm spices like clove, nutmeg, cinnamon or maybe it's the tonka beans. Reminds me of mulled wine but with a cherry base, heavy on the spices.

I'm expecting something more delicious... but this is not.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: 5.5/10. Amaretto liquor and baby talcum powder. Makes me cough. I was tempted to wash it off but once the powder dies down it improves to heliotrope sweet cakes. That first stage is quite rough and not for the sensitive sniffer.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: One of my favorite fragrances to wear. Dark enchanted forest fairytale vibes. Mysterious, dense, sugary sweet my friend considers this too masculine and I cannot even make an attempt at understanding how she got that impression. To my nose there is nothing masculine about this fragrance although it can absolutely be worn by a man. Feve smells like it could have been from the house of Lolita Lempicka (before they began watering their fragrances). This is absolutely perfect for an enchantress like myself who performs magic spells beneath the light of a full moon. Absolutely incomparable and one of the most magical and addictive fragrances I’ve smelled in quite some time. My goodness this is amazing through and through. When casting spells this is what I reach for.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I like this, but its another Fragrance I will be giving to my BF. Its a bit too masculine for me, but Ill absolutely devour him when he wears this.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Christian Dior! You used to be the best in the Designer Game Man!

This fragrance is the reason why! Roasted Tonka Beans, Cherry, Lavender, I Mean come on man! This is French perfumery at its best!

Then the Blue Goblin came to our lives! But thats another story!

The reason i Respect Dior so much is because he pushed the boundaries of the Designer game man!

Beast 12H Plus! Even on my "Bad 2018 Version" That is!

Masterpiece 10/10!

Oh and before i forget! DO NOT TAKE THIS OUT OF THE GAME DIOR!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Am I the only person who doesn't like this perfume? I don't hate sweet perfume at all, but the initial blast from this is aggressively sweet. The the spice is not the type of warm spice I normally want - its like sniffing a packet of dry spices. Overall, its too harsh for me. I prefer Tobaccolor and Spice Blend in the same vein from MCD.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I get cherry and lavender and lots of Powdery smell happening. Dry down is a dry vanilla Smokey. I didn’t love it

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Perfect autumn. Perfect chocolate. The perfect gourmet fragrance.
Blissfully calm, like the morning when you don't have to rush anywhere. Warm, like a favorite blanket with funny reindeer. Soft as a curled-up cat. Sweet as the aroma of hot chocolate from the open door of a small cafe. Dark and deep, like an autumn park: dusky lavender, leather-vanilla: a forgotten glove on a leafy bench. The alchemy of autumn, turning gold into copper...

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Gourmand unisex.
Gourmand with a hint of sourness (the citrus) and floral (lavender+ fresia) that will develop in a sweet creamy and powdery skin scent.
Personally among notes I cannot detect cherry and jasmine, but the rest is there and well blended.
It is unique and definitely a masterpiece. 4.5/5

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Perhaps foolishly, when I started my fragrance journey, I was determined to try every cherry note out there. Deep dark cherries were one of my mother's favourite things to eat growing up and I get a little teary eyed smelling them, thinking about bowls of cherries shared over the kitchen table with her in my youth.

FD...firstly, this is what I wished Guerlain LPRN would be, but isn't. I immediately get cherries and am brought back to the kitchen table with my mom. There is a warmth to this fragrance, a sweetness, brought by the cherries, and the ever so slightly powderiness of the lavender and tonka bean. It is very smooth, very well blended and brings me back to my childhood somehow.

I don't like fruity and powder at all but the way this is composed, I don't notice any one note being harsh or sticking out.

Longevity is wonderful, 6-7 hours on skin, silage is strong - you can go gentle on the trigger.

Overall 7/10, personally, but 9.5/10 overall. This is not one that feels like me when I wear it personally but holy crap, does this do something to me. One of the most beautifully blended fragrances out there.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Wow. Smooth multilayered fragrance. It’s powdery/vanilla/tobacco. It is complex and beautifully blended. It was a must buy at first spray. 10/10 from Dior again.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: This one is one of the most amazing fragrances I have ever smelled and I have smelled a lot but I don’t get the feeling to write a review that often. Keep in mind I have 2016 bottle and I never smelled the newer 2018 reformulated version which people say that it’s different. First when regular no -fragrance interested people smell this they are amazed with its quality and they keep telling me it’s a 10/10 when I ask for a grade, plus they ask me where they can buy it. This is an amalgamation of gourmand, classy, sexy sort of scent. I’m gonna cherish that 2016 bottle for a long time since newer ones don’t have a good reputation. Love this.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
This is intense baby powder mixed with sweet cacao powder and caramel. From the initial spray until the dry down it is very linear.

The other notes are there but they are really toned down and you have to look for them to notice.

This has a really synthetic vibe and that is really off putting for me.

It is cozy and nice for the cold weather but nothing special. Definitely not worth the hype and the price tag for me.
I only have a sample and I would not buy this for its price.

That said I do not think it is bad . It is just ok.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
First spray out of my sample decant and I was like whoa..amazing, then it was strange and spicy. I kept smelling something spicy like cinnamon on my skin(weird, I know). 30 mins It was too sweet. More almond/cherry than vanilla.Very powdery and floral by my nose. I was thinking a little too mature for me and hey- I'm in my 40s so there's that. I was glad I just had a decant.

Two hours later, I am totally digging this. It's turned into an elegant gourmand. Wow. Cozy, warm, gently sweet vanilla. If you like a gourmand that's not so "in your face" this is it. Not much for projection. More projection than AV Orchidee Vanilla but less than CD Hypnotic poison.

I am totally down with this! Amazed at how this unfolded and looking forward to what's to come.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
wow... I am writing this right after trying it for the first time. Now this is how you should do a gourmand.. very skillful handling of praline, cacao and caramel with LAVENDER , CEDAR and of course very prominent tonka, vanilla and cherry notes... I am speechless!

It’s not like other oftenly poor made overpriced niche gourmands, the ones smell like you mixed every note in your hand and came with a weird synthetic-sweet mash overload with some notes trying to peak up but always subdued by the caos of the fragrance.

Feve Delicieuse is so well blended but you can appreciate every single note on it‘s own. The leather note becomes relatively more recognizable as it dries down, despite this being rather a linear fragrance. BUT even though the “sum” of the scent is linear overall, the notes behave like they are dancing under the roof of the ballroom of this fragrance! When I smell my arm continously, 1 second praline shows up and then leather, then tonka and the vanilla come onto stage carrying the cherry on top of them, then praline again gets front of them hand to hand with cacao and the show goes on with cedar and lavender being the back up dancers. OUT OF THE WORLD QUALITY!
The only downside is the projection is on the lower side but I am too hooked on watching the show even if it’s not a loud one.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Lovely, spicy gourmand fragrance. Smells absolutely delicious. For me, this dries down to a nice vanilla after hour 3. I will always have this in my collection.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior opens with notes of lavender, mint, vanilla, leather and benzoin. It seems more masculine than feminine to me. There is a warm and thick familiar powdery scent lingering in the background, similar to baby powder. Tonka, cacao, caramel, yes, they are all there. It’s been two hours, and as I’m searching for each individual note, it hits me- this smells identical to A&D ointment. For those of you with no children, A&D ointment is used as a preventive for diaper rash. NOT SEXY!
Is my extremely sensitive nose not working correctly today, I wonder? I will wait a few more hours to see if the notes evolve from A&D into the masterpiece this is hyped up to be. And, I'll get some evaluations from my lovely, trendy teenage daughters.

It’s been four more hours. The fragrance has not evolved past A&D ointment. I am disappointed. My daughters summaries: Daughter #1 (22yo): Smells like baby wipes; Daughter #2 (21yo): Just like kids cold medicine, Daughter #3 (17yo): Smells like Avon Skin so Soft that we used to repel mosquitoes as kids.

This fragrance, although odd IMO, does perform great, longevity and projection are both top notch. But, I don’t want to smell like diaper ointment, so I’m taking a pass. I will return this bottle.

Rating: 1/10. It's not overtly offensive; its just not sexy or appealing in any stretch of the imagination.
Compliments: 0/10.
Projection: 8/10; Sillage: 8/10; Application: 4 atomizations. Performance: 9/10
Ages: None. I don’t know anyone, at any age, who wants to intentionally smell like diaper ointment, so I’m leaving this blank.
Blind-Buy: No, definitely get a decant and sample this first. And, get some honest and candid opinions from someone you trust before you spend $250 on a bottle of this.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
-Reminiscent of JPG- Gaultier 2, a discontinued scent.
-More powdery and feminine-leaning than Gaultier 2.
-It's a nice, spicy scent.
-Not fbw. (-)

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: a favorite of georgie, the fragrance apprentice <3

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: A leatherier and fruitier Tobacco Vanille to me, which makes this one a little more masculine imo. For ladies looking for a gourmand, Xerjoff Italica (Pre-2021 reformulation is like saffron fudge) and initio side effect is even better for a cherry tobacco.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Hm. This is not what I was expecting. On me this leans more masculine than feminine. So I’m giving this to my boyfriend. I like the smell but this isn’t my cup of tea. And yes I can totally understand what people are saying about the baby powder. So weird!

Edit - After an hour this smells like cola! The cherry cola! With some creamy powdery note. It’s fresh. I think I like it now!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I don't know what I was expecting but it does smell exactly like some of the reviews here.
I expected something more vanilla, earthy and smooth, however, this is a bit more loud than I expected.
At first whiff: Baby powder - not iris type of powder vibe but actual powder, Spicy - Cinnamon isn't in the notes but I get that spicy tingle in my nose perhaps from the mint, Cherry - which I actually do not find a pleasant note in any perfume so I'm perplexed why I thought I would love this, Then there is something somewhere in the middle of the sour tart cherry, light talc and spice is a comforting, smooth, familiar and warm touch. Maybe it's the tonka/vanilla/milk.
I do like it more after it chills tf out. The chocolate, caramel and praline smooth out the spicy a bit.
Doesn't smell cheap, quite the opposite actually. Not my signature, glad I didn't blind buy but may put on every once in a blue moon for something different.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
@Dubsy

Just contact Dior, you still can get this one by them.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I got a sample of this fragrance before committing to a full buy, and boy am I glad. On me, this unfortunately smells strongly of baby powder, with hint of cherry and leather/wood. Oddly dusty. Not enjoyable at all and very different from what I was expecting. Would not recommend as a blind buy.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Dior Feve Delicieuse EDP opens with a strong projection of sweet, lactonic, gourmand, and fruity notes. The opening is delicious, refined, bold, inviting, and delightful. The milk, praline, caramel, cacao, sour cherry, and vanilla are the opening most noticeable notes. The chocolate, milk, praline, caramel, and vanilla mix their notes into a lactonic, dessert-like, and delectable accord, intense and delicious. The sour cherry is also noticeable, a candy-sweet, tart, syrupy, with an almond touch fruit. As the fragrance commences to dry down, the tonka bean develops a sweet, spicy, caramel, and nutty accord closely follow by the ambery and the sweet resinous touch of the benzoin and, the creamy milky, and warm touch of the sandalwood. The leather is the projecting accord, a mild inoffensive leathery touch in the background. The jasmine, freesia, and lavender are support notes, a faint touch in towards the back of the fragrance. The fragrance is relatively linear, the bergamot is a faint touch during the opening, regardless, all featured notes come up as soon as the fragrance is applied and continue into the dry down which occurs very quickly. Once Dior Feve Delicieuse EDP has reached its full dry down, it can be summarized as a strong projection, fantastic, sweet, vanilla, cacao, caramel, praline, cherry, milk, and resinous fragrance with leathery, and faint floral accords. The fragrance feels ambery, appetizing, bold, casual, comforting, creamy, delectable, delicious, dense, dry, elegant, energizing, exotic, expensive, fruity, gourmand, high-quality, inviting, slightly leathery, long-lasting, milky, modern, natural, nicely-blended, nutty, resinous, rare, rich, romantic, seductive, special, sweet, syrupy, unique, unisex, warm, and very pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2020 (#9A01).
WOW RATING: 10/10. A lactonic, fruity, chocolaty, gourmand, and delicious fragrance.
DISLIKE RATING: 1/10. The fragrance is very sweet but well-blended.
UNIQUENESS: 10/10. The notes and resulting scent are unique.
MASS APPEAL: 9/10. Lactonic, fruity, and chocolaty notes are crowd-pleasers.
PROJECTION: 4/10. Moderate, about 4 feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 6/10. Moderate, about 6 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: 4 atomizations.
LONGEVITY: 7/10. Excellent, about 7 hours, it projects well for over 4 hours.
SEASONS: Winter, spring, fall, colder days, daytime, nighttime, and climate-controlled environments.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, office, business, casual, holidays, vacations, romantic, dating, clubbing. This is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 6/10. A great fragrance for casual and formal wear.
GENDER: Unisex. All featured notes, lactonic, fruity, and chocolaty, are unisex.
AGES: 25 and above.
RECOMMENDATION: Dior Feve Delicieuse EDP can be purchased for $200 (4.25oz). An exquisite and delectable fragrance ideal for those that appreciate its main notes. This is a great buy.
BLIND-BUY: No, sample it first.
SIMILAR: These are examples of fragrances in the same genre. Dua Fragrances Beauteous Delight is a very good clone of Dior Feve Delicieuse; Guerlain Spiritueuse Double Vanille is a great boozy, and vanilla fragrance; Kilian Black Phantom EDP is a fantastic, intense, delicious coffee, boozy rum, sweet caramel, and dark chocolate fragrance; Kilian Back to Black is a great, honey, tobacco, almond, and sweet fragrance; Montale Chocolate Greedy is an intimate, very sweet, cacao, vanilla, and tonka bean fragrance; Nishane Fan Your Flames is a great, intense, rum, tobacco, woody, and tonka fragrance; Paco Rabanne Black XS EDT is a delectable, mild, very sweet, praline, and tolu balsam fragrance; Parfums De Marly Oajan EDP is a great, intense, spicy, cinnamon, sweet, honey, vanilla, tonka bean, and resinous fragrance; Thierry Mugler A*Men Pure Tonka is a great, intense, sweet, tonka, coffee, and cacao fragrance; Tiziana Terenzi Al Contrario is an exquisite, malt, woods, cacao, and sugar cane gourmand fragrance; Tom Ford Noir De Noir is a great, mild, roses, patchouli, oud, vanilla, and truffle fragrance; Tom Ford Noir Extreme EDP is a great, delicious, sweet, dessert-like, and floral fragrance; Costume National 21 is a delicious, ambery, milk, vanilla, and tonka fragrance; Mancera Choco Violet is a very good, mild, tasty chocolate, vanilla, and hazelnut fragrance; Hugo Boss The Scent Private Accord EDP is a good, unique, short-lived, sweet vanilla, Maninka, coffee, and cacao fragrance; Mancera Roses & Chocolate is OK, a mild, dry, sweet chocolate, vanilla, and light floral fragrance; Dior Feve Delicieuse EDP is a fantastic intense, sweet, vanilla, cacao, caramel, praline, cherry, milk, and resinous fragrance.
SUMMARY: A strong projection, fantastic, sweet, vanilla, cacao, caramel, praline, cherry, milk, and resinous fragrance with leathery, and faint floral accords. The fragrance feels ambery, appetizing, bold, casual, comforting, creamy, delectable, delicious, dense, dry, elegant, energizing, exotic, expensive, fruity, gourmand, high-quality, inviting, slightly leathery, long-lasting, milky, modern, natural, nicely-blended, nutty, resinous, rare, rich, romantic, seductive, special, sweet, syrupy, unique, unisex, warm, and very pleasant.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I must say this perfume is a total disappointment for me. After years and years of using other Dior scents, I was expecting for this so called prive collection to be the best, reason why I really wanted to buy and try one of these. I need to start with the longevivity... oh, god, this is the weakest perfume I ever tried from Dior. After 3 hours I can barely smell it on my skin.
Also, I don't really smell the top notes at all. Only a bit of cherry and then tonka and vanilla with a small hint of cedar. As others said, this is not gourmand at all. It dries out into a very powdery scent. For me is 3/10.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: This was a blind buy and I do not regret this. I was expecting a 'masterpiece' but I would not call it that, It is a very lovely fragrance however. It smells exactly like pears baby lotion :)

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: This reminds me of the bottom of my mother's "pocketbook" from the early 1970s, but in the best way possible. This is a total comfort scent to me. It reminds me of the comfort and mystery of the pocketbook, where from the depths would ocassionally emerge a cherry lifesaver candy or aged mint and a tissue, just when absolutely needed. The cherry and mint of the candies, the powderyness of a Guerlain face powder and an waxy-scented lipstick in a metal tube, as well as some of the dust of an aging packet of tissues all being cradled in the depths of the high quality and somehwat aged soft leather of the pocketbook, bring back comforting feelings of when mother had it all under control and knew exactly how we should behave. Mother carried only the best leather bags, and the leather is very high quality here, so it smells like the softest leather ever. The cherry is strong on me at first, but eventually blends well with the powderiness that eventually settles in. This is one of the most memory-evoking fragrances I have ever smelled. I'm thinking of many Sundays, mother dressed in her finest with lipstick on and face powdered, carrying her leather bag and gloves, but I'm falling asleep in the old Gothic-style church with my head eventually settling next to the handbag, nodding off while watching dust particles sparkle in the streams of light through the arched stained glass windows, hearing the faint crinkling from the woman in the pew behind opening a mint...

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
While this is a very very good scent, I’m quite hesitant to call this gourmand to me personally.
Yes it sweet, yes it’s rich, yes it’s dense, and yes it has gourmand notes.....but smelling it doesn’t really make me feel like I wanna eat it or make me feel like it’s food or make it feels super sweet.

It’s more just like a really nice powdery sweet scent.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Also a wonderful tonka bean scent. The tonka bean is refined with vanilla, cacao, praline, caramel and a touch of cherry. This fragrance is a gourmand bomb with a fantastic shelf life and a great sillage.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I am not sure what some of these reviewers are smelling, but this is an absolute gem! If you are a gourmand lover of perfumes as I am, then this is heaven in a bottle! The fragrance starts out with a warm, spicy, lactonic, amber, cherry, and vanilla notes. Then comes this amazing mouth watering dry down of the most luscious gourmand notes of cacao, caramel, Tonka bean, praline and nutty accord that anyone can imagine. Yes, it's powdery, soft, spicy, and absolutely delicious as the name implies. The projection is above average as is the sillage and longevity. This is luxurious, classy, and it smells expensive! A beautiful evening and date scent, and can be worn year around, but a standout in colder months of the year.

My 3 P's
- Price 7/10
- Projection 8/10
- Performance 8/10

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I was really looking forward to trying this but boy was it a let down, it smells like baby wipes and that’s as accurate I can be. I didn’t enjoy the opening or the base notes and unfortunately smelt like baby wipes all day. It’s not worth it at all.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Literally talcum powder. One note: baby doll.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Hi! If any one has pre-formulated (2014-2016) bottle of this Feve Delicieuse for sale, please let me know! I would love to buy it from you. Thanks!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I really like this perfume, although I'm not getting that winter vibe everyone talks about. It smells like toys from the 90s, mostly like plastic, or baby doll heads. It's among my best scents so far but only for nostalgia it creates.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: A warm spicy blend, in which I might be tempted to distinguish cinnamon, cocoa, vanilla and even a note of dark (and perhaps bitter) cherry. Sweet and powdery, but not exceedingly so. Androgynous, yes, but perhaps tilting more towards the feminine side. Summing up, I would say it's a good way to spend a solitary evening by the fireplace, sipping from a cup of hot chocolate and dreaming of Christmas...

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Man, this is what I love about perfumes. The notes are those but each one of us lives a personal and unique experience! To me, this is such a comforting scent and I do not agree that it's an attention seeker nor it is a standout perfume. On me it grows like a skin scent and it's very warm. Like literally the sillage smells like a sweet, cinnamon-y heat. I get a sour vanilla on the drydown with a hint of powder that somehow manages to give it a cleanliness which is hard to find in gourmands. Don't overspray, this juice is potent!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
It's so complicated scent..
I don't like the opening it's more masculine but I enjoy the heart it's more better and more delicious to me,the dry down is too Powdery which I don't prefer.
I am really hesitate whether totally like it or not..
5/10

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I like tonka and I like Dior, but I do not like this fragrance, especially on a woman. Personally it smells like a late 20's man with an above average sense of style who likes to go out for drinks and flirt with women (or men). Obviously he likes sweet fragrances because he wears Feve Delecieuse. My problem with it is that there are so many distinct accords happening at the same time, all at such intensity, and it smells as though the wearer is trying very hard to be noticed. It's powdery, sweet, balsamic, woody, spicy, fruity, leather, floral, everything but the kitchen sink, and the sum of its parts are greater than the whole. It is an absolute bomb, a beast, a room filler, so you are committed once you go in with it.

I'm not the demographic for this fragrance. Maybe my husband has a friend I can pass my decant on to.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I was very excited to try this perfume, because I love tonka bean notes. I am very disappointed. At first the powdery notes hit me hard. I am not fan of that. Five minutes later the scent recedes to let the cherry stand out. One hour later it disappeared on me. Sadly, no tonka on my skin.
I would rename this Cerise Poudre.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I'm getting a mixture of praline, cacao and some medicinal spa-scent, which is a bit weird. And I think it suits mature women.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
This is an interesting discovery from Dior.

My first thought:
Bougie cocoa-flavored play doh.

After a few minutes I get mint, tonka, and cherry.

This isn't a powdery play doh in the vein of Dior's Hypnotic Poison EDT, but a spicy, minty play doh. Gourmand but refreshing.

The dry down reminds me of "Chocolovers" by Aquolina even though there is no orange note here. Isn't it funny how you can remember a fragrance you haven't smelled since 12+ years ago?

I could almost see myself rocking this despite the fact that I tend to wear girly cake bombs, but I hate leather in perfume. I would definitely love to smell this on a man, though. It's sexy but cozy.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Strong, sweet, and powdery. It's an attention-getter, but not my personal favorite...definitely for cooler weather. I think it'd asphyxiate anybody near you on a hot, humid summer day. Overall, 6/10..

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Caramel baby powder

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Feve Delicieuse by Dior has a very strong, even sharp, avid start. The leading note of the composition is tonka bean. It is known to connoisseurs of perfume for its sweet, almond-like aroma.

The almond tones of tonka are enriched here with heaps of dry cocoa with a clear boost of something floral and dusty.

Then this cocoa tempest quiets down and reveals a flickering, potent tonka bean. In the great sea of this ingredient there are other notes sunken: tobacco and cinnamon. Cocoa takes on a more chocolate form while caramel starts shimmering somewhere and vanilla takes the scene. From now on, smooth vanilla penetrates every single note of the blend.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I blind bought this and because of the notes and reviews I thought I would like it. I didn't at all. I thought maybe I was going crazy so I gave it another chance. I tried both on my skin and on fabric. I didnt like neither. It smells like play doh . I am suprised this isn't mentioned because it smells exactly like play doh. I am just grateful I got the smallest bottle available. I really thought I got a fake for a second but I got directly from dior.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I got a sample of this from Ebay and initially I was so hopeful as it has that sexy dior golden smell but then suddenly, to my horror and revulsion.... play dough. The smell of play dough makes me feel sick and even when I see play dough now unopened I feel sick.
Gutted!!! It could have been so good. It could have been love.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
My hopes were high-high in the sky with this fragrance, I couldn't wait to get a decant of this and when I did... disappointment. The opening is weird, but this I sorta knew already, so I waited for the good side of this to show up and waited and nothing good really came to my nose. This scent sounds good in theory but it's not so good in practice. I thought it will be gourmand and delicious, hence the name, but it seems harsh and weird. Performance wise this left my skin in maybe 4-5 hours.
In my opinion, not worth the hype, nor the price.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Mine arrived from Dior, and I really like it. I think it might turn into a love. The initial spray and first few mins are so not my favourite. I cannot describe the opening, but it is strange, "off" and very chemical like.

Luckily, the not so great opening softens and the tonka, vanilla and soft woods come out. My skin is really picking up a sweet tobacco note and dry cherry too.

On my skin this is like a very posh combo of Versace The Dreamer, TF Tobacco Vanille and a soft boozy scotch note. Overall, I would say this is an excellent Blind Buy (so far) :)

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Warm and cozy but very sweet opening with minute traces of a slightly herbal lavender. It quickly goes to the heart and what I get is a nice mix of cherry, florals, and tonka bean. The mid is very cherry liqueur like, and I'm glad it's kept in check by the supporting notes. I can detect some white florals as well. The liqueur accord gives the whole composition a slightly boozy quality which does smell nice on the skin. I have to mention that the whole structure is obviously very gourmand in nature so for anyone who detests sweet/gourmand notes, this one is not for you. As time goes on, it gets a bit more powdery and then the vanillic aspect comes into play as well. It doesn't smell like straight up vanilla either, but Demachy has once again blended this very well which means it transitions smoohtly from top, heart, to base notes. The drydown is still powdery sweet with a nice lingering tonka/vanilla accord. I really enjoy sweet fragrances and this is as sweet as I'd get. Luckily the blend here is exquisite and dare I say fairly elegant.

Performance is great, will last for quite some time with decent projection. More of a cold weather scent but could work in spring or cold summer nights as well. Suitable for casual, romantic settings, or office wear if you watch your application. Unisex, leaning slightly feminine, but a man who appreciates gourmand scents should pull this off without issue.

8/10

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Wow, this one is lovely. I was a little shocked at the smell of the initial opening because it didn't smell gourmand - I was wondering what the heck people were talking about. It shortly dries down though to powder, tonka, with a little bit of vanilla which is gorgeous. Definitely unisex. Quite soft, no big projection here. Very comfortaing. If I didn't know any better I would have guessed this was a Guerlain fragrance, as the tonka reminds me of Mon Guerlain and there is some leathery vanilla that reminds me of Shalimar. I am happy that I tried this.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I am a Guy when I wear this women follow me around supermarkets really obviously. Having said that the only time I wear this is when I go to the Supermarket.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Yes. Yes. Yes.

Look no further. This is it, all that ever was, all that will be. Alpha, Omega, all that.

Don't question. Just get it. No, don't. I want to be the only person wearing this.

It's everything.

Warm, cosy, soft, hard, feminine, masculine, edible, drinkable, huggable, wrestleable, sweet, savoury, just-been-pregged girl falling asleep in boyfriend's jumper. The kind of boyfriend whose armpits you want to sniff all night; when he smiles you change your underwear.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Cocoa, vanilla, tonka and caramel.... what i was thinking? I can't stand overly sweet perfumes.
This one is well made, yes it is not just another scent, but for me it is so sweet and strong longevity i will not wear it. Had a decant of it, so will swap.
I recommend to try first.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Really wanted to love this. It’s not bad in anyway just not as decadent or warm as I expected. It really has a strong baby powder smell. If they got rid of that, it would be amazing.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Now this is a very beautiful scent! Just received a decant of this - I get a really sweet caramely tonka and I smell the chocolate as well in this. I'm unfortunately wearing this in summer right now as I'm trying this - I would definitely save this for the fall/winter. But yeah, definitely beautiful!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Blind buy!!!!

It's very comforting and warm, the tonka is amazing and very well rounded with the other ingredients. I definitely smell vanilla, soft woods and cinnamon all surrounding the tonka. It is a skin scent, doesn't create a big cloud around you. Unisex and beautiful.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: So I blind bought.....again! This time it was a hit! Oh dear Lord above - this unisex fragrance is gourmand HEAVEN! A briefly harsh opening of almonds warms down quickly to a magnificent blend of Tonka (oh so soft),Vanilla, Caramel and Coconut maybe? But the Tonka is so beautiful. This smells expensive and is divine. If you love gourmand scents then trust me on this one. The bottle is beautiful too. I understand the Christmas vibe that some people get from this - there is some cinnamon or clove in there too. I guess this scent would really come into its own during Autumn and Winter, but I love it so much I will wear it all year round. Now that we are in quarantine I have been expanding my burgeoning perfume wardrobe. It helps me to escape from these four walls into lands unknown and affords me a little bit of luxury every day. Keep safe everyone. Smell you on the other side! :)

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Early on in my fragrance journey, I tried this, and loved it. Couldn’t find a fault in it.
Now that my tastes are a bit more refined, I have tried it again, and determined that it is much too powdery for me. I am surprised by the accords listed here.. it is not very sweet in my opinion. much more powdery than sweet.

Then again! I’m just now realizing that I tried this when the weather was cooler.. Maybe I’ll set this aside until fall.
I am always so surprised by how the weather affects how you perceive scents

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I just tried this briefly because it is so hyped. I don’t love it that much! It’s sweet without any edge or nuances. Actually I was shocked by Hypnotic Poison too- just root beer and playdough. Anyway I will update as I sample it more. ATM I much prefer my beloved Myrrh and Tonka.
Update: It is confirmed. This one I do not need in my collection, yay. Because it is expensive. And yesterday I just sprang for one of the last EDP bottles of Roja Enigma, which was an instant obsession for me. Eff the “pour homme” on the bottle- c’est pour femme! Pour moi!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: All I can say is thank goodness I sampled this before buying it. This is so not me. Where to begin? This is a powder bomb and supposedly it has a lot of gourmand notes. I can definitely get the cocoa powder. It smells like it’s made out of it in fact. The other note that is quite strong in this is the leather. This isn’t a smooth fragrance it has a rough texture of powder. I don’t get any caramel or cherry. I do get vanilla and a LOT of wood. The leather and woody notes make this somewhat masculine and earthy. I was expecting a very smooth gourmand and this is more of a cocoa powder bomb with leather, wood and some vanilla and like an earthy smell. Yes! The cut hay! It sort of has a hay texture. Different but not my jam.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I was so excited to try Feve. It's so hyped up I was originally going to buy it blindly, but wisely I picked up a decant... Thank god I did.

This fragrance for me was very underwhelming. It just feels 'unfinished' to me. It kept me wanting more. I kept thinking, is that it? All I heard was how this fragrance was Beast mode. NOT!!! Well at least for me it wasn't. I like to smell my fragrances, and I don't want to constantly sniff my clothes or wrists to find it.

Don't get me wrong it's a nice sent. I like it very much, the I love the sweet tonka bean comfort of the fragrance... and it has this powdery cotton candy like texture to it; but for the price, I have other gourmand like scents that perform much better than this one for fraction of the cost.

I'm still on the fence with this one. I do want to buy a bottle but I know myself and will have buyers remorse later... I will finish using my decant, hopefully it will grow on me and maybe I'll change my mind but for now it's just not working for me.

EDIT 3/23/20... This scent is growing on me. Starting to really love it. It's a creeper. Didn't love it out the gate, but becoming more addicted to it the more I use it. Still not the best longevity for me but I do get 4-6 hours out of it, so not too bad. Still don't know about it being beast mode, but it's FB worthy for me now... especially with the rumors of it being discontinued.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Looking at the notes and I just don’t understand what is going wrong here, seams like everything I would absolutely love but it’s not working with me, I tried multiple times and nope. Still no love here or honestly even like.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
My impression:
The opening is sweet and powdery with a cosmetic bag vibe. I get rich dark vanilla and Iris
The middle dry-down remains the same but more fluffy and all together softer, with a hint of play-doh, and cherries
The final stage of the wear has minimal change from the middle stage a little softer, but the projection is solid.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Recently I ordered decants of three popular fragrances from the Dior Prive line. (Ambre Nuit, Bois d’argent, and this) This is the winner for me which is saying a lot because I love all three. This mainly smells like cocoa powder and cocoa butter as well as tonka beans. However there’s lots of little nuances I pick up on like the caramel and benzoin throughout the life of this fragrance. If you’re a fan of Noir de Noir I think you’ll love this too. They’re very different scents, however, I think they appeal to similar tastes. Both powdery and sweet. This is the happy go lucky cousin to that fragrance. Just a cool, confident and super warm and charming person whereas noir de noir is dark and mysterious. I adore this fragrance and will have to pick it up for next Autumn. The performance is also really good on this and it lasts me a good 6 hours of solid projection before becoming a skin scent.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Introduction by François Demachy: This perfume is delectably tempting and sweet, yet never cloying. I chose exotic Tonka Bean for its slightly bitter roundness. This is a mouth-watering treat that nevertheless retains some mystery." Fève Délicieuse is one of those fragrances that impel any perfume enthusiast to expand their possessions just by feeling shame or offense to the perfumistic gods for not having in the closet such a perfect work, so pleasant, so round, so full of harmonized elements to please. Fève Délicieuse is something like, for a man, a full and milky female breast: something absolutely irresistible and that you want to try all the time. When spraying, wait 10 minutes for the perfume to settle (until then there is a crazy disharmony), and feel the delicious dry down where everything is submitted to the cocoa king: a cocoa as it appears in the image of notes-grid: pure, powdery, aided by a cloud of delicious things - caramel, sweets, bitter cherry - the third layer at the bottom of the gourmand is the dusty woody floral with makeup aspect, but under control and of high quality. The WOW factor here is the harmony of so many layers: usually perfumes like this - high quality - cause a storm and impel the aroma in several directions at the same time - but here everything goes majestically in unison. I can't think of a perfume MORE unisex and undefined in gender than this one - perfect for men and women to appreciate themselves and their acquaintances. A work of art that requires being in the closet of any connoisseur of delicious smells.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Its a gourmand that smells classy and upscale.

Very well blended and unique.


Last 8hrs.
Smell 9.5/10


lOVE IT.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
this is a delicious gourmand fragrance. Very sophisticated imho.

I'm a man, I liked it but... it's not for everyone. Can be too feminine for some guys. Only the bold guys will be able to pull this off...


8/10 for the scent

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Wore this for the past week ( while being sick so I tried my best to get myself into this one, being my first time with it )

When I smelled it initially, I honestly thought I’d hate it.

It’s, to me, a baby powder type of bomb initially.
While it calms down, it’s still prevalent. People say from the Tonka bean ( has a vanilla powder smell to it ) I don’t know what a Tonka Bean smells like, but if this is it, then there you go.

Overall, I enjoyed it, Is it something to run out for? You seriously need to try and test it for yourself.

While to me, this is a beautiful, powdery fragrance, this is not going to be for everyone and it would be wise to try and sample it before running out for it. It is not a cheap one.

I will personally have this in my arsenal, I do enjoy its composition overall.

Because of it’s powdery nature, it best fits in the cold weather for sure.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I was in Dior yesterday 04.12.19 (Cape Town, South Africa) and when I asked why this wasn't in their display on perfumes, I was told it was being reformulated and they only had one bottle left. So if this version is your holy grail - snap them up before it gets re-jigged.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
The Tonka bean here is very well rounded with cherries, vanilla, praline, caramel, lavender, benzoin and all of these notes that tries to compliment each other that's why it's giving off a ethereal powdery vibe. It smells like when my mom asks me to get something inside her bag full of makeup, money, and perfumes, lipstick, this is what I smell. The cacao here is not chocolate milk, cacao bean, or dark choco, it's cacao powder. But it's good it's unique, I could drink the bottle and die from it. Not the best gourmand but the most unique. It also smells really high class, elegant and high quality. This is exactly the scent of what I imagined inside a dior beautiful boutique smelling test strips. Really Unisex, my mom says it's really masculine but for me it's really feminine. It is really in that level of genderlessness.

This is better than tonka imperiale imho. I think guerlain was not informed that tonka gets really sour on skin it smells like dried saliva on 4 hour mark, so i think dior added cherries, and their powdery signature to prevent the tonka getting sour on skin.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: This instantly reminds me of pdm Oajan only a lot weaker in every way , very disappointed.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
This is my winter comfort blanket, the tonka is so, so good.
I adore this one, it is a shock if you are not into gourmand or unisex. This is an acquired taste and not for a newbie frag lover.
But once you fall in love with this you will be in it forever!!!
I will always own a bottle.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Smells like a baby powder coated maraschino cherry. I cannot.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I HATED the opening when I first sprayed this and couldn't understand why it was so much money. Then the dry down happened and I loved it. Just when you think it's gone the beautiful vanilla smell taps you on the shoulder to say hey i'm still here.

I'm a sweet perfume lover and this is like the rich cool aunt of my sweet perfumes.
Sadly I'm not rich so I just buy the samples of EBAY when I want more of this.
I would wear this for a posh event

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: indeed # 1 without comparison .

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I owned a bottle of this and sold it to someone who loved it in order to make room in my collection. I love this fragrance, though. I just didn't wear it but somewhat regret the sale.

The scent itself is very bitter in the beginning, that is until it dries down to a warm and creamy vanilla / tonka combo with a bit of cherry in there. I purchased this thinking it'd have something in common with L'Homme Ideal EDP (which I love) but I was incredibly wrong. This is a totally different beast. It's effortlessly sensual and elegant. Good for dates and neck nuzzly goodness. Easy to overapply but also pretty sexy when overapplied.

I have no idea how this compares to the 2018 version. Hopefully it's just as good.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
First you get bright tonka bean and vanilla, then sweet tonka bean, then powdery tonka bean, and finally buttery tonka bean.

A sensual and delicious gourmand of the highest quality - one of the best!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I misunderstood this fragrance because I listened to all the reviews that told me it was a winter scent. I tried it in the winter and the aromatic quality on my skin gave me a minty, cool vibe that made me think it was a ghost with no soul. I was told it would be too cloying in the summer. From this point on, I am going to try ALL my “winter” scents that didn’t work for me THIS AUGUST. Due to the airy nature of this perfume, it totally works for me in the summer, and now I feel bad about bashing this one. It is the best tonka bean ever and is a fantastic substitute for those tiresome “citric summer scents” that I have been wearing all summer, while thinking in my head “Well, I am supposed to be wearing these fresh citruses”. Wrong. Sometimes, those fresh citruses turn sweaty in the dry-down in the summer, while sweet scents don't. Not all skin chemistry is the same, and nor is the climate of where you live, so a winter scent JUST MIGHT only work in the summer, as does this one on me (and today is hot). It is not overbearing at all, and all the negative facets of this perfume that I smelled in the winter are not apparent in August. I spray far away from my arm, just one spray, and it turns into a freshie this summer.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I get a strong vibe of baby powder from this - could be the vanillic notes combined with the powdery cocoa. The slight bitterness of the caramel makes sure the fragrance doesn't get too cloying, and overall this isn't a syrupy, sticky scent; instead, it's a fluffy powdery one.

Around an hour or two later, the tonka bean becomes more prominent, giving it a bit of hay-like nuances. However, when blended with the baby powder notes from the opening, it somehow becomes violet-like, which I'm not a fan of.

This is undoubtedly a well-blended fragrance, but it's a pass for me. Maybe it's my skin chemistry.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Kinda disappointed, wore it several times and used 3 of those little 7,5 ml bottles, but this fragrance is nothing special and far from the best gourmands. This smells like a fragrance that hasn't been finished yet, like there are some notes missing. This is definitely not a blindbuy worthy fragrance.

Scent: 6/10
Longevity: 8/10
Projection: 6,5/10

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
this toes the lines between gourmand, resin, aromatic -- and toes them elegantly. yes there's the sweet undertone that grows more prominent over time. but the soapy hints (lavender is especially clear on me) never go away completely. and the woods/resins hold their place too.

unisex, leaning feminine (in my opinion, as someone who prefers unisex scents that lean masculine). wonderful performance.

for the baddies out there, this is something a bit more subtle yet unique. and for the more conservative sprayers looking to branch out, here is a great start.

this will never be a revolutionary heavyweight champ of a scent, but it should not to be counted out.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
i am going to be honest, i do not know what a tonka bean is supposed to smell like(i hear similar to vanilla)
to my nose when first sprayed it smells straight up like baby powder.. then it turns woody, i smell ceder & sandalwood.. hints of vanilla, the almond comes through a bit bitter. this fragrance is the best definition of unisex! like its as unisex as it gets, it really could go either way..

my opinion overall.. i like the fragrance quite a bit, does it live up to the hype? meh.. like i said its okay, a good fragrance but for the price? i get more compliments from savauge & if i were going to buy a fragrance for my woman i'd probably get her joy.. with that said, i don't dislike this fragrance but i enjoy other fragrances from dior better.. definitely sample before you buy, i wouldnt be upset if i blind bought this but there are fragrances i'd rather have first personally.. with that said, get your nose on this one for sure. even though its not an absolute favorite of mine it gets a thumbs up from me

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Ok, I never thought I will ever find and try this perfume. I used to love Dior before the "reformulation game" started with my signature called Miss Dior EDP-2012.

They used to advertise it as a gourmand masterpiece and yes it is! I would agree 100% with someone compared it with Poison Girl's vibes. Tonka bean is the key. For me it's like a baby of Pure Poison EDT (very first edition in the bottle where you can wear it by the cap, no spray) and Poison Girl EDP.

I am the one who used to say wear your perfume no matter the season but this one is a perfect for winter. I use to wear Poison Girl EDP during summer that gives a complete different character compared to cooler climates. I am really curious to see Feve Delicieuse during the heat. So, if you're a lover of Tobacco Vanille from Tom Ford or in general gourmand-rich vanillic fragrances, that gem shouldn't be missed from your collection! It's completely unisex, maybe 55% feminine-45% masculine.

It starts with a blast of spices, I would put my hand on fire I can detect asteroid anise, but it could also be the combination of cedar + sandalwood or the touches of leather-benzoin-cacao-a bit of indolic jasmine too. You can't detect something clearly but definitely tonka bean is the main star. So, a warm oriental opening followed by an overdose of sweetness that doesn't let it be sickly sweet. The lasting power is amazing as well as the sillage. It's like a time travel perfume. For a reason it reminds me of hugs with my God mother back to 90's, probably she is a Dior girl. In a few words, a unisex gourmand masterpiece that is as classic as modern, strong, nostalgic, warm and intense, rich, very well blended, vanillic but bitter too, a true compliment getter that is not going to disappoint anyone. The only reason I wouldn't buy it is that I already have similar perfume types. Vanilla lovers, go and smell it now!!!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
OH MY GOSH...THIS FRAGRANCE IS A MASTERPIECE!!

Truly i don't think i have ever come a fragrance as complex as Fev, yet so well blended. Looking at the notes it seems like the notes are all over the place: lavender with cherry? Caramel with milk? Mint and bergamot? The notes would make you believe that it would be a VERY WEIRD smelling fragrance.

This is also a journeyed fragrance; as time goes on more and more of the notes come out to where the perfume literally changes.
It opens with Tonka Bean, then the lavender and cocoa comes out, then the dry down is vanilla with those woody notes. But to put it simply:

Opening: Tonka Bean
Middle: a powdery lavender, cherry soap
Dry Down: Vanilla, woods with a hint of hay and powder

I also think that this is a fragrance that can be worn all year round. I do think it's strong so maybe it's not completely suitable for the intense heat, but it isn't overly sweet. Just go lightly on the sprays and it would be great.

This is probably one of my favorite niche fragrances i have tried so far.

Amazing, amazing fragrance!!

Scent: 9.5/10
Longevity: 9/10
Sillage: 9/10

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I’ve bought decants of 2015 Fève from 5 different person. 1 have strongest cherry notes, 1 have beautiful golden strings of praline lingering in the sillage, 1 have skunk mint notes, and 2 of them was powdery bright. Even the 2015 which heralded as the grail batch has many differences. My favorite was the one with praline golden strings in the sillage, it’s easily hit that elusive fresh baked cake notes.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Feve Delicieuse is a beautiful and very edible scent. It lasts and performs admirably and does indeed garner positive reactions, especially form ladies. It is very unisex and would work fantastic on either sex. It brings a feeling of happiness upon wearing and is easily one of the tastiest scents out there, without being over the top sweet. Overall, i highly recommend this one for cold weather.

Longevity- 8
Performance- 8
Compliments- 7
Scent Character- 9
Overall- 9

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: This instantly reminded me of Mon Guerlain wow! Has that similar powdery milky vanilla dna with the lavender hibernating underneath. Tons of tonka bean, tons of powder, very dry very dusty powder. This is too similar to Mon Guerlain that i decided not to keep it. Very nice scent and very well made, just too familiar.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I've bought a 5ml decant of this. The idea of it is nicer than it actually is. Too sweet, too gourmand. Buy a 1 or 2ml decant first. I can't even think of the correct setting to wear this? Inside next to the fireplace on a winters day? No, not even then because it's just too much.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
If you added cedar to Poison Girl and removed a third of its sweetness, mixed half part Mon Geurlain and smoothed the edges you would have Feve Delicieuse.

Edit 3/15/19 : My previous review didn't give FD enough credit. I've been wearing it more and still stand by what I said, but it's deserving of a more thoughtful review. It's not just Poison Girl+ Mon Guerlain+cedar, it's more substantial and refined than those, especially in the opening. The essence of the fragrance, namely the dry phases, is where my mind goes to designer Dior+ a few other things.

Feve D by all accounts is delicious. I think of cherry amaretto soaked spice cake every time I smell it. I like it a lot, it's cozy. I know it's a Dior by that tonka note. It's the same tonka I find in Addict as well as Poison Girl. The opening is wonderful, but when it dries down it starts to lose me. Long lasting, yes.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
This perfume has been raved about so much that I needed to give it a try. However, I found Fève Délicieuse to only be a strong like for me. There is something missing to wow me into making the purchase.

I find the scent heavy and warm, but projection is lighter. After 30 minutes it becomes a skin scent on me.

It’s not super sweet, and is a well blended gourmand, but there was nothing special about it. I didn’t bring my wrists to re-sniff them.

I’m glad I only got a sample. Sometimes it’s hard to go against the grain on something that is such a huge love for so many people. But it just wasn’t the gourmand scent for me. For the price, I recommend sampling the scent before blind buying.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I really like watching videos on YouTube about perfumes and this particular scent has come up several times. I became kinda interested in it so I ordered a 5 ml decant.
Well don’t get me wrong,it is not a bad perfume ,far from it actually. I really liked it,it smelled of beautifully blended quality ingredients yet ,to me it just doesn’t justify its price. It smells like a delicious mug of cocoa with a generous portion of cinnamon, a hint of coffee and vanilla. Maybe due to the praising words I expected something extraordinary but it is a pleasant gourmand and that’s it.
Silage is not too strong on me ,sits pretty close to the skin but that’s okay I can smell it. Longevity is tremendous,8-10 hours.
So all in all I think this is a great scent but it is not as complex as I expected (and hoped for).

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: alicechang, probably what you bought is a watered sample. I tried at the store and the longevity on the paper was for days! I don't trust guys on ebay.. buy from dior!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
In one word ... stunning.
One of the most complimented fragances in my collection. Cacao, Vanilla, Cherry, Tonka, Caramel, Praline, but not too sweet ... amazing smell. Suitable for women and men. One of the best gourmands out there.
Incredible performance, more than 15 hours of longevity with great sillage.
My bottle is the "reformulated" version and for me, there are no differences versus the first one.
Another masterpiece from Mr. Demachy.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
@alice chang: Try looking for a small decant on eBay. There are plenty of sellers. Even though this fragrance is gorgeous, it is too expensive to blind-buy.

There is no food to compare it to. It is a gourmand, but it does not smell like food or dessert. It is a very special kind of gourmand. Very airy and transparent.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
To people who actually own a bottle of this and no matter where you are from...

So, I am just curious as to whether you think it's worth it to buy the whole bottle (Which costs hundreds of dollars for a starter size of 125mL) or I should try out decanted ones first?! I personally just got into fragrances the last couple of months and heard so many good things about this one especially I'm a girl who's still in my mid 20s and I have figured that I'm into gourmand sweet/floral (esp rose)/fruity scents mostly (I also like floral woody scents I find recently). This is my first review/question post on fragrantica (I've been obsessed with reading about these perfumes as I went about on this perfumery journey). I've been looking to build my small perfume collection (I own about 15 perfumes now). Do you guys think this is a worth buying? I'm looking forward to your response. :)

If you were to describe this scent as food what would you say it is? I really am hoping this smells like some sort of dessert.

EDIT (19/12): I received my decant 30mL from eBay. I made sure I bought from a reputable seller. However, it just sprayed out & smelt so watered down (tried few sprays still the same). Maybe it's because of the spray head of the atomiser? Still...it spreaded out like body spray more like water on the skin with my fingertips and had no sheen on the surface of my skin just like a body spray comparing to the other decant I purchased from him (Hermes Ambres Narguile). It didn't smell like it would last long either even after three sprays I could already tell it's gonna disappear in an hour. I also tested it with a recent purchase of mine - Kim K's Pure Honey which ironically smells even stronger than this decanted Feve Delicieuse...Is my nose going crazy or what?! I am very concerned at this point. I have messaged the seller. The Hermes Ambres Narguile decant I bought from him seemed fine though.

He just got back to me and said his bottle is from 2018 March and said he had few people asked him about the batch year. He said he did just decant straight from the bottle. I will have to find that out by going to a Dior Boutique in Sydney and smell the actual thing. I won't leave him feedback till I find out the truth.

EDIT (20/12): It did last quite a bit but I wouldnt call it strong (definitely not as strong as Aventus for him & for her nor B2B by Kilian.) Yes so I think I received a genuine item, its just that this perfume formula is more watery than I am used to. It is still pretty strong though. projected for a few hours and lasted on the skin for at least 8. Sorry for causing misunderstanding guys.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Best gourmand ever!!You can tell they used good quality ingredients to create this long lasting beauty!!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Ok now, did the comparison between 2015 and 2018 on the 2018's profile.

The fragrance itself is all about tonka (which is pretty obvious). Shows plenty of layers of that note and is a complex beast.

Opens up with a delicate and smooth citrus blast (hard to say which exactly and it's only a twist for me). And soon the main star swoops in.

It is a very vibrant fragrance on my skin and there are plenty of facets it shows on my skin. The main themes are tonka, almonds, cherries, soft sandalwood, milky aspects, hints of chocolate, leather, dark cocoa, a pinch of coffee.

Actually these are notes that I can detect and didn't look into the notes breakdown.

It is a fragrance I'm still getting familiar with. Surely it's cozy, comforting and gathers plenty of compliments. And the sweet tooth aspect is there - if you don't like gourmands, it may be cloying for you.

Average longevity is 15 hours, sillage is quite big so 2 sprays are good for me. If I want to smell like Feve but less "invasive" I spray one spray on my chest or on the front of my neck and I'm good to go.

Gets me compliments, but I use it during fall nights or in winter (both day,evening and night outs).

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Gawd, but I am a sucker for that tonka bean; it rids me of my usual cynicism,
so I procured my bitter self a healthy dose of straight-up tonka essence, but unfortunately, it’s not really great on the skin by itself, tantamount to applying pure Madagascan vanilla bean extract behind your ears in order to smell like custard; it’s all down to those pesky molecules, and how large or small they may be. Tonka bean is nearly spot-on anise + cherry tobacco + fresh hay + a pinch of cocoa (for me) without the bitterness or acidity, and tonka done well isn’t an easy task. This “Delicious Bean”, however, is precisely what it’s meant to be; tonka bean executed superbly. A true tonka triumph (say it five times at top speed—I dare you)...

If I only enjoyed what the myriad bloggers and critics approve of, I wouldn’t appreciate, much less own a good portion of my collection; good for my bank account, bad for my soul. FD is as sumptuous in the heat of summer, as it is in the autumn, and I find that it’s even better tucked away in valleys of warmth, like the inner elbows & thighs, cleavage, and between the shoulder blades, where our wings used to be, before we fell to Earth.

Utilising the typically cool, almost mentholated lavender & mint as mixers in a cosy gourmand have the potential to go very wrong, like cucumbers in a stew, or fried watermelon. However, the aromatic features of both are blended expertly here, and lend clean warmth, not medicinal aloofness, and combined with the leather, sandalwood & cedar, the results are nothing short of a seriously grown-up (but not at all stuffy), balanced gourmand, that’s all cognac and no cookie. FD : A*Men as Godiva : Hershey’s, simply dependant upon preference, and I think that fans of L’Occitane’s original fragrances, such as 4 Voleurs, Eau des Baux, Vanilla Bourbon, etc. may find their “signature” here.

Aveda used to carry the most wonderfully aromatic herbal tea that contained a goodly dose of anise, and although totally sugar-free, it was subtly sweet to perfection. FD is a bit reminiscent of the aroma and flavour of that lovely tea, and in fact, wouldn’t be out of place in Aveda’s (sadly, and bafflingly, discontinued) home fragrances line.

A few of the reviews posted here appear to be for an entirely different fragrance from the one in the 2015 (batch 5T01) bottle that I own. I have the massive, 250ml bottle, so if anyone wants to try 10mls at a bargain, please shoot me a message; I’ll never use all of this in a hundred years, seriously.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Four sprays from a sample after my morning shower and... I got nothin'. It's light, pleasant, elegant, well blended, but that's it. Safe for office wear, but I don't work in an office so I will give this one a pass.

Tonka, vanilla, spice, tobacco, and all the good stuff I was looking for, but much too light to notice. Several hours in, I don't get any mint, medicinal notes, or powder. It's a very nice skin scent, but toooooo soft. Dial it up a bit and I'd wear it often.

If you appreciate delicate and beautiful unisex* fragrances, go for it.

* I think this would smell delicious on a guy who is comfortable wearing a fragrance that doesn't shout. However, I'm a "petite woman" who prefers a lot more drama in my perfumes.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: I do not smell anything gourmand in this cocktail. Infact it is very green, herbacious, medicinal. Dries down to minty almond mixed with baby powder. Did not like this at all

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: The opening is very impressive, sweet, complex gourmand, just enough lavender, lots of tonka...drydown, not for me though, mint emerges which I am not a huge fan of, very powdery, dry and leathery, a nice drydown for powdery / leathery minty scent lovers.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Tonka bean, tonka bean and tonka bean. I had originally bought a decant for myself, which I passed on to my brother. I find it masculine and not suited for myself. Though I must say it is very well executed and excellent for men. Just not for petit women, it stands at a contrast.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
So without looking at the notes I will describe my impression of how it smells.

It's like a combination of tobacco leaves, iris , and caramel, maybe some sandalwood too.

It's thick, sweet, and elegant. It leans feminine in my opinion.

Excellent quality juice.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: it smells fantastic, the best gourmand i ever smelled! but i can find some similarities with guerlain l'homme ideal edp, because most of the notes are the same!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Note: This review is for the 'reformulated' version. The comparison with the vintage is at the end of the review.

My girlfriend sprayed ONE spray on her wrist and distributed it on her other wrist and on her neck (this was a sample spray, which is not even a third of a bottle spray), one hour before meeting her. The sillage was wonderful, smooth, soft, airy. She smelled divine and I could not stop myself from taking every chance to inhale this beautiful scent cloud. I could smell her the entire day. The next day, when I woke up and snuggled up to her, I could still smell it! This was 18h after the initial spray.

It has around four hours of soft/average projection (40-50 cm). After this, it get closer to the skin (±20 cm) for another four hours. It finally becomes a skin-scent and slowly fades away, eighteen hours after the initial spray. Keep in mind that this is one sample spray, smeared out over four pulse points.

On her it smelled sweeter than it did on me and I could smell more vanilla. On me, the tonka bean note turned more bitter, which made it a bit more masculine. However, in my opinion this fragrance is more on the feminine side.

After spending a divine day in this cloud of deliciousness, I managed to pick up a 125ml 'vintage' bottle for a very gentle price.

Reformulated:
Scent: 12/10 (On my girl)
Projection: 10/10 (Soft, like a fragrance like this should be)
Sillage: 10/10 (Silky smooth sillage, lasts 8h+)
Longevity: 10/10 (18h+ on skin)
Versatility 9/10
Uniqueness: 9/10
Price-performance: 7/10 (Can be a bit pricey for some)
Total: 9.5/10 (This juice is a near perfect gourmand)

Vintage:
Scent: 12/10 (A bit more rich than the reform.)
Projection: 11/10 (A bit heavier than the reform.)
Sillage: 10/10 (Feels a bit thicker, but still silky smooth sillage, lasts 9h+)
Longevity: 11/10 (20h+ on skin)
Versatility 9/10
Uniqueness: 9/10
Price-performance: 6/10 (Vintage is a bit expensive on eBay. Not different enough from the reformulated version to justify for the higher price)
Total: 9.75/10 (I did not include the price)

I can honestly say that you do not need to search for a vintage bottle. I can imagine that when you only know the vintage Fève, you will be slightly dissapointed with the reformulation. However, even though the vintage is a bit thicker and richer, the higher prices on eBay do not justify the little bit of extra quality you get. Just get a bottle of the reformulated juice. It is still a 9.5 for me.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
This is my second review, my previous one was deleted. I have been trying this scent further and I stand by my original thoughts - I get mint, lavender, woodsy-incense and a sweet plastic. I picked it up because of the gourmand notes, especially the praline, and all the great reviews for it. I was and am disappointed it hasn't worked for me.

I think this is a scent that should be tried before purchasing.

For all the gourmand ingredients in its base, the top and middle ingredients that are not gourmand unfortunately take over the entire experience for me.

Update: This review is for the 2018 release, not the 2015. It should be on the other thread, now that it is also dated and the two have been clearly set apart from one another. I will add my review there as well.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Don't believe a word that Luca Turin writes about this fragrance. It's not boring or banal. It's a warm tonka-based masterpiece that lasts a pleasingly long time without being "in your face". It makes an excellent masculine fragrance.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I am a huge fan of gourmands and after hearing and reading that this is supposed to be the ultimate gourmand scent, and based on the notes, I was expecting to really love this. But I don't. It's nothing like I expected.

I have a 10 ml decant of this and I will probably just give it to my sister, if she happens to like it. Glad I didn't blind buy a full bottle.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
I had super high hopes for this, based on the reviews I saw here... but I was personally disappointed.

I don't think there's anything "foodie" or "gourmand" about this perfume. To my nose, it's a very dry, woody vanilla. I don't smell any of the other nuances that other reviewers have mentioned (caramel, booze, spices, etc)

It's not terrible or anything... just not my thing.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: @tyriel that's about how long it lasts on me, but my skin is on the dry side and absorbs scent. You could try buying another decant from a different seller and compare?

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
This is delicious and a complete crowd pleaser!

I got a sample (not sure about which batch) and have worn it a few times and it garnered compliments from more than one person each time. Especially women seem to love it, which surprised me - I thought women like 'butcher' scents on men, and this is decidedly unisex.

It's a heavenly, creamy, slightly spicy tonka/vanilla/caramel with an interesting 'clean' streak - there are moments where I feel I almost smell whiffs of citrus or classic men's cologne in there, and then it reverts back to a decadent gourmand. The projection and lasting power are excellent, too. It easily lasts 24 hours on clothes and even on skin it lasts about 4 hours with projection (strong at first and then goes down to medium) and then becomes a skin scent for another 4 or so.

I'll put this on my 'love' list just because of its crowd-pleasing abilities!

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: JennRollins, yes all of them are reformulated! The 2018 edition is different from the first one! Try to find the old formula which is more deeper and rich.

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew: Not a review. Just wondering if the newer bottles are indeed reformulated? And if so where can I get a bottle of the original formula?

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
reivew:
Dark Gourmand.

A Masterpiece. BEAST in every single category. Words can't describe how good this fragrance is. $200, $400, it doesn't matter. This fragrance justifies any price tag and puts all other in its category to shame.

Projection and longevity is scary. High quality offering from the House of Dior, but nothing surprising. I pray to the heavens this never gets reformulated.

10/10

name: Fève Délicieuse Christian Dior (unisex) ~ 2015
