UPDATE: If you are lamenting the poor longevity of Un Jardin en Mediterranee and are not averse to trying a fragrance inspired by it, may I suggest Babylon by Alexandria. In fact, I like Babylon even better than UJEM. And that's saying something. Babylon stays better and has a richer feel. Granted I may not be the most sophisticated nose on the block; but, to me, Babylon is bang-on. Babylon matches UJEM's notes almost verbatim. I think Babylon's creator, Hany Hafez at Alexandria, is a genius. More accessible price point than UJEM. Great value (unless for some reason you have to have Hermes).

Even though UJEM is classified as floral aquatic, I detect something slightly sweet in it. Maybe this is attributable to the fig (leaf) note. Not nearly as sweet as a gourmand or any of the fruity sugar bombs out there, though. Just a hint of sweetness. It serves to make this fresh, green, summery beauty all the more interesting and complex. I fell hard for this one, Luca Turin review notwithstanding! Pity UJEM has so little staying power.. I realize it is only an EDT, but still...

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
This really is like layers of silk sheets moving and changing in front of your face. It reminds me - a lot actually - of the spicy/woody dry down of Declaration d'un soir Cartier.
But this changes more. I smell this and think hmmm interesting and go back to look for that same note on another sniff but that note is replaced or metamorphosed, one of the silk sheets has moved exposing a slightly different facet.
Fairly versatile for the Jardin line.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
What a rollercoaster!

One of the most complex and multi layered fragrances I have smelled so far.

It starts with a big blast of fig leaf and cypress. So astringent and bitter... I was not blown away with the opening and disappointed at first.

After 10 minutes the acidity is curbed and now floral notes come to stage. So realistic, nostalgic, Mediterranean. It brings me to the springs I enjoyed during my childhood in the west coast of Turkey.

The floral notes live on quite a while, together with fig leaves. Totally unisex, totally natural. For me this is the ultimate smell of spring, innocence and freedom.

Quality: Excellent,
Silage, longevity: Adequate.

A must smell, especially if you are into natural smelling fragrances.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I consider this a masterpiece. At first is smells exactly like fig leaves. Reminds me of summer at my village where we used to cut the figs straight from the tree and eat them. It's dry and sweet. It's fresh and but not very soapy. And then dries down a bit floral from the flowers but still the leaves linger on. Extraordinary.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: if you like this you may also like calvin klein ck2. ..not in2u... the ck2.... fig + cypress in this one behaves like wasabi smell on ck2. .. minty vibe fresh leaf smell... i like both

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Un Jardin en Méditerranée Is the most dried woody in the line.
After trying all the Jardin line, this is kind of most dried in the family, it open with strong “fig leaf” not fresh not watery, but dry... sometimes it reminded me of real dry tobacco leafs, it naturally smell of fig leafs (very very natural), surround by “Jardin’s DNA” that’s green, spice and crisp. When the concept is Méditerranée I always imagine about “sea note” in it but no, there’s no sea note, or salty in this fragrance. This fragrance doesn’t change so much from open to dry down... it keep as fig leafs and green and stay that way.

Scent : 8/10 ( Very very natural fig leafs scent and niche quality )
Project: 7/10 ( A little bit less than La Mousson, but better than another)
Longevity: 6/10 ( 4 hours mostly)

I can’t say I love this scent, but have to accept this quality scent, it so naturally and relaxing... probably not my most favorite in the line. Anyway if you love the niche quality and fig you may probably love it.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I received this fragrance in a splash bottle and applied it as such. Un jardin en Mediterranee is a refreshing burst of oranges and lemon tempered with light florals. It is also green herbal and rich. The longevity of this EDT is surprising. It has been 5 hours and it is still very strong on my skin. It is performing beautifully on this 86 degree day. I purchased the travel set with 4 of the Un Jardin EDT. Can't wait to try the others as well. This is full bottle worthy. Great for hot, steamy weather.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I smelled it the first time at the airport after my holidays in Sardinia and I fell in love. It was a scent of summer! It's fresh, sweet but not powdery sweetness, for me smells like a herbal/ fruity tea not in the synthetic way. Absolutely beautiful. Everything about this product is great, the smell, the colour, the name and the bottle. And it is Hermes, it wasn't cheap. How surprised I was when on my first day of wearing it no one noticed. It last on my skin for an hour only! Completely not compatible with my skin.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I got a sample of this years ago, and found it to be way too green and masculine at first smell. But the more I've sampled it, the more I like it. I know people say fig but for me I mainly smell the cypress; it's fresh, peppery, and grassy. It warms up a bit as it dries and the cedar appears. I don't know that I would ever buy a bottle of this (my husband hates it, and though I like it its not something I would want to smell like all the time), but I think its unique and enjoy it immensely on occasion.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
This one is really nice out of context, but not worth the money.

The fragrance is beautiful and perfectly encapsulates summer or early autumn in the rural Mediterranean (I should know, as I am from there!)

The fig is intensely green, crisp, fresh and uplifting, and the bergamot perfectly accompanies it. The other notes listed don't really register for me, but they might just add more 'depth' to the fragrance. It's very naturalistic and evocative. It really does smell like home.

It also, to my surprise, smells almost exactly like Acqua di Parma's Fico di Amalfi, but it's noticeably cheaper. So here's your pro tip for the day!

Just like Fico, though, it's plagued by soft silage and very little longevity. It's gone within the hour, even on a cold day - I'll assume that on a hot one it would evaporate almost immediately. Beautiful and I'd definitely buy it for significantly cheaper, but not for its real price.

Why is it so damn hard to find a fig perfume that has any longevity?! Fig is technically one of my favorite notes, but every perfume I've tried is anywhere between weak and very weak! Any tips are welcome.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Did anyone else thought thait it smelled like hops or beer? I did...It’s a pretty nice and well-blended perfume but the “beer-like” note on my skin turned me off. It could be all the woods and amber mixed together or the fig leave - not sure. I will give it another try in the summer and see if anything changes.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Fig, strong cedar, cypress and glowing greenery, citrus that shines warmly, but dryly. I want to cry its so beautiful. It's juicy yet dry which is genius and not common. Great work, Ellena. The beach rose makes it lovely and without it it would have been too astringent. Now - perfection. My man and I go to Leros each summer. It's a perfect island in the Dodecanese islands in south eastern Greece archipelago. It smells just like this there. Paradise. Grassy and bright, earthy and dry, smooth yet because of the stunningly realistic citrus aspects.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I have a sample vial. This is very nice, it is mostly green and citrus to me. When I smell this I picture going to lunch on a hot sunny day on a Caribbean resort. Or stepping out of the shower in your villa on that same day, before an afternoon nap.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
After spraying: seared wood, sticks + tobacco
After 5 minutes: out from underneath emerge notes of rose + geranium + lemon balm + savory + iris note in the background (reminds me of Hiris).

Wood of deciduous species is similar to that in Eau Des Merveilles, the combination of rose, geranium and seared sticks reminds me of Cabaret Gres.


Interesting dry and bitter scent, three dimensional, spacious, elegant.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I agree with kwanpekyee.1 that this perfume smells a bit similar to Diptyque L'Ombre Dans L'Eau. That being said, while Diptyque leans more feminine with its dose of violet leaves, Un Jardin En Mediterranee leans toward masculine side of the spectrum.

For me I'd prefer this to Diptyque, but it's just a matter of preference. Diptyque is more refined, comes only in 75ml flacon edp, hence it's more pricey. This one is an edt in a 100ml flacon and can be bought at half the price of Diptyque.

Try before you buy.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
it baffles me that this smells exactly the same as Doptyque L'Ombre Dans L'Eau on me in the dry down..smells like stale tobacco...

Feel so sorry
I love all the leafy notes in both..

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Divine fragrance - it starts with a blast of fig, woods, so live, fresh and strong. develops into subtle and barely perceptible pine forest by the sea after hot hot summer day

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This is going to be another gushing review for another Ellena masterpiece. Un Jardin En Mediterranee is dominated by the fig leaf, not the pulp. I don't pick up any sweetness, and it's this lack of sugar that makes this a fabulous dry, aromatic Mediterranean scent. One of my summer favorites, and one of my favorite scents with fig.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Nectar of the Gods. Ellena is a genius.

Dry fig leaves, cypress/juniper, and overripe fruit backing in the sun. A bit like a certain kind of grape becoming a raisin. Dry and dusty. There's sunlight in here, and just a hint of an distant sea. It is a little mystery to me why it doesn't appeal to some, but perhaps they have not wandered through a mid-summer orchard or a vineyard with the sun beating down upon them. Love this scent. Makes me a bit homesick.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Fig then Floral. The thing Ilike is that unlike other fig fragrances this one doesn’t have that over alcohol lysed quality.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This one smells awful to me, reminds me of Calyx by Clinique

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
This is my favourite Jardin, hands down.

Sur Le Toit has rose, which doesn't work with my skin.

Monsieur Li and Sur Le Nil are too heavy on the citrus for my taste and so is Mousson while also being too spicy and masculine for me.

But Méditerranée does everything perfectly. It manages the fine balancing act between feminine and masculine magnificently, just like it does with its spices, its citrus and its florals.

It's mostly a fresh spicy scent to me, somewhere in the drydown a very understated, gorgeous floral comes in and the citrus (and again, I hate citrus) is really just a slight complementary note all the way in the background.

This reminds me of warm summer evenings along the Mediterranean or Adriatic. It creates such a vivid image, which is something that I adore in fragrances.

This is absolutely perfect for hot, dry days.

On a negative note I have to mention that while its longevity is very good, its sillage is modest at best; something that holds true for most of the Jardin line.

I've just bought a big bottle of Cartier and have pretty much blown through my perfume budget for this month, but oh my, am I tempted.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I like it and it smells indeed evocative of the Mediterranian, but also very familiar. I rummaged in my perfume cupboard and bingo! Jeanne en Provence Bouquet d'Agrumes +cypress+fig leaf+cedar+50€ = Hermes Un Jardin En Mediterranee. The difference is that UJEM evolves with time, becoming greener, lighter and more aquatic, whereas BA does not (take it as a good or bad sign), smelling from beginning to end like an orange blossom and mandarin peel. Neither one lasts more than 3 h on my skin. I want to believe that UJEM is done with better materials, but, regardless, in the first 15 min I cannot tell them apart. AT ALL. I would buy Un Jardin Sur Le Nil and Le Jardine de Monsieur Li again and again, but there is no point in repurchasing this one.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Sweet and fruity.

/ Slight idea of fig
/ Mostly sweet blend of fruits and florals.

Pleasant but could use some complexity.

7/10 | Poor-Mediocre Performance

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
This is an interesting scent: I tried a few sprays in-store and it opens with an impressive recreation of my countryside childhood with fresh green odours of what smells to me like nettles and dock leaves but it disappeared within 15 minutes.

Once back outside, the hot sunshine and humid air seemed to revive it for a few hours. Pleasurable but very niche.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Collectively the Hermes Jardin collection has really mastered the summer scent. If you're anything like me and you're ready to expand your summer repertoire beyond tropical, coconut scents and the 27th attempt at eau de sunscreen (I have yet to be sold on anything outside of the true original Bobbi Brown Beach, and the EL Bronze Goddess from the Tom Ford collab), this is a really sophisticated avenue to try.

This fragrance in particular is like a wonderful vacation. Less fruity cocktail drink by the pool and more time spent in the outdoors, lakes, rivers. Green fig leaf is pretty irresistible to me, but the cypress really makes me think of standing amongst some big wonderful tress in the hot sun.

For reference, this scent is VERY similar to Rosabotanica, but also to the much more affordable, lesser known CO Bigelow Cashmere Fig. A more distant but still identifiable relative is the Banana Republic 79.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Excellent scent from Jean Claude Ellena. Opens with a green fig and woody note that is wonderful. After the initial spray it takes about 10 minutes on me to hit it's stride and develop into a rich fig/woody scent that isn't sweet. Drydown is the longest yet best part of this frag. Could be worn in pretty much any occasion.

Sillage is moderate, but longevity is more than average. After spraying this on my hand at night, the scent was still on my skin after waking up in the morning.

This is my second favorite of the Hermes Jardin fragrances by Ellena, just behind 'Sur le Nil. My favorite fig based fragrance.

I'm wearing it today, and on a whim I layered it on top of Guerlain Vetiver, and am LOVING IT! The fig/woodiness of UJEM compliments and tones down the spicy Vetiver, making a more complex and interesting mixture.

My rating of fig-based fragrances are as follows with my impression of them:

1- Jardin in Mediterranee by Hermes: Fantastic natural fig/woody fragrance with 6-8 hour longevity

2- Noble Fig by Ferrari: green fig/sage with decent longevity and minimal sillage

3- Fico de Amalfi by Acqua di Parma: light fig/citrus blend. Summer fragrance with minimal sillage and longevity

4- Figuier Ardent by Atelier Cologne: sweet/green fig with milky citrus. Sillage and Longevity are moderate/good

5- Ninfeo Mio by Annick Goutal: very green leaf/ivy/citrus scent where the fig takes a while to emerge. Decent sillage/longevity.

6- Zegna Milan by Ermenegildo Zegna: Simple fig mixed with Iso E Super. Lasts a while and sillage is moderate

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: My favorite of the Jardin collection, and the only fig perfume I can actually wear. Fresh, uplifting, green, and so modern. Jean-Claude Ellena is a master!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Out of all the Jardin scents, this one is the weirdest. I love a fig note but this one just smells a bit weird. I get more dirt and the smell of tar after it rains. Figs do have a strong earthy smell, but this one really capitalizes on that. I also get a lot of green in the opening, which I'm not a huge fan of mixed with the earth, and a strong cardamom thing going on. I'd have liked something sweeter at the top to temper the weird.

Finally, it dries down into a gorgeous, fruity-fig with a clean but never soapy floral-ish note. This dry down is heavenly and makes me imagine wearing Blue-striped linen in a Hamptons house, tan and worry-free. It's so beautiful!

I'd say because of the top notes (which last a while) it's more for a man because it's too unfeminine (but still not overtly masculine). It's weird but definitely worth a sniff. This lasts the longest out of the Jardin scents and smells very sophisticated.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
LOL! :-D "Heavy rain", did you mean women's panty liners? I can somehow understand the comparison, after all, this is an aromatic/green/fresh spicy scent (and e.g. chamomile is used in the afore mentioned ladies' products).
Well, I tried to use this in the mediterranean summer (last summer), but came to the conclusion, that this is more of a mediterranean spring scent. The perfume evaporates too quickly in the summer heat. I bought this because of the fig accord, but must confess that I prefer the Fico di Amalfi (Aqua di Parma) to this one. Letting go a little of the unisex scents, the winner of the fig category for me is the oh so modest Eau soleil by Biotherm.
Still, this is my favourite of the "jardins" series by Hermes.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
A slightly woody floral with a southern european feel.

Fig tree, cedar and mastic tree blending with orange blossom, grass, bergamot and white musk. The fig note is not as creamy as usually found (i.e. in Philosykos) but more of a "green" fig. It's unisex but leaning slightly feminine, fresh, green and quite natural. A little sweet and a little sour, but the fig is still the main player here. I find it quite light (as with others of the Hermes Jardin line) but again, this makes a great scent for smaller spaces like airplane flights, as it's quite subtle and not overpowering. Projection dies down after a couple of hours and it becomes a skinscent. Very peaceful, casual and calming. Unfortunately, my GF found this scent to have a slight "urine" vibe when I wear it, so the bottle ultimately had to go.

BTW, am I the only one, who's reminded of the smell of a greenhouse with this one?

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I really liked this from the first spray...but I was disappointed later on...i love the top notes of this perfume but after a couple of hours they give their place to something typical floral..nothing stands out anymore! Typical and inoffensive...such a same because this perfume really captures the Mediterranean spirit and scent ..i just expected something more

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Most interesting and longest lasting fig fragrance I have tried so far. Definitely dries down to a whafting cedar wood but the fig is still there too. I very much like how dry this is - no sweetness that I find ruins fig frag.

I get mainly fig and cedar with a just a smidge of soft musky floral and even less citrus. At a loss for the pustachio, but I do get a tomato steam / fresh green garden vibe. More green than milky notes compared to other fig frags. I love the whole Hermes Jardin line and this is my new favourite I think. Lasts 8hr on me
⛤⛤⛤⛤⛤

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I love fig fragrances, and so I really thought I would like this. Based on all these reviews, I guess I must be the only person in the universe who doesn't like this fragrance. The opening is SO strong and the cypress is so overpowering that I couldn't even. The drydown wasn't much better for me. This has a masculine vibe. Sadly, every time I smell my wrist my face scrunches up and my head begins to shake no. Cypress smells a bit like cedar. I don't want to smell like either one.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
There is a beautiful feeling in this Jean Claude Ellena creation, and it's as if suddenly all the receptors in my nostrils flared in an organic, capillary way to become branches, leaves opening up to the citrusy chlorophyll fed to them by Un Jardin En Mediterranee. On the evening I tried it, I had on my other wrist Ck One, which I also reviewed here on Fragrantica. CkOne is also supposed to be fresh, and is definitely well made, but a complete different beast from UJeM. One shouts, the other one purrs, whispers.

What Un Jardin En Mediterranee embodies, is what Jean Claude Ellena tried (and succeeded) to do in his most recent creations, as recounted by his diary book published a few years ago: he tried to leave a blank space in the perfume, to leave something unsaid, that can be filled by our brain or our nose . A bit like the human instinct of filling in visual gaps in images which we perceive as whole because our brain joins the dots and gaps that our eye doesn't find.

Like a sentence written with a broken typewriter, which we still read despite the words missing letters here and there, this perfume leaves something unsaid and guessed at the same time.

Perhaps it's the white sap of the figs, here complete with the leaves and juiciness/freshness of the fruit. We imagine it smarting on our tongue and causing our lips to stick together while eating the fig. Or maybe it's the sun over the gold wheat at the corners of the garden, missing but implied in every Mediterranean green space.

Whatever it is, this is a story that keeps evolving and a perfume which you will keep spraying until it is said more clearly. That, and the sillage being small, makes for a hushed tone, beloved of Ellena and definitely achieving that poetry which he so often seeks in perfume form.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
What a masterpiece by Hermés! This is Sicily in a bottle.

I have never seen real, true Sicilian limoncello so beautifully represented like it is in this perfume. Un Jardin En Mediterranée does what its name promises : a walk along a beautiful Sicilian garden, smelling the sea breeze right after you squeezed some lemons... It's like drinking limoncello and taking a walk on the beach at night - a serene, magical walk that takes you to a time where things used to be easier and romantic.

It's not a blah, boring citric perfume. No, in here, you're captured by a beautiful Sicilian lemon scent in all its power and strength, but it's delicate and captivating thanks to its floral mid notes that give it warmth and coziness.

Its citric notes are therapeutic to me somehow - they're so soothing I usually wear this right after taking a shower before I go to bed. It's like wrapping yourself in a beautiful mediterranean dream... Hermés was spot on with this one!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Oh man, I bought a sample of this at my local oil fragrance shop and I instantly fell in love with it. This is my signature fragrance. I have so much to say about this fragrance. I love it so much because when I was a kid I used to go camping a lot, and I really enjoyed the smell of the cypress note. It brought back so much memories, a master piece. 9/10

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
If you are living in a tropical climate like in Indonesia or other South East Asian countries in general, and with high level of humidity, most perfumes either niche or designer will be tamed like zap, that quck, gone in 15 minutes to 30 minutes. But this one along with Sur le Nil are quite odd. I smelled them first time at a department store here in Jakarta with the usual uber-cold air-conditioner, it didn't project and longevity is minimum.

But when you wear it outside in temperature around 90 degree F, both will shine. The projection are greater well around 2-3 feet and longevity is great. They are super fresh and relaxing. 9/10 for Mediterranee and 10/10 for Sur le Nil, because I love mango more than fig...lol.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I like this perfume. It is nice and fresh, it reminds me a lot of my Bvlgari Au The Rouge perfume, which is really red tea based. Often fig perfumes smell very similar to tea perfumes for me. This mellows out a lot nicer than Au The Rouge, which I like. It is a good spring or summer scent! Lasting power is only a few hours for me though...but it may wear longer added to clothing.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This is a beautiful, woody, citrus scent which is complex and transporting. Unfortunately it doesn't last very long, perhaps an hour or so. And for the price, that just doesn't cut it.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
شروع ناموزون و غیر یکدست که به مرور تا پایان عمر عطر رو به بهبودی میرود و ترکیب انجیری که در ابتدا خوب میکس نشده بالاخره در جای صحیحش قرار می گیرد.
-----------
Scent & Qualiy: 8/10
Longevity: 7/10
Sillage: 7/10
Creativity & Uniqueness:7/10
Affordability: 7/10
-----------
Overall: 7.2/10

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
This perfume sends me to a dimension of deep thoughts and peace. It's a very calming, philosophic scent. It has become my "Calm the hell down" -perfume for those days when my mind is on the fast lane. It works wonders, I just take a deep breath from my wrist and feel at peace for a while.

I think it must be the fig leaf and the rest of the base notes. Even though we don't have fig or cedar trees in Finland, I think about the woods in here when I smell the perfume. (We have a lot of pine trees, and of course junipers, so it's not that much a long shot!) Forest always calms me, and in Jardin Mediterranee I detect that dry and warm feeling of it. When everything is quiet and still full of sounds. Just me, the trees, moss, birds and light.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
What kind of glorious black magic is this??

Here's the thing, I smelled this before, very much enjoyed it and picked up a sample. It hung out in a box with all of my other samples. Today is a 100 degree day with high humidity, exactly everything that I loathe. Summer and I are NOT friends. Then I spray this on and step outside. It absolutely sings in this weather. So much so that I actually felt kind of disappointed when I walked into the air conditioning, a feeling that has never happened to me before in my life. So, here it is, a scent that can make even me enjoy the summer.

100000% unisex.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: this is quite nice, however to me at least it seems rather 100 % a male perfume...maybe layered with a more feminine one? and the notes are somewhat less personal than those in other 'jardin's for example the jardin sur le toit feels a lot more special and memorable

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This is my least favorite of the Jardin scents from Hermes. I love all of the Jardin fragrances to different degrees. I don't like fig-centric fragrances at all. In this one, the fig is balanced by the citrus, cypress, and cedar, and I enjoy wearing it.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Love reading all your reviews! What a garden of sensuality and truth!

Being more of an essential oil connoisseur, I had yet to find a perfume or even EDT I could rock w joy. At Staples northeast US / Northampton, MA there is an associate who was wearing this and she was petting my dog, as she usually does and I caught a whiff of powder feminine flow. I wanted some of that in my groove ...so I blind bought a bottle from fragrance net be it looks like they are selling tester bottles cause it says not for resale, though I am glad for the price cause I am not one to splurge on perfume let alone essential oils above the $50 mark.

The fragrance almost made me swoon upon opening and the bottle is a trip...quite literally.

I like the solitude, confidence, and freedom evoked by the sharp. Light, and spacious smells. Like me they are elusive and hard to pin down. Transformational and transformative.

Medicinal, minty, cool, breezy and fun. I sprayed it all over my house and laid in bed w it or a while enjoying the shape of the bottle while reading all your reviews. Since childhood I have always been a 'nose' myself. And having grown up in Tue northern Galilee of Israel bordering Lebanon and recently back for j emotional familial and romantic visit...I had the opportunity to get up close and personal w a fig tree...ooh the smell, may it never end...how it draws u in seductively w modesty and shyness. No wonder people think that is what clothes Adam and eve. Sexy, surreal, and silent. What a winner. I like the idea of layering and may experiment w the sibling scent. Yum! Thank you:-)

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Wahou!! I'm happy I discovered this gem. It is ideal for summer and warm temperatures. It is a true spring in the bottle. So aromatic herbal and fresh with slight spicy accords. I would never discover the pyramid without viewing it first. I would say there are green tee leaves, mente, basil, bergamot and some spices like black paper. But the only note mentioned in common is bergamot, no pepper at all. This spicy note should come from juniper or red cedar and should be associated to woody notes mentioned in main accords. It is not sweet at all but surprisingly aromatic and green without being sharp. I can understand why it is unisex but I just adore it and think it is more suitable for women than men.
What a high quality!! It dures all the day long. Such a relaxing of a good tastes perfume. Bravissimo Jean-Claud Ellena! I hope it will exist forever on the market of fragrancies! Bravissimo!!!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
برگ انجیر... آ

در این عطر با بوی غالب برگ انجیر مواجه هستیم. دوستداران عطرهای با بوی غالب انجیر حتما این عطر رو استشمام کنند. با وجود اینکه برگ انجیر در ساختار این عطر؛ از نتهای پایانی محسوب میشه و قاعدتا انتظار داریم که تا حدود یک ساعت اثری از آن حس نکنیم؛ ولی از همان اول بوی انجیر در عطر قابل شناسایی هست. آقای ژان کلود النا در این عطر ازنتهای سرو و برگ انجیر استفاده کرده و یک ترکیب خیلی زیبا از این دو نت رو ارایه میده. اگه دوستان عطر
L’Arbre de la Connaissance
از برند
Jovoy Paris
رو تست کرده باشند؛ در این عطر از انجیر استفاده شده. ولی حسی که انجیر در این عطر به آدم میده؛ یه حسی شبیه به رنگهای ضد زنگ هست وقتی که بر روی سطوح قرار میگیرند و مدتی که طول میکشه تا رنگ مذکور خشک بشه؛ بوی حاصله شبیه به عطر جووی هست. ولی در اینجا استاد النا با تلفیق سایر نتها (که بیشترش سرو هست) با این نت برگ انجیر؛ بویی به مراتب طبیعی تر از این رایحه رو عرضه کرده

بعد از 30 دقیقه؛ بوی عطر کمی تند میشه که این تندی بیشتر به علت افزایش پخش بوی نت برگ انجیر هست
--------------------------------------------------------

In this perfume, fig is the dominant note in pyramidal scent. Fig lovers should test this perfume. As you can see in the pyramid scent, fig is the base note, but whatever you see is that fig is detectable from start point. Mr. Ellena mixed fig with cypress so good. If you tested L'Abre de la Connainssance, by Jovoy Paris, you detect a smell like stainless color when it doesn't dry. But the scent of fig in this perfume is so better. Mr. Ellena mixed fig with cypress so good that you feel a good scent (Vice versa of fig scent in L'Abre de la Connaissance).

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Upon dabbing on my wrist and chest this morning, I thought"This is 4711!" And as the day has gone by, nothing has changed my mind. It does resemble the freshness of the original 4711-the citrus and green notes. Tom Fords Portofino Neroli is also a close match to 4711-but I did not expect this perfume to go in that direction.

As time has passed, the Hermes has gotten a bit grassier, less citrus, but the resemblance is undeniable. The bottom notes are different than in 4711, yet the top and middle are the same, and that seems to be where my nose stays. Since 4711 is one of my all time favorites, of course, I love this. Tomorrow, I will do a side by side comparison to see what I think. Today I have a headache and that can sometimes affect my sense of smell.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: an extraordinary and beautiful scent-i buy it again and again although it os pretty expensove. it really evokes a garden in the south-for me it is sicily and some island i havent visited yer.inlike its freshness and the fug leaf maked ut pleasanťy dry.it is playful yet serious.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Un Jardin En Mediterranee is one of my treasured gems in my collection. It's a very easy, natural, green, fig scent with a kind of tropical exotic essence. It takes me to a place of happiness similar to being in a vacation spot on a island away from the daily troubles of life. This is one of those fragrances that help create a mood, a vibe. I like it so much I wouldn't care if anybody else liked it or disliked it, I'll be wearing it for my own enjoyment regardless. It's just beautiful

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I've been tried several Hermes perfumes including Jardin series which i think most of them are wonderful, but Un Jardin en mediteraniee is too spicy for me.
I never smell fig leaves, but to my nose there is like bellpepper scent which i can't stand especially to be wear in humid hot climate area which where i lived (Indonesia). I tried it many times and occasions, but this typical note (bellpepper) still annoys and affected my mood.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Hermes un jardin en Mediterranean (UJEM) is fig based fragrance which is very green and airy in nature and it's inspired by a la la land where we are sitting under a fig tree by the side of lake drinking some sort of citrusy juice . As you spray this perfume you smell citrusy fig with a green background and this will stay like this for an 30 minutes and then you see floral note kicking in and now fig is sweet which is combination of pistachio and musk. Thing to note here is that fig in this is not just the fruit part however it's the whole tree with it leaf and roots which is been blended quite well . In whole this is a very easy fragrance to wear and you can see the touch of jean claude ellena magic in this perfume however all is not honky dory with this perfume

My issue with this perfume is two fold one is that it does not last beyond 6 hours and projection is quite subtle I would have preferred more specially considering it cost around 130$ for 100 ML which is not justified however good part is that this is quite easily available at discounters so you can get it for half the retails .

I have extensively tested original Hermes un jardin line and in my opinion this is second best from the line after un jardin sur le toit which is another fantastic fragrance . I will recommend this fragrance specially if you live in tropical climate and even more so if you like fig based fragrance like I do ! 8/10

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
(generously daubed)
This is a gloriously salty musk. The opening is a wonderful herbal burst of Fig and evergreens with a hint of floral. It is beachy and breathtaking, like a more complex wood sage and sea salt.

As it settles the green disappears and a soapy floral mixes with the saltiness. An hour in like there might be some of the lily of the valley that blooms on my skin in many ozonic fragrances. It doesn't seem to bother me after a while though.

I was looking for a green garden scent for fall and this is going straight into the summer pile. If I hadn't just ordered my main scent for the next season I may have had a delemma.

Five hours later it's still salty. Occasionally I get a whiff of bergamot or orange blossom, but it's mainly salty air. Eleven hours later I can still detect it on my wrist. I'm very impressed.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
THIS iS PURE LOVE.

It starts out very fig-leafy and herbal and then it dries down to a "sparkling" aromatic-citrus scent.

It feels clean.

The sillage is very close to the skin.
Lasting power: I get occasional wafts after 6 hours.

Basically you will not offend anybody!!!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
UJEM is definitely unique and not something you smell on the average consumer. I do not get anything floral, aquatic, sweet, or citrus on my skin. The only way it could be aquatic is if you meant rotting seaweed on the beach.

It opens to vinegar drenched woods. The acid is palpable. If it is not pickling vinegar with bitter herbs, it is a tomato based dish or overripe vegetables rotting in the sun. After an hour it briefly dries down to fig leaf before becoming a peppery fig leaf with woods in the background. This is not a feminine or unisex scent on me at all.

This is a very hot scent. I believe it made me feel even warmer on our hot, humid day. In the heat I need a fragrance that compliments it or is cooling, not a scent that makes it WORSE.

Your enjoyment of this will highly depend on your body chemistry, so please try before you buy.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Depth... Un Jardin En Mediterranee has so much depth! The opening is so unique and quite frankly draws you in. You'll literally pause after spraying to take in the fig leaf, cedar and juniper waltz that occurs in the first ten minutes. The citrus is present in this scent but ever so lightly. When the florals kick in we get another layer of richness. The oleander is opulent and when juxtaposed with the orange and the citrus, just sings. The orange blossom is the bridge to the sweet pistachio and musk base, its all so beautiful and elegant and very Hermes! This scent is clearly unisex and it is a very green quality that makes it so. UJEM veers in so many directions scent wise. One whiff and you get fig leaf, another whiff later and it is oleander. After a few minutes you may take in a rich cedar and juniper and then a few minutes later citrus, musk and pistachio. My point is there is a progression with this scent, but it is not predictable and very green and in line with its name ... a garden, but a garden in mid spring and in full bloom. This scent has sentimental value to me. UJEM transports me to the mediterranean maghreb, more specifically my mother in law's garden. It is filled with vervain, a lemon tree and of course a fig tree. This scent encapsulates her garden beautifully. Like I said, this is unisex, but the musk and cedar give it a more masculine vibe, but that means nothing because my wife steals this scent from me regularly in spring. UJEM is perfect for spring days, and should be worn when you are meeting an old friend that you haven't seen in a while over tea and preferably in an outdoor venue.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Lovely just lovely. The fig base with the pistachios blends very well with the other notes, and is to die for. The fragrance as i describe it. Citrusy, fresh, aromatic. It's very unique during the summer it's not your typical citrus and woody base as most designer frags. Hermes has quality for sure. Unfortunately performance is bad 4-6 hours max and has average projection. Great smell bad performance, still bottle full worthy imo.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: My nose propably won't do this justice, but hand on heart this smells like like mediterranean garden. First sniff instantly takes You to the middle of the hot, dry day on some small Greek Island.It is dry, earthy, almost hostile, but slowly. When the evening comes,and the scent settles it begins to bloom into something so comforting...I am pretty sure it is not for me, but I wouldn't mind smelling this whole day on person sitting next to me:)

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: The scent of wild bushes by the beach, honeyed plants under the sunshine

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This scent reminds me of the wonderful times I had on the Italian coast, Cinque Terre and The South of France. The Greek islands...They really do capture the smell of that Mediterranean vegetation under the scorching sun

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Lovely smell of fig, so green and summery! I could wear this every day, but it's a bit expensive!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermes is a great aromatic,woody,citrus perfume with a lot of citrus
notes. It is a good perfume for spring and summer seasons with moderate projection and longevity for daily use.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: It is said in some reviews that there is something in this fragrance that smells like shampoo. Today I discovered what it is - unfortunately, the middle phase reminds Fructis hair products a lot.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: My fiance says he likes this a lot, but personally I feel like I smell like a soggy day in the Home Depot lumber section.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
It's a green, very "planty" scent. Smelling this one in a garden makes you wonder whether it's real plants or just the fragrance you are inhaling. It reminds me very much of certain fragrancves by Annick Goutal or L'Artisan, which means the quality is high, but we had it before.

***

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I love this scent, and it's one of my few bottles that I have made a significant dent in, which is hard to do since I have quite a few... It lasts a long time too, even at work 8 hours after it was put on I could get whiffs every once in a while, although I'd prefer to refresh to smell the scent fully and strongly again since it's so wonderful. This is strongly cypress to me. I find the scent a bit sour and bitter, but in a great way. I don't think of this as masculine or feminine at all, 100% unisex. I love wearing this all the time, and it is very much worth trying out.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: A fresh, sweet take on the fig leaf genre, emphasis on the sweet. This is a very fruity fig with a pleasant aromatic base from the cypress and cedar. As it dries down develops a synthetic, shampoo-like quality. I'm shocked that Hermes has something like this in their collection as they generally make elegant, well balanced, and, above all, very expensive and natural smelling fragrances. It's not bad but it's cheaper smelling than it should be.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I went on a bender tonight trying on 5 Hermes frags, including this one, Un Jardin en Méditerranée as well as Sur le nil. Both great fragrances - this one very pleasant cedars and green (fig?) after a big opening of citrus. Almost masculine, Méditerranée is definitely different but pleasing. Reminds me a bit of Chanel Christalle, but less sharp. Will give it another try before purchasing though.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
After I had an instant love for Jardin Sur de Nil, I wanted to try others from this line. The first thought after applying was, fresh, spicy and aquatic. If I put it on the unisex scale, there is slight dominance of masculine side. The dry down is as beautiful as Sur de Nil, and actually I find them similar, thinking of Mediterranee as more fresh and spicy.and Sur de Nil more citrus.
Both are soooo beautiful, but as female, I find Sur de Nil more suitable for me.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I live in China and haven't been to Europe. Yet this perfume reminds me of the Earl Grey Tea, a kind of flavoured tea which is popular in Europe. The smell makes me feel relaxed just like having an afternoon tea-time on the Mediterranean beach.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This smells like vacation to me - lovely smell, but I had to get used to the strongness and masculinity of this fragrance. My boyfriend loves this and wears it too.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: On me this perfume is 100% Biotherm Eau Vitmainée... not bad but does not reminds me of a Mediterranean Garden at all. Fresh and green for me.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Ohhhh, I feel like a million bucks wearing this. Cool, green, aromatic and aloof. Dressed all in white and sipping a cool drink somewhere in a marvelous restaurant in Portugal (or wherever really).

I also agree with nero77 below. I've read CB book about the creation of SJP Lovely and Un Jardin Sur Le Nil and it made me explore the rest of the range. So well crafted and different. I'm not a snob when it comes to fragrance but this screams quality and class. On me the citrus notes, cypress and fig leave are the most dominant ones. A few hours in the pistachio lends a creamy touch and a tad sweetness. At least that's what I assume. I could bathe in this, really. Huge thank you again to my swap partner!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
The scent of green figs...

Let me start by saying that I am a huge fan of the Un Jardin series of fragrances. I love the work of Jean-Claude Ellena and find that his work is nothing short of superb in every aspect. I had been wanting to try this perfume for a long time.

Finally, I've been wearing it recently and have enjoyed it. My initial preconception was that it would be a sweet, juicy fig type of scent, much like Acqua di Parma - Blu Mediterraneo: Fico di Amalfi, however here is a green figgy scent which is more in keeping with the same style as Un Jardin Sur le Nil, another green fragrance. I must say that as a fig perfume, I do prefer the Acqua di parma version. However this one does make me feel that if you didn't like Sur le Nil (ie you found it "too green") then you woudl like this instead.

Overall, this is well worth a try in my opinion, if you like fresh, spring & summer fragrances with substance. A masterful effort from Jean-Claude Ellena.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This Hermes scent reminds me so much of Jo Malone´s Wood sage and Sea Salt. They have the same fresh, aquatic and citrusy quality to it! It has a touch of Musk and has a little bit of sweet fig in it! I love it!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Another one of my favorite perfumes, also in the the Hermes Jardin line. It reminds me of gardening, I get a very strong impression of tomato plant (not the fruit) but I believe that may be the fig leaf as other reviewers have stated. It is very earthy and natural smelling. Vines and green leaves and soil is what I get out of this scent and I love it!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
These are fresh off impressions after a first sniff of the tester.

Wow, this thing makes me want to cry with joy.

I don't know why, this is a surreal summer scent a la Calvin Klein, but with tons more depth and I guess it reminds me some perfect summer day where I and my beloved girl were lost in a summer city where everything is green, everything in bloom. Quite honestly, I can't even tell if that memory is real, but that's what this fragrance brings to mind.

Absolutely mind-blowing.

*** After wearing this for a while, I find it has average projection and longevity, has a bit of a sweet vibe to it that I did not notice at start, but is still such a great pleasure to smell. It's 100% feminine, I don't see how a man could wear this.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I dont think there is anything else I can say that hasnt been said already, but all one needs to know is that this and Sir Le Nil are the only two one needs from this line

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Paul Cézanne, L'Estaque, 1883–1885
+++

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
scent : 10/10
sillage : 7/10
longevity :7/10
80% day / 20% night fragrance
nice green and woody scent

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
There was something so familiar about this scent, and after hours of smelling I finally figured out what it was: Henri Bendel's "Holiday" home fragrance that was released in a collaboration with Bath and Body Works. I loved that smell in my teens. It was this intense, indescribable spice unlike anything else I could find. I still have a small bottle of fragrance oil that I must have had for over 10 years.

There's a spice note in Un Jardin En Mediterranee that is reminiscent of that for me. It's much cleaner, and very fresh. The aquatic and green notes are there, but along with them is that intoxicating spice. Trees, lush foliage, fresh air, and a nearby coast line all come to mind. It really does make me think of walking along the Mediterranean. There is nothing synthetic about this fragrance, and I am incredibly impressed. I definitely smell the fig leaf and cypress. Clean, sophisticated, lush, and green. There is something ethereal and living to this smell.

I was so blown away after receiving a tester of this, that I was convinced to blind buy a bottle of lotion in the Un Jardin Apres la Mousson fragrance, as I've been looking for a cardamom fragrance and Jean-Claude Ellena has thoroughly impressed me with his mastery in creating perfumes.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I always wanted to have this one, and finally after so many times checking it, i got this.

All I want to say is "Natural". It has a nature aura, very natural, bitter and green just like a garden or forest. No synthetics, no artificial. I am so much fond of natural smelling perfumes. This one stands on top. So much relaxing, soothing. Reminds me of a walk in a garden and sea shore. Its a tranquilizer.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I have 4 fig fragrances, Mediterranee, Caligna, Ninfeo Mio, Fico di Amalfi. This one has the most dominant bitter green fig leaf note, which is very nice and refreshing. Caligna highlights the milky fig fruit, Ninfeo Mio, is citrus dominant, Fico di Amalfi has the best balance of green fig, fig fruit and citrus.
I thought I smelled something synthetic, but it may be the white nerium flower which has a talcum like smell that I never smelled befor.

The opening blast is the best, it is dry with a small bit of sweetness. You get that stark green fig leaf. I love natural, earthy green fragrances, and that fig leaf is wonderfull. It's rather sharp in a fresh way in the opening, with the coniferous notes and citruses. It is a bit woody, the floral note, which is powdery sweet balances the bitterness of the fig leaf.

Update: I'm liking this a lot more. I think this will eventually replace my Ninfeo Mio, and Fico di Amalfi, which are shy and soft with there fig notes. Hermes Mediterranee, the fig leaf is strong and sharp makes a beutifull accord with the fresh aromatic juniper and cypress, and well blended citrus.

PS: My favorite and most natural fig fragrance has become Diptyque Philosykos.


Rating: 9/10

God bless you. John 3:16

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Well, I went to a store two days ago. I was sniffing some fragrances and i decided to go on the women section to see if they had the "un jardin" line. I like "un jardin sur le Nil" but for me it's not that masculine and i found it too sweet for my taste, but i like the scent. So i found this one and i tried. Man, the blast of citrus on the top punched me in the face and after 10 seconds, the fig leaf and cypress apeared like a storm and wowed me. Made me smile, seriously. Man, i love fig and the only fig based fragrance that i tried was Womanity but i didn't dig it. This just makes me feel good, happy and complete. I'll buy it as soon as i can. Great scent. You got fig leaf, cypress, and some citrus on the back that make a juicy vibe, in my opinion. Really great spring fragrance.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I bought this blind because of my love for Balenciaga Rosabotanica. I could not be happier. Fig leaf and cypress with citrus notes make this such a winner for me. Makes me feel like I'm taking a stroll through Cinque Terre or something. It's edgy but not too sharp, and comforting all at the same time.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: If you miss Lancome Benghal buy this one. The settling of this one is identical (for me) with Benghal. ( I couldn't imagine this one on men though...)

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: OK, it's not listed in the notes up there, but...TOMATO! This is absolutely a tomato fragrance - stems, leaves, fruit, and all. Amazingly realistic rendition of a scent rarely demonstrated in perfumery, and I've never smelled a better version of it than this.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Description: Imagine walking along a secret trail in an old garden overlooking the glittering Mediterranean (!), the aroma of fig leaves and bark filling you with a radiant calm.

Recommendation: One of those rare scents that manage to smell fresh and warm at the same time, this one is a sublime summer fragrance for the outdoors, or for reminding you of the outdoors while you are sitting in your cubicle.

Creativity*: 4.25 out of 5
Blend**: 4.25
Distinctiveness***: 3.75
Performance: 3
Mass appeal: 4.25
Allure****: 3.25
Design: 5
Name: 4.5

Personal appreciation: 4.25 out of 5

Final notes: About 5 minutes into this gem, a foody, almost honey-like accord sets in. It lasts for maybe 20 to 30 minutes. I personally prefer what comes next: A woody and fresh-spicy drydown with an atmospheric feel courtesy of a generous dose of J.C. Ellena's signature ingredient, Iso E Super.

-----
*Creativity: A frag gets a perfect score if it was the first of its kind on the market and if this kind was a game changer; **Blend: A perfect blend will trigger your imagination, take you places, but won't try to be the exact copy of something that exists in the world (in other words, single-themed gourmands get low scores); ***Distinctiveness: If everybody is wearing it and/or there are uncounted olfactory twins on the market: low score; ****Allure: Assessment based on verbal and non-verbal reactions from my surroundings.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
You cannot be prepared before smelling this, even if you are sure that you can tell what it will smell like after reading comments or judging after appearence.

It is not just a "smell", but feelings, memories and pictures caught in a bottle. When you spray it you open a little box of joy of summer on the seaside.
Fig leaf and woody notes are prominent surely. It is spicey, but not like peppery, but like rosemary and laurel. Really when you walk along the shore and crumbling rosemary in your hands.

I used to wear it for years, nowadays, my taste just turned to love fragrances mostly on the feminine side. And this is totally unisex.

I keep the smell in my memories for sure.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Un Jardin en mediteranee is a spectacularly unpretentious fragrance that makes a nonchalant nod towards Terre d'Hermes. Le Jardin has lost the earthy heaviness of the aforementioned and leaves us with a gentle breeze of what a spring garden in the Mediterranean (hence the name)would smell like. It's a gentle almost minty in its opening fragrance, that is timeless and I believe could bring up the best in a person by unleashing different structural characteristics with different body chemistry.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I just love Hermés Jardin en Méditerranée - it is so intoxicating that I feel like wearing it to bed - makes me dream of mediteranian summers, citrus an figtrees. Just had to buy a bottle in order to forget that it is winter.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: at the beginning i enjoyed all the herbal and woody notes that give, but after a while it becomes a simply classic fragrance with white flowers and citrus, like many orhers!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I get some salty note upon application for a few minutes. Didn't notice it before.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: When I first wore Un Jardin En Mediterranee, I thought it was simply a light, lemony orange-blossom scent, but now I see there’s more to it than that. There is something in here that is definitely spicy *hot* that I didn’t notice the first few times I wore it, but I don’t see any “hot” notes listed. (Could it be the pistachio?) Of the few Hermes I have worn, Un Jardin En Mediterranee is my favorite. More Hermes, please!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Fruity. Well-blended with no sharpness. Beautiful like most Hermes that I have encountered but not one I must have. May have to try again.

One spray on me
Sillage: less than arms' length
Longevity: 2 to 3 hours then nose-to-wrist for next 2 hours
Rating: 3/5

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Best from the Jardin series, IMO.

Fig leaves, jasmine, grassy vibe and bergamot with some pistachio is all I get from this, so gentle and subtle, but at the same time so masculine and confortable. Suitable for spring/summer (just don't advise to wear it on hot days, probably it will unravel)

Another gem from one of my bests perfumists, Ellena! Kudos for you my dear, again!

Scent: 9/10
Longevity: 8.5/10
Sillage: 7/10
Praise: 5/10 (that's not the priority on this one)

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I hoped this would be a beachy mysterious 'mermaidy' scent.
It isn't. It makes me think more of an expensive vacation in the Mediterranean.
To my taste this scent is way too sharp, too unisex, but maybe that is because I expected it to be different. I think this would best fit a woman over 40

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Jean Claude Ellena is a genius. I'm a huge fan of his work. The Jardin range is pure art in a bottle. This one being my favourite of the four. It is an anti depressant in a bottle.
I wish I always smelled this way. My only quip is that it doesn't last very long on me and I wish it lasted forever.
If you like "typical" perfumes that smell like every other female, this isn't going to be for you. If you want to evoke the senses, be transported to paradise and find yourself in a beautiful place.... Un Jardin En Mediterranee <3

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This is my SOTD and I am glad,I have had this on my radar for about a year.Sniffed it but never wore it officially.Got a sample from Sephora and wow!Hermes does it again.The fragrance is great,cuts through hot weather like nobody's business.I love the green juicy fig accords in it.If you want to stand out and smell different this is it.Very refreshing spicy and earthy.My favorite notes are the orange blossom and cypress,This juice last good amount of time on my skin and silage is great.Did I mention how cool the bottle looks?!!!!!!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
نام این عطر به زبان فرانسه میشه یک باغ در مدیترانه

وقتی رو پوستت عطر رو اسپری میکنی بوی بسیار طبیعی برگ انجیر رو احساس خواهید کرد که طی چند ثانیه رایحه برگ درخت کاج هم باهاش ترکیب میشه و رایحه بسیار لذت بخشی رو ایجاد میکنه

این عطر منو میبره به یک رویای زیبا

روی یه قایق چوبی وسط یه رودخونه باریک ، وسط جنگل
همه اطراف این رودخونه رو درخت و چمن و کلی پوشش گیاهی دربرگرفته . بیشتر درخت ها انجیر و کاج هستند و بوشون همه جای رودخونه رو گرفتن

نورخورشید از لابه لایه شاخه ها میتابه به رودخونه

با قایقت خیلی آروم داری روی آب حرکت میکنی که بعد از مدتی هوس لیموترشی که تو کیفت هست رو میکنی . پارو رو رها میکنی و لیموترش تازت رو از کیفت برمیداری ولی یادت میوفته که چاقوت همراهت نیست پس وقتی گاز میزنی همون طور که مزه تلخ و ترش رو میچشی ، بوی ترش و باطراوت لیمو همراه تلخی پوستش که گاز زدی رو حس میکنی

همین طور که داری لیموترشت رو نوش جان میکنی ، چون تو راهی که داری میری به دریا هم نزدیکی ، یکم بوی شور نمک دریا رو هم حس میکنی

بعد از تمام کردن لیموترش پارو رو برمیداری و به سمت باغ نارنگی که بیرون جنگله و کم کم داری بهش نزدیک میشی پارو میزنی و کم کم رایحه غالب برگ انجیر که از اول راه همراهیت میکرد ضعیف تر و ضعیفتر میشه. تا اینکه به باغ زیبای نارنگی میرسی و بوی نیمه شیرین نارنگی ها و بوی ضعیفی از باغچه گلی که کنار خونت داری رو احساس میکنی
---------------------------------------------------------------
بعد از 1 ساعت بوی نارنگی رو با بوی ضعیف گلی متوجه خواهید شد و بعد از 1 ساعت دیگه بوی خیلی ضعیف نارنگی همراه بوی مشخص مشک و کمی هم بوی گلی این عطر فوق العاده رو به پایان میرسونن

طول عمر عطر حدود 4 ساعت و پخشش 2 تا 1 ساعت خوب و بعد از اون ضعیفتر میشه

ولی پخش و ماندگاریش به هیج وجه برام ارزش نداره

هروقت غمگین هستید از این عطر استفاده کنید چون وقتی بوش میکنی ناگهان احساس خوشحالی بهت دست میده

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Un Jardin En Mediterranee is all about fig with a fresh, bitter, woody edge. On my skin, this is a fairly linear green scent done the pleasingly transparent, overtly spare, modernist style of Jean-Claude Ellena. Nice, unisex, neutral and unlikely to offend, but also similarly unlikely to inspire.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Opens quite spicy, a bit bitter, that quickly turns into a sweet green sweetish mix. I smell fig leaf, bergamot and then a hint of fir and juniper appears creating a certain freshness. Lastly, a very light musk appears. The drydown is a sweet but still fresh and green mix, with a balmy feel to it, on a base of cedar.

Sillage is moderate, longevity moderate.

A fresh scent for spring or summer. A happy scent that reeks of freedom. Unisex due to the sweetness and the cedar/greens. I don't really like the balminess, that's not really my thing and occasionally the fir/cypress notes get stronger and a little bit acrid. Then it changes back to sweet fig leaves, very refreshing. I will retry this one in summertime when the weather is a bit warmer!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: My signature perfume for 2012-2014. Fell in love at the very first sniff. Couldn't be happier when I got the first bottle at a Sephora in Boston. I sprayed this magic juice literallly anytime on my body and every corner in my home. I grew up in a fig farm and this is exactly what I have smelled growing up. As a student who constantly transfer among schools, move in and out,explore new places and quickly leave for the next destination all by myself, this perfume really makes me less lonely and nervous about whatever I am going to face tomorrow. Figgy, grassy, bitter and free. A must try for every traveller.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: My first impression of Un Jardin en Mediterranee was light, floral, feminine. But after wearing awhile, there is a light touch of fresh vegetables straight from the ground, probably from the “fig woods” note(s). I wish they were stronger because I prefer something heavier. And maybe a little patchouli in the base would bring out that vegetal pungency, making it last longer than an hour. Overall, a lemony orange blossom that fades fast.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I have two Un Jardin fragrances, this one and Sur la Nil. Both are very good. Some merits to this one:

Hermes is very good at making a light, airy fragrance that lasts and lasts but never loses its gossamer appeal. If you like the scent of flowers on fresh breezes, in between earth and sea air, you'll love pretty much any of its fragrances.

This one has a distinctly sunny, fruited tree grove on maybe a craggy cliff overlooking the Mediterranean Sea. You get a little trees (apparently that's cypress and juniper but to me it just smells rather sunny and scrubby), you get a bit of floral (perhaps the orange blossom, though whatever it is isn't distinctly orangy) and a whole lot of tree fruits. Some may even say tomato plant. But I say it's fig tree. I really hesitate to say "oh it smells of fig leaf" since I've had fig plants and the leaves never smelled. I think honestly it's fig fruits, which are sweet and succulent and woodsy themselves.

But I don't sniff this and say right on, I get this or that particular note. I think it's really a garden, including the fruit, plants, earth, sun, air, wind and light all kind of giving you a dapply sense of a bunch of things going on. You're not going to smell of fig jam or bubblegum with this.

I do get a really bright summer garden image as well, perhaps tomatoes, zucchini and giant pumpkin blossoms, maybe some bees and flies and more sunlight. The colors would be green, blue and maybe even bright green/yellow/orange and glossy brown or green fruit.

Both the Un Jardin frags I have really do transport you. I liked reading the stories of what places these folks had been to, and how it reminded them of Tunisia, Italy, etc. (all on the coastline of the Sea) and the Egyptian who discussed Un Jardin sur la Nil.

This fragrances is no exception to the above. Reading below, each person's review had a bit of travel guide in it, which is fun, and I really do feel for me, I don't get to travel but I can mentally travel when I wear this. I think for that reason, this must have truly hit the mark the designer intended. I think I may like sur la Nil a bit better overall for me, but I definitely think this is masterful work.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Un Jardin En Mediterranee is a very elegant and ladylike perfume for the summer; and unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend it for people who have trouble with citrus, green accords and their skin.

On my skin, this opens with a burst of fig leaf, which really is very refreshing and green, and I was enjoying this paired with the woodsiness... until my chemistry just turned the green and citrus accords to soap. It really is a lovely soap that's very refined and subtle, and I do sense that the notes used are of a good quality; however, my skin does have a tendency to draw out the synthetic nature of these particular notes, so this also smelt quite synthetic on me.

Overall, it's not my favourite from the Jardin series because it wasn't really what I was looking for. Sillage is soft; lasts for about 4-5 hours.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Fruity and floral, with grapefruit as the main note to start with more of a figgy sweetness in the dry down, UJEM fits, as other reviewers have said, into several genres: sweet, fruity, floral, woodsy. And in that respect, it's versatile, but it does not impress, project, or last, at least not to me. It is certainly a spring and summer day scent, primarily, and does speak to the outdoors in its fruity/floral/woodsy balance.

Longevity is a little disappointing, as it's a skin scent within the hour and lasts only maybe six hours after that (as a skin scent). And while it's described as unisex, it leans toward the feminine side on my skin, and this isn't surprising since many shops list this as a women's perfume.

Not for me but worth smelling if you're looking for something off the beaten path and contrasting most summer aquatics.

6 out of 10

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
This is my favourite fragrance from the Jardin series. It has the right balance between sweet, bitter and floral. As a fragrance aiming at the Mediterranean, it strikes the right balance among herbs-fig-florals. There is always the risk of being too heavily sweet or floral, but it succeeds in maintaining a bitter-fresh smell, perhaps due to the fig note.

It is my favourite fragrance when going to the beach, even here in the tropics. It works wonders in the hot climate and never becomes cloying. Love it!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
To me the whole Jardin series is an exercise in cut vegetation and spice. In evey Jardin fragrance but especially in this one - fresh wet celery and clear plastic hum throughout.

It is absolutely contemporary and 'transparent'. BUT, at a distance this fragrance takes on a different character all together. When I'm writing I always have the urge to put my nose right up to where I applied the fragrance. I am thinking this is not the way these Jardin fragrances were intended to be experienced.

When you sniff Mediterranee around a foot away it is so much more natural, humid & floral. The celery is barely noticeable and the vegetable notes blend and become moist and less supermarket sterile. It manages to capture some of that pungent vegetation and spice reminiscent of an open window alleyway in a salty seaside village in the evening before dinner time. The florals really come alive and the spices wafting through the windows mix to create something unique to place.

I was so happy to smell this on a friend yesterday and it just taught me that I don't have to bury my nose in a fragrance to really appreciate it. This one is best at a distance and tells an interesting story if you don't get too close.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
You don't need to book a holiday when you can buy this. For me, many fragrances embody a certain time, situation or place, this one has all of them at once.

It reminds me of my times in the Mediterranean. The moist, fresh fig leaf element is in the garden in the morning, when you've watered the plants and droplets form on the fig leaf. Later that day as it becomes scorchingly hot you find yourself walking down towards the sea through the woods. The smell of the woods are lifted by the fresh salty sea breeze that brushes gently through the branches. You know it's the middle of summer but the soothing air is there to cool you down. By now youre thirsty from your leisurely stroll, so you sit down and gulp down a refreshingly juicy orange, lime, basil and lemon drink that's been freshly squeezed from fruits just picked nearby, their rinds have been rubbed along the rim of the glass,, no ice, it's just ice cold. It quenches your thirst.

Not many fragrances have made me see colours or taste something. But this one made me see a dark green that was juicy and quenched my thirst along with a very rich deep azure blue. It will no doubt be my summer fragrance.

It's certainly woody, but it's certainly aquatic too. There is a floral note but it's by no means a floral fragrance. I'd like to know if others get the salty sea air note as much as I do or whether this just reminds me of the Med so much that I assosciate it with that back of the throat sea salt note.

Truly impressed!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Hmm, I was somewhat repulsed when I first sprayed, but then after sniffing my jacket sleeve a second time, strangely I quite enjoyed it. Smells earthy green, aquatic, exotic, and a little unusual. I think this is much more green-aqautic than floral-aquatic. There's little to nothing floral to the nose here.
How odd. I love it and I don't even know why.
This is the best fig as far as I know, especially given that it doesn't have a coconutty accord that so many of them tend to have, such as Philosykos.
8.5/10

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I absolutely loved this the first time I tried it a couple of years ago. Not sure if they changed something about the formulation, but now all I get is a huge hit of unpleasant harshness up front that I just can't deal with.

I do love some of the drydown notes, but the overpowering first note just never goes away.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Love this, but does take some time to develop. I can see that the top notes might not be pleasing to some, but I find them to be unusual in a good way. This is very green with woody notes as it warms, I find it to be more herbal than aquatic, at least on me. I don't think it will replace eau d'orange vert as my favorite Hermes fragrance, but think it may run a close second.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I really enjoy Hermès because they have created a fine fragrance with unquie aroma's covering a wide range. I have fair size collection's to name a few Rocbar, Bel Ami and last Terre D' Hermès perfect as fall/winter fragrance. Recently I picked up Terre D Hermès eau Très Fraiche, Un Jardin Sur Le Nil and finally Un Jardin Mêditerranée.
My review on Un Jardin Mêditerranée,
Every time I wear this fragrance I feel like I'm in Italy going through a vineyard/garden. In the first 2hrs the aroma of orange blossom and lemon gives it a real zesty aromatic aroma. The main notes of fig leaf is so intense you get a green vib which lasts well past 4hrs. To balance this GEM both cypress and juniper berry gives it a hint of herbal/woodsy undertones. Floating is a floral aroma giving it a deep warm/sweet aroma.
Longevity and Silage is very high lasting well past 6hrs.
Finally thoughts,
Out of the different fragrance's from Hermès this juice can be worn from early spring throughout the summer months and till the end of fall. What's nice about this fragrance is that every time you wear it gives off a calm relaxing happy vib. I enjoy using it and several co-workers complimented me because it wasn't a heavy fragrance which has a cloying aroma. This fragrance has a delicate balance between green/earth notes topped with floral aroma. I recommend to those who know Hermès, if your not sure test first....if it's not for you I'm sure there's something else that could be substituted. Rating this fragrance 7.5/10

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: i smelled this fragrance in a store more than 10 years ago and liked it. Ever since i started collecting scents this perfume has eluded me. Finaly i have got my bottle of un jardin du mediterranee ,witch in my mind was placed on a pedistal of mythical proportions. .... The scent does not want to be with me. After the initial blast of citrus i get the drydown of juniper and fig. This base suddenly dissapears only to drift in and out of reach every time i press my nose to the wrist i sprayed it on. I know i is a good scent unfortunately i must apreciate it on someone other than myself.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Ahhh...what a shame! I did want to like this perfume so much....alas, this salty note made it too masculine for my nose....
If anybody is interested, I have a brand new full bottle available for a swap! :)

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: the top notes are the only thing my nose seems to catch. Further on the basenotes just seem to dissapear on me. It is one of the best and natural smelling scents i know. Fresh but not sour, herbal but not too masculine. Unfortunately i cannot profit from this.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Fig leaf and mint.


9/10

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Un Jardin sur le Nil was my favourite perfume for a couple of years, it was the only one I wore before I got seriously interested in perfumes, and I still love it. So when I did get the perfume craze, exploring the other Jardins was an obvious priority, and I got a sample of this mediterranean version first.
It took me several months and the whole sample to finally form an opinion, though, because I seem to react to this fragrance differently each time. Roughly though, I gradually liked it more and more. At first, there were a couple of times when I found the smell slightly nauseating. That was in spring, when it was colder and I was experiencing a lot of work-related stress, so either or both of those factors might have contributed to that. Then during the hottest summer months I wasn't drawn to it, preferring the lighter Jardin sur le Nil, which seemed to fit those hot and restless days better. But now, finally, in the cool late summer/early autumn weather we're having here, I've fallen in love with Un Jardin en Mediterranée at last.

I love the fig leaf in this; it must be my favourite note and I'd say about half of my loved scents have it. So you might think I don't need another one, but I think I do, because this is different: the other fig scents I've tried are all either sweet, brightened by dominant citrus notes, or so realistic they're almost boring. This one is none of that: it's very natural, but the combination with the cypress and the juniper works very well here for making it more complex. It's very green and quite aromatic; woody in that coniferous way that I like, beautifully balanced out by the natural milkiness of the fig leaf.
So it is lovely, but only as long as you don't overspray. That's extra important with this one, because it has a tendency to become harsh in that case.
I also think it's a bit weird that this is classified as "aquatic floral", because I don't smell any of either of those accords.

For me this is perfect for late spring/early autumn, so I'll be on the lookout for a small bottle.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This is a perfect summer scent-- it's light, fresh, and isn't too overpowering when the mercury rises. I'm normally a fan of Tom Ford's Jasmin Rouge during the summer, but I wanted an alternative to Jasmin Rouge and this was perfect! On me it tends to change and several people have said I smell a little bit vanilla-lemony-minty (which is definitely the scientific term...) but that makes it great for hot weather, close-quarters and not wanting to overpower people if you reapply, and it's moderately long-lasting. (This also makes a great hair perfume!)

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Bought this one and "un jardin sur le nil" last week. I really love that scent - i think, you*ll love the fig leaves, or you'll hate them. :)

it's really different from the other summer-scents for women.. not sticky sweet, but nice.

my boyfriend says it's too masculine for me, but i dont care! ;))

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
These Un Jardin fragrances shoulda been called "Un Jardin Cirtus et Fraiche" or something !

Un Jardin Mediterranee definitely smells very much like freshly-squeezed Hermes citrus rush . That said, in lots of pizzazz.
