I like this unique style of fragrance of course. No one can go wrong with being unique. It is not overpowering and not offensive, as it smells very natural.

Great for wear during the day, in the heart of summer and late spring. It does have a nice staying power when worn with your sunscreen !

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Perhaps someone more educated than I can explain what it is that makes almost all of Jean Claude Ellena's fragrances smell so very "Jean Claude Ellena" I suppose it's just the same way you can tell the difference between Listening to a classic 80s hit and hearing the Glee kids sing one on TV. His signature is so specific but I am not educated enough to put my finger on what it is. Anyway it's the reason why my ex used to gag and snicker "ugh you reek of Hermes"
Unlike my ex I happen to love that "I-don't-know-what". It's fresh a little sour, woody, so stimulating, and unique like Stevie Nicks' voice. It doesn't matter what she sings, you know it's her and not Bonnie Tyler. The Garden Series has it, mostly everything in the Hermessence line has it, the colognes have it, and so on and so on...
Whatever it is, I like it best in THIS fragrance because I find it more consistent here than I do in the other fragrances.
Un Jardin en Mediterranee though it starts out with quite a punch is beautiful and juicy from start to finish. It fades and becomes a bit lighter with time but doesn't disappoint. I love the transition of old Guerlains. Whether they change from beginning to end they don't disappoint by turning huskily dry or sour like many of Jean Claude Ellena's creations. Un Jardin en Mediterranee changes quite subtly if at all and I appreciate that much more than say, Sur Le Nile which becomes a dry boring oriental, Osmanthe Yunnan which turns into dryish leather, or Terre which becomes peppery vetiver and sour juice. Un Jardin may not be groundbreakingly unique, but what it lacks in originality it makes up for with juicy straightforward beauty and the undeniable presence of that "Jean Claude Ellena smell" my ex despised. It is my favorite in the line, hands down.
So, SO perfect for the summertime in Japan.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
The first half an hour with this scent on my skin was difficult, because it was quite harsh. Screaming citruses and greens!
However, with time this scent mellows a bit and starts to be pleasant. I can wear its middle and base notes. Not in my style, but acceptable.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I have a love-hate relationship with Un Jardin En Méditerranée. On good days, I'll like it enough, but on bad days, I steer clear of it like a plague.

It smelled absolutely perfect on paper, but somehow it rarely ever works well on me. It's overwhelming, dizzying and I feel like I'm being enveloped in a cloud of sea salt and sweet figs even with just a spray. This is by far the least-used perfume in my collection because of that reason.

But I can see how it works on some others. Objectively speaking, it's very charming and I remember how much I really loved it on paper: pure magic. It's intriguing. It commands you to smell it again. The best way to describe this is something that has very distinct personality. You can really love it or really despise it.

Overall, a very magical and mysterious perfume, but sadly it rarely ever works for me.

Rating: 8/10

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: My favorite fig fragrance. It's more complex then other famous fig fragrances (Fico di Amalfi Acqua di Parma or Philosykos Diptyque). There are some citrus-woody notes that make this fragrance very delicious and well rounded. Simply beautiful - aromatic, sweet & fresh.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: This is a beautifull summer flowery citrus scent but is not unisex imho. Is a woman scent.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
great perfume great invention , this is my favorite fig perfume after Philosykos by Diptyque , but this one makes me really go my to my village in Lebanon , i feel home wearing it .
So pleasant perfume even if i expected to smell a warm earthy scent but no it was fresh elegant and rich , really the touch of bergamot , lemon and mandarin added too much specially in the beginning ,
it is a very suggested perfume for who likes nature in green & fresh .

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Such a beautifully unique fragrance! I have not smelled such a rich, complex, airy fragrance like this before. Sure, I have tried rich ambery vanilla fragrances with spices and incense, but nothing like this. The fig in this fragrances gives me a rich leathery feel almost like dried figs, and the woodiness of the juniper makes everything more robust. I am going to burn through my sample so fast that I really think I should purchase a botle within the coming days. Longevity is around 6 hours, projection is mild, but I don't care! This fragrances smells so good that I cannot dismiss it due to the performance. This is literally the first fragrance that I have smelled that put a smile on my face the second I smelled it. Great Job, Mr. Ellena!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I am very picky about perfumes. Even though I like a lot of them, I find there are very few I can wear without feeling ill or head-achy after a while. But I don't just want to wear citrusy smells all the time, even though those are generally safe for me.

So, I still love to order and test samples. And every once in a while, one in the lot I've sampled makes me go, "Whoa, this is special". It happened with Diptyque's L'ombre dans L'eau and Philosykos and Chanel's Les Exclusifs Sycomore, Bois des Iles, and No 22.

And now it's happened with Un Jardin en Mediterranee. I LOVE this. It's fresh but rich. I just get the sense of something syrupy and thick, but NOT in an overpowering way. I don't mean syrup-y like overt sweetness, but more like tree sap. Naturally sweet tree sap.

Actually, as I wore this throughout the day, I kept getting more of the woody notes, to the point I almost felt this is what a Christmas tree in the Mediterranean would smell like. Don't ask me why. It doesn't make much sense, but that's the image I kept getting.

It's sweeter than Philosykos, and to be honest, I don't know which one I like more. Philosykos is greener and sharper (EDT, haven't tried the EDP), and this has the fig smelling riper. I love both and I can see myself craving both of them on different days.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: it is a breath from mediterrean gardens,really...My favourite summer scent for summer.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: It's very...vegetable.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
beautiful scent gets compliment from every body - i give it:
smell: 10
longevity : 8.5
projection : 8.5

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
The first time I tried this all I smelled was loamy soil! Like the earth in the garden - then over time the other scents emerged, as if the garden was sprouting & growing right there, at that moment.

I love this. It is amazing.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I like it very-very much! I'm tempted to wear it myself, but considering comments here people tend to find it quite feminine. I guess I'd better find a girl who's willing to wear it and tolerate me sniffing her all the time. :)

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: By the way, I do own sur le nil, which I totally love

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Last year I smelled this, smelled great. But I couldn't see myself, 21, wearing it. The smell would fit great for someone from South America or Southern Europe like Italy- somewhere warm climate with someone who has dark skin. I dunno, that was just what I thought-- just like heavy oud reminding me of people in the middle east and india, since a lot of people I know from those area would not buy any perfume that does not smell heavy.

It smelled like.... scent good for use only if I were to visit the beach, which I totally hate. And smelled like a scent good for someone 30 and up.

Last month I smelled it again...smelled too strong and yucky.

Today, I smelled it again at Hermes boutique...and I liked it! I was given paper sealed in small plastic bag so I could smell the middle and base note. I came home and after 6 hours and 12 hours later, I am smelling this and I really like it. I think in the past, I was never interested in woody scent since I never walked into any teenager or women in 20s wearing woody scent. But after roaming niche perfumeries and smelling all sorts of scents, I got used to woody scent :D:D

I know it is so odd that I initially thought the perfume was okay, but not a fit for me, then it smelled so yucky, then finally today it smelled good. But I might try it on my skin a couple times, and perhaps it does fit me.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Just sheer perfection for a light bright summer scent. Likely to become a classic for many and I highly recommend anyone pick up a bottle of this stuff, and give it a whirl around the nostrils and try on their skin. Worthy of all the high praise from the members who have commentated.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
I started to believe , Guerlain isn't for me.
In general they don't seem to klick and conceirning the other jardins -
They did not.
So this was the last one to go................Love !
I wish I tried this from the very beginning...
The citruses are lovely at starters, the oleander is a new note for me but orange flowers I love.
But what strikes me the most is the very nice balance between
the woods and the ffreshness of the citruses .
And the fig together with pistachio really stands out on me ,
almost like a solitare drydown.
The fact that its not too sweet , other than the pistachio-
will make it very wearable this upcoming summer too !
Yeay !

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
Amazingly interesting scent! This perfume has medicament or herb scent in it. I guess it comes from the fig leaf note.
The fragrance is green and close to nature. Fresh and clean.
I like it a lot, this is a beautiful garden full of amazing scents. Very nice summer fragrance.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
So I've been wearing this for about two hours now and I'm cautiously in love. Somehow it's not at all what I expected it to be and yet now I can't think how I could have thought it would be anything different. It's exactly how I would expect a Mediterranean garden to smell. It has a sort of balmy quality mixed in with the cypress, fig leaf and cedar. I haven't gotten much citrus in this wearing, though - I'll have to see if it shows up the next time I try this.

To me it's very much a unisex scent, perhaps leaning a tad towards masculine. As temporalgrace said, it's not so much a perfume as a concentrated version of the smell in a garden. I adore it, I find it very striking.

This is definitely going on my "must buy" list.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: It's not a "wow, what is that lovely smell?" kid of scent, but more of a slightly earthy green scent that creeps in slowly. It doesn't really smell like perfume, but rather the scent that clings to the tips of your fingers after collecting spices from your garden. It's very light and it's fairly pleasant, but fig leaf isn't one of my favorites and this doesn't really grab me.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Un Jardin en Méditerranée – I like figs and I thought this would WOW me, but meh; well it smells like figs, very light; again diptyque has a better interpretation for figs

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
It starts out like brushing against the blossoms of a bitter orange (neroli) and sitting on a sun warmed cedar bench, eating a fig dipped in honey, with the almost salty taste of sea water on your lips, as if you'd just dried yourself from a dip in the ocean.

I'm in love.

It does seem very feminine to me, but not 'girly' at all.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: I smell mostly bergamot and lemon with some cypress. I find citruses too overwhelming here. It is okay but not a love. Unfortunately, I dropped my decant and it broke, so I will not be able to retest it in the future. On the side note, initially I was not impressed with Eau de Merveilles but it grew on me. However, after one test I decided Un Jardin En Mediterranee is not worth a full bottle for me.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew:
The salty sea air hits you first then the fig and citrus appear. I dont usually like the fig scent as I usually find it too sweet and heavy but fortunately this doesnt ruin the scent for me at all. Warm musky vanilla then appears before settling down with the juniper and cypress. Cypress is a note that for me always immediately conjures up images of italy. It just had to be in this scent.
This scent amazingly manages to be clean, fresh, warm and deep, all at the same time. The sum of these different notes successfully recreates for me a sunny walk along the sea shore somewhere in the med. Bliss. I was also very impressed on its sillage and longevity. I would agree with the moderate level for both.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Top notes of citrus with bottom notes of cyprus and cedar. Every time I wear this I'm transported to an Italian garden on the seashore.....OMG it's so so lovely. I started to wear it only in the summer, but here it is October and I'm still wearing it. Nice citrus fragrance, but one with some depth. Just adore it!

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Similar to Nil, but this is sweeter and not that sour, just a little, I recognize the base/style of Hermes, typically, nor too modern like other smells, but neither oldish. Good feeling to wear it in warm climate, refreshes all time and not an offensive smell. The price is high slightly.

name: Un Jardin En Mediterranee Hermès (unisex) ~ 2003
reivew: Just perfection. It's sunny, bright, and lovely. Imagine a beautiful forest filled with lemon trees, and fig trees, and in the distance the ocean. That legitimately is what this fragrance smells like to me. Hermes is in my opinion one of the great perfumers of our time. Just classic, well made juice. I highly recommend you pick up a bottle of this stuff, and give it a whirl.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This should have been called f****** fabulous

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Much of what needs to be said has been said. This is a in your face leather scent with raspberry and florals supporting it. I love it but cannot wear this one no matter how I try. It feels like the scent wears me more than I'm wearing the scent. I do think this can be that 'bad' boy scent but go easy on the trigger, its extremely pungent.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Although it's a nice scent, it smells just like Ombre Leather to me. Maybe a wee bit lighter. I don't detect any raspberry in here. Just straight up leather, like Ombre Leather.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: 3 stars. Glamourous leather. Linear

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Drake wasn’t lying when he said “Tom Ford Tuscan Leather, smellin like Brick” lol 10/10 easy

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I tested this on a guy, uhh... in the know, and he said it does not smell exactly like cocain; but it's in the same realm ("it's like raspberries don't smell exactly like strawberries", he said).
I sorta like it, but smelling it on him made me think it's not gonna work for any occasion other than perhaps hanging out in an underground club.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Smells like leather. Awkward. Like wearing a gourmand that smells just like Hershey's syrup. I've never liked a Tom Ford fragrance yet.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Nobody likes it around me when asked (have asked many times)..., but I do. People find it too offensive. I love it, and going to wear it anyway.10/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Some years have passed since I have tried a sample of this wonder for my first time. Now, I have finally decided to take the big step, and take this beauty in a full bottle.

Where to begin...
first consideration: I think reformulation and Estée Lauder acquisition took 'minor' reformulation to this beast, since I remember a very similar scent, compared to few years ago. This is the only TF I have tried by now, but I already have the sensation it could be monumental and one of the best - if not the masterpiece - of the entire Tom Ford Private Blend line.

This fragrance is quite linear and eternal - at least for 6 to 8 hours, where the breakpoint of drydown begins. It will last hours and hours, so you will have to love it, although I suspect it is hard not to love a quality product like this. Could be offensive, though.

Second (and very unusual) consideration: I don't know if it is the reaction with my skin or a recent formula, but I am quite sure the leather note is artificially re-created here. An illusion.

I can detect suede, a lot of raspberry (sweet note) and it settles in a thyme - woody background that is gorgeous during drydown, all accompanied by a pinch of saffron mixed with the omnipresent 'coke' freebase mark (maybe a little depowered, but still here in all its splendor).

An irreverent punch in the face!

The amazing thing is that these elements combined together contribute to give a raw, rugged and dry quality leather - that, in my opinion, should be a somehow 'harsh' note.

The bottle itself is a work of art, reminding a solid and strong Doric order column of ancient Greek's architecture, unveiling the vision of Mr. Tom Ford back in his glorious heydays.

Ultra masculine, fills a room and takes no prisoners. Two atomization will likely last for an entire day or even longer... God have mercy if you spray it on your dresses. A bit overpriced, but still it is one of the most wonderful lines in perfumery world (at least, it is possibly the highest end in the designers frags world).

When you smell it, you can smell success, richness, the Hollywood world, fake-plastic-surgery-rich superstars, luxury... I can figure very easily a lot of actors, models, directors in the jet set to wear this to their parties or formal events.

It is an otherworldly fragrance, a godlike perfume.

Maybe I will radically change my judgement in the future; by now, indeed, I thank Heaven made TF to dream bigger than anyone else during his times - and becoming such a visionary!

Chapeau!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Hello, I've come to tell you to buy la yukawam instead and buy your mom a gift with the 2 to 3 hundred you saved

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
For some reason the raspberry note is not very pronounced on my skin. I just get strong leather, suede, resins, amber. It is very potent, It has strong projection and longevity. I can't wear it, it is too masculine. It is amazing on men.
I have MAC Ruby woo which is somewhat similar but is much more feminine (the fruity and floral notes are in the center with the leather) and I recommend it for females who enjoy leather scents.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Many years ago this use to have a herbal gasoline crispy leather opening that seriously reminisced pure real cocaine. This lasted for hours and the raspberry note was a lot less sweet and prominent. These days it’s still the beast it used to be but more like a jar of raspberry jam thrown over a leather jacket.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Super realistic leather with a hint of raspberries. In what it's trying to do, its easily 10/10. Sadly this is not my cup of tea at all. But if you like the description of the smell, you should blind buy this. And i usually dont recommend anyone to blind buy anything.

EDIT: I feel in love with this one. First try i felt like this was too much for me, a little too raw and smoky, but now i love it. The genius combination of raspberry mixed with the high-quality brand new Ferrari interior is my weak-point, i cannot wait for colder weather so i can wear this every day. Mr. Ford, hats off to you for this one, cause this will permanently stay in my collection.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is one of, if not the best leather centric fragrances on the market.
Opulent Leather with a hint of raspberry sweetness.
The drydown has some animalics lurking in the background to give it further depth.

Picture this: You are sitting in the interior of a brand new Ferrari while eating raspberries and petting your pet tiger cub. 🐅

Leather, Raspberries, Animalic = Tuscan Leather
Another masterpiece and a masterclass in perfumery from TF

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is an enhanced Ombre leather, when it dries it gets better rather than stronger like Ombre leather. If you spray Ombre and Tuscan side by side they will last the same amount, but Ombre stops projecting faster, and has less character, pure leather. This turns the raspberry into less sweet more smokey scent. If you smell it really hard it will give you a burnt tobacco smell very deep down. It's brilliant.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Drydown separates this from ombre leather, it gets better as it dries, unlike ombre leather imo

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Saffron compliments the bright, animalic leather well. Raspberry adds a rosy, aldehydic touch while woods and amber hold it all together nicely. An excellent creation that deserves all the attention it gets.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Too masculine, leathery, animalic, so divine!
In addition to leather and vetiver, I also get the scents of salty ambergris, and incense!
The longevity is very long, and the sillage is enormous. Suitable for night events in cold seasons.
I was honestly expecting a bold animalic leather but with much of my surprise what I got was a simple and yet very striking leathery-amber with industrial facets.
Tuscan leather is the fragrance I imagine gangsters would wear, Someone like al pacino in godfather or Tom hardy in legend movie.
Extremely masculine, I have no idea why it's labeled unisex.!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: It’s delicious. I wear it for myself, cause I know people think a woman is not supposed to smell like leather. But is one of my top 5 best perfumes ever. It smells amazing, like the inside of a very fancy car with a sexy raspberry fragrance. Leather and raspberry. Raspberry is quite strong on my skin so it make me feel feminine even with the strong leather note. Love.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Opens very bitter and leathery, drydown is a bit sweeter. This is a warm, but very harsh leather scent. For me the raspberry is unnecessary because it amplifies the (already very prominent) leather too much.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This juice by far the best Leather fragrance in the WORLD ever produced ... period !!

It's a stunner, majestic, opulent, luxurious, bold, sexy, alluring, & high quality amazing blend in all aspects. IMO this is the best TF private blend fragrance, even better than TV. I have both & TL by miles is much better than TV.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tuscan Leather is everything you'd expect from Tom Ford's Private Line - high quality, audacious and unapologetic. Along with Tobacco Vanille, Tuscan Leather was the first Private Line I ever smelled, and I was shocked by its boldness and depth. When you first spray it, it smells overwhelmingly like leather, like the seats of a new car or a leather jacket. Obviously, the presence of leather didn't surprise me, but having only smelled designer fragrances at that point, I guess I expected it to be combined with other accords, like in Spicebomb for example. In the opening of TL, the saffron gives the leather a spicy touch. While leather is the predominant accord throughout, as it dries down, the raspberry and amber become more prominent, giving it a little bit more fruitiness and smoothness. It's got a definitive ashiness too, almost like when you smell cigarette smoke from a distance.

As you'd expect, the projection is heavy, and the longevity is incredible. I can smell it on me after showers, and on clothing for days. Its boldness makes it more suited to evening wear, especially if you want to have an impact, and its heaviness lends itself to colder weather.

People say it's either love it or hate it, and for the majority of people, they may not like it, or at least would prefer more mainstream fragrances. It's my most expensive fragrance and definitely the least likeable by mainstream standards. However, I don't think that is to the detriment of this fragrance. There is no reason whatsoever to spend this much money on a fragrance just to smell nice to those around you - if that's what you want then buy Dior Sauvage and be done with it. The only reason to spend this much is for yourself, if you are interested in fragrance in more of the artistic sense, and want to push the boundaries further than is possible with designer fragrances.

Ombré Leather from the signature line is definitely more palatable, and if you just want to please those around you, the Signature Line is definitely a better bet, but if you're bold and want to experience something more impactful and 'out there', TL along with the rest of the Private Line is very much worth a look. Don't blind buy it, though.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: What caught my attention upon initial spray was the thyme and saffron opening. Then the suede, then the flower and raspberry sweetness. Finally the Amber and woods. This scent is for the sophisticated individual who knows what he/she wants and how to get it. Fairly long lasting, with 1 spray lasting 4 to 5 hours on my skin. Definitely try first before buying.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
When I first sprayed this in store, I immediately fell in love and purchased a full bottle. Fast forward a few months and I grew to despise it! No doubt this is part and parcel of the olfactory journey.

Initially I loved that I could pick up leather and suede that is sweetened by notes of raspberry. However now all I smell is industrial gears, with industrial oil smattered across an animal's hide with a highly synthetic raspberry note that sits awkwardly on top.

Please - do not use my review as a basis to buy it or not. Go smell it yourself - many people seem to adore it! I did at the start and overtime grew to hate it. This bottle will definitely be on my shelf for many years!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Masterpiece that cannot be missed in your collection.One of my favourite TF. I find irresistible on men, but could suit a strong woman for a night date. Very addictive and seductive. Unfortunately I found someone offended and confused by the smoke, therefore not office scent and not a safe blind buy. 4/5

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Well what can I say that hasn't been said already!!! Tuscan Leather is a game changer. The raspberry and leather blend together like nothing else, it gives a sharp sweet smokey scent that will turn heads. Projects well and lasts long but its %100 a Male frag, perfect for a Night out the Town like a Club or Bar. 9/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tuscan Leather is not what I expected, but in a fantastically alluring way. I have heard some comparing it to the signature blend Ombré Leather (I own a bottle), but personally cannot see them comparing in any way. I really like both, but for completely different reasons and I think that they are certainly both worth having.

Perhaps somewhat strangely, I don’t get a massively strong leather note in this one. To me, Tuscan leather is an intoxicating blend of smokey, tart and sweet spices, that dries down to a gorgeous rounded out layer of suede. I reckon the name ‘Tuscan Suede’ might have suited this one more. The leather note I get from OL is much more of a dirty, badass leather jacket. This is more refined and dressed up, as if you rode your motorcycle in the day and wore OL, you would transition into TL for dinner and drinks.

A stunner of a fragrance for colder weather. I have purchased a bottle.

EDIT: I had heard that this fragrance was reformulated and the cocaine note has been toned down, so I was cautious of batch variation. The original review was based on a decanted sample that I assume came from a newer bottle. The full bottle I purchased is a discontinued 30ml size and hence an older batch and let me tell you: the older is MUCH closer to what I expected. Sharp, gasoline-like raw leather in the opening and less sweet in the base. Still, no doubt in the smoky, tart, supple suede dry down this is fantastic and unique to OL. If you really want to ‘smell like brick’ like Drake says, try to find an older bottle. I love it.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The best leather perfume in the market without any close competition many brands tried to Copy or clone this fragrance and no one came close to the real deal

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
When I close my eyes and smell this, it takes me to the leather markets of Florence.
Super heavy on leather for first hour but mellows down to sweetness. 2 sprays are enough.
Sometimes I layer it with Amouage Lyric man, the rose and leather go really well together.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tuscan Leather is an all time Tom Ford favorite. Sweet raspberry mixed florals at the top blended perfectly with woods, leather, and amber. It's a performance beast and works perfectly in the winter months. But if you want to stand out in the crowds he's my secrete layering or blending: blend 15ml of Tuscan Leather and 15ml of Creed Aventus in a 30ml decant spray bottle. The sweet raspberry pineapple black currant with smokey woods and leather will be a night out you will not forget.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The leather slapped me across the face and they offered me a raspberry for my trouble.

I don't think I'm quite sophisticated enough in my fragrance journey to appreciate this. It really smells like leather. Like actual leather in a leather shop. Not fragrance leather that is trying to be pleasing. Actual oily and the good kind of stinky animal hides.

I don't dislike this. But I just don't understand it. Yet.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Update: my man bought me 100 mL for Valentine's Day 2021. My first full bottle of Tom Ford! I am much excite. :D

I bought a 5 mL decant after having my world turned upside down by a 1 mL freebie. Dealers, that's how they get you, I swear...

I went bonkers and sprayed approximately an entire mL allllllllllllllll over my chest, neck, and up and down my inner arms while getting dressed for work today.

"Jesus Christ, whose bones are you trying to jump?" was probably my favorite comment from a colleague.

YOLO, and lesson learned. Even for a chronic oversprayer, two will do with this beast.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Absolutely dumbfounding that nearly 200 people above have voted this fragrance as being “weak” or “very weak”...

Must be sniffing fakes... They simply cannot have their noses on the real deal... or maybe they are suffering olfactory fatigue or olfactory adaptation to it?..

I sprayed 1 single spray of this on my inner elbow at 6am this morning before work.. didnt want to push it and offend anyone at the office so I went extremely conservative with it..

It is now 5:45 in the afternoon and I can still clearly smell it wafting off my inner elbow.

This is an absolute powerhouse and it actually smells better as it fades... the first hour, even with one spray, can be overpowering and quite possibly headache inducing..

I wore two sprays of it on my day off last week and nearly choked to death on it..

Less is more in this instance.

Burying your nose in it and smelling it up close isnt really that pleasing to the nose.. thats not to say it smells bad, its just too strong. It smells bloody nice from a foot or so away.

As for the “smells like cocaine” claims.. if your coke smells like this, i’m sorry, but you need to find a new coke dealer..

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Not adding a review just some information:

The cocaine smell probably comes from methyl benzoate, the smell that cocaine releases in moist air, and what drug dogs are trained to sniff out. I have heard that the newer formulations are not as cocainey (not tried the old ones). You could buy some methyl benzoate (available online as a perfume ingredient) and apply them together to amp up the "coke bender" note :)

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
"In some ways, this scent wears the person - this impolite smell needs a good fit with a rugged character."-- @mikecch

I received this as a ~1 mL decanted freebie with the purchase of 2 mL of Ombre Leather. I like Ombre Leather, as I feel it is more versatile and easy to wear in a variety of situations, and I don't feel weird wearing it work.

I *love* Tuscan Leather, though. All of my favorite notes (Raspberry, Thyme, Leather and Suede) in one downright addictive tiny vial. I don't know if I would want to wear it work, as it feels explosive and impolite to other's personal space. Longevity is impressive for my skin, around 7-8 hours.

My wallet aches at the idea of $250 for 50 mL, but all I'm waiting for is a point multiplier event at Sephora to click "Add to Basket", since I doubt this goes on sale. If it weren't so damn expensive, this would easily become my new signature.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is one of the very few that, when i have it on, i close my eyes (literally) in olfactory climax while smelling the top of my hand.

Resinous ashy leather concealing a tender approachable side.

This could easily be my signature if i decided to have one.

I don't know why, but every time i wear it, i feel like i'm traveling somewhere. It invokes vacations, luxury hotels, Mediterranean marinas with expensive yachts and topless sports cars parked on the surrounding streets. That's the image i get when i wear it. It almost makes me want to pack my bags and travel.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Here's my question (and long story) to all of you regarding this fragrance.

The first time I came across TF TL was in a Nordstrom in Toronto, a few years ago now. I knew right away that I had stumbled across something special and I'm not going to be able to add anything about the fragrance itself that hasn't already been said by all of you.

I showed my wife and if you knew my wife, you'd know she could care less about my fragrance obsession. But even she agreed that this was nice and she'd be all right with me buying it. But there it sat on Private Blend row with a Private Blend price tag. No matter, the sales woman gives me three 4ml samples to take home, so now I have 12ml's of TL anyway.

Every once in a while I'd put it on and think, I need to get this. Then one day my wife and I are back in Nordstrom and we see something called Ombre Leather from TF. We sample it, she loves it more than TL and it's $100 less. SOLD! So now I have a leather fragrance in my collection. Yay!

Then one day I'm in Sak's and the sales lady loves me (they love anyone who will talk to them about fragrances) and she shows me (and gives me) literally a bag full of Clive Christian samples. So I try on "C" and I think "man... that smells familiar!"

Then I come across a guy named Alan who's trying to unload a bottle of Velvet Oud Rose from Jo Malone. I go to meet him to to potentially buy it but he brought some other frags with him, including a bottle of Oro 1920 from Bois 1920. Once again "man... this ALSO smells familiar" so I bought that instead of the Jo Malone.

There's no question that Tuscan Leather is the best I've smelled from this particular leather/fruit smell. Clive C is very smooth. Oro 1920 is extremely smooth, long lasting and perfectly unisex, probably the closest to Tuscan Leather. Ombre Leather is dirty, strong, has a bit more edge but underneath has that same TL scent.

And then you look at the long line of fragrances above under "This Perfume reminds me of" and there's currently TWENTY different ones. So then I start to think "is TF even the original of this fragrance or did they just copy someone else?" "are there better ones out there I haven't even tried?'

Tom Ford is so popular and for someone like me who lives in Toronto Canada where choice is actually limited, it's easy to assume that Tuscan Leather is the gold standard for this scent but is that actually the case?

So the question I have for you is this. Is it worth it, to pay Private Blend prices for 50 ml of a fantastic fragrance when you can likely get something extremely close somewhere else for less?

Don't get me wrong, I'd love to have this in my collection but since I already own Ombre Leather which is from TF and Oro 1920 which is fantastic and even my little samples of not only Clive C but also TF Tuscan Leather, would I pay nearly $300 CDN for 50ml's of the Private Blend?

Especially knowing there are 20 other fragrances out there that smell similar?

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Smells like cocaine. What's not to love?

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Leather & Raspberries are v Strong Notes in this Perfume along with Saffron, Suade, Woody, Amber, Olibanum, Thyme & Jasmine. This is Most Polarizing Scent, A Bit Dark Character associated with Perfume. It not Smooth & Sweet Fragrance Initially First 30 Mins but a Bit Dark & Rough Edge attached to it. A get a bit Dusty Tobacco Vibe combined with Leather & all Notes I mentioned earlier. After 30 Mins Its Turns out Little Sweet with Dark Tones

Its a Strong Masculine Scent, Business Women and Women in Martial Arts are my Examples of Type of Women who can pull this Scent Well.

Only Recommended for Winters, Recommended for Fall, Spring & Winter Nights & Winter Days.

I agree with angie66 review, Its like a Bad Boy meeting Good Girl

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Gorgeous and elegant plain and simple.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Raspberries, second-hand smoke and an old suede jacket.

The opening of berries and cigarettes is joined by a sueded leather accord - slightly dusty, a little dirty, strangely likeable.

This smells nothing like leather from Tuscany, but more like a worn-out leather couch in a gambling den.

In some ways, this scent wears the person - this impolite smell needs a good fit with a rugged character.

Recommended.
The polarising older brother to the more versatile Ombré Leather.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I blind bought this.
Before that I read in a comment below that it smells like a dirty ashtray.
When I took my first sniff on my arm I said:
"He was right. It do smell like a dirty ashtray!"

But now to the good part:
I can't get enough of this smell. I crave it!
I spray it on my arm just to be able to sniff it.
I didn't get the raspberry at first, but then after wearing it a couple of times, l get it immediately, hiding in fresh clean suede and leather, along with some smokey vibe.
It's elegant and dirty at the same time. I guess you have to be a little bold to wear this.
You can get away wearing it on a Summer night, but it's more suitable for colder climate.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The Scarface of perfumes.
Total luxury, elegance, but always with a good dose of irreverence.
Linear direct simple perfect in its being.
Leather, suede with added raspberry (fruity but a little tart)
Lust and being altered on a 20 thousand euro leather sofa.
Nothing to add.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Wonderful raspberry & leather. Sometimes i close my eyes while wearing this and the colour that comes to my mind is BROWN. It´s the stereotype of leather, that´s what you get here and i mean that in a very positive way. When you want a lether-frag with no hocus pocus, then Tuscan Leather is your compadre.

Sure, Marquis de Sade 1740 and Naomi Goodsir Cuir Velours is two great leather-scents also, but they come "with a twist" and thats fine - sometimes....but in the cold winter, when i just want that brown, browner, darkest leather, it´s Tom Ford i reach for.

Some people say this is raw and unpolite - i don´t agree. It´s easy to wear, sexy and smooth. Masculine + 30 years of age.

Instagram: @a_fraghags_tale

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Just drown me in this, its the best leather I've ever smelled.

Raspberry, touch of smokiness, and luxurious leather to even it all out. Absolutely divine blend of notes that makes an exquisite masterpiece.

Tom Ford, just take my money already!!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: To me this smells like pure, rich leather. I don't get much of any other notes except to prop up the leather and make the composition. The type of leather is new and expensive- it really reminds me of the smell of a new leather shoe. It's definitely polarizing and not for everyone, but a must try if you like the leather note. I find Ombre Leather to be a bit more mass-appealing and less polarizing, however for people wanting a pure strong leather, Tuscan Leather is where it's at.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: What more can be said about this beast that has not already been said. It polarizes, yes, for some, it is heavenly and for others the smell of a burnt out car. The fact there is no middle ground is testament to its strong character. I adore it. I don't know if enough attention is given to the summer-berry top note - perhaps Drake's cokey homage has drawn attention away from that. It reminds me starting out of the raspberry fondant filling you get in those dark chocolate creme bars from Frys. Though the insanely powerful leather/suede engine soon pulls away from the raspberry note, it never quite goes away and leaves the lingering (boy does this stuff linger) remnants silk smooth and never too basic. As for projection - only wear this to work if you are a show off, or want to impress one person in particular - hah, but even that might be a crap shoot. Finally seasonality. Possibly a bit sickly in hot weather, but absolutely perfect for ur winter wooly scarf. Yum.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is another love for me from Tom Ford. Even though I like OMBRE Leather more (very unique, good value), this is one is also very appealing. Smells like a very sophisticated Leather all the way, sort of what I smell in the houses of my rich friends. Its a very good smooth scent from start to finish -- no harsh openings, no overpowering drydowns. Very nice, and its well worth the price IMO.

My only gripe with this is that it smells too close to other Leather fragrances with better prices. I feel its too close to Godolphin or even Fahrenheit for me to justify the higher price tag, even if it IS a lot smoother and more refined. Its the best of the 3, no doubt, but not by much.

Its a pretty good performer on my skin too -- lasting around 5 or 6 hours as a detectable aura. Projects really well in the first 3 hours, is always present, but is never overpowering. Overall, a classy Leather that's completely safe to blind buy, if money is not an issue.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: leather in a bottle

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is an INSANELY awesome fragrance for the beginner fragrance collectors and veterans. If you're afraid of pulling the trigger on a bottle then PLEASE try a decant or sample of this scent. You will not regret it.

This baby opens up with a strong deep leather/suede with the gentle sweetness tones of raspberries underneath. After about 5 - 6 hours of fruity-leather accords, you're left with a smooth leather-suede scent throughout the dry down which lasts for a whopping 12 hours on me. I kid you not, I sprayed this on my sweater and my friends are just looking at me like "Yo, why the hell you still wearing that scent today?!". I'm just over here trying to explain to them it's just stuck to the sweater! Hah!

So here's my scoring for this fragrance:
Projection: 9/10 (This baby will fill up the room! So be wary of how many sprays you use.)
Longevity: 10/10 (You couldn't ask for a better lasting fragrance, this is the go-to for long lasting!)
Uniqueness: 10/10 (My first spray, this BLEW MY MIND! It also turns heads, including my wife's, and she's not a big fan of leather.)
Price: 6/10 (This can be a bit tough for many people to pull the trigger on. Yes it IS expensive, since it's Tom Fords private collection. However, I swear this baby is worth EVERY penny!)
Overall: 8.5/10 (If you don't have this fragrance in your collection, I implore you to try it at least once in your life. Even if you hate leather, this may be the scent that changes your mind!)

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
A very “American” perfume: so strong, so bombastic, you have to like it, if you don't, it'll bust down your door and bring you democracy.

A dry, sweet, artificial berry gives you a bright dentist-poster smile, not natural, but effective. Heck, if one can be beautiful, who wants to be natural?

What ensues is a heavily tar-like leather (I was thinking both Suederal and Isobutyl Quinoline, but what do I know?) with a hint of high-pitched saffron (Safraleine), mixed with Tom Ford’s trade mark dry powder base, which smells half cocoa, half coke.

This composition is crafted with a lot of exclamation mark (!) in mind: very pleasant ! very straightforward !! very...in-your-face !!!

A rather linear scent, it rejects nuance, juice, or unnecessary sentiments: it is what it is.

Gotta admit, the scent is superb, hard to NOT fall in love with it, because you know It won't take no for an answer.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The Best

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Favorite Tom Ford Fragrance and the first I ever purchased. Smells classy and elegant 10/10.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: On my first spray of this all I got was a very heavy, smokey leather. This reminds me a lot of spending time with the boys in the garage, working on our project cars when we were teenagers. A couple hours in I am getting a softer leather fragrance, with warm vanilla undertones. I wish I could detect the raspberry, but my nose just isn't picking it up. This is a really great fragrance if you like leather.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: dry leather stained by tar, yet it distills some floral beauty

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
First impressions:

The opening smells like a luxurious leather jacket/bag. Then after 5 mins the sweet raspberry kicks in. The leather takes a back seat here. It is one of the most beautiful scents I've ever smelled. I couldn't stop sniffing myself. Damn that smells so freaking good. After 2 hours you can smell the smokey leather notes mixing with raspberries. It's super awesome and it might come off as a bit feminine in the first 2 hours but then it's a manly scent. This thing projects and projects off my skin. I got the 2019 batch with the old bottle? No idea. Anyway people telling this has been re-formulated or whatever have a fake one I guess.

This thing keeps projecting like the oldskool Dior Homme Parfum.

You can seriously drive women crazy with this one.

EDIT: received Ombre Leather today. OL is less sweet and it smells like a burning leather jacket instead of sweet smokey leather.

EDIT: Dry down on OL is almost the same as TL but less sweet, less depth imo.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is probably the forerunner of the fruity leather family, typified by TL, a yuqawam, aoud leather (Montale), pure leather (merchant of venice), and oud saphir. I havd them all in full bottles or original testers, so I am happy to compare herein. They all share the same backbone despite the claimed difference in note composition.

The difference between all 5 above is the performance mainly and how thick they smell. There might be a minor difference in sweet vs leather strength in each, but to me they are all replicas of each other, regardless of which one preceded the others.

Graded from strong to weak are: TS and la yuqawam, aoud leather, pure leather and oud saphir.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I have heard about this perfume from celebrities. Therefore I made that move to test it. The moment I smelt paper blot I got a punch from real life ashtray. So I highly advise, please don't rush to smell what you spray if you are not smoker. Ash is real.

Suprisingly the rest development was pure sexual flirt, I never smelt anything like it. The scent makes female toes curl up. But yeah, I believe, you must be smelling like cookie to pull this perfume off. On someone with healthy pleasant natural skin scent it should be delicious.

To sum things up, it has really nice fruity tobacco and leather scent, with time it becomes perfum-y leather jacket and it has some kind of sexual atmosphere.

Tom Ford knows every button of human nature.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is one of the most unapologetic fragrances you will come across. Super animalic leather kind of reined in with saffron and reaspberry. What sets this apart from all of its subsequent clones and inspirations is the smokiness of this fragrance. TL smolders for a while before it settles down, sort of settles down i should say.

If you are an alpha male, or at least want to portray one, this is it...This scent lasts a lifetime. It is not versatile, it is truly best in cold weather, formal. Wearing this in heat, or the office and even a SLIGHT over application would suffocate the room. You need to wear this with confidence and assertiveness in my opinion.

Masterpiece even if you DONT like it. This fragrance commands respect for what it is, what it represents, and the quality exhibited. Must-own for me.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I'll keep it straight to the point:

New Car Leather Smell + Cherry Car Freshener + Cocaine.

The fake cherry air freshener ruins it for me. He should have chosen a higher quality ingredient to represent the cherry. The leather is a new car/leather couch scent and is very strong! So strong, that one should consider mainly wear this during evenings only.

Strong, solid longevity, linear.

Ford's mind works where he wants to recreate scents that he experienced in some random extraordinary moment of his life. I can only imagine the story where this idea spawned...lol Slightly edgy. Sadly REFORMULATED with poor ingredients, no longer cocainey.
As an Italian, I love it as it's my favorite leather scent discovered to date next to Ombre Leather.
Warning! Out of 25 girls tested, not a single girl has said they like it, in fact, most are grossed out by it. I guess it's too strong of a processed newly made leather couch scent.
Sadly, this frag will be only for me to wear by myself.

4/5 Woofs

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: A very strong perfume. I am currently experimenting with leather dominant perfumes and so far my fav brand is Hermes (Eau d'Hermes being my favorite). This however gave me a reminder of heated tobacco.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
A leather jacket, raspberries and a line of coke. Perfect.

Although there are so many similar leather scents out there this was the pioneer.

This and Widian London are my two favourites.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
There's a reason why so many people love this, and why songs are written about it. It has an air of sophistication but also an effortless cool. It is smart, dark and sexy - reminiscent in attitude (if not exact smell) of a black leather biker's jacket and a cigarette. It never feels too dark or heavy - it's just right. However, even though it's the closest thing I own to a signature, I have never been able to describe it or 'get inside it', such is my love for it and such is its exquisite blending. Finally though, it has revealed its secrets to me in warmer weather (24*C).

It still opens with a deep hit of new suede and leather, but after twenty minutes or so when the suede makes way, the frankincense reveals itself so much more. It appears as a dry, smoky leather draped over a smooth rounded frankincense. Together they still pack a punch though. The frankincense just gives it that extra bit of class underneath the edgy leather. Later on, there also feels like there could be two facets to the leather accord. A sharpness from the smoky note, and a dryness from the leather and the woods - all contrasting with the roundness from the olibanum. There's also a caramelised burnt toast note, which is often confused as plastic or cocaine, but it's far too nice to pass off as either.

If it seems linear, that's just its genius. It's just tightly composed. Everything sits roughly in the same place - nothing ever too dense and never cloying. Maybe that's the source of its power - and why it held such mystery, such allure, and why I was mesmerised by it - I couldn't separate out its colours.

It occupies a similar place of perfection (but not smell) in my head as Amouage's Jubilation XV. Simply stunning. A modern classic.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is bold, dark, dirty and fierce. My wife hates it, so of course I like it even more ;)
The only subtlety about TL is the raspberry note, which is delicate and sweetens the smell of a bikers garage just a touch. I have an 'inspired by' type beard oil from a boutique place on Etsy called House Of Handsome which has more of the sweetness and I actually slightly prefer it, its easier to wear without the olfactory punch in the nose of whoever you meet!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This fragrance is like the Danny and Sandy of the perfume world. Bad boy meets good girl.

When I first put this on I instantly didn't like it. To me, it smelt slightly like sweat,all be it a sweet hint of sweat. But then after about twenty minutes, I fell in love with the smell which turned sweet and powdery on me, but with a slight hint of masculineness.

It conjures up images of getting off with a handsome bad boy in his old but cool car. Old leather seats, he smells of tobacco, any tobacco he may come across, and when you get up close to him, you can slightly smell sweat. Then the scent changes to that of a naughty sweet smelling girl who's been up to no good with the local bad boy! That smell gave me a high once it arrived. And it lasted on my skin all through the night and I could still smell it faintly this morning when I woke, reminding me of the high I'd had the night before.

I liked it eventually, but I'm slightly scared of it at first (rather like a bad boy!)

Disclaimer: I have never engaged in such shenanigans!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: To my nose, a sweet, heavy raspberry explosion. It stays this way for about 3 to 4 hours before the leather comes off the base to dance with the sweet raspberry. Above average projection throughout the longevity of 20+ hours.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Amazing fragrance - strong leather and raspberry. I feel like the longevity isn't amazing but maybe that's just my nose. I love this scent. Not a massive compliment puller but that's not why you'd wear this fragrance.... you'd wear it because you're a badass who doesn't conform to that Dior Sauvage, crowd pleasing stuff. You are your own boss. You please yourself.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tuscan Leather opens with a moderate to a strong projection of just leather. The leather is an intense accord but it feels as white, leather as opposed to animalic or pungent, yet it has a soft gasoline-vibe. The leather accord overpowers all other notes. The saffron and raspberry create a very faint sweet touch. The thyme is more noticeable and it adds a warm and spicy touch; the olibanum also accents the leather notes with its balsamic and spice tones. Towards the dry-down, the suede and leather join their notes in one that comes across as just leather; finally, amber and woody notes add a woody and resinous touch. The fragrance is linear, there is little change from the opening to the dry-down. Once Tom Ford Tuscan Leather has reached its full dry-down, it can be summarized as a strong projection, bold leather and suede fragrance with woody and very faint fruit touches. The fragrance bold, dry, elegant, casual, formal, exotic, high-quality, leathery, masculine, mature, modern, refined, and very pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2020
WOW RATING: 9/10. This is an impressive bold leather and suede fragrance.
DISLIKE RATING: 6/10. The leather note is strong; it has a soft gasoline-like vibe that some people are likely to find it offensive.
UNIQUENESS: 6/10. Leather is a very common note, although Tuscan Leather is a great one.
MASS APPEAL: 4/10. Leather fragrances are not among the most crowd-pleasing fragrances. The combination of leather and suede creates a gasoline-like vibe in this fragrance.
PROJECTION: 4/10. Moderate, about 4 feet around the wearer. Close up it feels intense.
SILLAGE: 6/10. Very good, about 6 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: 2 to 4 atomizations.
LONGEVITY: 5/10. About five hours with 3 consistent moderate projection.
SEASONS: Fall, winter. Colder nights and climate-controlled environments.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, office, casual, holidays, clubbing. In moderation, this is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 5/10. Moderate, somehow limited by seasons and occasions.
GENDER: Masculine. Traditionally leather is a masculine tone.
AGES: 30 and above.
RECOMMENDATION: This is a great fragrance for casual and formal wear. However, its cost/value isn’t favorable, for $325 for 100ml. Consider alternatives.
BLIND-BUY: No, sample it first.
SIMILAR: These are examples of leather fragrances. Tom Ford Ombre Leather is a modern and natural leather fragrance, a great one; Valentino Uomo Intense EDP, is good leather fragrance, but its longevity isn’t the best; Amouage Memoir Men EDP is a great leather, spices, and incense fragrance; Amouage Epic Man - EDP Spray includes leather, spices, and green notes; Bvlgari Man In Black Men EDP is one of the best designer’s leather fragrances, but lacks longevity; Bentley For Men Intense EDP Spray by Bentley is a leather classic, strong and good performance; Carolina Herrera CH Prive EDT includes leather and whiskey; Giorgio Armani - Armani Code Profumo EDP, is a potent leather, and slightly fruity fragrance; Guerlain L'homme Ideal EDP features leather, bergamot, and vanilla; John Varvatos Dark Rebel Rider Men EDT Spray by John Varvatos is a super dark fragrance, leather, incense, woods, all in one, but lacks longevity; Montale Aoud Leather EDP is one of the best cost/value leather and oud fragrances; Mercedes-Benz Club Black Men EDT By Mercedes-Benz is an office-friendly incense, and leather fragrance.
SUMMARY: A strong projection, bold leather, and suede fragrance with woody and very faint fruit touches. The fragrance bold, dry, elegant, casual, formal, exotic, high-quality, leathery, masculine, mature, modern, refined, and very pleasant.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is one of the most unique leather scents I’ve ever smelt. I originally smelt it at the department store – It’s very intense for the first 1-2 hours. If you are indoors, it can be unbearable at times. It is best worn if you are out doors before stepping inside. But after that it smells absolutely divine.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
A rendering of the smell found in a car with leather upholstery. A leather car upholstery suggests luxury, so the inclusion of such a perfume in Tom Ford's prestigious portfolio cannot surprise anyone.

I smelled much more complex and attractive leather-based perfumes than Tuscan Leather, but I understand very well the attachment for this fragrance. I like the smell, but I find it hard to associate it with a perfume.

It is intended exclusively for cold weather.

The projection is initially high, after which it becomes medium, and the longevity is exceptional.

Fragrance 6/10
Projection Medium/High
Longevity 20 h

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
On first spray my senses embraced the thyme note which is reminiscent of childhood and thyme-picking hikes through the mountains. And when the leather came in, my memory jumped to my grandfather's store-room in which he kept his leather boots and rubber gloves that he used when going to the fields to harvest.
What I mean is that it is very masculine and got that working man vibe to it; not office-like or soft gentlemanish type of fragrance..this needs a beard, some heavy jeans, boots, rings, strong arms and definitely an outdoor-work environment.
Hell, this even needs a horse!! Imagine a nobleman on a horse riding through fields of thyme with his breath a bit alcoholic while carrying back a basket of raspberries and holding a classic hand-rolled cigarette in his mouth riding like he don't give a damn about anything.
It got me compliments and the waiter at the coffee-shop asked me about it. I quickly gave him the sample because I had already oredered a bottle, so let him enjoy it a bit.
On my way out a woman stopped and looked at me and froze then asked about the perfume. BUT...not everyone will like it, definitely not young girls...only women will like it and definitely above thirty. If you're into older women then go for it, it's your guaranteed bait.
Rugged, dry leather, earthy thyme, smoke, alcohol, and finally comes the sweetness of raspberries just to ease a rough journey of harsh, solid display of sweaty masculinity in a Mediterranean environment.
I don't think it's for women, yet, I would recommend ombre leather for poisonous, sociopathic women who love dark fragrances.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is a plain and simple stroke of genius.

This scent smells like so many things, places, memories, emotions at the same time that is hard to review at all.

I've bought a sample of this and was very intense.

Are you experienced?

EDIT: I'd really appreciate to know the nose behind this creation.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I really like Tuscan Leather!

The leather it makes me think of is of a well loved leather chair next to a bright window in a personal library. It is smokey and woody but the fruit and floral accords brighten it up to be suitably unisex. It feels like idealized old world academia.

a woman wearing this has some power behind her and a man wearing this is very approachable.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Very dry and very earthy leather. That's basically all it comes off as to me.

It's every so slightly softer and sweeter than Ombre Leather, but to me it still just smells like dry leather and basically nothing else.

There's an earthy, greenish, musty feel that almost borders on smelling like an old wet towel that wasn't dried properly and has started to smell a bit moldy... Or like old soil... Or like a tobacco pipe that hasn't been used for a long time.

This is clearly not for me.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The best frag ever made.

Do you want to feel powerful, sexy, wealthy, interesting? Ok, then wear this.

The one that changed it all for me.

Nothing more to add.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Strong, cold, alluring.

This is another smashing scent form the TF private blend line. You can get very strong leather notes from this, with a small aroma of raspberry lurking in the background. This is probably number 2 to Tobacco Vanille in my book. Girls will love this I’m telling you, people are going to love this. You’re going to love this. I wouldn’t recommend this for a blind buy, it’s definitely a required scent, but it’s one of those fragrances that you need to smell if you’re into frags. For me this is also very long lasting, but for me it didn’t have as great of a sillage compared to tobacco Vanille.

Rating:

Longevity- 9/10
Sillage- 8/10
Overall- 9/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I keep trying different niche fragrances in hope of finding something that I love more than TL and I keep being disappointed. This remains the best fragrance ever made to me. It's true that it is not the beast that it once was but modern reformulations are still great.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
As I mentioned in my Oud Wood review, very early into my fragrance journey I went to a department store to smell fragrances. The names of this and Oud Wood intrigued me so I sniffed each. Both were love at first smell, but for different reasons. While Oud Wood is a luxurious woody delight that sits on your skin like a silk blanket, Tuscan leather is pure opulence. I could not pick out the notes at the time but it smelt like ‘wealth’. It captured my imagination for months until I saved up enough to buy it. Now I’m more experienced with fragrance I feel that I understand this beast more, but still not completely.

I’m not going to bother talking about the listed notes, but to me this doesn’t smell like ‘straight leather’ like a boot, I’m assuming it’s the raspberry but to me it’s a completely unique smell. This uniqueness is especially apparent in what can only be described as a ‘blue-centric’ town in terms of fragrances. I wore this to a concert I was playing in while dressed in all black and for some reason everyone wanted to talk to me. I had sprayed very lightly so I assume the effect was subtle, but it is an extremely unusual and alluring scent.

Speaking of which it’s a monster of performance, in winter I go with 1 spray on the chest only, and I wouldn’t dream of wearing it in any other season. But it’s nice to have in my cupboard just to sniff everyday, it’s that good. It smells like ‘the man I want to become’ if that makes any sense.

Anyway this is a solid 9 for me, would be a 10 but the fact is it is very hard to pull off in most occasions. It’s not casual by any stretch of the imagination, especially for someone in their early twenties. But come this winter time, if the quarantine ends, I will be rocking this in parties as it always gets a reaction. Not compliments thusfar, but people do treat you differently.

EDIT: A few days ago I wore this (3 sprays - arms and chest) on a warm spring day c.18-20 degrees centigrade. It’s different to the deep winter smoky leather, the raspberry, saffron and thyme poke through more. It’s really shockingly elegant, the dry down is possibly better in the warmer weather...? I will test this on a summer evening in a few months for sure... I have a feeling it could work. Either way it smells extremely luxury and exclusive.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Smelled this from a friend before reading any of the comments regarding this fragrance. As I put my nose to the used cap my nipples instantly went hard and my entire body was covered in goose bumps. This smells so similar to cocaine it gave my body an involuntary response and Instantly brought a smile to my face. Sweet raspberry soaked in diesel with spicy saffron. Three sprays and you will smell like a a candy coated brick of Columbian gold. Rough, powerful and sexy this is confidence in a bottle. You will not receive any compliments wearing this scent but who cares when you smell like the worlds most expensive cocaine

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Your inside a old hot rod with leather seats , The leather seats and interior are stained with cigar smoke , Theres a few cigar butts in the ash tray and there is a wiff of that fragranced car spray, Raspberry flavor .

Thats what Tuscan Leather smells like , Love it .

I imagine if you ran into Johnny Depp at 2am inside a bar this is exactly what he would smell like .

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tuscan Leather, fragrance where leather, suede and raspberry dominate the composition from start to finish, provides a velvety, refined, neat and elegant aura. Unisex. The aroma is an interesting combination, a leather that tries to be animalistic and masculine, but the raspberry attenuates it, making it sweet and feminine, reaching a neutral balance.

Scent: 8.9
Originality: 9.3
Versatility: 7.5 (night and suit)
Climate: autumn and winter
Occasions: Gala events
Age: between 25 to 45
Quality: 9.6
Price: 7
Sillage: 9
Longevity: 9
Design (bottle): 10
Total rating: 9.2

Main notes I smell: suede, raspberry, leather
Emotions / feeling: black and red velvet

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Very sharp and harsh. Not very realistic, doesn’t smell smooth and nice like actual leather does. I don’t care for it. Maybe it smells more realistic and pleasant after hours on the skin but I can’t get past 30 mins with it. Sorry

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
first time i tried it couldnt stand it and much preferred adp colonia leather ....however tried again months later and its one of the best things ive ever smelled

no idea why ive done a 180 on it but its amazing ...for me i get a vibe of chanel antaeus mixed with fahrenheit

elegant and refined but manly and slightly rugged ...absolute 10/10 ,not amazing projection but longevity is incredible put on at 3pm worn all day showered at night and can still faintly smell it 24 hours later

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
first time i tried it couldnt stand it and much preferred adp colonia leather ....however tried again months later and its one of the best things ive ever smelled

no idea why ive done a 180 on it but its amazing ...for me i get a vibe of chanel antaeus mixed with fahrenheit

elegant and refined but manly and slightly rugged ...absolute 10/10 ,not amazing projection but longevity is incredible put on at 3pm worn all day showered at night and can still faintly smell it 24 hours later

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tuscan Leather introduces the good'n'old paradoxical formula of uniting tradition/conservatism (intense suede) and youth and openness (a simple and almost linear raspberry). Very pleasant and youthful suede (a bit older age than Bleecker Street suede though - BTW, if you like TL formula but happened to find it a too "old man" smell, try or go with Bond Bleecker St, it's the same thing but younger, despite it's another berry there - the blueberry). The raspberry here refers to candy smell, it's that very simple sweet. A shy WOW comes to mind when you realize that the raspberry coexists with the suede for the entire life of the perfume in the skin. It's slightly ambered and muskied. Forget the frankincense: in no way it gets in the way because it ain't there. A double-edged sword: manly and hot, but also sweet and cheerfully inviting. A proposal that always delivers high versatility and, here, some radioactive performance, projecting beast mode for 2h30 and slightly above skin for another 4 hours.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Had it for about a month and my conclusion is that this is stronger than I thought it was. Thank God if this was reformulated. Can't stand obnoxious strong scents like 1 Million, Sauvage EDT or Dior Homme Parfum.

People are going crazy cause they compare it to the old ones, pre-reformulated batches, but this is still strong and potent af. Smells like raspberry gem on a burnt leather jacket.

Smells great, going to do a line now !

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I wanted to like this, gave it a couple of tries... but I still hate it. Raspberry leather headache inducing synthetic mess. It's strong for sure, but to me it smells like a leather car interior that was freshly sprayed with a raspberry smelling interior polish. The opposite of crowdpleaser, and by no means a safe blind buy.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: :’’’( why are my favorite scents reformulated.no old power

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
while i would not recommend blind-buying this - i did.
i gifted this to my boyfriend solely because i love the name and because i read somewhere that this is drake's signature fragrance.. LOL.

boyfriend is now on his second bottle. this is borderline orgasmic.. when i smell this i have an experience unlike any other fragrance. the unmistakable rich dark brown, worn, almost oily leather notes make it incredibly animalic. the raspberry twist turns this into pure sex. this should be worn exclusively by a "bad boy," or a man who is trying to give off that vibe. definitely not an office or everyday scent. definitely a date night / clubbing / whenever you want to feel like a sexy alpha-male scent.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: am i the only one that gets only a raspberry after an 1h 30min mark. I got same issues with ombre leather. also with that one the leather note just disappears (in 2 hours). its really disappointing because i really adore that leathery opening, like a big punch in your head (nose).

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Is Tuscany just too far to travel?? - then why not try a "Spraycation" with Amour by Sangado or Oud Wafaa by Al Aneeq?Both will transport you - 0n a budget - to the birthplace of the renaissance without breaking the bank and if you are feeling a need for a touch of "il toro" then you will find that the Sangado is an absolute beast! Ciao!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is like Slipknot's Psychosocial: a rough, rugged and raw opening (synthetic frankincense, thyme, oud), that transitions to a beautifully strong and melodic bridge/chorus (raspberry, saffron, jasmine).

then, like the song, it goes back and forth a bit, but the initial shock is muted by the elegant complexity and emotion behind it.

on my skin, it often morphs into a strong cedar accord, which is latent but not omnipresent.

Ive never done cocaine, but ive tasted it, so i can see how this has at least some similarity. it does have a harsh, chemical and wild personality, but that is tamed by the structure and sequencing of the composition. the duality between rough smoke and smooth tart sweetness is a masterful gambit.

this fragrance has serious presence. it is dark, bold, haunting, muscular, untouchably alpha. imagine a Russian mob boss in a Brabus G-wagon, smoking a hash-filled blunt.

in my experience, many women don't like it. but if you wear fragrance to impress women-or anyone- good night and good luck.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I'm a fan of big bold leather fragrances. Knize Ten, Cuir de Russie, Antaeus, you name it. I hoped Tuscan Leather will be immediate love for me, but it turned out to be an immediate scrubber. Way too strong, synthetic, not kind of leather I'm used to + headache inducing which rarely happens to me with any fragrance... again, totally individual and personal preference, but I hope it suffices to say that this one has its fan and also not a small number of folks that cannot stand it, so be conscious about setting where you pull it off. Not a safe blindbuy either, but given dozens of clone houses copying it (and some damn well), you can test your love/hate relationship pretty easily.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Short & sweet. I think Tom’s 2018 Ombré Leather is much nicer, more wearable, and a better fragrance all around. Compare & see for yourself. Ombré is incredible! Enjoy.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
You either love it or hate it, nothing in between. I love the smell from the bottle or on someone else, but for me it's definitely too heavy.
Btw, is it just me, or it kind of smells like cocaine? LOL Anyway, smell is very addictive.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The ultimate masculine fragrance. Bold, animalic leather coated in warm, friendly raspberry. To wear this you have to be confident, proud, and not afraid to attract attention. Honestly a woman could pull it off too if she wanted to thanks to the raspberry.

5/5

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: It smells really real and natural. Too overbearing IMO. This fragrance is totally dependent on personal preference. Definetely not a crowd pleaser.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I'm not a fan of the opening but the drydown is exceptionnal. It's a smoky leather, remind me a little bit the smokyness drydown of Aventus.
Scent : 8/10
Projection : 10/10
Longevity : 10/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tuscan Leather smells unique but it is very strong and gets annoying in some moments. But sometimes I really enjoy it.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The best of TF Private Blend (after discontinued Amber Absolute), Tuscan Leather is now just a shadow of itself. Newer releases are toned down quite a bit: I get between 6 and 8h longevity with my current decant while the first one was giving 24h+. Don't be fooled by the tester bottles in shops, it's not the same juice.

Over time I found alternatives which I now prefer because they are more wearable: Godolphin has a greener opening and a "sexier" dry down, Aoud Leather has also a "sexier" finish with its Ambergris.

The closest clone of TL for me is La Yuqawam, also the best deal if you want that strong dark leather note.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
50% similar to Ombre Leather, a nice rendition of leather with smoky undertones. To me, the raspberry is shy upon drydown, and a lingering sweetness is what shows up occasionally. Therefore, I find this more wearable for a woman than the ashy, drier OL. This is my preference of sillage; medium to soft.

Everything is Embarrassing, performed by Sky Ferreira

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I have a bottle purchased almost a week ago only wore it once.. Amazing fragrance sprayed on Monday on neck and jacket and gloves... The fragrance is still very strong on the jacket and gloves no problem with longevity and projection.....

Fragrance still in clothing a week later nice...

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
