reivew: I really like this one and have but one comment to make given all that has already been said by others: This perfume is the only one in my collection of a dozen perfumes (all of them being rather mainstream designer products) that causes allergic reactions among people I cross paths with. From precipitating itchy noses to borderline anaphylactic reactions, I no longer dare wear it if I’m going to be in an indoor milieu. I really like/love the smell but the adverse physiological reactions it risks triggering in all too many of the people I cross paths with makes it a no go. It has been relegated to the status of a very solitary indulgence. Too bad that.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Finally! Really nice. Was the only TF that intrigued me at Neiman Marcus. I can only compare it to my beloved ombre leather. It's just as they said — less wearable and less friendly than ombre, and definitely more meaner and bold.


Whereas ombre's leather is black and rubbery, this is tan and dry and definitely more bitter. Thought I'd pick up on the raspberry more than I did but wasn't like that at all. I'm sure the saffron and thyme played a part but I forgot these were in the picture. In the background hangs the jasmine and elemi but to my nose had that aventus jasmine-rose vibe. Obviously, the floral pleasantly smooths things as time goes on and things become balanced and less offensive. What I like about this one is that it's more linear than ombre. OL evolves into a powdery sweet mess which kills its badassery. This is coherent, although, does sweeten up and mellow down due to amber and suede.


This puts in my mind a steely-eyed Clint Eastwood-like cowboy/bounty hunter type that the movies try to depict. Rugged as dirt. Dry as Death Valley. Fearless as an inanimate rock.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Attention Frag. heads!!!! I just purchased a 2019 bottle from London heath row and the smell completely changed!!!!

First of all the leather is very muted and the raspberry is very extreme intensive. But what shocks me the longevity and performance sucks!!!! Honestly sucks after 2 hours there is nothing!!!

I usually pass everyday by House of Fraser and Smell Tuscan leather from the 250ml decanter they had, and it was very potent and beast mode performing juice. However, what I bought from heath row doesn't smell or perform the same.

SHAME ON YOU FORD FOR ROBBING US WITH THESE PRICES!!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I am pretty new to the fragrance world, but am not interested in mass-appealing boring fragrances such as Acqua di gio or Dior Sauvage that smell like anything else. I bought a 30 ml bottle after reading positive reviews everywhere on the internet and having a love for the smell of leather already. Upon first spray, I absolutely hated the small. Really Harsh chemical smell and the leather note was overpowering for me. However, as TL dried down on my skin it became a masterpiece. As time progressed, it lost the thick invasive smell and transformed into a beautiful sweet leather smell mixed with floral and vanilla notes. I instantly became hooked on the smell and find it extremely comforting. Lasted at least 14 hours on my skin and the projection was incredible. I was not expecting the fruitiness before buying TL and it was a pleasant surprise that adds so much depth and character to the fragrance profile. This is the real deal. Tom Ford TL is pure luxury and sophistication. I have not tried wearing it in public yet as I just received it in the mail yesterday. But, I know not everyone will enjoy the smell. Definitely made for those who do not care about receiving tons of compliments, but rather appreciate the uniqueness of a scent and how it makes them feel when smelling it on themselves.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tuscan Leather does share some similarities with Ombre Leather, but TL is richer, fuller. OL smells unfinished to me while TL is perfectly balanced and finished fragrance. Just try them both and see for yourself.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Beautiful scent! Oily leather mixed with petroleum and gasoline. Very masculine in the opening. In the mid, the leather meshes with that bright, sweet raspberry note which gives Tuscan Leather some balance. The dry down is where the leather dissipates and the raspberry note becomes more creamy along with some floral notes. One of the best cold weather scents ever made!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
A rockstar! in my top five favorite fragrances i've ever warn or got my nose on. Never found another leather fragrance that comes close. The opening can be a bit much but the drydown is sexy, long lasting and projecting just as this type of fragrance should. Beastmode no doubt. The raspberry is the scent that ties it all together. I can't think of a better cold weather lady killer.

10/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Hands down my favorite fragrance so far! I purchased a 30ml bottle after receiving a 4ml sample. Longevity is beast, base notes stay on my skin (which I have dryer skin) for at least 12 hours if not longer. Silage is hard to say. My girlfriend says she can smell it at about arms length but not much further. Someone I work with said he smelled it about 6 feet away or so. My favorite part of this fragrance so far is the opening/middle. I think it's the frankincense/olibanum but not sure. It's just amazing, although I love the base notes also! My 30ml bottle should last me a while but I will definitely buy a 50ml bottle or bigger next time. Just picked up a sample of TF Tobacco Vanille and I must say I may have to purchase a bottle of that also, very good, although I like Tuscan Leather a bit more!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Elvis is alive and living inside this bottle! Pure class!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The best leather fragrance I have experienced so far. This one honestly took a while to grow on me, as when I was only a couple of years into the hobby of perfumes I managed to get my nose on it, and really didn't care for it much due to it both being a little challenging, and primarily only getting the leather note.

Fast forward a few years, and i'm now in love with it - the way the leather / suede plays off the sweetness of the raspberry, the underlying and more subtle notes swirling around that beautifully masculine leather, all with an edge of smokey ash.. it really is a masterpiece. Performance of this one is phenomenal too, as anyone who has been lucky enough to own it can testify to - 10 hours minimum, it really feels like it lasts forever. If you initially didn't like this fragrance (which is completely understandable) do yourself a favour and revisit it when you've had exposure to a wider range of scents - you won't regret it.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is one of about 3 fragrances I've experienced 'love at first sniff' with, having sampled over 200 fragrances.

The dominant notes are leather/suede and raspberry. The intensity of the sharp raspberry peaks initially, and rolls off as the scent dries down, revealing a warm saffron amber sweetness that slowly bubbles to the surface.

Scent: (5 / 5)
Love at first sniff, an empyrean deeply masculine head turner.

Performance: (5 / 5)
Detectable on skin within a foot for about 7 hours, a skin scent for about 12, and will last on clothes until washed.

Versatility: (1.5 / 5)
Nauseating in heat, so stick to cold weather and cool nights. Would only wear with masculine & non-casual clothing as well.

Overall: (5 / 5)
No criticisms, if only fewer people knew about it.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I smelled this and, honestly, my girlie parts did a double-take! This... THIS! This smelled like a first date, when I was somewhere between a teen and mid-twenties, with a guy wearing a leather jacket in the autumn. It had a toned-down masculine scent with a leathery scent RIGHT UNDERNEATH it, and a slightly perceptible smokey scent beneath that.

I was so shocked, I had to smell it again! Yep, same reaction.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Cigarettes and leather with a hint of hair spray. Like you went to a bar the night before and woke up wearing the same clothes. Worldly. Not peaceful. Not calm. No thank you.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I know this smell! I know what it replicates. Back in the late 1960s and 1970s, when you were taking a cross country trip with the family and checked into a Las Vegas hotel with a lounge and bar and pool, this is exactly the smell that you would get when you walked into the lobby, all excited to be in Las Vegas and in air conditioning. This is the smell of the leather banquette seating and spilled liquor and a million spent cigarettes still lingering in the air of the lounge off the lobby, plus a hint of gasoline from the pre-unleaded-era cars outside. This scent contains all of it: leather booths, stale cigarette smoke, drinks and drinks spilled, carpet cleaner (faintly fruity), wood and leather bars, air conditioning and the slight staleness of an interior that never has open windows, and the wild West and excitement. The minute I smelled this, it brought back that lost era of Vegas hotels that have all been torn down to make way for the new mega-casino hotels. What makes this so genius, in my view, is that Tom Ford is replicating a scent from a place that no longer exists. Anyone can make a perfume based on leather notes. But there are only a few perfumers who can actually replicate something, like a Vegas hotel lobby/lounge smell from the late 60s or 70s, from decades ago that you cannot smell any more. The nose that created this perfume has created a kind of time machine, and that is genius. Honestly, it is not really a straight up leather smell. It is leather mixed with stale cigarettes, stale ladies perfume still in the air from 2am last night, old hairspray, all the scents that linger in the air from the lounge show and activities of the night before, all circulated with the old air conditioning. I like this perfume because of its ability to recreate the past, but I also like it because it is unique. It is also strong enough that it lasts, which I value a lot. Plus, it does not activate my allergies. One down side to recreating a smell from the past is that people too young to have smelled it in real life are not going to recognize what this is. Ford was born in 1961.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I get why people peg this as a masculine fragrance. It’s got all the elements of a great masculine fragrance, yet I feel this to be absolutely unisex. The sweetness, smokiness and leather combine into a perfect blend of sex and luxury. I love it on myself and I do consider myself very feminine, but I am also a lover of leather and smoke in my fragrances. It has very meek sillage on me, and in that sense it’s definitely a *private* blend. I’m addicted.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I love this stuff! I have been sampling for years and just recently made it to the niche stuff.

On first spray the leather is intense, almost too much but in the next 30 minutes it will transform before your very nose. It settles down to a perfect mixture of suede and sweet. The notes say raspberry but I get a very sweet note that is hard to describe. After an hour is when it really shines. Sweet smokey leather that projects moderately. Not too much to offend, but something people close to you can smell with no doubt. A prefect blend that transitions as the day goes by. This one is done well. Bravo, Tom Ford.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Tuscan Leather is one of those colognes you either like a lot or don't like at all. It has a heavy leathery and suede smell. It's very animalic and dirty. It smells like sex. It's actually not bad and I would definitely wear it. A good sexy night cologne...

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
You really need to develope your nose to fall in love with this one.

I am into the fragrance game for 4 years, and I got into the niche world this year.

When I first tried Tuscan Leather it was a clear yuck for me, and my girlfriend as well. Then I got a 5 ml decant of Acqua Di Parma Colonia Leather, and I was blown away. Somehow I understood the point of these crisp leather fragrances. I was wearing that AdP with my leather jacket, leather boots, leather belt, leather watch strap, kinda daring outfit.

3 months later, I felt like something changed in my nose, so I went back to the department store to give TL another chance. I immediately knew that I need this fragrance...

I am writing this review wearing the 2010 batch of Tuscan Leather...

It is my clubbing, going to a bar fragrance, it overpowers those "pear bubblegum boys" "sweet vanilla coca cola boys" anywhere, and it absolutely turn the women's head. Sometimes in a good way, sometimes not, but this is why it is so beautiful... Pure masculinity, and confidence in a bottle. Whenever I wear this one, I feel like I am the alpha...

Scent: 9/10 (at least for me, with only 1-2 sprays as far as my nose as possible)
Masculinity: 10/10 (no further questions)
Versatility: 4/10 (only cold weather with the darkest rough denim leather combo outfit)
Performance: 10/10 (projecting for 6 hours at least)
Longevity: 10/10 (10+ hours)

You need at least a decant of this.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I bought a 100ml bottle from Sephora this week. Unfortunately, I'm having performance issues with this one. It only lasts for 2-3 hours with low projection.

Is anybody also having longevity problems like me?

People say TL is supposed to be a beast, so I'm very disappointed.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I love this smell. It really sets the mood. It stays in my clothes for days and weeks but my friend cant smell it :( why would i want a fragrance that nobody can smell

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This does smell quite anamalic. Maybe it's an indolic jasmine.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This...is a masterpiece. This is a MANS fragrance, definitely not unisex, I don’t care how manly your haircut is, how many piercings you have, or how big your gauges are, if you are a women, this fragrance is not for you!

This is Tom Ford himself in a bottle. If Chuck Norris sweats, this is what it will smell like. If the smell of confidence could be captured and put in a bottle, this is what it would smell like. This is for the guy who does not care about anything. If you are not the most bada** motherf****er you know, do not attempt to wear this fragrance, because IT will end up wearing you.

This is a night out fragrance. A red carpet type fragrance. A guy sitting in the VIP area sipping on whiskey while smoking a Cuban cigar type of fragrance. Those are the vibes that this fragrance gives. It is not a versatile fragrance. Do not wear this while dressed casually.It does have a scent that is reminiscent to a certain drug, it certainly gives off those vibes.

This is a very strong leathery fragrance. It is a night time fragrance for sure, and preferably cold weather. 2 sprays and this is the only thing that you will smell for the next 6+ hours so go very easy on the trigger with this one. It is a great fragrance to layer with other fragrances. I love to layer it with Aventus. It really emphasize that smokey, leathery smell that Aventus has and tones down the sometimes overbearing pineapple. Another surprisingly good combination is Tuscan Leather with a little bit of...JPG Ultra Male. The sweetness from the ultra male can tone down that leather note in TL and help to emphasize the sweetness that TL has in its background. This makes TL a little more wearable and versatile and will get you tons of compliments.

Overall a very good, manly, intense, and not-so-versatile fragrance. A bottle will last you a lifetime or two due to its lack of versatility, and it’s sheer strength. When you can pull this fragrance off successfully, it is bada** in a bottle and it is a beautiful scent. Definitely recommend trying it out.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Fruity sweetness and smoky leather. Genre blazing: certainly up there with the most cloned fragrances of all time. It's remarkable and able to be adored by most perspectives (snobs, casuals, historians etc).

9.5/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is the smell of a Russian restaurant.
A mixed combination of loud women’s and men’s fragrances, cigarett smoke, cognac, and lots of leather jackets all jam packed into one bottle!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Okay, I think Tom Ford Private Collection is overrated but...this is so gorgeous! Very masculine, dominant but the notes don't bother you. Barbaric and elegant at the same time in a good way.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Truly a masculine scent for mature men. That rugged guy who smells like he just got home from the car workshop. But not in a dirty way. It's smooth and like people say, smells like the inside of a brand new car. It's clear in it's identity what it's trying to be without all the supporting accords for more depth. This is straight forward leather that doesn't evolve into anything else, just smooth leather from start to finish.
I never fall for hype around fragrances. Because i never like them. But this is one lives up to the hype if you like the smell of natural leather.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This perfume makes me feel like I'm being seduced by an Italian man wearing tight acid washed jeans and a tan suede jacket, donning a mustache, and chain smoking cigarettes while waiting at a sweaty subway stop.

It's sexy, a little dirty, and not for everyone.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Its all been said about this one... I was very curious on this perfume so i went for a try 3 days in a row.. First sniff, ashes blenfed With soil... No leather no rasberries..
I got confused... Where is the magic in this one and why all the hype about it?
After 3hrs,i finally understood why... Its the dry down.
Creamy rasberries With a hint of vanilla? Subliminaly sweet and sour.. Still no leather.. There is some thing about TF perfumes that get you addicted... But if i had to choose a leathery scent from his house, that would be ombre leather, one of the most realistic interpretations of leather.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tuscan Leather by Tom Ford.

Wow. Impressive scent. The drydown smells like a massive white suede jacket. It's like putting your head in the jacket or getting slapped by it. Very strong, warm and masculine.

I really like this one. The performance is good too.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I'm in love with this one.
My favorite from Tom Ford, followed by Ombre Leather. Guess I have a thing for leather, after all.

First 10 minutes of wearing this, already a compliment recieved, by the girl at the Chanel Boutique haha

Very masculine, bad boy. I picture James Dean in a leather jacket and a cigarette in his mouth everytime I smell this.
That very confident, stylish, sensual person.

Performance is incredible, 18+ hours on my skin.

Not for everyone, not for everyday.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Am I the only one who thinks this smells like hickory smoked bbq with a hint of leather? very pungent for sure and I will say that this should be blending with something like Ferragamo F Black or Creed Aventus

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is the very first niche fragrance I had ever smelled. Previously, I had only worn fashion and designer colognes. I happened to walk by a Tom Ford display at Dillards, and curiosity struck me. I had heard of Tom Ford in songs and wondered what the big deal was. I saw Tuscan Leather and recognized the name from a Drake song, so naturally, that was the first fragrance I asked the man to let me sample. The first whiff was something I had never experienced before. It was primal, dark, and hit me like a ton of bricks. I was caught completely off guard, because I had never experienced anything like it. The leather note was intoxicating, I had to keep smelling it, I was addicted to the scent. I took the sample card home with me and could not stop smelling it. Then the sweet raspberry note crept its way through the powerful leathery scent. I did not know fragrances could have such complexity to them. I could not stop thinking about this fragrance, I knew I needed it. This fragrance has a playful arrogance to it, wearing it gives you a sense of confidence that is inexplicable. It is definitely a very polarizing scent, it can sometimes be a bit offensive, but it is by far my favorite of the Private Blend collection.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is one of the most unique leather scents I’ve ever smelt. I originally smelt it at the department store – It’s very intense for the first 1-2 hours. If you are indoors, it can be unbearable at times. It is best worn if you are out doors before stepping inside. But after that it smells absolutely divine.

I can smell rich leather and saffron – This is the ultimate leather scent for men.

Be warned, it’s quite strong and remains this way for a few hours. 2-3 sprays of this will last 8+ hours easily. It staying on my clothes for days.

It is definitely a night-time perfume – Preferably in colder seasons (it could get over the top in hot temps)

Fragrance 8.5/10
Performance: 9/10
Versatility: 8/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
*Very addictive.
*Very long-lasting.
*Very opulent.

A mix of smoke and rubber keeps the secret of the raspberry sweetness and the jasmin fragility and reveals its true self to the wearer. The leather jacket is a cover up as there is a true, sensitive, heart beating in there.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: @pandoras - Yes, this is absolutely compatible for layering with many other scents in the private blend line. Not all, per say, but many. When I was introduced to it, a salesperson was fond of layering this with Tobacco Vanille, however I found the combination to be a bit messy or over complicated for my personal tastes. My suggestion is to grab a sample from Sephora or Macy's etc and try it out for yourself! There are no "rules" in fragrances aside those we set for ourselves. :)

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Few weeks ago I’ve tried TL and bought one, I really looooved it
And when I was looking for reviews about it on line found out that there’s a clone
La Yukawam and some said it’s even better, so I bought La Yuqawam
And just got it , I have them both on my hands, I didn’t like La Yuqawam so much, it’s like
Comparing zero Coc to the real Coca Cola , while TL smells like expensive leather
And cigar smoky and sexy La Yukawam smells like a cheaper cigarettes with a bit of sweetness , I don’t why but it also reminds me of beer.i certainly would not replace TL with La Yuqawam.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Is this suited to layerings with other PB line. Even vanilla fatale?

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
On its own, Tuscan Leather is a hard sell on my skin. It’s a heavy leather with a piercing raspberry accompanied by thyme and saffron. I wobble between being in love and wanting to expel my stomach contents from the strong sensations (actually this is in a good way, oddly enough). I can definitely relate this to a night of cocaine which I’ve heard this is supposed to resemble. Spot on there mr. Ford

Combined with Tobacco Oud or Oud Wood this become a totally different experience though. The piercing raspberry mellows out and the whole composition becomes more balanced and actually is my favorite scent for a cold winter or autumn day

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I find this to be too heavy. And not in a good way.
The opening and first 2 hours all i get is benzine...
It eventually settles down and smells more wild leather and red berries but the first 2 hours are almost unberable.
Nope, sorry TF.
If someone is interested in this scent I suggest to test out Byredo Black Saffron. They are very similar but Black Saffron is more smooth and does not have that benzine smell.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Smooth, beautiful, classic.

The leather perfectly mixes with the sweeter notes to make something truly addicting. Though the absolute, total opposite of 'sporty' or 'summer', I've worn this on morning summer runs to great effect. Like Dior's 'Fahrenheit', I enjoy pushing this scent during warm/hot days and in more casual settings -- makes for a completely different vibe.

But for most people, this will work wonderfully as a fall/winter, formal kind of fragrance. The raspberry keeps this from being stuffy on men, while the leather would really make this stand out on a woman.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Wow wow wow, I absolutely love it, it’s very classy and luxurious
For a confident attractive women, I see it more on a mature woman +30
I give it a 9/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I have recently procured a 100ml bottle of Tuscan Leather as part of a much larger order.
I must say:
Mr Ford, you’ve done it again....
I tip my hat to you, sir.......
For the exquisitely crafted, perfectly blended masterpiece Tuscan Leather.
A rich, intoxicating leather with a signature wildcard , the raspberry.
Rush rush to the yayo, indeed...Mr Ford....
Addicting, exhilarating...and the epitome of luxury and excessive indulgence
You just want it up your nose again and again.
And so too, do the people that surround you.

The Verdict: EXCELLENCE

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: very long lasting. masterpiece smell

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Most luxury fragrances make me smell nice; this one makes me smell rich.

(I'm not!)

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is one of those scents that I can't run out of so i always have an unopened bottle.
For me it was love at first sight. You get what you are promised: leather; Great smell, longevity and silage.

Please don't compare it to Ombre Leather, because you'll be doing an injustice.

I find this smell more masculine than unisex, but this has already been covered.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The only comment I have received so far is that I smell like a shisha bar. :(

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Even thought is masculine, I loved it and this is what a handsome millionaire smells like( I imagine)))))

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Incredible, proud. This is the scent of men.
Very longlasting 10+/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I sprayed my friend's bottle on my scarf, and could still smell it days later and I was hooked, so I treated myself to a 100ml bottle after an exam. And I don't regret it!

I'm an amateur and can't recognise all the individual notes, but to me it has a dark smoky mysterious vibe and the more you smell it, the more detail you notice, I truly feel like this is something that has character, it has even more character once it mixes with your own skin scent.

This fragrance is empowering, it makes you feel confident and stylish. It's perfect for an evening date or special occasion... In fact, I love wearing it all the time.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I smelled it on my very generous friend and it blow my mind in a way that made her insist to give me the bottle ,,I took it and I rerly used it cus although I loved it I believe it was Musclent

So I believe it is not for women
Scent 9
Longevity 9
Projection 8

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Finally bought Tuscan Leather; thrilled

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Remember reading that Tuscan Leather was created by two perfumers: Jacques Cavallier and Harry Frémont, they also created Noir de Noir.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Who is the nose behind this magical perfume?

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
this reminds me of the first woman I loved.

we don't talk anymore, but we used to chain-smoke after school every day. the burning leather hits you first, and so it begins a little dangerous, but when the smoke clears you are left with a fruity herbal kiss that promises to protect you.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This has got to be my favourite private blend to date. Amazing scent suitable for all seasons. I feel I get nose fatigue as after a couple of hours I can’t smell this on myself but others still can.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I have been stopped by strangers asking me what I was wearing ! Iran is famous for it's Saffron and I assume Cyrus the Great's Kitchen must've had an abundant supply of Saffron and his court and hallways must've had Saffron scent lingering in it before and after lavish banquets , Regal fragrance , period. And then there's definitely the ashtray note but.... no complaints, it's an ashtray in a meeting room full of expensive leather furniture where you have just been handed your multi million dollar contract after a narrow competition. If you want to feel dirty rich get a Tom Ford Tuscan Leather!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The fragrance that makes you think you are a billionaire even if you are not.


You will smell sexual, confident, badass and wealthy.
Wear your black suit and tie, slick back your hair and spray tuscan leather, now you will get all the attention from ladies, people haven't smelled anything like this before in their life, They will think what is that amazing smell.
Unique, polarizing, luxurious and rich.
Tuscan leather is the fragrance I imagine gangsters would wear, Someone like al pacino in godfather or tom hardy in legend movie.
Extremely masculine, I have no idea why it's labeled unisex.!
unbelievably long lasting, like it stays for ever on your suit or shirt, and it projects for a good 4 hours and everybody will notice you, not so many compliments like aventus but compliments are intense, like I want to smell you all night.

A masterpice from tom ford's Private Blend. My favorite so far from the line
Scent: 9.5/10
Longevity: 10/10
Sillage: 9/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I remember killing time one day at a local department store and, out of the many private blend fragrances by Tom Ford, I picked up Tuscan Leather. It was love at first sight for me, and after waiting a day I went back and bought a 100ml bottle.

I'm going to make a comparison with Dior Homme Parfum because for me, they're in essence a sweet leather scent. The two are world's apart however in their own good ways. DHP is feminine in nature but smells masculine, whereas TL is very masculine despite being unisex. DHP is smooth and creamy whereas TL is abrupt and in your face.

Tuscan Leather to me is strong and forthright, but not flamboyant. It's a suave, charming, arrogant and wealthy man that knows they've made it in life. In fact I'd picture Tom Ford as Tuscan Leather itself.

The leather note can be a bit strong for some, but then the raspberry and florals kick in ever so slightly to calm everything down. When I first tested this, I got a little bit on my fingers which I got strong whiffs of over the next 12 hours. This stuff is strong, so go easy on the sprays. Even still, you'll get a whole days use out of this lovely smell.

I'd probably recommend a 30ml bottle unless you're an absolute die hard fan for it, because this will last you a long time!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Im a big fan of Oud Wood. Wear it all the time. Can’t get enough of it. So my curiosity for TFs other private blends naturally grew with every review I consumed. Tuscan Leather seemed especially promising. But I must say it’s not what I expected.

The first note that hits you is this intense leathery smokiness, where the smoke and leather sort of blends together. The second couple of notes that stand out is a little bit of the thyme and the raspberry, which work pretty well in tandem with the leather. These, to me, are perhaps the most prominent notes. There’s also a sweetness buried somewhere in the smoke and leather, which might be a combination of the raspberry and the amber.

The scent is quite mineral-like and lacks much freshness, in the conventional definition of the word. It does however have a kind of distinct sparkling sharpness to it. It sort of goes beyond what I previously though perfumes could smell like.

Edit: The scent has grown on me a bit since. It´s quite addictive in a strange way. Sort of like it more and more.

Edit 2: Ok. Love the scent now (after 2 months). Some people says it smells like cocaine. Maybe there’s actually cocaine in it?

Scent: Addictive and luxurious
Sillage/projection: Above average
Longevity: Good

Visual projection: Sharp / high-resolution white particles on top, with a gradient towards gray, a hint of beige and brown leather towards the bottom, with a stroke of pink in the middle.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Wow, love this stuff! The Mrs likes it too, so get to wear this as my go to night out/date scent! Thank you Mr Ford

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: If Pablo Escobar had a signature scent, this would have been it.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Smells very good. Strong, deep and long lasting. For the people who have Dior homme Parfum from before 2018, layer DHP on top of Tuscan Leather. This combination smells like Irish Leather from the house of Memo Paris, which smells amazing but not as good as Tuscan Leather itself.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Fantastic fragrance. I adore also PDM Godolphin, this one projects heavier and is more leathery , so it is not as versatile as Godolphin. Raspberry-leathery combo is phenomenal. Performance - above average.I think it leans more masculine. The price is high, but the quality also, so must own.
Overall: 9/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Do you want to be like the most pleasant smelling obnoxious person on earth? Do you like cocaine? Do you wear only black clothes? Buy this fragrance

If not, then wearing this will make you want to be that person. Love it

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Very leather, very masculine, very sexy. 4.5/5

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: its stronger than ombre leather and more smoky .very long lasting i recommend !

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: If it smell like cocaine i will probably become a junkie if i try that white powder just once.the leather,the raspberry mmmh...AMAZING.if you'r a confident gentleman this one is for you.in my top 5 of all time without any doubt

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Just buy it. If you love being sophisticated and you like to make the diference, just use this. Pure class. Pure charm. It makes you fell like you´r the king of the world. Period. Even if you´r only a boy, the moment you use this, you become a man. 6 out of 5 stars. An example of how complete a fragrance should be. It will be parte of the perfumery history books for all the eternity. Its becoming my favorite fragrance of all time. Masterpiece!,

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Longevity: 10
Sillage: 9.5
Projection: 10
Scent: 7.5-8
Very unique and strong smell. Lasts forever. Only need 2 sprays and you can smell it on yourself hours later. Yes it is more expensive, but because you only need 2 sprays and the fact that it performs like fragrances should, the price tag is worthy.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
One of the best Longevity I have tried so far, put on yesterday now over 12 hours later this stuff is still extremely potent. Nice scent also, refined and mature for those intimate moments.
Longevity 10/10
Scent 8.5/10
Sillage 8/10
Overall 9/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Close your eyes and dream, it's snowing and so cold and you were smelling cold soil.

Love it.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Tom ford tuscan leather
Where do I need to start,
I start by saying this is it.

Tuscan leather is a nice leather based scent whit a small sweet hint in the background.

Gender: I think it is masculie
Scent: 10/10
Sillage 8/10
Projection: 2 hours after that a nice suptil scent but can be smelt ferry well
Longhevedy: 12 hours even after the reformulation

This fragrance tells people how you are.
The person who wears this is a sophisticated person who don't care what people thinks.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Although nowadays it’s very much a mainstream fragrance (that has garnered huge celebrity status), it still manages to convey this edgy, outlaw vibe that gives the wearer the perfect illusion of individuality. It’s the hip hop of the fragrance world! I should hate Tuscan Leather, but I love it. It smells addictive, sexy and confident, it evokes all manner of misbehaviour and is deliciously off message. No wonder so many people elude to cocaine when describing Tuscan Leather; it’s almost as much a drug as it is a fragrance. 10/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Petrichor, the terraqueous "rain smell" that briefly alerts one to a coming storm: that was my impression of this scent, probably my favorite of the Tom Ford brand (not saying a lot, but what the heck, why not do a little review of this!). His other scent releases are unabashedly derivative, lesser imitations, always relegated to the bottom shelf of the small town Sephora. I owned some of this once about four years ago but gifted it to a friend. There are so many different perfume releases these days, its so hard to choose. I really think you have to follow your nose to the best possible option, avoid collecting a million different perfumes, the sex appeal of salesmen and flashy
branding.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
Beautifully blended rasperry and leather. Elegant, intoxicating. That said, quite expensive.

Tonight, I am wearing Tuscan Leather on one arm, and Nabeel Macho Man on the other. I have a pretty developed nose, and honestly, I wouldn't be able to tell which one is which in blind test. Macho Man may be slightly less defined in terms of notes, but honestly, it's really hard to discriminate one from the other.
I am impressed on how Nabeel managed to create a perfect clone of TL, not only in terms of scent, but also performance (Macho Man may even perform slightly better. For your info: 1.6oz of TL retails for approx $180, while an oil stick of Nabeel MM retails for approx $5. Feel free to spend your money as you want, but the $175 difference in expense is like throwing money in the toilet bowl. May I suggest we buy Nabeel's Macho Man and give the $175 leftover to a charity? (or buy other frags with those!). If it's worth, I spend the money, but here, really, the price difference is NOT justified.

As far as I'm concerned, I'm not a fan of that strong rasperry note, and prefer leather fragrances like Tom Ford Ombre Leather, or Gucci Guilty Absolute. Just a like for me.

Fall/Winter evenings, 30+, unisex (slightly feminine IMO)

Edit: 5 hours in: TL has become a skin scent, Macho Man still projects at 3-4 inches... just saying...
Edit2: 12 hours later, TL is dead, while MM is still there as a skin scent.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
One of the most addictive and sexy fragrances ever created! The leather and raspberry absolutely an eye popping good combo that has sillage to die for! While I normally don't put age on most fragrances I truly believe this is for a confident handsome man that is over 25. The performance is wonderful and the projection is solid for the first 2-3. Absolute timeless classic that never get's old. Tom Ford Private Blends are subjectively over priced but this one is worth every penny. Beautiful, seductive, and smile inducing masterpiece!

Literally 10/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Super powerful leather smell. It's great but too smoky for me

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
the latest version of this once wonderful scent has been toned down to incredible depth, it's not even a pale ghost of its former self...just an empty shell..clearly the house of Tom Ford is after easy bucks from countries where they love insipid scents....
Get Rasasi La Yuqawam for a taste of the old glory!

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Really strong perfume. Fills the room

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
I think I am a fan of leather scents, since I enjoy dior parfum, le male essense, and other fragrances that have a strong leather note. For some reason I never was a huge fan of this. It's not that I don't like it, it's just something about it that smells dated to me or something. I can see why people like it however. Its a refined leather smell with this light berry overtone. It has it's own DNA that is unique to this scent. I think the clones out there are REALLY close.. There was a scent by Mac, I forgot the name but it was pretty much identical to it. Plus everyone knows about la yuqawan whatever. That one is pretty close too.

I respect the scent and why people enjoy it, it's just not really anything that grabbed me. Definitely not worth the Tom Ford price for me. Then again no fragrance really is.

For me scent 3/5
Objective rating on scent 4.5/5

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: The first contact with the skin is strong.(It burn my eyes:)

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I have found about Tom Ford just few years ago when I was recommended to smell this in private collection. Just wow. Dry like chalk ash, fruity tobacco soaked in a guy's leather jacket. I'm not original in description, I know. But I can't find anything that would make me feel more sensual and sexy in special occasions than 1 spray of this.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: A cocky alpha male dressed in full suit with a hot pink tie. He squeezes your hand so hard it hurts, but you're almost certain he's tickling your palm and winking while doing it. First thought is genital compensation. Second thought is homo-eroticism.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
First 4 hours of leather, Saffron and suede then complete joy of frankincense for next 12 hours ( i have pure hojari frankincense from oman so i can feel that smell),can feel jasmine bit not prominent, i haven't smelled raspberries so i can't talk About it bjt some thing on the beginning is smoky
Any how a pure men choice because its too dark for women(i think). Imagination (fragrance for a good looking suited booted cigar in the hand mafia boss)

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: This is not my taste. All I smell is leather. Smells like one of my wife's new leather purses. She thinks it smells good, so maybe I'll give it another try sometime down the road. But for now it's a no go for me.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Knock your socks off leather. This stuff is well worth the price. Love it in every way. Last all day from 3 sprays.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is a very bold, loud, yet refined and complex beast mode fragrance. It has the allure of Drake naming a song after it, and the bad boy rep of not only smelling of high end leather (like in a brand new Rolls Royce or Bugatti), but also smells a bit like cocaine! I guess there is also a subtle raspberry note which adds even more slightly fruity complexity.

The combo of the actual juice, and all the above folklore def makes you feel like a successful boss who doesnt play by the rules when you put it on. Having said that, it might be too strong for some people to like, so I think it could be a bit polarizing. But I personally think its amazing, especially for night time, or cooler weather.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: So I have tried it and got it as a present for my dad. On me it is horrendous. It just smells like strong leather on my skin and stayed that way and I hated it on me but on my Dad it smells great. His skin reacts very well with it. it retains the leather which softens and there's berries and some vanilla. It's also reasonably ageless although I cant imagine many men in their early 20s managing to wear this well. Its strong, its powerful and it blasts presence.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
One of my first loves and probably my first "adult" signature scent. It was also my first TF fragrance and responsible for opening my eyes to the world of niche.

There's still some on a bottle in my collection and I'll spray it every so often. It brings back memories.

There are now similar fragrances on both sides of the price spectrum: more sophisticated and (even more) expensive (I love Clive Christian's C) as well as cheaper clones. I'm not looking forward to the day it won't be in my collection again... but that day will come.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is a MASTERPIECE. It's famous for a reason. Try it, let it sink in and try again. Often copied, never replicated. They say this for a reason too. The first time I sniffed it, I got a severe headache. A week later, I could still smell it on my shirt. Top quality product for a premium price. You're paying not just for the perfume inside but the brand name and of course the presentation as well.

Every time I have worn it, I have had at least 1 woman compliment me. Every single time !!!

It's that good and not just any sleazy, average compliment but people actually come tracking you. It's a beautiful scent you'll more than likely not appreciate. It's not for everyone.

Classy, sophisticated, serious, toxic, obnoxious, noir, dark, posh, expensive are some words that suitably describe this fragrance.

This is my second review of it and I can't stress enough, that you absolutely need to have this in your collection if you're a true fragrance enthusiast. Average joe might skip cuz this isn't his average crowd pleasing Armani or Paco Rabanne. This is Niche Quality product. None of that Creed BS. You get what you pay for. Smells like a man and performs like a man. No more no less. This is not your average western perfume. I can easily compare it to the quality offered by Amouage.

Liquid gold is what I call it.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
The most standout Tom Ford fragrance, in my opinion. This is what I want... my car to smell like. Honestly the opening is atmospheric and very captivating. Sadly, the drydown is not so good. However, this is a great scent for most formal events. Definitely worth considering.
Rating: 8.5/10

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is my favorite Private Blend, this and Italian Cypress, are rich, manly, close to masterpieces. They are not so perfumy or gimmicky as other Private Blends, that are often spectacular on first impression, and then later don't feel too wearable.
This is very wearable, as in signature fragrance.

I think masterpieces mix and blend contrasting notes. This does it by the dark and oily leather, contrasting with the rasberry and a touch of Jasmine. The safron is great and plays an important part.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: If you want to spend 150€ ,it's ok you are free. If you want the same perfume ,if you want a perfume like this ,if you have a little money ,you buy Cuoio Pal Zileri. No difference.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
This is not just any leather. This is not like showing up at the pot luck smelling like your new chaps and donning a trusted whip, heaven forbid. This is what Grace Kelly, Sophia Loren, or Audrey Hepburn would probably smell like in their mink coats, showing up for dinner at the Hotel de Paris in Monte-Carlo, with a tuxedo clad accomplice at their side, smelling like the inside of a Bentley that has been bathed in jasmine and incense. I see Frank Sinatra singing at the back of the restaurant. Tom Ford must have had some great dreams after creating this one, I'll bet.

Projection is a lot stronger than you might think and sillage is just enough to have the waiters watching your every move. For winters only (keep the Bentley in the garage until then).

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew:
It took me 6 years to appreciate this fragrance. Recently I tried it again and I loved it instantly. Tuscan Leather is a simple composition but classy and quite manly. I believe that women can wear it but it leans to masculine scents. Suitable for winter, fall, spring and cool summer nights. It's not so heavy as many reviews say.

It opens with a mild gasoline vibe with a tiny essence of tires. In the air, from a distance, the only I can smell is leather. The leather in TFTL is safe, refined and the combo with the other notes makes it elegant. The leather after some time feels more like suede than leather. Smooth and refined. After that emerges the raspberry with a tiny jasmine somewhere at the background and mild olibanum which exists only to support the dominant notes, it doesn't play big role. Then comes the thyme along with the saffron which becomes stronger as time passes. The thyme stays at the background. I also get faint traces of black pepper. Dominant notes are suede, leather, raspberry, saffron and thyme. The rest notes are mild.

I'm quite pleased from its performance although I didn't found the monster I was expecting. Sillage is moderate, projection is heavy for some minutes then calms to a moderate and it settles close to the skin quite quickly and stays such for most of its life. The longevity is good. From my first test it lives for about 8-8.5 hours which is enough for me. Of course I'll do some full wearings and I'll update if necessary.
Tuscan Leather feels luxurious and has a mature vibe. It's not old school by any means but it's not for teens imo. Better with a suit or with nice clothes..

If you want rough leather try the much cheaper Gucci Gucci Guilty Absolute niche quality imo

If you want a more playful version of TFTL with an oriental twist try Arabesque Perfumes Kohel

If you feel that the raspberry is too much in TFTL and want a more dark/masculine version try Bois 1920 Oro 1920

If you want the King of leathers try The Spirit of Dubai Meydan stellar performance compared to the other scents mentioned here.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: I had opportunity to sample Oud wood,Tobacco vanille and Tuscan leather.All 3 are amazing mostly winter wearable scents...if I could choose the best among those 3 fantastic scents,Tuscan leather would be at the top,following oud wood and tobacco vanille...all three scents are amazing,but Tuscan wins just for a fraction...

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: That's what is wearing my future husband. I could roll in this. That's my catnip. The berry sweetness is nicely blended that it makes impression of fruity tobacco soaked in expensive leather. I will sound like broken record but I think it smells like money.

name: Tuscan Leather Tom Ford (unisex) ~ 2007
reivew: Talk about longevity and potency. Two sprays after shower on inner elbow at 10pm,stuff around till 330am, put the same jumper on at midday and wow nearly bowled me over. May be on the verge of too strong for me and headache inducing. Do not do more than 2 sprays, people around you may hate you for it!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This one is nice, and indeed a (gentle) masculine musk, IMO. I don't know why but this reminds of a male version of J&J baby shampoo, should the original J&J baby shampoo scent be for girls. It is very wearable for either a man or a woman, but I would prefer smelling this on my man. I get more musk than vanilla or spice. Not a FB interest for me, but a well done aromatic musk for those who prefer such scents!

*This one does not at all remind me of Shalimar perfume, though I see lots of "smells like" for this one...

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Update:

The 20 yrs limited edition seems to have the concentration of the older version. Hope this doesn't change.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Chose a sample of this to go with my bottle of Lys Méditerranée, as I am pre-emptively searching for a deep winter scent. The orange and vanilla notes come to me, but most striking is the aroma of a Catholic church with a light but palpable whiff of incense and inviting dampness. It is absolutely beautiful, and has gone straight onto my wish list. Almost makes you excited for winter to come.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Lush. Amber run riot. An unusual and spectacular brace of clove makes this a unique mid note to an otherwise sultry composition. Lasts forever. Although I identified this as female, I also can envision this on a Middle Eastern or South Asian man. I am still sampling this to determine if this will be another addiction. Regardless, it's definitely a no at the dentist's office, or any mundane place. This is something Icwould wear for me.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Hey! Im the Modern Shalimar!

This smells like a modernized Shalimar without those Animalic facets, it has indeed a Musc that might come across animalic.

But its way easier to pull then Shalimar! If you own both of those! Do make a comparison!

Back on the Fragrance! I Wish i loved Clove! If i was i would love this Fragrance!

I Understand its constant nature for change and development! This fragrance has many faces!

Its a masterpiece Aight! Just not for me!

Solid 9!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: 6.5/10. Immediate: what I want to smell on a man. Then fruity musk, red fruits and rosewood/red cedar. The woodiness is strong with rose water. Cinnamon comes 8 hours later and I prefer this part but have to wait a long time. True to other Frederic Malle scents, smells natural and not chemically. This one is not my favorite.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is how I remember one catholic convent chapel smelled like. It's odd, there is no lily note listed, but as I smell it all I can think of is this particular chapel with fragrant lilies on the altar. Absolutely lovely.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Has this really been reformulated? Because to me this perfume is both striking and potent. My review is based on a sample I got this month.

It’s the sexier, naughtier brother (sister?) compared to Dans Tes Bras. I think I like DTB more because it’s more like a sexy intelligent gentleman sitting in the corner smiling at you but MR is more like the cocky sexbomb being the centre of attention. MR is very sweet and I personally think this leans more female. Not your average sweet, but more of a musky, thick sweetness like molasses. You know how the smell of sex isn’t particularly nice or anything but it’s kind of addictive? MR has that character.

Performance is beast. I did 2 small sprays on my neck, and really it just wouldn’t come off and 3 days later I lay in bed still getting wafts of Musc Ravageur. Mind you I had washed my hair twice. Impressive but annoying when you feel like wearing something different.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is a very peculiar fragrance, that deserves its legendary status.

To my nose it has a camphor note at the very start that is somehow disturbing as it tickles my nostrils and makes me sneeze.
But, when you pass these first 5 minutes, the very heart of this spicy-oriental-vanillic scent develops.
The cinnamon note is there, spicy but not too strong, I can smell also some clove, pepper and nutmeg ; later, I detect also some juniper and balsamic resins.

The drydown is quite soft, when all the spices are gone, it's a classic soft ambery-vanilla one, that changes into something animalic, strong (=musc, and not the clean type! )
Quite a sillage and a good lasting power.

Mind you, this is not your typical powdery-oriental.
Musc Ravageur is a strong perfume, with huge personality; compelling or disturbing, it depends on you and yor skin chemistry.

I like it, as I like many orientals; it could easily suit a man (provided he has the personality to wear it! this is not a fresh water!).
Definitely a must try.
_________________

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This perfume is really crazy.
This animal musk is really fantastic and critical.
If you want to give someone a sensual feel, choose this right away.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: The scent of decadence; like cinnamon sticks, amber, and citrus wrapped in layers of luxurious fabric. Dried down very sweet, warm, and inoffensive, with incredible longevity. The perfume rep described this one as "sex in a bottle". I don't get the sexy side of this at all--just warm and comforting.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Dark chocolate. It is heavy and intense. I was expecting it to be more vanillic and sweeter but this is dark. I absolutely get chocolate note. Very masculine and sexy. I love it. Much better than expected. But I find it suitable only for cold winter. In where I live, it is very short period of a time.
8/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: There is something intriguing yet repulsive about this fragrance. Such an interesting one to me. Purchased a decant, tried on skin, toyed around with it. I don't know what note/s cause/s it to be vomit inducing most times, and tolerable other times. I can only assume it is the heavy-rich cinnamon+cloves combo. Needless to say, my bank account is happy.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Very orangey-cream-sweet and dessert-ish. It smells very good, but I'd rather eat something like this than wear it.

Grade: C+
Quick take: Orange Whip water slide

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
After sampling this fragrance a few times, I finally decided it was necessary to add it to my ever growing collection.

It's sweet, spicy, sexy and stunning.

I wore it as my scent of the day yesterday and as I was moving around this morning, preparing for my day, I was still catching wafts of it, though much fainter and I first sprayed it almost 24 hours ago. Sitting here typing this review, I am still smelling it quite strongly radiating from my neck up to my nose.

The citrus and lavender give it a very fresh and clean opening, but on my skin, that is very short lived and enters into a spicy vanilla, almost gourmand scent profile pretty quickly. Then, the musk and woods come out to play but never take center stage, instead the amber dances with the spicy vanilla for many, many hours. It's sweet but never cloying, it's woody but never dominated by the woods. It's musky but always somehow still fresh.

It projected extremely well for me for the first 5-6 hours before settling closer to the skin. It radiated a good 3-4 feet out and was leaving wonderful sillage trails for about the same amount of time. Performance is stellar and for the price, I really wouldn't expect any less. This fragrance delivers, beautiful scent, excellent performance, artistic uniqueness. I've never smelled anything quite like this fragrance.

I really love it. I'm so glad I finally pulled the trigger on a bottle.

Scent : 10/10, so well blended, so seductive, so beautiful. I feel it leans more masculine but it is unisex.
Longevity : 10/10 almost 24 hours after spraying, I can still smell it radiating from my skin
Projection : 10/10 it's not a beast but it really radiates from my skin extremely well, again about 3-4 feet.
Sillage : 10/10 if you're still still leaving an intoxicating scent trail 5-6 hours after spraying, then it's doing it's job extremely well
Overall : 10/10

Final thoughts ...
I don't know about reformulations and all that stuff because I've only sampled 2020 batches and my bottle is a 2020 batch but I can't complain. To me, as it is today, it is a masterpiece. Maybe if I had smelled previous batches or original batches, I might be able to complain but I can't since my review is for the fragrance as it is today and in my opinion, it is a perfect 10 all around. I love this stuff and I am so blessed to have a bottle in my collection. This fragrance is really something special. It might not be a fragrance for everyone but I do believe everyone should smell and sample it, just to experience it at least once.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
It is hilarious that the ad copy for this fragrance on the Frederic Malle website is "savage sex appeal." Haha really?! Are you sure?

I've been sampling this for the past week and love putting it on before bed because it's cozy and warm, a bit like hot milk with flannel PJs in the winter. It's unisex and comforting beyond anything else. The vanilla root beer opening with hint of wintergreen is not my idea of "sexy man" in a million years. Just very amused by that.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Have only smelled it recently, so chalking its raunchy legend up to pre-reformulation. To me this is a sexy cookie, warm & spicy & more decadent than might be expected for something so comfy, like cashmere sweats or a silk charmeuse nightgown. Definitely in a relationship with the Shalimar drydown.

With this on I want to rub my cheek against its scent on my wrist like a cat, eyes shut, humming. Unfussy luxe.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
To me, for anyone that is Australian or lives in Australia, it smells like musk sticks. The candy.

It's sweet, inviting, revives memories of being younger.

(had a 2020 sample)

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Vegetal and carnal co-exist in a bottle. It feels like an extremely minty toothpaste but does not smell like mint by any means. Burning yet cooling at the same time, the combination of multiple spices reveals the animatic layer underneath. It is an unconventional take on sexy perfume.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: It smells like gross plasticky vanilla frosting with a layer of musk on it. And there's something in there that evokes licorice. Maybe it's just the gross old tongue numbing candy aura. I'm really not into this at all.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
사야지 사야지 하다가 겨울이 다 가버렸다.
올 겨울엔 무적권 살거다. 비싸지만 비싼건 이유가 있다 싶은 물건.

처음 뿌리고 2~3시간동안은 자가격리 후 외출하라는 말이 있는데
그 탑노트 마져 환상적이다.....

지속 발향은 말할것도 없이 뛰어나고
피드백도 말할게 없다.(안좋아서)
근데 내가 좋으니까 쓸거다.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
The 2020 bottles have an animalic touch added in them (Anniversary edition) 20 Years of Creative Freedom.

Can others confirm? It should have an independent page

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Musc Ravageur so like Mandodari Prin. My preference leans towards Mandodari. Musc Ravageur has no lasting power in my opinion. So disappointed in my blind buy. Musc Ravageur is nice however it’s not as nice as other Frederic Malle fragrances I have.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
What can I say about this legendary perfume that hasn't already been said more eloquently by others? I've only smelled very recent batches of Musc Ravageur, and my bottle is from 2019, so I can't contribute much on how this stacks up against past formulations. I can say that I couldn't be happier to finally have this in my collection, and that it's truly masterful.

While the musk in question isn't hugely animalic, it's far from neutral. Rather, it's just dirty enough to make things interesting and balance with the other primary notes. The blend is exquisitely smooth, warm, and rich thanks to the dry, naturalistic vanilla, finely spiced cinnamon, and more intensely spicy clove (I could swear that I smell mace here as well, but it may just be my imagination). The sandalwood and tonka diffuse the density of the vanilla, spices, and musk, imparting powdery and woody notes that jive particularly well with the cinnamon.

Now, all of this is quite dark and velvety, so it would make sense to add some more luminous tones for contrast. Hence, the lightest brush of crisp lavender and what I consider to be the master-stroke: fabulously pungent, juicy tangerine. I don't pick up on the bergamot or other woods, but that's probably a personal olfactory failing and the result of such a well-blended composition. The cleverness of tangerine is that it's tangy and slightly tart, but not as acidic or sour as other citric notes like lemon, lime, or orange. It thereby serves to soften and saturate the spices, provide dimension to the vanilla and woods, and add a kind of polished twang to the musk. It's an ingenious perfume, steeped in decadence, and seductively structured. It beckons to you, but never overwhelms—ravishing musk, indeed!

Despite sharing a few notes with Shalimar, the proportions are totally different in Musc Ravageur, which is overall less animalic and sassy. I perceive very little resemblance between them; one does not recall the other. And while I understand the associations with the holidays—mulled cider and baked goods and all that—it doesn't feel especially "Christmassy" to me, or very gourmand, despite some of the built-in vanilla-amber sweetness. It's its own beast, one partial to curling up luxuriantly by the fire, elegantly négligé. I see some reviewers complaining about performance, but on my skin, it excels in both longevity and projection. Perfectly unisex but far from sexless, and better in cooler weather, in the evening.

This and Carnal Flower are my two favorites in the Malle collection, and they're both quite sexy, but differently so. Where Carnal Flower is the botanical embodiment of flesh-bound desire, Musc Ravageur is carnality itself, channeled into the suavest, most sumptuous vessel. If CF recalled the debaucherous greenhouse of Émile Zola's La Curée, MR is the poignant warmth of the coulisses in Nana.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Musc Ravageur, to my nose, is warm Xmas spices, sweetened with vanilla and rounded by gentle musk. The slightly herbal and sour opening fades very quickly on my skin, with punchy Xmas spices dominating within the first couple of minutes.

An exquisite gourmand with peppery nose feel.

It is delicate for a spice scent - more elegant but somewhat underprojecting as far as cinnamon and vanilla scents for men are concerned.

Musc Ravageur smells masculine to me - a niche and softer version of 1 Million Prive, etc. Durability is good, but projection is average.

In my humble opinion, however, Musc Ravageur is not significantly better than most cinnamon and vanilla focused scents to justify its price tag. Its delicate and rich blend will not smell too different from masculine designer spices to the average person.

This is a Xmas scent for perfume lovers and niche collectors.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: First impressions. Like others have said, quite similar to Caron Pour Un Homme -- but with more depth. A blast of lavender, vanilla and musk is what I get. But the lavender is livelier and complemented with some soft spices, transitioning seamlessly into vanilla, transitioning into a musk note that is also more animalic. So, the main notes are similar, but meld together better than in Pour Un Homme.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Lovely, warm, fuzzy vanilla whose tooth-achingly sweetness is cut short by powder and musk.

On my skin this perfume skipped the lavender intro and went direct to the base: spices, tonka, amber, but everything is delicate, almost hinted, while the dominant accord is musky and vanillic. It is sexy and evocative, not in your face sexual, no indoles nor animalic notes whatsoever.

I expected Valmont but I got Danceny, this musc has nothing of the ravageur; it is a comforting, sweet chap who will cook you dessert, keep you warm on the sofa, and will have vanilla sex with you - eventually.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Smells like I'm drinking a warm, spicy oolong tea, while smoking a cigarette on the porch of a log cabin. The creaminess of the sandalwood develops and adds a roundness. The finish is powdery and woody. I was sure there was some sort of tobacco and tea in this, and It's an exceptional blend, but not my cup of tea. This is one of those frags that looks better on paper than the interview.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I just got the discovery set, and while I really like this one I think I’ll stick with my $50 bottle of L de Lolita. Smells very similar and L lasts longer.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This fragrance is a very strong like for me. My nose smells a vein of Shalimar in it. The thing that burst my bubble was after about 3 hours or so I could barely smell it anymore. Then I looked up the price and that was disappointing too. At $200.00 for 1.7 ounces Frederic Malle needs to step up their game. Why would someone pay $200.00 for this when you can purchase a whole lotta Shalimar for the same price.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Wonderful, unique scent. Deep and securely masculine for the first three hours- afterwards it's a smooth, unintimidating vanilla. Was hoping it would prove more on the unisex side but it might be too manly for me.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Warm Powdery Strong Cinnamon Vanilla Musk.
Not Feminine but Definitely not for Men under 30. Smells nice and unique and but I personally think it's difficult to wear for an occasion because of its strongness. Maybe for Non-Wedding Formal events or a Family function just for something different.
Night/Autumn Overall 7.5/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: My favorite one in my niche collections.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
MR is a masculine-leaning version of my beloved cinnamon bomb perfumes. I vehemently disliked the opening, as the musk-lavender-cloves combo was harsh, clashy, and somehow too animalic, like an aftershave gone bad. However, a couple of hours afterwards, it morphs into a delicious citrusy, ambery, woody, cinnamon-vanilla fragrance. I even like the tonka bean in it, which I tend to dislike as a note. This phase is the perfect cold-weather perfume: it smells cosy and envelops you softly, without taking over your space. Nonetheless, the opening is just a big no for me, so I'll have to pass on this one.
Oh, and if anyone was wondering, this one is 90% similar to Mehareés by L'Erbolario. Mehareés opening is less clashy, but its dry-down is not as well-blended as MR. However, given the 200€ price difference, I'd get Mehareés over MR any day.

6/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Reading so many reformulation complaints Do friends think a 2010 batch of Musk Ravageur should be a safe buy ?

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I don't know -- there's something here that I like - very woody and cinnamon-y - but on me it smells so incense-y and so much like burnt ashes/a burnt toaster that I have an urge to pull my nose away from my wrist and cough up the smoke. I don't think I'll get compliments from anyone on this.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: To all. Update. I ordered a 2ml that is the real deal and it smells of niche quality as expected. There is no comparison to that of the Russian bottle. I know... I got what I paid for and deserve it! But posting this here so that others don't gamble as I did. As Pops always told me, if price is too good to be true - it's probably not.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: @ HollywoodNovaBaby did you ever find out if your bottle was fake? I'm in same predicament. Order cheap from Russia and doesn't smell like anything at a $300 retail price point. But, unless I buy the real deal, (skeptic of decants as well) I have no way of knowing. Are we being scammed by Russian sellers? Also there is no YouTube video on "fake vs. real" like so many other counterfeit frags out there... Hollywood? Anyone?

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is the second Frederic Malle scent which turns my stomach. To take the question of fakes or dodgey decants out of the equation, i ordered actual 10ml bottles of the official perfumes from a reputable website for £48 and £35.

To me, this smells like a cat which has urinated on itself and then been doused with some spicy vanilla scent. Awful. I don’t get any whiffs of heaven or sexiness. Maybe I am just a clean musk person and animalic scents just don’t suit me. I am lamenting the loss of £80 but celebrating the fact that i didnt waste circa £500 on scents that I hate.

Selling my 10ml bottles of Musc Ravageur and Carnal Flower for £20 each if anyone is interested. Bottles are almost full.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
One of the best creations ever made.

Musc Ravageur = Art

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Sweet, powdery vanilla & amber scent. It smells like idleness and decadence.

I didn't find this sexy at all. When I tried this on I felt like I should be wearing a velvet smoking jacket and reclining on a divan, about to "ravage" a cupcake.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
For me art is the deliberate creative process or product of many human activities that appeal to our senses.
Wrongly, I did not conceive perfumery as art until this fragrance entered my life. I did not know the niche fragrances, but this one, I was struck by seeing a review on a channel one day. And when I tried it, it left me senseless, it was as if Stendhal syndrome took hold of me, and I understood that this was also art and I had not contemplated it that way.
Since that day I have been tied to this fragrance, it is neither better nor worse, but she opened a world for me with her sweet spices wrapper, with vanilla and cinnamon, with that powdery touch of lavender, and with her sexy background. of musk that supports the entire composition.

Uniqueness: Medium-high
Scent: 8/10
Sillage: medium
Longevity: 8h
you can follow me and see more reviews on Instagram in the account International_niche_community

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: For the vanilla lovers out there. The more you smell it, just like fermented fruit, in a good way, of course. No wonder it's long lasting one! Definitely unique.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is an amazing scent. The one thing that surprises me about Musc Ravageur is the amount of compliments I get. I think it is my most complimented niche.

The first hour I get almost a bakery like smell. I think the cinnamon, amber and cedar give off the bakery like smell.

After it dries down, it still jumps off the skin with a very alluring note. I don't know what note it is, but this is were I really start to get the compliments.

Musc Ravegeur has surpassed Portrait of a Lady as my favorite Malle. And that is saying something.

10/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I´ve been testing and searching for a signature fragrance for quite some time and now this is it ! Opening did not really impress me at first but when it dries down..oh my it becomes this addicting and soft aura of musc and vanilla almost like warm skin. It lasts for atleast 7-8 hours on my skin and projects moderately which i find fitting for this fragrance. The sillage is inviting and i got complimented wearing it. Would i recommend buying it ? Yes ! however i do not recommend blindly getting it because it is quite pricey. Strongly recommend testing this out a couple of times before getting a bottle i don´t think this is for everyone.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
The new Musc Ravageur is "Musc Missing".. it is the less performing half of the previous edition.
Estee Lauder struck again? I think so, it's another perfume, sorry no no, this is another cologne. The current one is a cologne with a lot of cinnamon, with very light musc.
Good for a nose that hasn't tried the first one. The youtubers tell what they want and the companies that produce it, they are not sincere. Bad Boys.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: this is really like from an unknown world, because it just can't be defined, it's clean and dirty at the same time.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: My favorite one in the collection. Warm, spicy (think cinnamon) creamy musk. Musk is the last "real" ingredient I haven't smelled yet. But if it smelled like this, it would be dreamy.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Outright gorgeous and seductive. Enough longevity. Projection might not be stellar but who cares when scent is absolutely invigorating. Full marks.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I just bought a sampler from FM Website, this fragrance smells just as good as the bottle I had from years ago (and sold, and subsequently regret doing so). Not sure what the reformulation complaints are about, to me this smells maybe even better than it used to. I feel it's more complex than in the past, and maybe that's because it's not as heavy or dense and allowed the notes to open up a bit more.

Sometimes I get a very plush, fuzzy musk with tons of cinnamon, or sometimes the lavender is far more noticeable and the fragrance is highly aromatic. Other times I get a very anise-styled bready smell due to the cloves, or a real smoky, dark Shalimar come mid. I haven't even mentioned the fact that I also tend to get an almost chocolaty vibe in the dry-down depending on the mood of the fragrance.

Call me crazy but if there was a reform, it's better than it was because as much as I loved it, I recall it being a very linear fragrance. Now, it's like 6 fragrances in one depending on how the notes decide to play on my skin.

I'm getting a 5ml decant to solidify my love of the fragrance, and will probably end up buying another bottle and this time, I will NOT be selling it; It will be only for me!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I feel like I'm wearing a full-length red fox fur coat and drinking a hot toddy with extra cinnamon...and extra bourbon. :) Depending on what you think is sexy, you may imagine wearing a full-length fur coat sans clothing or over an all-black ensemble--black cashmere turtlenecks are sexy, what can I say?
