This perfume completely subverted my expectations. Based on youtube reviews and hype, I thought this would be highly animalic and lurid. I had my panties all in a bunch for nothing. This has a naughty kitty vibe, but only as naughty as a Persian cat. We are dealing with domesticated, not feral felines here. The first thing that stood out to me was the cinnamon and aromatic opening, once that calms down the fragrance warms up it becomes a cozy spicy vanilla fuzzy musk. Kitty's got claws, but she doesn't scratch too hard.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: TROLL below,🙄😡

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: My boyfriend bought a small sample bottle of this fragrance. He thought it was just okay and smelt like an old man but I really liked it! The initial spray smells powdery and warm and as it dries down I get a delicious spiced donut smell. Definitely an attractive and complex gourmand scent.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Second review. I am mad AF. This masterpiece (no longer the case) was destroyed when it was reformulated about 2 years ago. It was the most sensual perfume in my wardrobe. My signature scent. Estee Lauder Co. should be embarrassed for transforming a beauty into a monster.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
How to describe...

You're at a café. In the seat beside you is a large feral lion. The most delicious French toast ever made is on the table in front of you. It smells divine - vanilla and cinnamon and freshly baked goodness - it's almost boozy it's so rich. You want to lean in and take a bite... but you know the minute you do the lion will devour you.
Musc Ravageur.

Hmm. No, perhaps there's a better way to describe it...

You're a tangerine, but also a cinnamon role, but wait, no, YOU'RE A WILD ANIMAL running through the woods!
Musc Ravageur.

Just sample it.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Smells like... delicious band-aids?

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Harmless perfume and very fleeting hold, it does not ravage the world of perfumery.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is just ODDICTIVE. Yes, u heard it right, odd but addictive, esp if u have associated with some sort of stories. This is not your go-to bleu de Chanel or panty dropper Eros, or your compliment thirst Layton, this is something else. Nobody has ever experienced the same Musc Ravageur, either pleasant or not. Mine was very pleasant.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Blind bought this fragrance, upon the first use I was a bit unsure of the scent however once the scent settled down into my skin it became heavenly. An absolute masterpiece.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I just don't understand. I do understand, like I get it, but I don't get it. There *is* a funky sebaceous musk in there, and it's more prominent in Helmut Lang EDC (minus the ugly vanillla, plus hairspray) and especially Helmut Lang EDP (plus heliotropic baby oil). But this does not smell expensive or covetable to me, and curse whoever once wrote that it smelled like vanilla-scented dollarstore dog bone toy, because the truth is fierce and heartless.

There is a definite, deep similarity to Meharees and also Safran Troublant. But the Meharees is just better in my opinion (very good actually) because its layered notes are more real-smelling, not so wacky-wonky-chewy-plastic. Meharees gives you dates and spices and vanilla and black musk simmered and swirled together. MR is a laboratory smell.

But that musk in there is good, I'll say. I do dig the Helmut Langs very much. But I'd love Roucel to make a perfume that just goes whole hog for that musk, because sometimes I crave it without all the other stuff.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
A beautiful fragrance. While it centers heavily around vanilla, the other notes do two things. First, they make the vanilla less intense. Vanilla fragrances can be very sweet and in this one that gets toned down. Making it more wearable. Second, and this is more difficult to describe, they make the fragrance more unique. Yes, there is vanilla, but with such a twist that it's different and unique enough to not just be another vanilla fragrance.

It's not animalic to me, although I can imagine some people get that element from it. I think it depends on how it dries down on your skin. There certainly is a nature, earthy type of element to it, which is the counterweight to balance out the vanilla. It's quite genius since it works really well. When smelled on the application spot, both sides are very recognizable. In the air they blend and this is where, in my opinion, the fragrance really shines.

I've read cozy, comfort, addictive in the other reviews and yes, I would agree. This is one you would wear for yourself to feel good. While it also being pleasant to other people. It's not extreme, though it does touch on being polarizing slightly. Its uniqueness makes it something that does either fit your taste or it doesn't. In that regard it's not a safe blind-buy, so make sure to sample it.

Performance is excellent. I haven't counted the hours, but it will last through a regular day, with a skin scent being clearly there still the next day. Projection is good. It does not fill a room, which is good in my opinion. It forms a nice bubble around you and while that bubble shrinks, it does take a long time before it doesn't project at all anymore. And it has a nice sillage for even longer.

Versatility is something I find difficult to say right now. I'd wear it on all occasions. But that's a matter of taste. The hardest part is if it's good for hot weather. Maybe it's too sweet for it, maybe not. For colder weather it works just fine.

The quality is 10/10. The ingredients are of the highest quality, as you would expect from a Frederic Malle perfume. Therefore the price is justified in my opinion. It's a quality luxury item and thus appropriately priced. You don't need a lot by the way, a few sprays go a long way. So your bottle will last a good while.

The nose-blindness effect is pretty strong for me with this fragrance. It can appear to have gone or diminished greatly pretty quickly. But hours later when your nose detects it again, it's obvious that it was there pretty strongly the whole time.

Conclusion: masterpiece but do sample it since it's pretty specific when it comes to taste.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Warm, spicy, vanilla, amber fragrance with lots of musk. I’m a Delina/Roses Vanille/Portrait of a Lady rose-fragrance lover, so this is probably wasted on me. It’s a lovely fragrance, just not for me. Good longevity! Great for cool temps. . .

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I disliked Musc Ravageur and I am kind of sad about that reading most other people's reaction to this perfume. I love the warm/woody/animalic vibe, but something in it in how it comes together comes across as honey to me and honestly is kind of stomach turning. I am not sure what it is, if it is too sweet for me or the lavender or if it is the "forbidden" part everyone keeps talking about.

Which makes it unfortunate that I get great longevity out of this. By the end of the day I can still smell it on my skin.

So I guess for this one you really need to be looking for something sweet and honey-like. This combination here just made me nauseous.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I'm with the person who said there must be something forbidden in it because it's addicting. I feel I shouldn't like it this much, but I'm hooked. This is a my cooler weather quarantine comfort scent. It's so soft and cozy and grounded. Yes, there's that animalic scent, but despite that I love it. The animalic/ barnyard vibe is really strong at first, but it does soften and almost disappear though a hint is still there. But maybe it's that hint of bad that makes it feel grounded and comforting. It's a perfume that is difficult to describe, as is my attraction to it. One of my favorite scents in the world is the smell of soft, hot cat fur on a cat that has been napping in a sunbeam for a good long while, and there's something about this that is almost as good as hot cat fur in the drydown.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
To me, it's in the similar creamy feeling as Xerjoff Naxos. The dry down is definitely similar. I have Naxos, and I think this would be redundant in my collection. It's long lasting, but doesn't project too far.

Personally I prefer Naxos to this. However, it is very pleasant and won't offend virtually anyone around you.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
A masterpiece of perfumery!!

This is not an easy scent to describe. This is more like a feeling and the experience! A sexy, semi gourmand, spicy, dark and sweet scent that comes alive on your skin, develops and transforms as the time passes. The opening is a little challenging but the drydown is magical! The scent interacts with your skin and some times the drydown comes more vanilic, some times more spicy and some times more musky.. I haven't encountered something like this with another fragrance!

Performance is amazing, it stays for over 12 hours and projects really good for 3+ hours, after that comes closer to the skin but it's easily noticeable. This is a very sexy, alluring scent and it's best use is on a date or night out!

Overall, this is to me wearable art, a masterpiece! You can't judge this scent only by the notes or performance etc.. This scent takes you on a journey, it's more about the experience and the overall feeling. I guess that this is a must try for everyone who loves the art of perfumery.. Do not blindbuy but definitely sample!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Hello Everyone, what are the chances of me finding a bottle of the ORIGINAL BOTTLE of this fragrance? Any suggestions? All Recs appreciated!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
My best from Frederick Malle. Musc Ravageur has something 'forbidden' in it, because I'm addicted to it. No jokes here, I spray it even when I'm at home doing chores, just to get those whiffs I crave, otherwise I might have withdrawals 😃. There's something pheromonic about it, none of my other expensive gorgeous perfumes have it.
Great longevity.
I also got a MR hair mist, which I love.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Soft, powdery musk with an animalic undertone.

Musc Ravageur (MR) is one of Frederic Malle's best sellers, if not the best seller.

It is a musky scent, soft and powdery. It has a mild woody spiciness, and a bitter, almost animalic, floral undertone.

The vanilla/lavender combo adds a smooth and somewhat clean aspect to the musk. The vanilla is not sweet nor very gourmand; just its smell without the sweetness.

This powdery scent of musk is lightly seasoned with cinnamon and cloves, and the sandalwood mainly adds a soft woodiness to the scent. It's from here the animalic undertone comes. If there was civet listed, I would totally vote on it as "noticeable". Also, I thought geranium was a main player given the floral bitterness but it's not.

The citruses are barely noticeable and serve only to liven up the scent and prevent it from being too woody/heavy.

Overall the scent is musky, powdery, smooth, mildly-vanillic, clean, with a bitter woody spiciness.

While it doesn't smell exactly like it, it really is in the same category as Pour un Homme de Caron: soft, powdery, clean, non-sweet vanilla/lavender, and barbershopy to an extent, PuHdC more than MR in the last point. I'm surprised at the lack of its mention in the reviews other then Heifrank's.

It is really good and simple yet interesting scent, but is it worth the hype? Honestly, no. I was left underwhelmed when I first smelled it. Although, I do see its appeal.

Musc Ravageur is a mature, cool weather scent, that works both for semi-causal and formal occasions, but suits the latter more.

"Like"

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I’m not sure why people are comparing the smell of this to a cat or armpits or whatever... maybe they have old formulation, or just need to get their noses checked out. But to me this smells like a freshly baked Cinnamon bun. Absolutely love it 10/10!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
On me this is a sweet, powdery, musky fragrance, that is borderline gourmand. This is actually much sweeter than I thought it was going to be. In the opening I get quite a bit of musk, vanilla, and cinnamon. As it dries down the musk dissipates and it’s mainly a powdery vanilla. I didn’t see heliotrope listed in the notes, but I definitely get it, or at least that vibe.

In my opinion it’s completely unisex. I like the scent a lot, but unfortunately it becomes a skin scent on me and there is never any real projection off of my skin; I can’t smell it on myself after about 30 minutes unless I dig my nose into my skin. As a skin scent it lasts about three hours on me.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Not going to lie....

In my quest to appreciate and continue to find another "niche" brand to add to my favourites I tried SO MUCH to like this ..


BUT.


It smells like Farts, Baby Powder, Old books and Curdled cream that's been sitting in a luke warm room for too long.


Absolute hard pass for me...



(Certainly not canning anyone who loves this.. afterall, the best thing about perfumery is people like different stuff that makes them happy! ...)

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I really don't know if this one's a keeper. I had a boss who wore Shalimar and I can certainly see a resemblance. I don't pick up any spices at all - certainly no clove or cinnamon and musk is absent too. I get Shalimar with lanolin and a hint of vanilla. I'll pop it away and revisit it again over time. I might have changed my mind by then but for the moment, it's a thumbs down from me. It's a well crafted perfume but it's strange how our memories of a particular fragrance can conjure up good/bad past experiences. This one makes me sad.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I just love this. It was love at first sniff but I convinced myself it was too heavy, too masculine, too attention seeking to buy and that somehow it didn’t ‘suit’ me. I think it was the sales assistants that gave that impression. Fast forward a year and I wear it and love it and don’t care. To me it isn’t even that ‘animalic’ - I get vanilla (my skin amplifies vanilla) and powder through too. It is actually quite soft, sensual, and inviting. Excellent performance, and moderate sillage with one or two sprays (which is enough.) It is my secret pleasure and absolutely a comfort scent.

Maurice Roucel has made a masterpiece here. Funnily enough, I love his Dans Tes Bras too, they are my favourites in the line at the moment.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is a really nice warm tonka/amber/musk fragrance. I don't get the vanilla note that seems to be most voted here, but it is definitely "vanillic" from the amber and tonka.

It dries down after about 1.5h to a lovely warm scent with the tonka being the most prominent and amber as a support note. The musk adds a sort of humanistic/animalistic touch, like smelling someones skin. This "skin" vibe actually gives me goosebumps sometimes, like when you smell someone you are in love with. In the background there is a really subtle herbacous accord that I can't quite identify but it might come from the combination of the spices and lavender.

Really sexy, sensual and inviting. Above average longevity and lasts even longer on clothes.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
such a well crafted scent, everything´s so rounded !!!
Frederic Malle = 10/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Beautiful scent, but leans way too masculine for me. I’m getting a hefty dose of cinnamon and musk in the beginning, then it dries down to cloves and a lighter musk. I don’t regret blind buying this because I’m sure my husband will love it.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: It is a masterpiece and very unique. I was only ok when I first smelled it on a paper but magic happened when I sprayed it on my skin. The 30mins opening was nice but when it dried down to the mid notes, it was intoxicating then I fell in love with it. It’s the one that I would always keep it in my collection. People said it’s better for winter because it’s so beastly but I wear it all seasons. Probably my skin chemistry tone down the fragrances a little. I don’t think it’s too loud. I actually don’t really define my perfumes by seasons (I wear the all day all seasons) except 1 or 2 that is really beastly even on my skin.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: What a beautiful fragrance! Warm spicy, musky, enveloping. There is nothing else like it. Rich and long lasting.You can also get it at a good discount online. A great fragrance for fall and winter.... a little too dense for spring and summer. Totally unisex. One of the best Musc fragrance there is. It’s a 10!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I don't know if it's just me and my skin, but this is modernized, slightly sweeter Davidoff Zino.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This perfume grabs you. Never have I been so blown away by a fragrance. Listing notes would be silly, this is about having the whole experience all at once or forget about it. I've smelled the Rojas, the expensive Ensar ouds and so on, it does not grab me as this does.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
A mix of sweet dark spices and flawless musk. The harmony of exotic amber with cloves and cinnamon is utterly delicious. Musc Ravageur is one of Frederic Malle’s top and best selling creations. I can clearly understand the reasons for this. I think many people might like the aroma that emerges especially after its opening; hot spices and vanilla...This is a sweet scent, not sugary in the full sense to my nose but it has that burnt caramel effect somehow... Also, tonka bean has a serious contribution to sweetness.

My rating: 8/10

***As a note, let me add that some reviewers find this similar to Francesca Bianchi’s Under My Skin but resemblance to my nose is no more than 1%. Under my Skin is a whole different league. Champions league. ***

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Absolutely gorgeous, a tender whiff of vanilla and cinnamon made exciting by sparkly cloves. Extremely easy to wear, soothing and unobrusive, Musc Ravageur is Maurice Roucel's love letter to perfumery.
Stellar ingredients, moderate projection and great longevity. Completely unisex.

Ballad of the Dying Man, performed by Father John Misty

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I have older bottle and it is more animalic than newer one. New formulation has more powdery-aromatic notes which lacks previous mysterious.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Got this on eBay from one of the Russian sellers. Came unopened, completely wrapped in cellophane. I think it might be fake even though it looks real. It’s a skin scent. Smells like a sweet leather. I thought this was supposed to be a beast?
Can anyone comment or message me if they have any info about the Russian sellers that seem to flood ebay? I want to know if there products are authentic, I’m not sure who would know. If you search BR 540 almost all of them are from Russia for the same price, same seller(s).

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I’m just now trying this. I’m feeling very mixed about this one. On one hand it smells like a delicious chai latte, but on the other hand, there’s some serious funk in the background.
It makes me think of a mink farmer that worked all day and didn’t have time to take a shower before going out so they drenched themself in pumpkin spice body spray.
I don’t know if I could wear this but yet I kinda love it.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
The musk on this is really soft, I wouldn’t even call it musk. Its like, if musk rolled around on freshly laundered French linens.

Shes hefty, bold and a little bit smokey…but soft. The cinnamon does it. The vanilla makes it creamy. And the tonka just makes her irresistible.

The dry down is heaven, and just as aggressive at the opening but…different.

If this juice had a theme song it would be ‘ Bensonhurst blues’ by Oscar Benton.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
for me, to name this simple, it's the MYRRH, simply myrrh, hard, very dry, very very bitter, even for a man it's so bleak and very masculine, I think the sillage is much poor than what is shown here, for the longevity it's always there, not obvious but observed, people like to adore this, I take it's an ok.

comparing MR to my collection, I like to name it my vintage Egoiste without the rose and in the critical condition, like its name suggested, ;) and before here showed MR is smelled like Shalimar! they're belonged to different tribes.

2 days later, still there, softer, like a stagnant flower.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Citrus and lavender on the opening--in some moments, these blend to produce a distinct honey note-- this interplay just makes me think of bees, and teeters on the edge of gourmand, but pulls back at the last second.

The musk is rich and not too dirty. As it dries down, it smells like sniffing a baby's head--or possibly the crook of your lover's thigh. Either way, highly evocative of joyful things.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: MUSK!!!!! This has got to be the most natural musk smelling fragrance. I went to Neiman Marcus today with my wife to purchase the last Carnal Flower which I absolutely love but WOW The SA sprayed MUSC RAVAGEUR on my arm and this is borderline PORN! I want to smell this on my wife every single time. It smells like an upscale African incense stick not lit. Smells like a person smelling like they sell body oils for a living and they have so many oils on that they don’t remember which ones they have put on. Smells like a powerful skin scent. THIS IS CRAZY!!! I didn’t like this at first. My wife was all in from first sniff. Now that I’m sitting at home with the scent radiating off of my arm, we are debating going back before they close to buy the 50ml of MUSC RAVAGEUR. An easy 10 out of 10 for me and I’ve only experienced this fragrance for 5 hours! Blown away

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Oh man oh man,
This is special! Gorgeous mix of spices. This is like a sugar coated clove bomb with powdering of cinnamon. The vanilla smoothens it and forms a great base.
The longevity and sillage is outstanding.
Mild cool weather. Special date fragrance. Not for everyday.
Could be used by late 20s female (light spray).
L elbolario meharees is not too far away if on budget.
I love this.
Outstanding niche and all time legend for a reason.
10/10. Exotic!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Has Nothing to do with Shalimar, or Lolita etc.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is a conforting, musky, borderline gourmand scent.
There's nothing heavily animalic to my nose. It's like a very good oriental fragrance with an amazing musky backbobe. If you like shalimar and other similar scents, you will love this.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I'm wearing the reformulated version of Musc Ravageur and I'm finding it to be much more wearable than the impossibly strong and headache-inducing original formula that I tried some 10 years ago. I know that lots of people prefer their perfumes super-strong, and Maurice Roucel is THE perfumer to deliver such goods. However, as I get older, I find it increasingly difficult to tolerate those crazy strong scents. So, in this case, I definitely prefer the reformulation.
What does Musc Ravageur smell like now? Like a perfect mixture of Chanel Coromandel EDP and Tauer L'Air du Desert Marocain, with just a hint of Shalimar! The opening is citric-vanillic (hence the Shalimar vibe), and then other notes emerge - mainly cinnamon and cloves, mixed with tonka and musk, creating the warm, ambery, sweet, ever so slightly animalic composition. So, if you like Coromandel and/or Marocain (or Grand Soir and such), then this new, tamed, not so 'ravaging' Musc Ravageur is your new best mate. I would also say that this version definitely leans feminine. Silage is moderate to strong, and the lasting power has not been compromised - on my skin it lasts 10+ hours.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: There’s a “furniture polish” vibe I’ve not noticed before that’s starting to turn me off this once favourite scent of mine.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
21st CENTURY SHALAMAR?

OVERVIEW: Vanilla is one of the first aroma’s we’d ever come to know, with such deep and rich scent memories. To me it has such a feminine allure. On the one hand, it’s the sexy sweet skin of your lover. On the other, it’s creamy, lactonic and maternal, with notably high doses of natural vanilla found in mothers milk. Musc Ravageur embodies both.

COMPOSITION: Musc Ravageur opens with a heavy vanilla blast, the spices offsetting the sweetness. I get images of a Victorian cathouse, or the Moulon Rouge. High class and feminine, mysterious, yet with a sleezy double life. She’s got something she doesn’t want you to know - for now at least.

On the other side, I see a proud mother lioness, fierce yet nurturing. Powerful in her own right, yet yielding to the male lion where he leads best. Separate they are vulnerable, together they are strong. Both powerful in their own roles. She as mother and lover. He as hunter and provider. Together they are complete.

AROMA: thick, heavy, rich dense oriental vanilla with heavy spices. Powdery, spicy, moody. Heavy on vanilla and clove above everything else. I’m recently learning my taste deeper and this taught me a few things. First, I prefer airy, aromatic scents - this is dense, thick, sultry, powdery. Next, I prefer naturalistic smells - woods, green, earth, vetiver - this is sticky, spicy and sweet.

WEAR WHAT YOU LOVE: this is extremely feminine to me. Wear what you love but I personally love manly scents, and I didn’t get that from the 100s of reviews who claim every single fragrance is unisex - very confusing. To me this is pretty yet powerful, like a 21st century interpretation of Shalamar. Best on individuals who embody a feminine spirit.

VERDICT: sometimes the embodiment of a goddess, sometime’s expensive oriental candle. Still undecided but will smell on the right female to FULLY make up my mind. Will update soon!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is a spicy vanilla musk. It’s sexy and I like it a lot but there’s something in there that reminds me of Christmas - probably the cloves - and that makes it less versatile in my opinion. If it wasn’t for that I’d probably buy it.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I intend to provide my own personal interpretation as I do not consider myself to easily understand or recognise the composition of a perfume. I am not an expert.

Just received this perfume as a birthday gift - unbelievably strange. I think I love it??? It is a very strong and powerful scent; on initial application it smells fresh and vanillery but the strangest thing happens as it drys - apart from the fact that it lasts for ages it starts to remind me of unwashed hair - like a pheromone smell. It's sort of captivating and dirty but I like it. There's a smell of cloves which I love. It stays on my skin literally from shower to shower, not much will shift this scent. I wore a different perfume today but despite many reapplications I can still smell Musc Ravageur - I think I may have got some on my watch. It is a very private and personal scent; I'm almost embarrassed to wear it in public! I want to spray myself in it and spend some time with him...............just us......

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I really like this at the beginning, is the first musk of this kind that i try, i had cleaner or dirtier before. Then it becomes more powdery.... and i started smelling something very familiar, something that i associate with christmas, in two seconds i remembered, it's Mehareès from L'Erbolario!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
A vanillic clove bomb with musk that is highly enjoyable after the initial opening. Most people will compliment you in the right settings ,a cold weather fragrance.Tested from many samples.

Scent:8.5/10
Projection:8/10
Complement factor:7.5/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Musc Ravageur on my skin reminds me alot of Shalimar Parfum in the beginning, a bit less when it dries down. Still this is to me like a Shalimar with a bit of christmas spices and a bit more "darkness". It lacks the "sparkle" of Shalimar, and thus smells a bit more masculine. I still think it is very easy to wear as a woman.

The only other Fredric Malle I have tried is Portrait of a Lady, which performs very well on my skin (few fragrances do) unfortunately Musc Ravageur needs heavier application to last, and the sillage is lesser. I love these types of scents to waft around me, so that is a slight disappointment. I do find that Shalimar edp envelops me more in the cold, so that might be the case with this one as well.

I really like this and have no doubts I will finish my bottle. It's an easy oriental and very balanced and smooth to my nose.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
@Art you didn't make anything clear, dear.
I get that medicinal vibe in the opening, it's because of the clove. Can't get past that, it ruins the whole composition for me. It's like a visit in a very cosy pharmacy.
Not a fan of a perfume with the tonka/lavender/amber accord either, so it is not my cup of tea.
Having that in mind: the musk and vanilla blend is masterful to the point when it doesn't smell neither like musk, nor like vanilla anymore.
Feels like an afterglow of what a legend of a perfume it used to be before the reformulation. Opinion, not fact.
Is it worth to buy a bottle of a perfume just to learn how a good blend of musk & vanilla smells? No. Is it worth sampling for educational purposes? Definitely.
Wearable. Complicated. Legendary. Faint.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I get the slightest amount of something citric in the opening. And as we all know, then comes the infamous spicy blend of cloves, cinnamon, and a synthetic civet (or musk) accord. I have a decant of the supposed reformulation and I had a sample several years back and I can assure you some minor tweaks have been made since Malle announced he had to reformulate some fragrances due to IFRA restrictions. The musk and cloves in the older sample were much more pronounced. I totally understood why some people would hate this aspect of the scent.

The recent formulation is still amazing but slightly watered down. The mid is unmistakably spicy and there is a creamy vanilla present in the background but I wouldn't call Musc Ravageur a vanilla scent nor a gourmand, at all. The cloves are very prominent to my nose, but Roucel blended the spiciness and the sweeter vanilla accords with such finesse, that the overall result is exquisite. The musk or civet is lurking beneath the spicy melange but it will never be too animalic or challenging unless you're not used to orientals in general. The drydown is a creamy mix of vanilla, soft spices, and woods.

Performance is great, it is no beast by any means, but it will last for quite some time on skin. I like this scent so much that I would say you can wear this in more casuals settings as well (office included) and even though it is perfect for colder weather, it could be worn year round if applied accordingly.

One of Malle's best in the line and in my opinion Roucel's magnum opus. A classic which will never go out of style.

10/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
To make it clear as Maurice Roucel told the interviewer, Musc Ravageur has a “Musk” he mean “Deer Musk” not “Civet” that he claimed this musk get rid of top note that make it animal-like stinks and dreadful, but it more skin like feeling as a fresh baby skin.

I know Civet and Deer Musk is different because my hometown has a civet farm, civet is the way more stinky and fishy and you can find it in Kouros. Deer musk the way more subtle, animalic make it smell a bit like harsh urine that get rid of ammonia, touch of powdery and fresh skin.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Guerlain Shalimar plus Lavender, minus incense. Lots of orange and bergamot, clove, cinnamon, vanilla, cedar, musc.
Very pleasant, warm, smoky, nice in bed, very comforting in cold weather.
A drier, more masculine take on Shalimar, recommended for men who love Shalimar but hesitate to wear it because they find it too feminine.
For women: Go for vintage Shalimar if you can find it.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Lovely, lovely! Spicy, somewhat fresh, musky, warm ambery, vanillic gooey-like dream of a fragrance. Performance is also really good! A strong love!!! Totally FB worthy! 93

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: There is info out there from quotes from Malle and Roucel as well as official marketing literature that synthetic civet was used on MR. People are not making it up or confusing anything. It’s brief was to reinterpret and modernize Shalimar. It has musks and it def had civet.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I am just sampling this for the first time. I like this. It seems to me to be the perfect musk reference fragrance. I don’t think I need it though, which is good because yesterday I bought a Roja Enigma EDP from fragrancex on an installment plan.. even though slowly I am forking over a lot of cash for it and I’m glad not to need this too.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I was searching my review to update it, but apparently it has been vanished. Well, let me sum it up for you: i really disliked it.

However the last couple of weeks i have been trying to persuade myself that i like Musc Ravageur. While i have not completely succeeded, i managed to appreciate it significantly more, as i now dont hate it anymore.
It is musky, it is warm, cosy , it is strange and it is full of cinnamon. This is a fragrance with a unique character.
If it is to be worn, i think one should spray a very small quantity, otherwise victims may occur.
It is so unlike anything else i have smelled that i would perhaps even try to trace down the wearer, just from curiosity.
Overall i find Musc Ravageur to be a special fragrance, but quite peculiar and hard to wear too.

6.5/10


Edit:

5 months later and i think i kinda like it! Promotion to

7/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Musc Ravageur is composed of high quality fragrance notes from top to bottom and from the initial spray they will make you smell great. Straight up in the first seconds the bergamot and lavender give a bitter and slightly sweet combination, like being outdoors surrounded by bushes. Within a couple of minutes the woods come through and the feeling of being outdoors is accentuated. At about five minutes the spices are discernible along with woods, lavender and bergamot, and at this point there are wonderful relaxing notes in the air around you. Soon the vanilla joins in the dance and for about three hours you will smell fabulous. Musc Ravageur is suitable for the office, casual settings and formal occasions with its subtlety and elegance making it universally liked.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This perfume doesn't need any introduction. It is a must have for everyone who appreciates great scents. This is one of the legends of modern niche perfumery, that made people look beyond the designer counters at retail malls. It is this perfume that sort of opens up the niche world to the mass. I have been wearing this for 10+ years, and it has often garnered compliments and most of the females I've asked said they like it.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Well, I can say my bottle has a very animalic type of musk. Some say it’s the clove note (I think Maurice Roucel himself said that in an interview), but I’m not sure about that. Civet or not, It has a VERY urinous aspect to me.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Often compared to Meharées L'Erbolario (22 euros/50ml), will review both having had full bottles of both, but first the scent.

- Opens up with a heavy does of mostly clove plus spices, sharp and strong. The longest opening you can think of, about 90 minutes of clove. If you don't like clove, this will bug you!

- After these 90 minutes you will start getting the musk, vanilla and oranges, now this bit is identical to Meharées. The dry down is stunning, IMO.

- Performance 10 to 12 hours, on my t-shirt, two days!
- I love the scent but people around me were rather "meh" about it (brother, friends, a date), it doesn't "smell like sex" or anything like that.

- MR and Meharées are identical in the drydown, Meharées doesn't have the clove opening, costs 22 euros, but I am allergic to something in it!! MR is expensive, performs 3x or 4x times better than Meharées and the quality is higher (no allergens, presentation, performance,..).

All in all, I find Meharées a safe blind buy and if you are not allergic like me, I would say value to money, get Meharées.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: @fittiger: There's a big clue on this page and in the post below you: Meharees.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
My favorite fragrance of all time. I have tried almost every big fragrance that there is to try. Even those elusive discontinued gems like TF Amber Absolute, Antidote, vintage Chergui, M7, big Amouages and other stuff.

Yet, this one tops them all. Just to let you know, I also had Mehares and yes, they are close but there is only one original.

My holy grail trio is Musc Ravageur, Tom Ford Tuscan Leather and Guerlain Shalimar.

If you are a fragrance lover, there is no excuse not to try the above-mentioned trio. Cheers!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Oh what a rebel soul. Dies too young unfortunately. 7/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Blessedly, this is close enough to L de Lolita that I don't feel the need to spend 5x (or more!) for a bottle. Is it possible there's some nuance that makes the Frederic Malle version more special, rarer, more complex? If there is, my nose is too dumb to get it. It's still possible to find bottles of L de Lolita for a very reasonable price (hmm, should I get *another* backup??), and I've never had issues with longevity or sillage with it.

For those who prefer Musc Ravageur (or don't know/care to know L de L), more power to you! For anyone looking for a more affordable option, I'd suggest checking out the L de Lolita! For me, I will happily use up my sample and consider this pennies (lol) saved toward purchasing other 'fumes.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Lolita LL on left wrist, MR on right, SAME SMELL ALL THE WAY FROM APPLICATION THROUGH DRYDOWN! Longevity of MR is better.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Sort of a romantic and business-like odour in one place. Lemony-musky opening, but vanilla dances into the limelight after the opening wears off. Very pleasant and vigorous, leaving you to enjoy the lavendery aftertouch. While not included in my favourite pool of fragrances, I would wear this regularly.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
If you like vanilla probably you Will LOVE It... If dont, please be aware! This is one of the BEST vanillas i have tried. The opening is very sweet and animalic, with the Notorious vanilla, the cinnamon, and all the animalic notes. The dry down is a bit woodier, with the sandakwood and the patchouli and during the whole performance all the time a very noticeable musk. I must say that i orefer the opening than the dry down... When the vanilla dissapears It turns Aldo more animalic, It smell a bit like dried saliva, a bit like the dry down of perfumes like kouros and, depending on the moment, that could be addictive or a bit annoying... The smell at opening makes me remember a lot when my grandmother cooked vanilla flan... It is a very similar scent!! Or something like flanin el niño! ;)
The performance is good but not a beast because after the first hour It turns down quickly, but is nice. The price is high but un line with other similar perfumes like under my skin by Francesca bianchi.
Summing Up, if you are looking for a special vanilla... This could be your perfume!

Scent: 9
Longevity: 8
Sillage: 7
Quality/price: 5
Versatility: 6
Originality: 7
Global: 8.5

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I know there is no Rose in this, but the dry down on me reminds me of Delina. Anyone else get that? Maybe it's just my body Chemistry. Lasts FOREVER! Not really my thing though!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I have a mini bottle of the older formulation, it smells nice so I got a full bottle and I will say that I am not super impressed now that I have a full bottle. I love the smell and love the shape of the bottle from a collectors standpoint but the composition is weak, why companies water down greatness is beyond me and deserves a full boycott of all their products, that's how I feel, it's a shady thing to do when you still charge full price for what one thinks is as good as the OG version. I also think that I have become spoiled with Middle Eastern perfumes and honestly anything else just seems weak and secondary with exception of a chosen few that project well and last more then a few hours on the skin, plus a cheaper price for some middle eastern perfumes with monster performance. When a master perfumer creates a masterpiece leave it alone, especially when it's as expensive as this is.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
A fantastic spicy, musky, creamy,powdery, vanillic fragrance.

This has been one of my all time favorite fragrances for many years. It starts off with some citrus along with cloves and cinnamon. the cloves starts to decrease leaving room for the cinnamon, musk, Tonka and vanilla to take over and transform the smell into a border-line gourmand .it is also powdery. I don't find this fragrance particularly dirty or anything like that.
Performance is excellent on older batches. both 2009 and 2014.

9.2/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Update:

I know Esteē Lauder bought EDP Frederic Malle back in 2015. I've been wearing Musc Ravageur, my signature perfume (and I mean, I wear it everyday, day and night, all seasons), for approximately 8 years (3 years or so before it was included in EL's portfolio).

I must say again, I love the perfume and wouldn't think about wearing any other as my signature perfume, even though I wear 2-4 perfumes layered under Musc Ravageur sometimes.

That said and coming back from a cosmetic retail background, I know EL always changes formulations and/or dilutes them (wether it's perfumes or makeup) in order to maximize profits shortly after acquiring any brand. In my opinion, they respected Musc Ravageur's formulation for a few years. But I've noticed a difference in my last two bottles. The scent itself has not been compromised, but the concentration has.

I don't know what the original concentration was as many perfume houses do not disclose that information (if any of you know such information, I'd appreciate it if you share).

I will still keep it as my go to, signature perfume, but I have to change the numbers in my previous rating:

Lasting power: 6/10 (it used to last so long, that after washing my clothes, whenever I had to iron something, it still smelt like Musc). Not the case any longer, but I must say, after 6+ hrs, I can still get a faint whiff every so often (as some people around me can, as well).
Sillage: 7/10
The sillage was enormous. I know this is a turn off for many people. Not for me. I am confident enough to enter a room and have people notice my presence before they see me because they can smell me. Some of them are a bit too sensitive to the scent. I truly don't care (I do not work in an office environment).
Now, I've noticed the projection is approximately 8-10 feet max.

The only thing I'm thankful for is that the formulation has not been compromised, albeit, it's diluted.

I didn't try it when it was launched.

Thoughts?

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Cinnamon sticks for the entire life of it.

it actually opens ultra nice similar to Straight to Heaven Extreme. but it’s all cinnamon afterwards.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: one of my favourites in the house, it's very lovely scent. it's animalic musk.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
A masterpiece you must try. Not too musky and not too sweet. Just a perfect balance. It is not spicy at all on my skin. I get amber, vanilla, musk and woods.

Totally unisex but I actually would prefer this on a woman than a man.

I cannot pull this off everyday.. way too sexy. Date night and sexy time only.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Do not be fooled even for a second by the presence of vanilla and cinnamon: Musc Ravageur is in another league and away from the bubble gum vanilla frags based on cinnamon note like One Million, Paco XS, Azarro Wanted, Ultra Male and, to quote a "niche" - Parfums of Marly Herod ETC. Noooo, sir ... Here we have an authentic and root musk - the clove moistened in citrus comes together with a cutting feeling and gives an interesting aspect of tearing the skin of this animal, sitting on a typically masculine and almost clean wood base, with the cinnamon acting bitter and pure, without any sugar. Vanilla and tonka bean, very pure and perfumed in lavender, only lightly sweet gives the pleasant counterpoint to the wildness behind. There's a WOW factor here in the proposal to use ingredients present in easy-to-wear perfumes (above cited), but here finely tuned to assume their most natural and organic form possible, without aromatic disguises of pleasantness, sweetness or roundness: a nirvana for connoisseurs of high-level aromatic organicity. Good/average performance.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Fantastic sensual scent, warm, comforting, skin like.
Right amount of unbidden complexity, without edging on the retro.
The faint lavender brightens the mix, evoking a certain sensibility behind the dark spices. It's magnetic, and an excellent wedding of sensuality and cosiness.
It's terrific, yet, the longevity has disappointed me several times.

I would expect better than 4 hours from this.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Bad to the Bone (Maurice Roucel, 2000)

Bottle Design: Frederic Malle

Scentrack: Grace Jones- Libertango

A deadly beauty. In a dirty French way camouflaged Roucel's lavender. A lavender complementary surrounded by gluckwine clove, cinnamon and skanky musk. This musk is dirty, filled with animalic attraction. Vanilla is transparent, yet strong and almost edible. A sweet post coital cookie.
Only for winter, due its potency. Perfect for leaving your morning mark in girlfriend's linen.

Rating: 8/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Without sounding arrogant or pompous, I would like to make a statement that this juice is most definitely not for the beginners or one's who like to play safe.

This is a bold, heavy, highly complicated affair. It is like looking at Piccasso or Sadqain's abstract painting where the individual components make absolutely no sense but the whole painting takes a beautiful flowing form. It fragrance is to be appreciated as a beautiful piece of artwork .

While the musk predominates, the occasional lavender, tonka, vanilla and cedar make their brief appearances in a well orchestrated manner. The balance of these individual components create a gorgeous harmony.

Best worn outdoors on a very cold day, that's when it truly blossoms and shows its true colours. Just need to go easy on the spray as it has enormous silage and 8 plus hrs longevity.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This fragrance is one of the worst I have smelled, especially in the first 3 hours. It smells very medicinal. I would not wear this even I get paid to do so. It makes me nauseous actually. It becomes less annoying as it dries down but still unpleasant to my nose.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I smell a spicy sweet tobacco scent which could be either a masculine paradise or the perfume of a sophisticated confident woman. The perfume screams quality, it lasts for hours and projects pretty well! A treasure I would say...!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Today I needed the warm hug of Musc Ravageur. I had put it to one side as it's now high summer here in South Africa but today is unseasonably chilly and due to life being, well, life, I needed the warmth. Wow! So smokey today! Reminiscent of LapsangSouchong. Still the comforting vanilla at the top but there is a deeper, mustier fug that is so interesting. This really is one of the all time great fragrances.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I could drink this.
The fragrance has more bite than the oil.
Every moment of the wear is deeply enjoyable. It’s just rich sexy comforting enveloping and not overly intellectual. I don’t find it challenging or funky or even very musky. It’s more a spicy vanilla.
Reminds me of this massage oil from the 70s called Kama Sutra my parents owned (which weirds me out a bit) but I love this fragrance no less.
Definitely too sexy for work.
Love to wear this to bed :)
The dry down is insanely wonderful and the next day even better. My skin just smells of the most subtle and amazing warm sweet musk.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
If L de Lolita came in a men's version- this would have been it.
Or L de Lolita layered with Jicky/Shalimar/Habit Rouge.

This may prove too masculine for my tastes. I have a 2019 bottle (one code is Aug 2019, one is Sept 11, 2019, the bottom of the bottle has a 3 digit A89 Estee Lauder code, but then another 5 digit code that also works with EL) and I do find this very average in potency/sillage. Nothing skanky or body odor either. Very spicy/herbal amber/cinnamon. This is my only experience with MR, so I can't comment on reforms/orig juice.

I like this, but not $200+ like. Maybe a $50 like since it wears too masculine for me.

Has a rather "barbershop" drydown. Maybe I need to wait until warmer temps if I want the unique skanky weirdo MR.

Formal wearing UPDATE- WOW!! Ok, so apparently the best day to test this was last night, lol.
A foot of new snow, 20-30 mph gusty winds, 10 degrees-- and Musc Ravageur. Shoveling snow creates sweat/body heat, but the temps are insanely cold, and I LOVE MR!
This is like L de Lolita plus armpit man sweat- IN THE BEST WAY. A spicy masculine sweat- kinda like the way I dig the hot body odor in Dune.
The next morning, I still had MR on my shirt and it smelled like L de Lolita sprayed over 2-week old Angel (patchouli)- and I liked it!
But... I found sillage to be sad/weak. Sure it HAD sillage and longevity, but not nearly enough for a $250+ perfume. I was heavy with the sprays which I suppose is what you have to do.

I got more cloves than lavender on my skin- which is good. My skin wearing wasn't Jicky-like at all (and I like Jicky!). My proper body test was skin only. I also love the WARMTH from this perfume, even if it's in my imagination from the cold Michigan winter.

My yesterday tissue test is all L de Lolita.

This is a win, but not worth the price. Bless Paypal Credit!

Four days later, can't stop spraying. I need a fresh hit of this crack every hour. Love it. The masculine/odd opening is now a craving of mine because I know it doesn't last long. The lavender with the clove is kinda funky, but this quickly meshes into cinnamon-clove-spice-vanilla-cake and I LOVE IT.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
A masterpiece niche fragrance, one for those who can appreciate depth and warmth. Being niche expect this fragrance to be somewhat polarizing. Those with less experienced noses will probably dislike this one as it can be challenging (especially the opening). Having said that, this was my first ever niche purchase.

To me this is an animalic/sexual vanilla amber fragrance, it opens with lavender, spices and a little citrus which quickly gives way to a cinnamon powdery amber and vanilla combo. Reminds me of an animalic grand soir (MFK) with lavender and cloves in the opening.

It hits you throughout the day sometimes intensifying and then going back to being subdued. Best time to wear this is during autumn/winter as the cold carries the fragrance and also makes certain notes stand out. I also had really good experiences when wearing this in air conditioned environments.

This is a beast mode performance fragrance therefore you don't need to apply much, I get between 10-12hrs where it projects for the first 6hrs and finally dries down remaining close to the skin.

This fragrance is not versatile making it only wearable for certain specific occasions. Essentially if you don't wear this right... you could potentially have a bad experience :)

Musc Ravageur to me will always be in the top ten best fragrances of all time, it is so far above others in the genre making it a timeless classic.

Please sample this before purchasing, not for everyone.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I remember this being much more animalic than the current formulation. If someone could shed some light on how the two formulations are different and how does it currently perform.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: The first time I ever sprayed this I got a lot of medicinal clove, bergomont and lavender. After 10 min it became sweeter and musky then dissapeared....so I thought. I must become nose blind because people keep telling me I smell sweet and I smell good. The next time I wore this the opening smells almost identical to Tom Ford Black Orchid . it really does. After an hour the dry down smells like the opening of L de Lolita. It's not as sweet and it's a little musky. ..a little dirty but so addictive. I don't know if I have an older bottle but it smells a lot different to me than what a lot of the other reviewers were saying. I smell it longer than normal now and don't become as nose blind to it as fast which is strange to me. Sometimes when I get wafts of it it smells like Black Orchid other times if I smell it from my clothing it smells like l d Lolita..it's different and it's beautiful. I wish I could smell it all the time instead of in wafts.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Sweet, erogenous and dirty musc.

I always have issues picking the right occasion to wear it. The dirty aspect might offend some people, but I usually wear it during intimate moments, and it seems to be working just fine.

It might be gamble to wear it in crowded environments, unless you seek attention (not necessarily positive).

Scent: 8/10
Performance: 8/10
Versatility: 2/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I adore this perfume! So much more than I really can afford but I am helpless in it's warm embrace. This is touted as the ulimate sexy warm musk but to me it is gingerbread, vanilla and comfort. This is a warm cashmere blanket in front of a fire whilst drinking spiced chai. Wood and sweetness. Pure heaven - a hug in a bottle.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Spicy (cloves, cinnamon) and musky vanilla. Very moody. When it behaves, it smells dreamy. When it starts to act out, it smells like weird synthetic funk. I suppose I love it, but I rarely feel like wearing it. You never know how it goes with this one... It's a cult classic for a reason.

Totally unisex. Very good performance.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I'm sure Maurice Roucel took Shalimar an example to create Musc Ravageur but in a modern way with animalic musk, tonquitone. Actually current Shalimar is very modern and more complex than Musc Ravageur in my opinion. Musc Ravageur is not musky or animalic as well. This is ambery oriental (patchouli, vanilla) with the bright citrus blend of bergamot and mandarin. I remember first time I smelled years ago there was an animalic musk inside but current version is not anmilic as before.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Musc Ravageur smells like sex and cinnamon in a bed of billowy vanilla. Tastefully erotic. I love it, and every fraghead should smell it at least once. It’s an experience.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Got an official sample today! Been wanting to try this for forever! I have Meharees and they are quite similar. I love this type of scent! I think it is very sensual and I agree with the name! The opening to this one is a bit more unique as where Meharees gets to the marvelousness right away.
I actually perceive Meharees as more musky! Which in my book is a good thing!
Update:ADDICTED❤️😍


.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is very muskrat ass musky in the 1rst 45 minutes or so, but OMG, what a Heavenly drydown! C'mon cooler weather!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Musc Ravageur might just be the musk-less musk to beat all musks. Rarely do fragrance copywriters accurately capture a scent, but FM nails their description: "unapologetically sexy." You too can be the most sensual, the most desired, the most lusted-after gingerbread person on the block.

Or, as a friend often says, "Please wear SEXY CHRISTMAS tonight!"

Note: The body oil form is just as good, if not better, than the EDP spray.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: An elegant and well constructed Western Oriental scent that is also one of the safest musk based fragrances to wear in this world. The perfume opens with notes of lavender and bergamot and moves to a heart which has a prominent cinnamon with a bit of clove. The perfume settles into its synthetic musk base surrounded by vanilla, tonka bean, guaiac wood and slight traces of amber, cedar and sandalwood. Unisex slight masculine leaning with moderate sillage and projection and very good longevity. A musk perfume that can easily be worn up work. Enjoy!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is a truly wonderful unisex musk perfume. For me not one note overpowers another, they just harmonise perfectly. It really is as good as the hype would have you believe, well in my opinion anyway. It’s just so damn expensive!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Interesting, but it's most definitely a no from me. When i smell this, it's like smelling two sides of a piece of fruity dessert, except one side has been urinated on by a squirrel. There are undertones of what could have been something quite nice, but then the animalic musk drenches it as it wafts closer.

Lasts a long time, which is terrible unless you want to be attracting feral cats.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Musc Ravegeur is one of my top three fragrances. Almost gourmand-like musc that truly lasts almost all day and the sillage is magnificent. Every time I wear this I constantly find myself thinking "Damn, I smell good!" while smelling my own wrists. It is quite dark and I cannot wear this in the heat (luckily I'm in Seattle so that's not a problem ;)).

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: All I could smell was cinnamon incense and vanilla/Tonka mixture. Felt like some sort of balsam or oldish cream.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I have had decant of this unusual masterpiece for past month and a half but whenever i start to write about it, i often am out of right words.Musc ravageur is not a fragrance but an experience. If category of niche fragrarances can be defined by a single fragrarance, i would vote for this one.

I may fail to do so but let me try painting an olfactory image of musc ravageur. Think of it as a pheromones excreted by a male animal to attract its female counterpart or a scent of man when he is at its most sensual.

So how has perfumer achieved this unusual scent? I'm no expert but i think cloves and black musc are key players. To my nose, this starts of with cloves (lots of cloves) which can be deal breaker for many like the note of cummin. Black musc must be the ingredient responsible for that pheromonic smell. There is certain bitterness to it which can attributed to use of citruses. After a while bitterness subsides leaving a pretty linear scent until a late dry down where vanilla lends a semi sweetness to whole concoction.

Kind of scent it is, i did not expect it to be loud projector. It remains close to you with above average longevity. To be really honest, i always wash it after few hours as this can be quite cloying in hot humid weather. But I'm sure this would be a stunner in cold weather. Occasion wise, it is neither a casual scent nor an office one but i could see it working well when you are suited up. Truth be told, i might not even dare wearing it even suited up.

This is ultra niche, there is nothing like it and i doubt there ever will be. No one should blind buy it but if you see fragrarance as a form of art, this is a must try

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This smells too similar to Kiehl’s musk perfume for me, but with an off putting burnt woody note in the dry down. It’s a beast of a scent though, but too pricey considering the Kiehls equivalent which I find more natural and sensuous, thus easier to manage!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This one is too weird, it’s a bad mix of notes that just do not complement eachother.
Not liking the cinnamon and cloves, burns my nose, then the cloyingly sweet comes up, an hour later it’s all gone, no it’s just no good. I will finish up the 5mil sample but i will not be buying a full bottle. I will stick with my beloved Tom Ford, Amouage, Chanel, Guerlain and Dior. I have tried to like FM perfumes, I have sampled about 15 of his perfumes and I either really hate them or just don’t like any. Im not into crazy overpriced perfumes that are not worth the high prices. Some of these perfume houses have some nerve charging the exuberant high prices they do for the terrible perfume concoctions they put out. They should not be allowed to get away with it. But as long as ignorant ppl will pay their asking price, they’ll just keep ripping u off. I don’t mind paying $$$$ for a great Niche or Brand name perfume but it had better be worth it and none of FM perfumes are worth even a fraction of the price they charge. Ughhhh they’re as bad as that other overpriced terrible brand Bond #9. Or that incredibly awful gorilla perfumes. I have learned long ago the hard way to never blind buy a full bottle of perfume based on other ppl great reviews. Always get a sample first and get it from a Dept store or from the brands website, never from eBay or even those sites that sell decant 2mil perfume samples, they too are huge rip offs, they water it down or add alcohol to it . You will know as soon as u compare the sample u bought from them to one u get from any Dept store such as Saks. I’m in NYC so I get my samples at Saks or Nordstrom. If you do not get your decant sample from a legit place then u can never be 100% sure what u have is authentic.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
It starts blasting "You give clove a bad name" into a microphone with a bass cab of lavender nappie powder and a kick drum of the animalic cinnamon from Lolita Lempicka L mannified into The Hulk.
It then dusks with dregs of some really good vanilla setting the mood for a toffeed-up version of the amber of Shalimar humming a noir version of Tainted Love to appear and meet a "bow chikka wow wow" musk. Then they run to let nature take its course. A modern woods and linalool spice accord takes away the 70s gold chain over chest hair vibe for a black tie over a loosened collar. Sexy? Yes. But not nearly as dirty or sexual as I thought it would be imo, this isn´t Jim Morrison in black leather pants sprayed with MKK but still great.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Rock Rose on a bed of vanilla and cinnamon. I had a cat named Silver, She recently passed away after 25 years on this earth and although I've had people pass that I've known in my life, nothing shook me like her passing did for whatever the reason. Silver loved to cuddle but when she was tired of me she'd definitely let me know that she was the queen and I should do as she says. Musc Ravageur smells like the fluffy tuft of fur I used to nuzzle right under her neck. I will "God willingly" always own a bottle of Musc Ravageur to remind me that I was lucky to have really loved something.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Lucky to have owned a 2010 batch (Finished it 2016). What more is there to say than what the Pundits here have not covered.

The manufacturers muted the Cinnamon & Clove and almost removed the animalic facet of the Musk. As a result, current formulation of the fragrance appears to be more citrusy, which by nature is fleeting. Therefore it is more airy and lower in performance.

In 2018 I finally pulled the trigger on Meharées from L'Erbolario along with Dolcelisir from the same brand. In my humble opinion, L'Erbolario is same in the air, as the current formulation. Love it even more coz I saved a ton of cash.

IFRA killed fragrances & continues to do so.

Instagram: @kushs.frags

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This fragrance is not linier. There are 3 distinct phases: In the opening, you do not get the listed top notes as much as the musc, cinnamon, and cloves, that are the strongest. This is the most polarizing phase. It's the one that many don't like, calling it medicinal, mothballs, and urinals I've read.
It was challenging for me at this point, as it seemed the musc was too harsh, before coming into balance.

The second phase is the best, and is the heart of the fragrance. It's when the harsher notes of Musc and spices, comes into balance with the gourmand aspects of the sweet vanilla and tonka.
The overbearing top notes of Musc and cloves settle to reveal the lavender, woods.
You get the gingerbread, or caramel taffy, together with the musc and spices.

The. 3rd phase is when the musc and spices fade, and you get mostly a creamy smooth gourmand scent of gingerbread, tonka, woods, and a bit of lingering Musc in the background.

So the middle and last phase are most enjoyable. I still like the challenging opening. It's an acquired taste in the opening.
I can see this becoming a signature fragrance. I've noticed my favorite fragrances were challenging at first, then I acquired a taste for them. So it is with Musc Ravageur. The blending is tight. It's strong and aggressive, but everything feels in balance. It smells like a great timeless classic, which it is.

It is more gourmand than Labdanum 18, yet darker and more aggressive. Labdanum 18 is very similar, but it's a soft Oriental.

The fragrance is the most Classic smelling of all the Malles. It is my second favorite after "French Lover".

PS: My 100 ml from eBay just came in. I was reviewing from my 10 ml. Maybe the bottle I got is more vintage. The opening has a rich, more natural and anamalic musc.
It has a bit smoother opening, I like it. Got a good bottle:)

Rating: 9.25/10

God bless. John 3:16

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Musc Ravageur in my books is a very very good perfume. It is created for a man as i see it, cant really imagine it on a woman. Roucels picture with great mustache is exactly what this scent is about. Opening to me is very much star anise. its very strong at the beginning, and as it was a blind buy of mine - i was a little put off. as perfume shifts - in around 5-10 mins, all other notes start to come out. main players here are cinnamon, musc, sweetish vanilla/amber. probably woods as well, since there is something masculine about it. when you read notes, you might think its too simple but its not true. this does turn to warm/dry/spicy cashmere like aura of the wearer without any gourmand, cinnabun parallels. it is sexy i would say, but there is nothing skanky. it doesnt smell old, but it is for a confident man. you cant be a shy tender flower and wear this. compliment getter, excellent blended, long lasting. i would say around 10 hours on me, which is excellent. Silage is not enormous, but you will be noticed. batch that i have is A28. never tried the original, but this one is quite good in my books :)

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I had a old bottle and tried latest one two days ago then got the sample. They are not same! Unfortunately older one has animalic notes but newer one doesn't have. I recognized difference when I try them side by side. Latest one is more airy, citrusy and has more lavander in my opinion. Still good but this is not Musc Ravageur!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Is it reformulated? The current version smell like pure sweet coumarin (or some type of musk I don't know?), with a bit fatty nuance. Later the coumarin is sprinkled with some dry warm spice powder, which secretly steals the show. Still, it’s a sweet show.

Although I’m glad they took out (or toned down) sticky vanilla which I absolutely hate, but now this is ...too monotonous. I mean, why pay a few hundreds dollars for a bottle of...coumarin (or musk)?

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Too similar to Honey Aoud from Montale in my opinion, and since I've got a bottle of that, I can't justify a bottle of this. Also, performance is quite average, maybe slightly above average (should be, for the price), but not quite the monster people say it is. And there is ZERO animalicness. Sure, some muskiness, but it's not animalic. Not dirty anyway. Overrated/10.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Very similar to Caron Pour un homme. This is because they have 3 similar dominant notes: lavendel, vanilla and musc.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Warm spicy scent. I tried just a tiny amount on my skin. I get a lot of vanilla and tonka beens. Not too musky for me ( I expected more musk). The dry down is similar to Must by Cartier.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
The musk in this just gloops & slithers right down into the very viscerals of one ... basically an uncompromising full-on heavyweight musk: musk, musk, & more musk, with a bit of musk thrown in. If that's what you're after - and it is often what I'm after, then this one certainly delivers - right on the doorstep!

I do realise there's other notes in this also; but it is really all about showcasing the musk, in this one.

I realise there is a reasonable manners ethic towards other reviewers on this site, but I'm afraid I've just been pushed beyond bursting point - & also how is it that there seems to be a culture of sending perfumes back on none-other grounds than not liking the perfume - caveat emptor! + some of it has been used!! ... and someone buys a perfume called Musc Ravageur and proposes to send it back to ebay™ on grounds that it may cause them to smell reminiscently of a furry animal!!? If I were a governor (or regulator, or whatever) on ebay™ I would be saying "look ... no ... just - no!"!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: after a long time wanting to, i am finally trying this! it's spicier than i imagined it would be for some reason. i get spices and lots of tonka and vanilla. there are hints of citruses and clove. overall this is strongest on the cinnamon, vanilla and tonka for me. there's a note wayyy in the back that i can't place, but it's smoky and slightly animalic. maybe tobacco and musk. when i breathe in deep the smokiness actually expands...it's fascinating. first i smell the musk, then i breathe deeper and that turns to pipe tobacco. at this point the spices have toned down some (after about 10 minutes) and it's primarily tonka, vanilla and musk on me. a good fall/winter scent.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Love at first sniff. This is snickerdoodle, spice cake heaven.

Update: coming back to this because I’m trying to nail the smell and I think I’ve figured it out — It smells like pfeffernuse, or German Christmas cookie, with slight animalic undertone.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This was the first gourmand I encountered and a fascinating composition. It's sweet, but hyper-masculine. It's one of those fragrances that so macho it manages to circle back to unisex. It would be similar to L'Occitane's Eau Des Baux in that it's a very dry composition, but the musk and amber prevent it from becoming too sheer. Love it or hate it, Musc Ravageur draws you in and stays with you.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Cloves, vanilla and musc! Who could have said that this is such an alluring combination?! This is otherworldly, and sorry to say that, but this is not for everybody.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Here's a note about the Musc Ravageur body balm, which is a true treat for the skin, very rich and softening.
I made a blind buy online, and I'm on the fence about it I have to admit.
What stands out to me, some 15 mins after applying, is an earthy animalic outdoorsy undertone, with wafts of lavender, vanilla, tonka and a bit of cinnamon on top. Imo when just applied it's not as nice as from 10 mins onwards, only then it gets to radiate a true scent harmony and becomes a bit powdery, which I like very much. Animalic musk, vanilla and lavender keep occupying main stage on my skin, can't help being reminded of vintage Jicky a bit. A great reference to some probably...
And as well as Jicky, MR to me doensn't confess to gender.
Is MR for me though? I have to say no. Just how Jicky isn't for me either. If anyone is interested in swapping an almost full 200 gr pot please PM me.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This instantly reminded me of Habanita EDT with the excess vanilla taken out. Suitable for men too. I didnt test on my skin so not sure how it becomes after the initial phase.

A bit too intense for my liking on first impression but i would like to test this properly.

Very earthy and long lasting.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I have a tiny bit left from the older batch and new one I repurchased recently. I heard this one was reformulated, but I never expected new one to be that different. It was sweet gem with a very spicy twist and completely unisex. Now its more on the feminine side. I get less cloves and less musk, more orange and just hint of cinnamon. At first I got upset about this new formulation. But now, after wearing it for few weeks... well... old formulation..new formulation..I still love it!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Habit Rouge is no longer a male version of Shalimar, nor Tom Ford Noir, but this is!

Musc Ravageur draws the bone structure from Shalimar EDP, cuts off the citrus and leathery note, then blends with some specific resinous and semi-fougere note a la YSL Opium Homme.

I like it, not sure if it is full bottle worthy yet.

Rating: 6.5/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Addicting | Polarizing | Intimidating | Daring (for youngsters)

Okay here’s the deal.. it has ingredients that invokes an older smell.. but the good sweet older smell that’s intoxicating.. only with superb ingredients and quality blend. More importantly what is considered “old” is not really the case here... it is not an old smell but invokes imagery settings of older times! This is unique and in my eyes a brilliant idea for future fragrances.

Beyond the blended foundation.. here’s what pops out:

• Make up
• powdered sugar (funnel cake)
• Apple cobbler
• baby doll
• fur
• Honey tobacco
• hint of scotch
• leather jacket
• bat man mask
• old feather dip ink pin freshly written Declaration of Independence airing out while read on a wood dusty porch on a breezy day next to a hay field.
• Cold air blowing through oak mossy trees at dusk
• Raisin date and walnut oatmeal

* I think the note list is missing iso E super (personally, the way the notes dance) or it could be immortelle bc it seems sweet honeyed waxy Iris like

“Voilá”
“There you are”

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: I had a sample of this. On my skin it turned very animalic & had a distinct sweaty arm pit quality coming through. It was very sweet vanilla (not spicy on me) with an undertone of BO & plastic....But never mind, you can't win 'em all & maybe it says more about me than the MR:)

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Just took the plunge and bought a 50 ml bottle, I’m not getting any musc or civet just vanilla and cinnamon , longevity and projection adequate but expect more for the price, to my nose it’s nothing at all like meharees I can’t smell any similarity at all

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Musc Ravegeur is my first introduction to Frederic Mall. I love it! I had tried several musc-oriented fragrances in the past, but often were hits-and-misses. I am not sure whether my skin chemistry is not quiet compatible with musc-based fragrances or some other reasons. However, Musc Ravegeur behaves so well with my skin. It opens with a huge blast of spicy musk, probably due to the presence of cloves and cinnamon that are so obvious to me on the top notes.Some may find the opening is very challenging. After about half an hour, the magic begins. It becomes so warm and comforting. The spicy notes still present, but much calmer, and in fact, adds a nice touch on the overall scent. I find Musc Ravegeur very comforting to me. It lasts throughout my working day, but becomes much closer to the skin. On clothes, it will last for a long time.
