I feel this fragrance is more appropriate for colder season. I would not wear this in the heat of summer. I believe women can wear this with confidence as well. Overall, Musc Ravegeur is a very alluring musc-based fragrance, and a very comforting one. This is a real fine offering by Frederic Malle. The asking price is steep, but indeed matches the quality of this fragrance.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
The great thing about Musc Ravageur is..theres no white musk at all. Anywhere. Thank the GODS. No laundry scent. No clean, cold sharpness. This is warm..it has a heartbeat. Its heartbeat is masterfully pared down into its basic components of some of the most classic oriental spicy amber accord made famous in the past with icons such as COCO, Opium and Shalimar.

Its warm and cozy as cashmere and a easy wear in the fall and winter if you have worn some of the oriental icons of past decades. Its a gingerbread warm cookie and a chai latte by the fireplace. It leans almost silky gourmand to make this a new way of an classic idea. Bravo Malle. Just lovely.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is GOOD.
Fuzzy and a bit dusty. Some vanilla, gently sweet. A hint of baking spices...
This is what I want my scarves to smell like this autumn.

Musc Ravageur smells like... fluffy, magic kitten fur.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
If this ain't sexy... then what the hell is?

Can't believe I've waited so long to get with Musc Ravageur. Was on a shortlist of fragrances to try years ago, during a brief obsession with animalics, but I never ended up sampling it. When I finally did, a few days ago, it exceeded my high expectations. Was an easy purchase decision to get a full bottle.

This is essentially a slightly civety musk cushioned in a pillow of spiced, milky vanilla. The longevity is rather good; projection is low after the first hour. More of a sexy skin scent vibe.

It's great stuff - I'm hooked :)

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Very oriental. Lot of cloves and cinnamon; some vanilla, musk, wood and maybe a floral. Spicy, medicinal vibe from the cloves. Drydown smells kind of like Jovan Musk but less floral.

MR is unisex leaning feminine with an 0ld lady vibe. Mature and for cooler weather. There are better scents for work but worse ones too. I don't find it sexy. Lasted about five hours with average sillage and projection. I swear I could still smell it faintly after a shower. Notes are natural smelling as expected from Frederic Malle but I just don't care for the composition. MR uses clove and cinnamon too heavily for my taste but I suppose this is an Oriental style perfume. It should perform better for this price imo. Musc Ravageur doesn't do much for me.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Yummy. Intimate. Familiar. Very, very sexy (I think...). Cosy. Warming. Sweet. Did I say sexy? Definitely sexy.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Beauty and the beast!

The Beast from tale of "Beauty and the beast " is the best way to explain how feelings of this fragrance, you can run away from it at the first sight because the raw beast but you will falling in love when you know him.
This fragrance open with raw dry vanilla and raw musky.
I personally like this fragrance, but I hesitate to say I love it (at first). This is combination of old fashion and classic way, the ancient powdery scent combining with animalic in the background reminded me of " Shalimar "(not similar but same feeling).

This is sexy? Maybe, it a kind of dark side of sexiness.

Scent 8/10 (I hate it at first, a month later I just can't stop thinking about it!)
Project 8/10 (Arm length on my skin, and middle project better than open!)
Longevity 8.5/10 ( About 8-10 hrs )

The musky note in this fragrance so fierce like the tiger at the open and dry down to dried raw vanilla and sweet ( clove in this fragrance not dominant the scent, but mixed and blended seamlessly with other very well to make it darker and dense.)

"Don't trust what the eyes can see and judge it at the first sign, spend more time to know this beast than you might falling in love... "

Open as Beast/Dark/Raw/Ancient , dry down to Gentle/Sweet/Romance

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
a fantastic spicy, musky,powdery vanillic fragrance.

2009 version review: this one starts off with cloves and cinnamon. the cloves starts to decrease leaving room for the cinnamon, musk and vanilla to take over and transform the smell into a border-line gourmand . it is also powdery. this fragrance lasts very long. i could still smell it on my skin almost 24 hours after application as a creamy fragrance.

9.2/10

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
2009 formula on skin: This is considered dirty? It's a soft sweet amber gourmand that invites me to come closer. Faintly powdery, although not in a talc kind of way. Feminine rather than masculine. I guess my nose reads "animalic" musk as "skin".

Very strong in the summer heat, so I apply it very lightly and I think it works in the air conditioned indoors. I wouldn't wear it outside though. Some heavy scents like L'air du Desert Marocain work outdoors on a summer day despite the heat, but IMO Musk Ravageur is too sweet.

Edit: Wow. This worked on its intended target; let's leave it at that. ;)

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Frederic Malle should have named this fragrance 'Cinnamon Ravageur'! I was expecting loads of animalic musk, but when I sprayed this on, the strongest notes that emerged were cinnamon, cloves and vanilla, with some tame musk in the background. Perhaps it has to do with the fact that I am testing this frag in a very hot and humid weather, and it might work differently when it's colder outside. Still, I didn't expect such a Christmas-like, almost edible concoction. So, if you're looking for a festive treat that projects strongly and lasts for hours, buy this fragrance; on the other hand, if you're looking for a dirty musk-bomb, look elsewhere.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I have a weird bond with Musc Ravageur. One where I am ambivalent about it, don’t know if I love it or not but for some reason I keep using it and smelling my wrist when I do. It reminds me of an unhealthy relationship with a woman, where she is married and you have an affair. You know it’s wrong, you know it’s never going to go anywhere serious and each time you are done having your raunchy and dirty session, you leave feeling guilty and confused but you keep coming back for more because you can’t help it…

It opens very spicy and earthy (cloves) also with an orange note and an aromatic lavender giving off a kind of medicinal vibe to the top. Could be the smell of a cinnamon/cloves ointment for sore muscles. In the background as the name implies you can find an amazing dirtier musk for a more carnal, sexual side with a “hairy” feel or texture to me. As time passes by the musky cinnamon stays and is joined by a smoother vanilla giving off a strong Cinnabon aura. So in the end I get a warm, very spicy Cinnabon with a light chocolate vibe and covered with vanilla while laying on a farm goat or a sheep’s clean hair. Does it sound weird to you? Yeah to me too, but somehow it looks like it works and I own a bottle of it. Why? I couldn’t tell you, but it lures me in. Damn you Musc Ravageur.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This smells exactly like one of those vanilla-scented plastic dog bones you find at the pet shop. It even has a note of animalic raunchiness. My pipe aficionado uncle used to have a mean little dog named Mugsy, and the house smelled like Captain Black pipe tobacco and Musc-Ravageur-scented dog toys. All pleasant memories, but I don’t want to smell like Mugsy.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
First I smelled this olfactory decadence on a friend, then I ordered a sample. I wore the sample out, then dove in for a 100ml bottle. Not the 50, the 100, because I will be wearing this frequently. Velvety Oriental notes, deep, warm vanilla and spice layered with wood... I'm all in. As a middle aged woman who can't stand wearing florals, this fits the bill in so many ways. Gourmand without being foody or cloyingly sweet. Sensual, earthy, and as others have stated, easier to wear than Shalimar (which I still appreciate).

A single spray makes for a pleasant skin scent I can enjoy all day while working at my desk. Two sprays and people around me start to notice. Three and I think I'd have to leave the room. Longevity is excellent, especially on clothes.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
Lovely in winter and straight up sex in summer. I wear it in both seasons and it brings completely different scents. In the winter the clove is more dominant and I get more cinnamon. In the summer it is sweeter, more animalic and somehow fresher, IMO. I know many people think this cannot be pulled off in summer, but that is not correct. Regulation
of your sprays will make a huge difference. Try a spray or two on a summers evening and embrace the magic!

Compliments are many, but I wear this for me and my lady.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I love ittt... And I'm not even that much of a fan of strong oriental powerhouses. I don't get that much of vanilla and cinnamon... Jut throwback 80's sweetish musk (similar to civet), elegant woods in the background (sandalwood and guaiac), and a little bit of fruity/sweet and herbal soapy notes in the background for a balance. Non cloying vanilla is dancing around somewhere there all the time. It's strong but still fresh at the same time.
It has a yin, masculine energy and gives you confidence, but is definitely unisex. Overall gives me an Italian vibe. :)

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is just so addictive, so sexy, so heavenly..just everything in a bottle! When I first sprayed it on paper, I wasn't so sure I liked this scent. But after I put the paper on my desk and came back to my room an hour later... The whole room smelled like heaven! I bought the 100ml bottle right away the next day, and it's still the best thing I have ever done..

On my skin it smells very smoky. musky vanilla, like vanilla burning and surrounded by smokes and fumes, and musks lingering in the background. I can't even explain how beautiful the scent is, I'm just so happy to have this scent in my room. Now the weather is changing to hot, humid summer, which sadly means that I wouldn't be able to spray this for a while. Waiting for cold weather so that I can spray this again soon..

Although this is my favorite scent and I can't express all my love for this, I wouldn't recommend a blind buy. To me, it definitely smelled much better on my skin than on paper, but this might depend on each person's skin chemistry and tastes. But if you like oriental, smoky vanilla, this probably would easily become your favorite too.

Edit: Most people seem to think of this as somewhat masculine.. To me it's just totally unisex. I'm a tiny young woman and I really enjoy it on myself. Goes well with both genders. And what does masculine really mean, anyways? ;)

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
I tried this a few years ago and didn't like it very much. Trying it now, I kind of love it. The difference may be due to either me knowing more about fragrances or a reformulation - for the better (which is unusual). Perhaps it is a combination of the two - a perfection of the blend, as well as an improvement of my nose.

The notes are well known, with musk, amber, vanilla being in focus. I am sensitive to vanilla and cannot stand too much of it. Fortunately this vanilla is not very sweet and not too domineering, though I could still wish for less.

It is extremely well blended and is a 'sexy' skin fragrance, one of the few original and among the best in today's world.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Do not blind buy. This did not smell good on me. It was strong overpowering and unpleasant. Definitely not one for me.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This is not for everyone. Not a compliment getter. You must be very confident and risky to wear this sexy animalic scent. There's something mysterious about this fragrance. I feel very special when I wear this. Masterpiece!!

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: Just putting this out there, Maurice Roucel did L de Lolita Lempicka AND Labdanum 18 Le Labo. Haven't smelled either of the other two - just something I noticed :-)

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew:
This is glorious.
Just not on me.

My skin kils it every time, I swear. For an hour or two it's spectacular and then it's just plain musky slightly spicy vanilla for another two and then... nothing. It is so frustrating that afterwords I have to make myself feel better. Usually with Shalimar who is so loud and unbelievably naughty for at least a day that wearing Musc Ravageur seems pointless.
But, I love it dearly and I am incapable of getting rid of it. Because those two hours are worth it.

name: Musc Ravageur Frederic Malle (unisex) ~ 2000
reivew: This just reminds me of Christmas. So cinnamony and Spicy. It is warm and comforting. An open fire on a snowy winter's evening and a glass of fine wine and conversation with a friend or loved one. So very comforting.
